review_body: We stayed at the Eastin Ashta for 2 weeks at the end of June. Within 24 hours we had decided we would definitely come back. The staff are just amazing. Every one of them. All smiley and happy. From arrival to departure. They would ask us how we were whenever we passed them and when we left or returned to the hotel. Great service at the pool all day with towels provided. Food was very good and the frozen cocktails were delicious. Me and my husband got sick for a day while there, nothing to do with the hotel. We think it was from our trip to the monkey sanctuary. Anyway the staff were so helpful and made toast for me at lunch time and a 'chip butty' for dinner as I couldn't eat anything else and  kept asking if we were ok. Breakfast was good. I ate far too much bacon. So crispy. The staff take your order for eggs however you want them.Room was a perfect size with a comfy king bed. You can have your sheets changed daily if you wish or leave a card provided on the bed to say you don't require a sheet change. The cleaner kept the room clean and  left towel art every day and 2 free bottles of water.  Shower was a walk in and great size. Small balcony which we only used to dry clothes and towels. Yes the room lighting is dull but a lot of hotels are like this. I always take a plug in bulb for extra light. Sockets are universal so no need for convertors. We managed with wardrobe space for a fortnight and I take travel fold up coat hangers for extra clothes hanging. Air con was brilliant. Even had to turn it off sometimes. Fridge kept drinks nicely chilled. WiFi was better than our own at home and free. Hired a scooter and kept it in the hotel car park which was very safe. There was a hotel security guard by the car park who would always say hello too.The construction work did not bother us at all as it can't be seen from the outdoor restaurant or pool just from the balconies.The hotel is in a great spot near the beach and away from the noise at night from the clubs. Lots of nice places to eat and drink within walking distance. We liked The Lawn, Tugu, Deus, Echo Beach BBQ, Beach Boy, Grass Terrace and Fat Mermaid. Lots of beach bars with bean bag beds if you want to sun lounge and watch the sunset. If your young and want late nights and music go to the Island Beach Bar (called Desoner in the evenings)  a 10 min walk along the road in line with the beach or Luigi's Hot Pizza a similar distance but left up the street  from the hotel. The people of Canggu are so friendly and polite. From shops to beach bars to restaurant. Never met an unfriendly face anywhere. And no one is pushy here. I recommend taking an unblocked mobile phone and getting a sim there so that you can use data for Google maps when you are out and about and so you can use the gojek app for taxis. We hired a driver for the day to to go to Ubud for the waterfalls and monkey sanctuary and he also took us to a lovely restaurant that  he recommended. Was about £35 for the whole day and he would just wait in his car at each stop.   We hope to return to the Eastin next year if our son is still there 'traveling'. He loves Canggu so much that he doesn't want to leave and we can see why. Such a chilled out place with so many friendly people.Makasih to everyone at Eastin Ashta. We had a great time. From Jon and Gina.

review_body: Excellent facilities, kind and welcoming staff. Only criticism was loud banging of doors at night, and thin walls so could hear next door / above and below. Poolside area perfect and gym was excellent. Great location near the beach.

review_body: Fantastic staff, really clean hotel, exceptional customer service. What a great stay, the staff really make this place shine, so attentive and lovely. Would easily recommend to others as the best place in Canggu.

review_body: Loved the location of this hotel, a close walk to bars, restaurants, shops, yoga and the beach but far enough away that it was quiet on the premises. Pool was lovely and clean. Not much shade around the pool if you want to avoid the sun, but great if you want to soak it all in! Room facilities were fantastic, everything is modern and clean. Only issue I had was not being able to call a Blue Bird taxi from the hotel itself when I was leaving to move to Seminyak. Staff offered me the hotel transport but this was more expensive so instead I had to walk down the street with my suitcase and hail from the road which wasn't very convenient. Apart from this, I would definitely recommend a stay here!

review_body: I've stayed in this hotel 3 times and I've enjoyed my stay on all of those times. The hotel located deep inside Canggu and is walking distance from the beach. It is surrounded by small stores, restaurants and cafe, so it was really easy to find food just by walking.The room was big and can fit an extra bed nicely. The pool area is great if you're looking to sunbathe cause it's open so sun exposure was maximal.Breakfast was good. I definitely feel relax there.

review_body: It was my first stay in Canggu and my friend has picked out this boutique hotel for our short 2.5 days stay. The room is relatively spacious and comfortable and it was at a prime location, not too far from many good eating places which are within walk-able distance. It is also a stone's throwaway from the beach which was extremely excellent and must say a good spot to stay if you are surfing! the pool is awesome as well with bean bags and tanning chairs. would definitely be back to stay at this hotel again!

review_body: Very clean and new hotel. Within walking distance of the beach and nice restaurants nearby. Never had so friendly staff in a hotel and everything was incredibly clean! Scooters also delivered via the hotel within an hour, great!Had a nice stay.Few small points for improvement- Rooms are very noisy, we heard the people walking above us and the people next door coming home and talking at night.- Do not wash clothes at the hotel! Washing 1 piece of underwear at the hotel is just as expensive as washing 1 kilo at a laundry shop.- Arranging a taxi through the hotel is much more expensive than arranging it yourself.

review_body: Thank you very much and good karma for the housekeeping staff ( Surya ) my hubby accidentally left his wallet, when we came back the wallet still there - none missing. Love the location, very close to our favourite surfing beach, the staffs are very kind from the receptionist till the securities staffs - love the room most especially the rain shower , always feeling fresh after spending some time on the beach, aircon is good , bed is comfy, food and drink are overpriced & the swimming pool water not fresh , feel itchy bit after swimming, the bathroom amenities is standard . we lost our helmet in parking park hotel ( underground park ), the security said they will find it, but until we checked out still no helmet found , we end up pay rp 100.000,- to motorbike rental.

review_body: Just finished a 6 night stay at this hotel and it was a pleasure from start to finish. We were welcomed on arrival, helped to our room with bags and everything explained clearly to us on breakfast times, pool times etc. The room was very spacious and clean, mini bar fully restocked every time you use something and if you ever need anything else any member if staff are willing to help.The pool staff are very helpful and happy aswel! Always making sure your okay for drinks/food and always happy. The only MINOR thing I can say about the hotel was the choice of food at breakfast. Not much choice at all apart from your basics, which is enough but I expected a little more. BUT this does not let the hotel down in any way, it is only a little criticism. Would defiantly stay again if I re visited Canggu!!

review_body: I had the worst experience ever in a hotel. This hotel has complete disregard for the hotel guests. What happened on the last day spoilt everything.On my last day, i was in a rush to get to the airport. For convenience sake, i booked a car using the grab app. I mean it's cheaper, faster and more convenient for me. The most unfortunate thing happened, the hotel lobby guys or security guards stopped the car from entering. They then refused the driver from leaving even when i was inside the car. They told the grab drive to ask me to leave. I was stunned because i felt really unsafe.I understand the standing feud between grab drivers and local taxis in Bali. If it was a local taxi guy who stopped me, fair enough. BUT it was the hotel staff which made me extremely unhappy. As hotel staff, you should accomodate to your guests every requests. Your guests are your priority not the local taxis. I find this unacceptable coming from a hotel who would prioritise local taxis over their own guests. The whole situation made me so upset. I was really late for my flight. They made me walk out all the way to the main road with my luggages. Can you believe it?I highly do not recommend this hotel.

review_body: Newly built, five minutes from Batu Bolong, but away from the weekend noise of Old Man's, the Eastin Ashta has everything you would want if you are looking for a very comfortable stay in Canggu. Rooms were large and spacious and aesthetically pleasing; the grounds were beautifully maintained; and the staff were friendly and accommodating - housekeeping even left me a very nice note after my first night's stay. One minor detail that could be improved upon is that the lighting in the room was dim especially in the evenings. Overall, though, a great stay and the price was an absolute bargain. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again next time I'm in Canggu.

review_body: Great experience! My boyfriend and I stayed four nights for about $400 USD. The hotel is gorgeous, very clean. The furniture in the lobby is a bit dirty/dusty looking but of course that’s from the hundreds of travelers bringing sand and dirt into the hotel from the beach. The location is OK. If you’re just staying here for the beach, it’s a perfect walking distance. But, as far as other things, there isn’t much to do within a good walking distance. A lot of stray dogs in the area, only places very nearby are an alcohol store, beach stores, and yoga places. But obviously that has nothing to do with the hotel itself. We booked a deluxe room which was on the fifth floor. Our room was gorgeous and very clean. The only thing is, the shower room is level with the rest of the hotel room. Our drain was clogged the first day, so our hotel room was FLOODED afterwards and some of our belongings got soaked. The next day, maintenance came to unclog the shower, and it was better - but the drain is still slow. Don’t use multiple functions at once on the shower head or water will escape the shower room at least a little bit. We had to stick a towel under the door for the entirety of our stay. Also, there was a very strange lingering diarrhea smell in between the shower room and the bed. It was there since we got there, not sure what caused it, but I ended up sleeping on that side of the bed so I’d consistently smell it if I ever reached on the bed stand to pick up my phone or whatnot. May have just been our room with the problems. But overall, this was a beautiful resort and I recommend it. The dining hall is gorgeous, clean and the food is good. I only wouldn’t recommend getting mie goreng there because they add way too much salt. The pool is gorgeous, is cleaned by hand daily, and the water temperature is perfect. They have a gym as well.
hotelName:
0    Eastin Ashta Resort Canggu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay here. The service is impeccable and the staff are lovely. It has everything that you need on-sight and is very close to most other things. It is a short walk to Echo beach and from our exploring we felt like it was on the best street, as it was close but also quasi-quiet. The street is quieter, but still includes coffee shops, restaurants, cocktail bars, and scooter hire. It just does not have the hustle and bustle of the other streets similarly close to the beach - but you can walk to the busier streets if you want too. Breakfast was fantastic. Changed everyday to keep it interesting. Food was fresh and tasty, and they make eggs, pancakes, and waffles to order. It’s a buffet, with western/eastern foods. We spent hours everyday at the pool, and loved the cocktails at the bar (2-4-1 between 5-8pm). Room was clean. Bed was soooo comfortable. Cleaned everyday at a time you could choose if this was more suitable. Going back to service: they assisted us with private transfer to and from the airport. Even when we landed at 2am and when that flight was cancelled. We hadn’t paid for breakfast but when we missed a night I asked if we could transfer that money to breakfast and they very kindly agreed. They made re-booking extra nights easy, and assisted us with private car for day trips. I cannot recommend this place more.
hotelName:

review_body: Easton Ashta is a nice, new hotel, has friendly staff, a great buffet brekkie and a really nice pool and restaurant. It is however really noisy. You can hear construction work right near the hotel from your balcony, people walking up and down the hotel corridors as well as room doors slamming and people talking in their rooms - the walls must be thin. we came here as a family but it seems mainly for couples and singles even though there is a kids crèche. Canggu is not really a family friendly location...the streets are hard to walk on with kids as they are so busy and narrow. Not sure what the hype of Canggu is - it is a dirty, party area. If your looking to come here with family- rent a nice villa away from the hustle and bustle

Large pool is also very nice and clean providing enough space for all guests, with pool bar (prices are higher than in other restaurants in canggu).Only minus would be the running construction work right next to the hotel. They are building there a huge resort, working from early morning till late evening and it can be disturbing when sitting on balcony or at pool.

review_body: The Easton hotel is located only minutes from the beach. The staff are very attentive and friendly. The restaurant has a great breakfast and dinner menu (we did not try the lunch menu as we were out during the day). The rooms and the entire hotel are very well kept and clean. There is some new construction going on in the neighborhood but the noise was not too loud.
hotelName:
0    Eastin Ashta Resort Canggu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Eastin Ashta Resort are a beautiful new development in Canggu, in an excellent location and with gorgeous sunset views by the pool. I highly recommend the in-house green tea scrub as well as lemon facial (perfect for any pigmentation from sun exposure). The breakfast is by far the best I of anywhere I stayed in Bali, with a generous buffet selection catering to both Indonesian and Western tastes. The hotel seems to be fantastic for families, with an on-site creche for little ones, whilst you escape to the beach just a short walk away. There are some lovely little bars and restaurants by the coastline which are ideal for watching the sunset in the evenings, it's also much less busy than some of the other stretches of shoreline. There is also a business centre should you desire a quiet place to work. Wifi and connectivity were fast and accessible, which can be a rarity around Bali!Should you rent a car or scooter, they have their own car park with free parking to keep this safe. Overall I cannot rate my stay with Eastin Ashta any higher, the exceeded all expectations and i would definitely be staying with them again on my next visit to Canggu.

The shower faucet was fantastic with press buttons for different pressure. Room service was great with plenty of choices. hotelName:
0    Eastin Ashta Resort Canggu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself, my husband and my 8 month old son just returned from a holiday in Bali, we stayed at the Eastin for 2 weeks. We don’t usually write reviews but the staff were so wonderful we felt we needed to let prospective customers know! From the moment we arrived the staff couldn’t have been friendlier, they treated my son like their own family. A particular thanks to reception staff Herry who was so wonderful with us and our son, he went far above and beyond what we expected. Herry absolutely made our stay even more brilliant than it would have been and I hope the management recognise what an exceptional member of staff they have. The room was beautiful, the hotel was so clean you could have eaten your food off the floor. The pool area was wonderful, my son used the playroom daily and my husband used the gym (both situated right next to the pool), and there was a great massage place opposite. The hotel was situated very close to the beach where we enjoyed sunset every evening. Overall I could not fault the Eastin and I would highly recommend it to anyone heading to Bali. The only suggestion I could make would be for the hotel to put a sail or cover over the baby pool as the floor around the pool got so hot my son (and other children) couldn’t walk or crawl around out of the water. Thanks for the wonderful stayKaty, Tom and Jensen
hotelName:
0    Eastin Ashta Resort Canggu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ok, me and my bro are taking a break from work and going on a holiday to Bali at the end of January for 3 days. We stayed at Eastin Astha Hotel, it takes less than an hour from the airport to the hotel. It is located in Canggu area. I think this is the best place you should choose to stay when you go to Bali, since it is close enough (I think) to every other place you'd want to visit. We choose to stay in Canggu area since it’s been boring lately in Kuta, Seminyak, Legian, etc, just the usual bar/club hoppers activity, it’s kind of dull for me personally.When we first arrive to Eastin Astha Hotel and checked in, we get an upgrade from a superior room to a deluxe room, of course we took it, but.... we got one king size bed, well... this is a bit awkward, two dudes, sharing one king size bed... but since it's a free upgrade and we got a much bigger and comfortable room, I think we could make it work. Just draw the line where you can't cross and we will be fine, and several other rules... (Not worth mentioning, but to summarize it is, just stay away from each other when we are in the room, LOL)We checked in, the staff are very friendly here, helping us carry our luggage to our room (thank you), and then explain all the features in our room. We ask for a smoking room, we get a room with a balcony, when you open the sliding door to the balcony, the air condition automatically turn off (Cool right!), so you can open the sliding door and just start smoking without any concern of anything, and after you finish, just close it, and turn the air condition on again. We ask why they made it like this, is because the Eastin Astha is intending to become an eco green energy saver resort. And the other thing that surprise us are, they said that some of the food ingredient they used were planted and managed by themselves in their garden (soo Cool!!)That night we then go to Echo Beach Grill and Bar, I highly recommend for all of you to go to this place… the meals are so good and the price are actually pretty cheap considering you get a buffet for rice, salad, potatoes, and the others (i can’t remember really..) to choose, and you can take it as many times as you want, while enjoying the beach at night. We spend those 3 days mostly just touring around the area and then back to our hotel for relaxing… well, maybe most of the time we spend it in the hotel since it’s just too comfort, fast wifi, good food, a big swimming pool, highly professional and very polite staff member. We would most definitely go back again staying at Eastin Astha. We recommend you guys to also try and stay at this Hotel.
hotelName:
0    Eastin Ashta Resort Canggu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed at Eastin for 4 nights, our room was very neat, tidy, modern and spacious, and to top it off a gorgeous view of the ocean (L5). The hotel is new, we loved the décor and the pool area is great, lots of space & sunbeds. Would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
0    Eastin Ashta Resort Canggu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay at Canggu,the location, breakfast, restaurant, services, all is lovely.Me and my family were planning only stay at the hotel or just walk to find nearest restaurant.It's oly 5 minutes walk to The Lawn, or La Bris, or other nice restaurants / bars / cafes.Keep the good work.Hope to see you again Eastin.:cheers:
hotelName:
0    Eastin Ashta Resort Canggu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room is very clean. Walking distance to the Beach and eateries. Breakfast at the hotel is ok. But I preferred having breakfast at the cafes nearby, more choices. Staff are friendly and helpful. Overall: Good!
hotelName:
0    Eastin Ashta Resort Canggu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved it. Close to everything, nice area. Not a good beach but we prefered the pool. The rooms were great, the pool and gym was great too. The food and breakfast was nice. Loved the view. The staff was great!
hotelName:
0    Eastin Ashta Resort Canggu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very new and clean hotel, close to the beach , perfect service and good bed . I will come again. Staff very helpful and nice. Breakfast good choise for the price. I stayed 6 nights. Good Air condition.
hotelName:
0    Eastin Ashta Resort Canggu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay at the Eastin Ashta in Canggu was a lovely surprise, as I wasn't sure what to expect, given this was my first booking there. The hotel is quite new, in a great location and with friendly, attentive staff. My room exceeded expectations (recommend the 6th floor if you can get it), large, new and spotless, with an ocean view (until the development adjacent is completed, then the view may change). The gym was clean and had good equipment, the pool area lovely and a well stocked mini bar. Staff were friendly and helpful and the beach and cafes, shops etc were very close by. I would definitely stay again - excellent value for money.
hotelName:
0    Eastin Ashta Resort Canggu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel in KutaStayed in hotel from May 27 to May 30. Rooms were big and comfortable. Bathrooms were amazing. Well maintained pool. The staff were lovely and breakfast was mouthwatering. Countless restaurants, pubs (Don't worry. You will not get disturbed.) , massage centers near hotel. Will definitely recommend.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and cosy hotel. The pool is a good side.Brakfast was great with good . Had lunch at their restaurant in the alley. Great food.My family and I had a great time. Thanks to all the staff. Will come again.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful location on small Balinese street, nearby the beach and shops. Good massage and cheap as well nearby in SPA. Beach is not the best, but still good for surfing. Room was very clean. Will recommend to all friends stay there.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good value for USD36 a night. Fab location, easy walk to main street and the beach. Spacious deluxe room with basic amenities - safe, kettle, fridge, hot shower, room slippers, wifi, shampoo & bath foam. I think all rooms have pool view. Hotel accepted my request for a top floor, quiet room. Comes with 2 small bottles of complimentary drinking water. Would have rated higher except all towels were really black. Perhaps they were clean but weren’t bleached - in which case they should bleach, or be replaced. The floor mat was extremely black (doesn’t look obvious with yellow light in the photo). I’m surprised other travellers didn’t mention so i’m not sure if this is common here. Else, it’d have been rated 4/5.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Terrace. we stayed for 3 nights and absolutely love everything. its close to everything and a short walk away from the beach. they also serve good breakfast and the rooms are clean. the beds ate very comfortable and we were able to sleep well. i highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting kuta
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From langkawi Island and we spent 2 nights at hotel terrace kuta.. the lroom very clean and comfortable.. The hotel staff a very friendly.. Hotel near to the town.. If we come back to Bali we will stay at terrace kuta again.. Thank you so much.. Recommended
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As me and my family need a short overnight stay before heading to Flores the next day, i've decided to book a night at this hotel due to the location and affordable price. Great to say the room is really clean and comes with a good service. I would really recommend this place to all who is travelling on a limited budget but at the same time looking for a place with cool architecture and pool.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean and comfortable accommodation in the heart of Kuta. Close walk to many shops, restaurants and the beach. Easy check in and out and okay WIFI. We had poolside suite which was spacious and very comfortable. Breakfast has ample options and starts early which is great. Parking downstairs for scooter and car. Helped organise last minute taxi to airport early in the morning. Pool is really nice and clean.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here after a late flight in before heading off to the other side of Bali. Welcoming staff and oragnised transport from airport. Basic hotel room - quite clean. Does have a balcony but only really big enough for one person. Breakfast was average. Pool area nice and relaxing - was quite while we hung out there waiting for our next driver. They were more than happy to hold our bags. Well situated for what we needed. Very good value for money.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's been about 2 years since I last stayed here. Nothing has changed, it's still a great hotel offering great service. Nice rooms at a nice price! Next time I'm back in Bali I will be sure to stay here again.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a deluxe pool access room...fabulous!!great location to go anywhere.pool nice, rooms clean and brekky ok.would definitely stay again!close to Benesari and 5min walk to beach.try pac man warung...cheap food, just around the corner.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are dated and need rennovation, food is average and priced that way. The singers in the bar are poor at best, sound like dogs howling while singing songs. Horrible really, so sad to say but its offensive
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My fifth stay at Hotel Terrace, spacious, spotlessly clean rooms, quiet & peaceful, very comfortable bed & soft pillows, sparkling swim pool, very good air conditioning, excellent buffet breakfast complete with Chef.Close to shops, restaurants, bars, & short walk to famous Kuta Beach. All staff so friendly and helpful, it is always a pleasure to stay at this Fine Boutique Hotel.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is my new favorite in bali. The rooms are very clean and comfy. The location is great and just walking distance away to evrything from restaurants to beaches etc.The staff is helpful and courteous. The pool is nice. We enjoyed our stay.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A well maintained hotel in the inner lanes of Kuta, within walking distance of the beaches, local shopping and restaurants. The rooms with free wifi are adequate in size, with clean sheets and towels provided and also tea/coffee maker. Separate wash and shower areas in the bathroom equipped with basic toiletries, this budget hotel is perfect for solo travelers.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was doing a one night lay-over in Kuta before heading to Gili T the next day so needed somewhere to stay for one night. Hotel Terrace blended good reviews on Tripadvisor with a competitive price (£20 for the night).Was a great choice. The room was really clean and well maintained (as someone else has pointed out - cleanest seen so far in Indonesia). Good facilities, good location and really nice staff.I even got a welcome drink at reception! Small things are important as this set a great first impression.Highly reccomended.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is the main benefit of this hotel. working distance to legin street . friendly staff . good rooms expect the view of bathroom . bcz bathroom covered by glass window and others can be see when use it . breakfast buffet has small varieties . but tasty. overall this is a good hotel to stay .if you need any travel or tours help pl whats up 0094759196197.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for a week and for the price it was excellent value. I had a premium room which was spacious as was the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and there was good housekeeping every day with 2 free bottles of water, plus tea and coffee. There’s a fridge, in room safe and flat screen tv with a couple of western channels. The only minor negatives were the room was showing a bit of “wear and tear” and the curtains let in light in the morning. Throughout my stay the staff were lovely and I was able to leave my suitcase in storage whilst visiting Java. They also helped me print boarding passes for flights and book Blue Bird taxis, which are metered, and work out half the price than standard taxis in the street that you have to haggle over the fare. The hotel is located on a side street just off the main strip so it’s quieter but you still have bars, restaurants, spas and supermarkets within 50 metres. It’s also less than 10 mins walk to the beach. In summary for the price it’s excellent value with friendly, helpful staff.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I missed my flight I booked this hotel from the airport at 22:00. Check in was quick and easy, my room was as advertised with a big bed and large bathroom. Everything was clean. My deluxe room had a small balcony overlooking the pool which seemed to be the quieter side. The hotel is short walking distance to the beach and legian street for food, bars, and music. They also held my luggage and let me chill in the pool til my flight.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We Have A very High expectations as we visited 1st time to Bali, and We are Cheeked our yesterday and now while writing the review I was find out my experience was quite very average type.Positive things I write 1st, very prime location of hotel it's like the near to second road next to Beach road, nearby with convenient store and Indian restaurant nearby really a walking one, near to money exchange, very great stuff of the hotel, they are very gentle and humble one, nice Pool and Optimum breakfast spread. On the negative aspects room was very tiny, there is no space for keeping your cloths, 3 hanger and and that is all, air-condition was a jock it's showing 16degree temp but it's never been cool through the stay we complaint complaint and just complaint nothing works they send a person who just take out the filter and nothing works, and it's so badly needed as terrible heat in kuta, and next worst part is fridge, they mentioned it's for relax not for chilling, are they kidding me we have stayed so Many hotels in so many parts of India and abroad I never get an escused like this.Overall they must need to think about ac and fridge, people come to holidays for relaxing not for complaining Thank you
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Unfortunately I could not rate this hotel any higher The staff wre great & helpfull but I dont know how this hotel got a 3 star rating our usaul 2 star hotel we stay at is a lot betterWe arrived to a hot room & turned the aircon on unfortunately after a couple of hours the room stayed hot.Our usual hotel has the room aircon alredy running when we arriveThe next morning after a restless sleep we reported it to mangementand he sent a maintainence guy to check it. Unfortunately it did not really fix the issue the aircon just was not adequate.We still slept every night with no sheets or bed covers to be comfortableYou need to leave a keycard oin a reader to leave the power on and their solution was to give us a spare keycard to leave in there so the aircon run all day.We also reported the bar fridge was not working only to be informed it was not actually a fridge but a cooler????.The manger had a proper all be it noisy fridge put in the roomThe breakfast was average to say the least with no real variety & the restarant if you call it a restarant is only open till 2pm.(Not a restarant at all just a basic kitchen)The deck around the pool is dangerous with nails & screws poking out & loose boards & why the pool closes at 7pm is beyond belief .Our normal hotel has a similar set up with rooms close to the pool and it is open till 10pm.This hotel just has no ambiece but is good if you just want a cllean room to sleep in>
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Kuta at the end of our trip to Bali due to its closeness to the airport and were pleasently surprised by this hotel. The rooms were very modern and clean, and very comfy bed with good size bathroom and shower. The location was good, far enough away from the street to be quiet and 10-min walk to the start of the beach and shopping centre. The staff were helpful and allowed us to print our boarding passes and Visas for the next leg of our trip. Thank you!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Terrace hotel is a great place to stay if you want to be close to the center of Kuta. It is a modern style hotel located a short way down Jalan Benesari so it does not get all the traffic noise of the main drag but is only a couple of minutes walk from lots of good bars and restaurants including a couple of my favorites 'The Pad Bar on Legian' and Kooters bar and grill which is just across the roadHotel itself is comfortable, clean and quiet. The staff are friendly and helpful. My room was a good size and very clean. One thing to note was that there is only a couple of English TV channels which were Nat Geo and History channel from memory. The nice looking pool area is quite small compared to larger resort style hotels but while I was there it was not busy and there was always a lounge available.Breakfast was basic but had more than enough to enjoy a good meal before heading out for the day.All in all for the price Hotel Terrace gets a thumbs up from me and I would stay there again.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hotel Terrace is an absolute gem of a place. This trip was my 23rd trip to Bali and the first time I would return and stay at the same hotel. The rooms were nice and clean, WIFI was brilliant and super fast, staff were all very friendly and as always go over and above for the guests. The breakfast was lovely and had OJ every day. We stayed in room 125 and our friends in room 126, both rooms are about 10 steps to the pool which was also very nice and refreshing. At AU$40 for the night for a deluxe pool access room ......... this place is a must !!!!Def will stay here again 9.5 / 10
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Some negative reviews here confuse me as I found my stay to be very comfortable and relaxed.I had initially booked for 3 nites and ended up booking for a extra 2 as I enjoyed my stay so much.I was given a quiet room on the 5th floor , my room was spacious and clean , my bed was very comfortable, I got a great nights sleep each nite and the wifi was very good too.Bathroom was clean also with the shower steaming hot when I needed it.My room was cleaned very well each day as I had the same friendly housekeeper each day.I never had breakfast included in my rate choosing to visit many of the restaurants within walking distance each morning.Hotel Terrace is in a fantastic location , there is a good money changer within 50m , some good spas across the street also.This hotel is excellent value for money and I can see myself returning.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed as a family at Hotel Terrace Kuta. The reception staff is nice and helpful. Rooms are good enough for 2 Adults. The hotel is new, modern, clean, well made and maintained. Each room overlooks the pool, which is quite a nice sight in the morning. We had breakfast there twice, both times the food was good, value for money and the hostess was nice and attentive.The location is good, easy to find with lots of food, and leisure options around in Legian/ Kuta area.I would recommend this hotel for people travelling to Bali.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed for week. For the price the hotel it is worth it.The room wasn't huge but you only need a place to sleep.The pool was good, breakfast wasn't a huge selection but again for the price we were happy.The hotel is close to bars, restaurants, massage parlours etc, easy walk/ride to Kuta.I saw one review complaint about roosters - it just adds to the Bali feel, there's a bar next door that played music, which again just added the the Bali experience.Plus I found the staff friendly and helpful.Not a flash hotel but great for price and location.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for one week and departed today - nice surprise during checkout when an invoice for drink and ice cream appeared which was already settled. After a lot of discussions reception person insisted that invoice has to be paid which we warned will have an impact on the hotel's TripAdvisor rating. No customer solution offered just another rip off we experienced in Bali. Rooms in bad condition dirty walls not state of the art. Stay away from this ripoff hotel.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very happy to stay 4 night in Hotel Terrace,i get room number 308 look like single room not sharing wall with adjoining room, bed nice to sleep, any help required just ring up friendly reception, they're very helpful.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is near Kuta beach and Legian Street. Very convenient. Good location.Bathroom is clean but there are some stains on the bed sheet. WiFi is okay. I was disappointed by the small balcony in room 318 which is no view at all! We arrived at 23:40. There is only one staff in the lobby. No welcome drink provided. We stayed there for 3 nights. We heard chicken scream at 6am every morning. As the price is really cheap, I will still recommend friends to have a try.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family stayed four nights in four pool access rooms...the rooms are nice, very clean and the bed comfy..The breakfast was fine.. I loved the omellets..The location of the hotel is great.. Close to the beach and loads of shops and restaurants...The staff were lovely and there is security guys 24 hours.. Who were also very friendly..we felt safe.. The pool is really nice however that was the one flaw for us...there needs to be pool opening hours and they should be adhered to...we were woken up early.. 7.30. Some mornings by kids and adults splashing and screaming in the pool....and small kids running around... I would have given this hotel a five if the noise levels in the mornings were managed better ..as it really is a lovely hotel..
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in Kuta, this is a good hotel with an excellent price. Room good and bathroom but the towel had an odour. TV has no international channels. Breakfast available for IDR75,000 and is a good deal. Staff friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 11 nights as a single parent with 2 children and felt completely safe throughout the stay. We had 2 pool access interconnecting rooms. I got a great deal for them, so was surprised at how good the rooms were for the price. Hotel and security staff were always friendly and helpful. The rooms were cleaned well daily. The sun only reaches one side of the sunbeds and only for a few hours but that’s pretty standard in Bali and didn’t ruin our experience. Plus you’re in Bali - so much to see! The pool was nice and well kept. We ate out for breakfast as a bit pricey compared to nearby eateries when you’re on a budget and 3 of you. Used the snack bar for lunch a few times and was well priced and nice. Location is great. You can walk to most places. Beach was a 5 mins walk, Waterbom and discovery mall about 30 mins walk. The beach walk mall about 15 min walk. There are LOADS of places to eat nearby all with different price ranges. From ridiculously cheap to ridiculously expensive. TV had a good few English channels. Overall, I would very much recommend and would happily stay again!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Terrace hotel a few times now and it is probably my favourite one around. The rooms are very clean with comfortable beds and a nice bathroom, everything gets cleaned everyday. The location is great, you can walk everywhere, shops, restaurants, nightclubs and the beach are all very close. Besides, the location is central, which makes it easy to visit other places like Seminyak and Canggu. Staff is helpful and friendly and the prices for the rooms are fantastic. Loved my stay!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good budget hotel. Staff are pleasant. Good security. Very clean. Rooms spacious and nice. Free coffee and tea facilities. Fast wifi throughout. Air con not to good but seems to be a common problem in Indonesian hotels. Room overlooked swimming pool. Check in and out quick. Did not have breakfast included but decided to have on last day only as had a long day ahead. OK. Simple no frills but pricey for what they offered. Go to the main road for cheaper better options unless included. Location wise perfect for main street. Restaurants, bars, shops and massages on your doorstep! If you are looking for a central cheap Kuta hotel that is clean, good night's sleep and shower with excellent location, this is the place!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you look for a budgeted hotel that is near Kuta Beach and also the famous Legian Street then this hotel is undoubtly recommended. My family and I stayed in Deluxe Room with Pool Access. Ah, some motor and/or car rentals are everywhere also, so we don't find difficulty to rent one when we decided to have street tour by ourselves. If there is ONE thing this hotel can improve is its breakfast variation.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very comfortable hotel, but it weren't enough furniture and hangers to put the clothes. Please can yo fix it please) Nice and big swimming pool, clean room nubmers, convinient location, near the airport
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here on dozens of occssions. Shame on me for not saying thank you sooner. Staff are amazing. Big and clean rooms. Central but away from the craziness of Kuta yet walking distance to it. Amazing!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is at the center of everything in Bali. Once you step out of the hotel, you can choose restaurants, souvenir shops, money changers, convenience stores and more. The hotel breakfast is good. They do not repeat the menu on Indonesian food. Airport transfer is a breeze as the staff would make arrangement for bluebird taxis. From hotel to airport is just 40k IDR.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in the hotel with my wife and 2 kids. We took premium room.Room was bit small but it was worth for money. The location of the hotel is very nice. Beach is just 7 mins of walk. The market is downstairs. The staff were very nice and helpful. Swimming pool was also great. Only bad thing was AC was not making the room cool as expected.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a nice clean hotel. The rooms were small but contained two single beds, good shower and air con and in room safe. The hotel is very close to some cheap bars to hang out in and there are ATMS and shops and tattoo parlours close by. The rates here were very reasonable and the breakfast buffet was good. The staff were very friendly.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was given a room overlooking the pool at the uppermost floor, 5th, to be precise. Room was pleasing, simple, modern, clean and bright. Bathroom was spotlessly clean but lack amenities. My problem starts when I was about to go to bed at 11.00 pm when the air-con chiller on the roof top, i believed starts to emit loud unbearable noise which disrupt my sleep. No one, I believed will able to sleep in such condition. Made a call, they obliged to change a room at the lower floors which I have no issue with it. I had to packed up in the middle of the night to change my room which I find it disruptive in sleep. Except from the person who answered my call in the midnight apologised, no one seems to follow up the next day. That's a minus. I will recommend this hotel to friends which I find good value for money with the exception of what I stated.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had deluxe double room (pool side) at 1F. The room wasn’t big but good enough. WiFi was well connected and fast. A/C wasn’t really cold but it was alright. Room was clean also the bathroom. Had enough lights and sockets. Mini fridge seemed couldn’t work well. Bed and pillows were comfortable. Staff are nice and efficient. Hotel offer beers and drinks with fare price. No need to go out to get drinks. Pool was nice and refreshing. Overall, it was a great choice for its price. And it has legit location, easy to go anywhere. Beach is about 10 mins walk. Mini mart right next to hotel. I would like to come back to this hotel again.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All nice & clean, little extras, nice and quiet even though it's in the middle of everything. Staff super nice & helpful, great tv with English channels including HBO & others. Nice pool, small range on food for lunch but nice breakfast. A little gem, highly recommended A+
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We initally booked 3 nights but have since extended our stay twice. Newish hotel with a nice pool area, rooms are clean with flat screen TV, fridge and kettle. Centrally located in walking distance to the beach, Jalan Legian andPoppies 2. Fast Wi-Fi and awesome staff.Prob the only con is that the rooms above can be a bit noisy, if your a light sleeper you might want earplugs.Other than that, fantastic..Would have to be one of the best value stays in Bali
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: During my holiday in Bali I stayed several times at Terrace Hotel. This a in between I been travelling to other destinations. The service in the hotel exceed the expectations. The staff is helpful and if there any issues solutions are offered promptly. The location is well located, easy distance from airport, outgoing, shops or a beach. The rooms are clean, the breakfast small but from good quality. The hotel has a nice pool, which is good to refresh during the time of relaxing. The times I stayed at Terrace always been comfortable, I would highly recommend this hotel as a base during a stay in Bali.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a few nights at this hotel and it is ok for the price but could easily be improved. The rooms need a refresh, a bit of paint and maintenance would make a big difference. There were hairs in the shower which is not a big deal but still a bit off putting. To add to that the bath towels looked very old and although supposedly white they looked grey. I do recommend getting a room on the top floor. We were unlucky and had some people above us banging around all night. I had to change rooms at 4:30 am! Not really the hotels fault but still. The other annoying thing was that the air-con units are all attached to the exterior walls surrounding the hotel which gives the feeling of sleeping in a washing machine. The breakfast looked kind of sparse and I decided to look elsewhere, guess you get what you pay for
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Paying only HKD190 for a room, I would say it’s triple the value. Spacious and clean hotel room with balcony looking down the pool. Pool is reasonable size. Staff are friendly and helpful. Led hand side down the road and there’s the beach in 5 mins with lots of restaurants and massage places along the road. This is the biggest surprise in my whole trip to Bali!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When my boyfriend come one year's ago and he choose Terrace Kuta hotel. The place Absolut good clean and quite. Staff very friendly, I love pool because sun come direct to pool when u enjoy in lunch time or afternoon. For sure next I will stay here again. Good price, good place and incredible,. I don't wanna leave from this hotel really COMFORTABLE
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here februari 2017 with my two sisters...the hotel is very clean...nice modern style decoration...its at the centre of kuta region...a little walk will bring you to kuta beach...the swimming pool is also clean and fresh...a lot of cafe and pub around...mostly australian ...simply great place...and the price is just perfect
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I never used charming in all my reviews, but this hotel is an exceptional!I've stayed here for 5 nights and for the price I've paid, i think its worth much more than I could ever imagine.First, you guys shud know that even though this is a small hotel, but it is squeaky clean everywhere!! The room was extremely comfortable and clean and so does the bathroom. The room is very spacious for 2 people and most of the rooms has small balcony which i think is really really neat looking down at the swimming pool. You can enjoy the tranquility of Balinese air in the morning and dusk at the balcony. All rooms have big sliding door unlike most similar hotel which only have small windows. TV channel was ok and aircond was also working nicely as it is a split unit.Every staff you'll meet at the hotel were very courteous and helpful. And if you ever wanted to rent a motorbike, the hotel gave the cheapest rent rate compare if you rent from any other place. They serve breakfast for USD5 but i think the breakfast was mediocre so we only had it one time and ate outside most of the times.The swimming pool sit in the middle of the hotel and it is beautifully preserves and maintained. I suggest you to take a dip at sunset around 730pm where it is really peaceful and you can truly enjoy this hotel.The last thing i wanna highlight to you guys is the location of this hotel which is very important regardless the niceness of the hotel. Well, the location is smack in the center of the lively Legian, but not on the main street. You have to deviate around 250meter from Legian main street to reach this hotel which was reasonably ok to me. And you have to walk around 1.2km to go to the beach along the narrow back roads of Legian. So you see, if you want to stay in Legian for all its Bar and happening things especially at night but still want to stay in a more peaceful hotel without hearing any of those noise, than this is perfect hotel. But if you prefer your hotel near to the beach of want to hear the sound of waves upon waking up, than please look for other hotel at Kuta area. One thing you guys shud also know when you rent a motorbike and stay in this hotel, most of the road in Legian are one way and cramped with pedestrian and motorbikes, so its not easy to navigate to get back every evening so be extra careful.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, comfortable and close to all the essentials like restaurants, laundry service, little shops etc..It’s a bit of a walk to the shopping mall and beach but it is do-able. A decent price as well for what you get. Being that hygiene is quite important to me, I would reccommend this place.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was stuck in Bali due to Mt Agung eruption. Decided to give good review on this hotel where the reception giving a good services, thumbs up. The room is clean and new, importantly wifi is really good, for me to work while i am stuck here.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a good enough hotel near the center of Kuta. Quiet place and beautiful pool. Room was ok and everything worked. Shower was quite clean and airconditioning worked. Wifi was fast and hotel breakfast did its' job although it wasn't fabulous.So if you need a hotel for a couple af days, this may be your place. Would not stay for more than a week, the same breakfast would get boring. Personnel was nice and helpful.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Terrace At Kuta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Realy nice people and a realy new and clean hostel. Drinks and good food anyway. The place to be! Near from the beach. The best host you can emagine: Agus!All wath you want, goes there hostel anyone.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolute class backpacker hostel from start to finish. Great rooms. Kicking lounge chillout area. Nice kitchen. Close to beach and local shops. Friendly staff. Clean as you like. Cute dogs. This place was good! Can't recommend high enough.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Canggu Beach Hostel with my friends. They have a pool outside next to the rice fields and some farms around. It's very calm and relaxing and just 10 min away from the beach. They sell all kinds of food and have a big menu of western and some local food but I just tried the cocktails which I found good.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really like this Hostel! Its very close to the Beach and to a big Statue. The Bed was comfortable i sleep well! The Bathroom and Toilet is good as well. I Love the Reggea Music on the Bar. The Workers here Are very friendly and the Canggu Beach Hostel is the cheapest Place to Rent a Scooter! You Can Play Pool and Ping Pong or you Can Jump into the Pool.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really good price.good location.breakfast is good.rooms are clean.staffs are really good.near to sea.there are a lot of Restaurants there.really good view .you can go there with friends or family.overall it’s ok
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fast service in front desk, and free access to the awesome pool club Black Sand on the same property with pool bar, restaurant, billiard and such. Lovely drinks. Will visit again when I'm back in Canggu.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Compare to other hostels in bali and in canggu, this one really stands out!Restaurant, pool, bar, scooter rental, movie nights, beer pong, billiard, game nights etc..this place has everything. Its close to the main city area (batu bolong), people that states otherwise dont know canggu. There are plenty of shortcuts and the staff can help tell you where they are. 5 min to batu bolong. The restaurang offers a good variaty of vegan food which i dont find very common at hostels or even hotels. Im glad i found this place and its so easy to make travel friends here!
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm disappointed because they cancelled completely on me 2 weeks before my reservation due to the place being renovated. I'm guessing they knew earlier than 2 weeks that this was the plan. Actually, I know they must have known because 6 weeks ago they changed my room due to another renovation. Would have rather had them just cancel altogether then. I'm scrambling now to find some place else. With this type of business management perhaps I dodged a bullet. Just hope I can get my refund soon...
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would recommend this hostel, its near to the beach, if you surf you can go just by walking an if not you can enjoy the beautiful sunset. The staff is very friendly and always willing to help.There's all lot different options for breakfast lunch or dinner. Olso the bar next to the swimming-pool it's open the whole day.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really can recommend this hostel for all those who want to meet nice people, have some good partys and go surfing. Close to the beach, good bed's, great pool, fun and helpful stuff! Its a quiet place in the middle of the rice fields but still close enough to go partying with a scooter.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Actually I wanted to just stay here for two nights and ended up to stay here more than one month. It's such a nice place to meet amazing people and what you get for the money is amazing. I truly can recommend this place if you want to meet nice people and want to keep your money together. The stuff is so so so helpful and friendly, it's really like a home. Thank you for everything ;)
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel was slightly underwhelming for a few reasons.There is a huge food menu advertised on big boards, however when I came to order dinner, there was barely anything available to me because they were out of stock of most things. Whilst trying to place my order, the staff member wasn't listening to me and was on WhatsApp instead, I had to repeat myself several times, very rude.The staff member that gave me my food also said "sorry this food isn't great", I don't understand why they would knowingly serve substandard food.The room we stayed in was clean enough but the 3 high bunk beds weren't great.I can see that this will be a nice hostel when building work has finished.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Has comfy clean beds, great hangout area(swimming pool, bean bags, ping pong table and pool table) to meet new people. Perfect for solo, fuss-free travellers. The vibe is relaxed and fun, the staffs are nice n friendly too.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really nice pool area, rooms have good AC and wifi, amazing food (budget menu available if you haven't got much money), can hire scooters to get into the main town if needed, good surf beach 5 minute walk away.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came here as a solo backpacker and found it really easy to meet people. Good environment and good sitting area. The pool is awesome and there are cheap food and drink options. Such a good price as well. The rooms are very clean and the beds are comfy. No complaints. Would recommend to solo travelers or groups. Awesome environment!!!
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 2 weeks there by myself, perfect to learn surf, meet people and have perfect holidays! Staff is really nice and helpful, you can have all you need in this place (food, drinks, swimming pool, pool table, ping pong table....) but also around Canggu! It's very close to the beach and lot of shops! I recommend it 100%!!!
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here in This hostel for 2 days. The hostel is not faraway from the beach and the area is quiet. The food is good and really cheap. You can also get a free dinner.You can get your personal locker so you can put your personal staffs.Recommended!
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a great stay at this hostel! Really nice pool area and a good vibe! Totally worth the money and I would recommend it to every backpacker staying in Canggu! And don’t forget to taste their avocado toast for breakfast
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a good hostel for meeting other travelers if you're traveling solo! The staff is so nice and helpful, and they have surf lessons which is cheap! I was supposed to stay three nights, but ended up staying six nights! Would recommend staying here!
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: first things first the staff there are amazing! So they are definately not a negative part of the hostel at all! They were super helpful and sweet!! Though the rooms are very small and the triple bunkbed is a bit too much for such a small room. We didnt know we had toleave our big backpacks outside of the dorm and take in only the things we needed. We found this very inconvienent for us. The bathrooms were good and the common area wasnt too bad either. The food was okay but most of my friends and i got sick after eating from here and we had to wait ages to eat, for example 6 of my friends would have eaten after already waiting ages and I had to wait 30 more minutes until I got my meal, it was so late some of my friends had headed off to sleep!
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'll start by saying, I wouldn't reccommend this hostel. I'll elaborate on why:-My partner got bitten by bedbugs all over her legs, feet and back! After reporting it, nothing was done about it other than stripping the bedsheets. She slept in my bed for the reminder of the stay to avoid further creepy crawleys. Avoid bed 8 downstairs main building!!- The bathrooms were not cleaned as regularly as stated. Workers came and built dividers in our adjoining bathroom, leaving sawdust, tools, bamboo and general rubbish. This left it out of action for most of the time. The upstairs showers were low in water pressure.. but the worst thing to find was a used tampon in the shower. Something about the memory of streams of red around your feet before you notice why still gives me shivers. This was STILL there the next day! -The hostel isn't best located, around Echo beach is much closer to all the other bars and restaurants. The hostel food is ok.. but there is way more choice and selection around Echo beach.- Lots of staff... but not very efficient. Hands up to Ian behind the bar.. one guy working his socks off by himself! Even when it was really busy. 24 hour reception is not true.. one couple arrived at 12am and had been waiting for 3 hours before one of the other guests pointed them to a free bed (ironically bed 8.. the bedbug one)- the socialising areas are a little restrictive compared to other hostels I've been toThere are some merits to the place though, the scooter hire is cheap and efficient, the drinks relatively cheap and food was ok (albeit variable in time to arrive)
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic hostel, very clean, very welcoming to the solo traveller and great parties in the evenings! Really nice staff who are very helpful with planning your trip and generally helping you out. Will definitely recommend canggu beach hostel
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So we booked 3 nights at the Canggu Beach Hostel. 2 days before arriving we requested the pickup service at the airport that the hostel proposes for 250k (the highest price you could pay, you can negotiate a local taxi for 230k easy). When we arrived no taxi was here to pick us up. We phoned the hostel and they said "we have a problem with our taxis, you have to take a taxi on our own sorry". Since they have their own drivers that we're working completely fine when we arrived an hour later our wonder what kind of problem they had. But fair enough, we negotiated a taxi for cheaper we weren't that unhappy, it happens.When we arrived at the hostel, it took 45 minutes to check in. Now, the hostel likes to say that it's because there are a lot of people which is true sometimes but when we arrived there was one person in line in front of us and two staff at the check-in. It took a lot of time because the check-in process is extremely long and the staff extremely slow. Then they asked for our credit card, I've been travelling 3 weeks in Indonesia and 2 months in SE Asia and this is the first time a hostel ask me for my credit card although we booked through an online booking website.Anyway, we finally check in and get to our room, and of course, the room was not done. The floor was full of sand and hair and the sheets had not been changed from the previous guests. So we go back to the reception and ask them to tidy the room. One of the staff says "I'll personally make sure the room is perfect, wait for 30 minutes". We come back 30 minutes later, sheets were changed and clean but of course the floor was still full of sand and hair. We ask them to redo it again and finally they get it right the 3rd time! The shower pressure is very weak, so my girlfriend ask them to turn it up so she could wash her hair. They said "ok we'll call the maintenance guy" of course 20 Minutes later the pressure is still very weak so we go ask again and they answer "sorry the maintenance guy just left to the airport to pick up guests" (I wonder why they couldn't pick us up then).Anyhow staff is not trained at this hostel and really inefficient, except the barman outside he really rocks, is smiling and efficient. Transport service (private shuttle) is really overpriced, you can find way cheaper. And it's the only place where we did not get a private bathroom along with the double room. TL;DR go to another hostel, you can find much better for much cheaper. PS: hope the management will not answer this comment in a sassy manner as they usually do. This hostel could be great but there are things that need to be addressed.PS2: a hello or even a smile from the manger would be greatly appreciated :)
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Front desk staff confirmed a price on internet and then did not honour that price. Insisted on higher rate when I tried to book within 48hrs of them confirming a lower rate. I booked a private room for a month at a different property. They agreed to a rate in writing and then refused to accept that the booking. I have been a host on Airbnb for a number of years and a host (someone with a listing) has 3 options when they have selected "dynamic pricing" on their listing: 1) send a special offer matching the rate you just agreed to. 2) Agree to adjust the rate back to what you agreed to after the booking (by giving a refund in Airbnb), or 3) Turn dynamic pricing off and adjust the rate manually back to the rate you already agreed to. Canggu Beach Hostel was contacted by both myself and representatives of Airbnb and stated "no, we will keep the pricing as it is". I booked a month stay for a private room at another property.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to meet people if you're a solo traveler. Surfing lessons are cheap and good. Close to the beautifull beach wich will occasionally shows seaturtles. Partys at night are great and with 2 hours of happy hour they not expensive. After 11 most people go to canggu city to keep on partying. Which is just a 15 minute walk.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My plan was to stay 6 nights and I decided to stay 2 nights more. The stuff is super friendly, they remember your name after two days and the food was amazing ! You can rent a scooter easy and the rooms is clean.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I didn't like it much probably because i'm a bit old for this kind of hostel, however I'd recommend it for people that wanna meet people and party. +clean, nice pool, good food, good wifi, close to one of the beaches, they rent scooters, nice staff. -Small lockers, 12 beds in one room, 1 toilet per bedroom, you have to leave your bag outside the room, drunk guys around late, noisy.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: - check in at 11pm was quiet fast done and organized..but there was no feeling of beeing welcomed.staff seemed unmotivated- stayed in a 12 bedroom which is in a seperate house a few meters up the muddy street, as it was night u couldn't see anything walking up there because of the darkness.- the room was quite smelly and not clean..specially the shower and toilet. The bed looked nice made up but it was full of sand.- In the middle of the night an other girl wanted to climb in my bed while i was sleeping and told me its hers.. so the bed was double booked.- when i got my luggage from the storageroom which ur not alowed to take in the rooms because to avoid the bedbugs (good idea) but after it was full of ants and other insects which were spread all over!- breakfast was really good:)- check out took ages! 45min.they wanted the towel back which i never got- the place was crowded and seemed to be not under control anymore...there was just not enough space for so many people!all in one i was very disappointed...specially because i was reading all the good reviews before.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are cheap but once you arrive you realize everything about this place is very pricey. Meals are around 65,000. The issue is that the hostel is not near anything, so you are basically trapped and have to buy expensive food / drinks. In addition, I saw someone lose their key and they charged 100,000! More than 1 night stay. Crazy! This place is nice, but a complete money machine. Come here if you've got cash to blow.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 300 meter to the beach, big swimming pool, nice staff, comfy bed, good value, i loved to join beach clean up make me feel good, 5 mins short cut to Batubalong Echo beach, bar, restaurant, shopping and night life...
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The food at this place is absolutely incredible and they offer all you need for a chill time in Canggu. A bit hard to find, but once you're there you don't need to leave so that's all good. Beware of spending too much, cause the card system and amazing food and drinks they offer will force you above you're budget.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thought I'd start this if with a quick snippet about the place. I wasn't aware of this until I had arrived. I question a place that needs to offer freebies to get a good review.  The Pros: -The Hostel is nice, fairly clean and has a bar/ food area and outdoor pool.  -They offer scooter hire at the same price as everywhere else (50,000 a day) -The food was pretty good with a decent selection -They have a card system so you essentially run up a tab until you leave the Hostel. THE CONS-They enforce a policy whereby you have to leave your Backpack in a Shed away from the Bungalows. They offer (the noisiest)plastic bags to put your belongings in to take to the rooms. It is apparently because of Bed Bug prevention. I understand that. The flaw in this is that you still take all your clothing up with you which is equally as likely to contain them as your backpack should you have the misfortune of Bed Bugs. This therefore is just a massive inconvenience having to go back and forth to this shed. - The check in & out takes ages! It's so over complicated. - The tab cards. In ways they are a Pro but as a group they all charge to the same account so you have to break down all of the costs and pay that way. - They prohibit the use of Uber, Grab, GoJek and Bluebird Taxis to pick you up and you have to use theirs, which from the quotes is got were more expensive. This is also something necessary as the Hostel is quite a ways out of town. - The Pool area is pretty run down and the outdoor area along with the common room is nowhere near large enough for the guests they accommodate, this made worse by the location so many don't go out. - With the small amount of areas to sit its worsened by the 3 high bunks. You can't sit in them as they are stacked so close together. - Two of our friends arrived late due to a delayed arrival and no one was around but security who were insistent they had no booking despite us already being there, explaining the situation and who the booking was under. This meant my wife had to get up at 2am to prove they were with the same booking. Bonus Comment- most of the people in the Bungalow we stayed in were left with little to sleep. This because of two couples decided to have sex on and off from 3am-7am. Granted this isn't a hostel fault but considering how seriously they took all the policies they didn't seem to take the one of prohibiting other people into the rooms as seriously.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hostel with a good atmosphere, the rooms are nice and have there own bathroom. The staff is friendly, and understand english. They are making food, which is really good. I can highly recommend this hostel.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is a really nice, relaxed atmosphere here which is great for meeting people. Nice pool/bar area with a great selection of drinks and happy hour. Food is also good, but a little more expensive than elsewhere. Not in the centre of Canggu but a nice location on the beach. Only a 20/30 minute walk along the beach into the centre of town. Rooms and bathrooms are nice and good wifi everywhere!
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I will start by saying this hostel uses a tab system which is okay for a solo traveller. However we had a party of 6 and all individual tabs where kept under the same name which made it confusing when paying at the end!! The food is great here and reasonably priced considering. The location means that your gonna have to get a scooter out while you are there which come at a cost of 50k which is okay. The pool area is lush it's nicely kept and chilled. Also another system is they do not allow you to take bags into the rooms, as they say it stops bedbugs. This can make it a bit of trek to your bags if you are in the top bungalow. Overall I enjoyed my stay, just a few things needs tweaking!!
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hostel, payment plan could use some work. Took forever to check in because of all the paperwork/ set up of payment cards. Basically you dont pay cash for anything, you have a swipe card. Should make things easy but we found it made things more complicated then it needed to be. Staff were lovely! Rooms were a good size as long as you dont mind triple bunks.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall good place. Not crazy atmosphere and bad location from other bars but chill vibes, nice pool and great food. I have to write more words to get a free beer so hi. More words. You should probs rent a scooter if you're staying here.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed my stay! Staff were very friendly, the food was great, good happy hour prices, the rooms were very clean and the it was a nice social and chill atmosphere by the pool, day and night!The WiFi works in the dorm rooms and the gym is very modern and well equipped. Location is a little further out than I expected, requiring a taxi or scooter to get around. Overall really great place!
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Planned to stay here for 5 nights, ended it early due to personal affair back in Jakarta. Amazing place, very professionally run, friendly and helpful staffs. The atmosphere is perfect to chill and socialize with people from all over the world, plus the food and beverages are well worth it. Price: amazingCleanliness: amazing, staffs are quick to make the bed soon as anyone is leaving their room in the morning.Another big plus: free gym everyday!Definitely coming back!I want to offer my photography and videography service to create content for this hostel's marketing effort! If this is something you are interested in, hit me up aprofessionalpanda@gmail.com :)
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is very good value for money and has a number of great facilities. The pool is huge and is a perf temperature! The rooms and nice and well air conditioned and the beds are very comfy. Also great for meeting people!!
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A good place if you want a get away near the black beach (5 mins walk). The bar staff are really friendly and the food is yummy! Go in prepared that you'll have to hire bikes/ bicycles to venture out to Canggu's main town. Hiring a bike for the day is no more than £3 here. They light up candles at night around the pool where you can sit and drink your happy hour drinks. The rooms are clean and my bed sheets were changed every night staying there.
