However, if you want to try more Indonesian food you'll need to fish around as it'll be a lot more cheaper and quicker service in a less busy environment.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great facilities, nice staff, good food! A bit away from the centre but you can rent a scooter pretty cheap. Also the pool is amazing to hang out and make new friends :) Free gym is also available. Recommend to stay here!
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely place with cool little bungalow type dorms. Nice pool with lovely clean toilets and hot showers. Amazing food and friendly staff! It's a little far out the way but you can rent scooters to and have a good day out. Not far from a black sand beach where you can pick up surf lessons for a reasonable price.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A fantastic hostel with a great social scene. A little out the way but a 15 minute scooter ride (available for rent at the hostel) will get you to all the great spots in Canggu. Being able to get to the beach with such a short walk is very beneficial. Especially if you're into your surfing. Highly recommend and comes at a great price.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hostel with very friendly staff. The food is great and the pool area is super beautiful. They clean the rooms and make your bed everyday. There is a scooter rental and a free gym you can use. To town is possible by scooter or a 10min walk via the beach.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this for 2 nights but extended it with the offer they had on. This was you pay 90k for 3 more nights and get the 4th free. It's such good value. The hostel is so clean, your beds are made every day and if you need a new towel you just ask. The room has an automatic mosquito spray. I arrived at 5am the security checked me in so there's no problem with late arrivals. Location wise it's about a 10 minute walk to the beach. It's about 10/15 min taxi or scooter ride to the 'centre' (good places are dotted all over the place in canggu) you can hire a scooter from the hostel for only 50k a day. It has a nice pool area. You get a free gym membership which is a 2 minute ride down the road!Only downside I would say is that it could do with a bigger bar/relaxing area which would make it easier to socialise at night. Really enjoyed my stay here thanks canggu beach hostel
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cool place with very good food. 5 min walk from a small beach but a taxi/bike away from most of the popular or central things. The rooms are very clean and AC works well. Would recommend the breakfast bowls!!
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is a perfect mix of party and chill. Good facilities, fab pool and outside area. The staff and other guests are lovely, this is a great place to meet people. I was very impressed with the menu, always something to try. Its hard to leave this hostel.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Forget about just staying in a normal boring hostel, this one is spectacular, 10mins with the scooter to the town, 2 mins walking to the beach, the set up is amazing for meeting travelers, have a game around the pool or a chat with others, after speaking to Alex one of the most professional owners i have seen in Bali hostels about sharing some of my performances at his hostel to make guests happy and he was absolutely supportive and guests were truly happy to be invited to the shows! Staff are unbelievably helpful, the new chef gives a delicious touch with his new menu, barman was doing his magic with a very very good prices for shots and cocktails, Likes: Almost everything - Dislikes: Three bunk beds, many out of control drunk travelers noises which actually happens in almost all hostels. However they still offer you private rooms if you needed to have a special night, i have shared a very very good memories at this place! Defo my fav in Canggu! Highly recommended for travelers!
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really loved my time at Canggu beach hostel. They had a chilled-out pool vibe to hang out at during the day and quick access to easy surf at the nearby beach. They also just got a new chef and the food is great now - nasi goreng and spinach eggs especially. Also thought Bob the fire performer, put on a great show with the beach fire and LED lights. Good pool party, beer pong, and open bar at night.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a wonderful stay here in the beginning of my Bali travels. Made so many friends here!! That's in every hostel, I know, but it was different here. Prob because of how the hostel is set up. It was so good that I came back here to end my last few days of my Bali trip. At night there is Bob whom I'm still friends with and he is the entertainer there. Such a friendly fella, gives a fireshow his own style. So good. He will make sure you'll all have fun together on a night out or even just to chill near the pool. Go there!
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Surfing, traveling or just a holiday this place caters for all! This place has a great social aspect where you hang out around the pool to meet new people. They also have their own kitchen with incredible food that's also cheap. Walking distance to a great beach and if you're lazy you can rent a scooter here also for only 50k! Check it out
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Canggu Beach Hostel twice during my trip to Bali. Didn't even consider a different hostel the second time I got back to Canggu. The hostel has got a really chilled out vibe, with an superb poolarea to relax at in between the surfingsessions. They are really serious about potential problems with bud bugs, so if that's a concern for you, this is the place to be. Everything is really clean and tidy, with a very welcoming and assisting staff. Would for sure recommend this place to everyone!
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice looking hostel, clean with comfortable beds. Got offered a free beer as I arrived for having had to wait 30 mins before they could put me in my room. The garden is pretty beautiful and comfortable seating is available. Wifi is fast, food is pretty good, nice music on all day long so overall grest place to relax. Scooter ental available from the hostel and free gym too! Would recommend.
hotelName:
2    Canggu Beach Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow was this place amazing, very quiet, relaxing and beyond beautiful. The gardens were immaculate and lush, a lot of care has gone into the gardens. The breakfast was very good and very filling. The staff are very young but helpful. There could be a kettle in the room with tea and coffee and new mattresses as ours was rather lumpy. Having said that the view and balcony made up for the mattress!
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two nights in a villa and this is definitely a place for us to return to. In the middle of stunning rice fields. From our beautiful terrace we had a fantastic view. When you can afford it, please go for a villa. It is spacious, beautiful decorated, clean comfy bed, large bathroom: it was one of our best stays this holiday. The staff is extremely friendly and the food in the restaurant good. Don't forget : 15% is added to the bill plus an extra 2% for your credit card payment.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights and cannot recommend it more. It was traveling in luxury but at budget prices. Our room had it's own private porch with a view of the rice terraces. The view from the restaurant is breathtaking and the food there is delicious and affordable. We had a couples massage that only cost about $10/each USD that was wonderful. We had cappuccinos delivered to the pool in the morning while we read, and the villa is within walking distance of most everything in Sideman. Only a quarter mile up the road are delicious warungs with views of Agung. Sideman is what Ubud probably once was, without the crowds and the trash. And the place is owned by a family from the area, not internationally owned, which is a plus. If you are going to Bali, you MUST go to Sideman and if in Sideman, you will not be disappointed with Sawah Indah (which means beautiful rice fields).
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After staying in this resort a couple of months ago we decided to go there for dinner in the restaurant. We enjoyed this a lot the last time we were there.Again the food was very delicious for a good price. The view is amazing and this is a good place to have dinner even if you are nog staying in the hotel
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were amazed when we got our familyroom. So nice and clean and they clean your room every day.Their driver Putu is such a nice guy. He drove us to Mount Batur one night at 2 a.m. and other cool places almost every day. Recommended if you need a driver!
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As I remember its my third time to stay In Sawah Indah Villa.Since I live in busy Denpasar city, sometimes I need relax in rural remote area and Sideman especially Sawah Indah Villa is the perfect place.Its really quiet here, all the staff always smile and willing to help.Now Sawah Indah Villa become a favorite place to escape from busy Denpasar city.And cant wait to come back this December for new year with the family
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is surrounded by nature and close to rice fields still tended by local rice farmers (dont go to talalangan rice terrace its a tourist trap near ubud, instead go on a rice field walk in sidemen and you'll get the real experience - we went with wayan a local man who works at his cousins warung near the hotel)We stayed in room 2 lovely spacious room with a great view from the balcony and it had an outdoor bathroom! having an outdoor shower was fun!I went to the spa twice. First time my boyfriend and i had massages - you can have massages together and are asked to put on paper pants. The massage was good and the therapist asked if it was comfortable enough so you do get chance to ask for a firmer or lighter massage. Second time i went alone for the body scrub with flower bath - loved it! you get 15 mins in the flower bath (after the scrub) to relax and its so peaceful. The spa is a wooden cottage on stilts in the gardens its only small and in a pretty, natural setting. Food - we only had breakfast though really tasty and a good variety. We ate dinner in the local warungs and we would have drinks at the hotel restaurant before going out. Its fine to sit at a table and just have drinks.The pool was great, towels are provided and theres a telephone next to the towel cabinet for ordering drinks/food. Also they serve a complimentery afternoon tea - tea and fried banana etc. we really enjoyed our stay at the hotel and sidemen still has a traditional way of life.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a couple living in Bali (Ubud) for many years and wanted a little getaway for the weekend. This hotel gave everything we expected. Service: it was getting used to again for us to be a tourist. Normally we avoid tourist places. The service was great. Personal greeted us politely whenever we saw them and they did a lot of effort to make us feel comfortable. Bringing food and drinks at the pool, changing the gasbottle for the hot water and filling out water bottles in the restaurant. Nothing seemed a problem to them. 5 stars!Infinity pool: I must say that the management does it clever with the main photo on tripadvisor to be an old one. If you look carefully you can see that a lot of photos are from 2013. Since than the hotel has grown but the pool is still an amazing place to hang out during the day. 5 stars!Room: we had room nr 4 and we got exactly what we booked. The room was spacious with a large outdoor balcony. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was also very nice. We personally like this style of furniture and rooms. 5 stars!Restaurant: also a lot different than on one of the first photos from 2013. It's a lot better. A large spacious restaurant on the first level gives you an great view of the surroundings. Prices and quality are average but the atmosphere makes up for it. Yes you can go to cheaper warungs in the street and we did also but we can reccomend to dine at least one evening here. Breakfast was fine Choice out of a western or indonesian breakfast. Indonesian cuisine is not western so don't expect a breakfast as you would get in a western hotel. No complaints. 4 stars!Spa: as we live in Bali (and as masseur myself) I know it when I have a good massage. The traditional Balinese massage we got were average. Not bad but it could be a lot better. The price was reasonable for hotel standards but to high if you put it next to the quality. The spa itself looked very nice. 3 stars!What we really liked was the surroundings of the hotel. It's in the middle of ricefields where the local people just work. It's like watching a play and a nice mix of hotel guests and locals just doing what they do on a daily base. Also we were happy that we could refill out waterbottle. Bali has a real plastic waste problem so we try to be aware as much as possible. The hotel does provide small water bottles to every room and I wished they stopped doing that. But it made us happy that refilling our bottles wasn't a problem.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really enjoyed our stay last week in this villa, nice view from the infinity pool. Great service of the staff, nice food, really recommend for those who wants to relax and enjoy the peaceful. Will definitely come back and recommend to our family and friends..
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was our second hotel in Bali, and we were very pleased with this hotel. We stayed there for two nights. The restaurant was delicious, and our room overlooked the rice fields.I hope you're not scared of lizards, we found at least two small ones in our room, and they can get a bit noisy during the night, but totally harmless.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Property, including our room, had an amazing view of the rice terraces and a beautiful pool, with a comfortable, beautiful private seating area. It was one of the most beautiful properties that we stayed in during our trip. The Indonesian breakfast was outstanding (we are vegetarians, and it was the best during our trip to Indonesia). Sidemen isn't swarmed by tourists, which is great. Staff were super friendly.Shower was not consistently warm - not sure if they use sun-heated water, and that was due to because of limited sunlight during our stay. This did not detract from our stay, whatsoever.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent two nights and wish it were longer. Absolutely beautiful design, lovely bungalows with great touches. Little things like small chill seating areas are scattered around, as are zen positive thoughts, which are carved into boards. It’s surrounded by lush rainforests and hills, which is view from the infinity pool. Staff is fantastic, and restaurant offers beautiful views and tasty food. It rained both days we were there and we still didn’t want to leave. Our favorite stay on Bali, will return.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is not really a review, as I didn't stay there. We had lunch at Sidemen in a day trip, saw this villa during our after lunch walk. We were attracted by the landscape design and the staff at the front desk were friendly and kind enough to invite us to take a walk around the property. This place is beautifully designed and surrounded by the rice field. I would definitively go back to Sidemen one day and stay there for a relaxing holiday.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 3 nights here. The bungalow was excellent, indoor bathtub, outdoor shower, huge terrace with view to ricefields. Well equipped and clean. The brekafast is limited, but good, with beautiful view.. The pool and overall the garden is amazing. We ate dinner 3 times at the hotel restaurant, very good quaility. Only a few insects in room, despite its in the nature. Very calm area and only a few toursits and hotel around, ideal to make walking tours. We enjoyed every minute here.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my 7times visit sidemen village, and Sawah Indah This is an amazing place to stay, the air the view and people are so nice, I hope I could stay longer. My room also pretty, I will definitely come back soon. Thank you so much ❤️
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two nights in Sawah Indah Villa and enjoyed our stay for the whole time. If we knew how beautiful and peaceful place this is, could have stayed longer. Nature sounds during the night were impressing and the staff was very kind.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the family room with 2 beds and 2 bath (with 2 bath tubs!) and wanted to extend but it was booked out. The service was absolutely great, prompt, delivered delicious food to the room and cared about their visitors. The views are spectacular and we loved that it was quiet in the morning. The rooms are not air conditioned but it was not needed as it is very airy and has lots of glass doors. We loved sitting on the deck and watching the rice fields and workers and also tried their Spa overlooking the rice terraces. The kids loved the pool and the Inspirational Quotes in the garden were very inspiring. We have also spotted 2 snakes and a few frogs.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The name "Sawah Indah" means "beautiful ricefield". The name is apt for the accomodation. The bungalows are set on a hill side with rice and other fields around. The villagers work in the fields and it gives a nice atmosphere. The place has a nice restaurant, reception area, swimming pool and recreation area. We took the small bungalow, but it was too small, so we upgraded to a big one. It was well worth the extra money. Very spacious, well-built and well-integrated in the landscape. Not only the Sawah Indah villa was nice, but the surrounding properties as well. All the development in the Sidemen community is done in a aesthetically pleasant, non-intrusive way. Me and my wife need good WiFi to do our work and the WiFi was great. The staff in the restaurant is very friendly and professional and the food is healthy and tasty. What is special about the place is the noises of jungle animals at night.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff, good meal, and very nice pool. I booked the cheapest room and maybe this room (room no. 7) needs more electric socket because the only one socket is for refrigerator. Overall, this Villa is very recommended for you who want to escape the crowded.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Set amongst the rice fields with a back drop of Mount Agung, Sawah Indah is a diamond with no flaws. The rooms, the staff, the gardens and pool are all wonderful. The restaurant however is amazing!!! I love food and there is nothing worse than wishing you had gone to another restaurant or Warung. Don't bother trying any other local eateries...just try everything on this menu. My highlight was doing the cooking class with Coman (not sure of spelling). She was fantastic and now I have their recipes...yay! Perfect place for total relaxation.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our young family stayed for only a couple of days but we were impressed with many different aspects of the villa. The gardens showed meticulous care and attention. They really are beautiful. The food was delicious and never failed to impress me. I would have loved bigger portions but I'm a big man. The staff were great with our children and catered to our every need. Finally, we really enjoyed the rice paddy walk. Be prepared to get your feet wet :)
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent view. You eat right infront of rice terraces. The service is excellent and fast. Great options on the menu. We took the crispy duck with soup rice vegetables tempeh and desert wow. The best lunch in Bali. Hard to find and not close to the road but really worth going to. Just love this restaurant.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful rooms - we tried 3 of them - all decorated exquisitely. Friendly staff and good food - would love to return. Great pool, too. Needed private transport to get there. Top floors ideal but all are good.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The views are amazing, the rooms were clean and the linen smelled fresh despite the rain we had. All the food we had during our stay was excellent. The staff in the restaurant always greeted us with a smile and were really helpful. The hotel organised a trekking through the rice fields, with a guide, which was more adventurous than we thought; we crossed rivers and climbed ridges. In the end we were happy that we did it. The only thing I would recommend is to pay the little extra money for the deluxe room. Our kids stayed in the standard room which was too small; especially the bathroom. If have we have the chance, we would definitely come back.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: + : - very friendly staff- nice rooms- fantastic views- pool- food in the restaurant was great- :- many bugs and other creatures in my room (from insects over small lizards till a real gecko = the big and noisy one called 'tokeh' by locals and a hell to catch)- only cold water in my shower but after 10 seconds you get used to it
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The view is splendid, the rooms are huge with terrace. The pools are lovely, the personnel is open and friendly. The best so far. The restaurant is not that great however, just average and you must not be in a hurry, plus it's not cheap but there's a lot of good warung apparently at less than 200 meters.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very lovely rooms in a beautiful rice field. We likes the restaurant a lot. The team is very friendly and food is very good. Many regards to Made and all the team. We stayed already two times and will come back again! Thank you!
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room excellent, comfortable bed and pillows, quality linen. Fan cooling only. Wooden doors and frames so they did not close properly. Bathroom huge and semi outdoor. Many steps so if you have a problem with knees and steps you really have a problem. Lovely outdoor seating area. Gardens lovely and views worth a visit. Pool not working and access to the water difficult. Staff helpful and polite. The offer tea or coffee around 3.30pm each day and bring to your room. Breakfast small.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While this is a beautiful hotel with lovely staff and rooms please be advised pool will be closed for a month March 2017 . There is another pool at sister hotel 200 meters away for use.Sideman is a beautiful chilaxing area.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had lunch here and were surprised of the kindness of it's personnel: so nice and so helpful and... also the food and drinks were perfect. Beautiful views on the surrounding rice fields. Will certainly go back.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel situation is incredible in the middle of the rice fields. We stayed in a Family Room which was in fact a 2 room suite with 2 bathroom and 2 balconies, one overlooking the swimming pool and the other one the rice fields.We felt that the personnel really went over to satisfy our every needs, they even came to the room so we could pre-order our evening meal to avoid waiting at the restaurant!For the price we payed I would definitely come back and recommend to everyone!
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First thing I would like to say is that there are a lot of older photos included when viewing this hotel online. The pool is not that open anymore and everything around the hotel has expanded. So, it is not as scenic as you would think. Ok, besides that the hotel grounds are very well kept and there are plenty of plants to look at which made me happy. Best selection I've seen so far in Bali. We stayed in a villa which was the furthest away from the reception desk and restaurant which was kind of nice, except for when the neighbor hotel restaurant starts paying their live band than its loud. The pool was nice, water was the coldest around which is nice on a hot day. People rave about the restaurant but I thought it was mediocre. I had to have ribs twice in a row because their selection was low. There are a lot of warungs within walking distance so don't be worried. The staff is friendly but one of the day managers rubbed me the wrong way like he didn't want to be there. Don't be surprised to see the cleaners lounging in the empty rooms next to you. Seems like it's there hideout spots from the boss. Overall it was good here. Would I come back? Probably if I was in a pinch. Oh and you are in the country. Lot of bugs but surprisingly very little mosquitos.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love, love Sidemen. Wow. The diversity of Bali continues to surprise me even after 15 trips in 8 years. Planned to see Sidemen as part of a road trip of East Bali and what a treat the whole area was. Sawah Indah Villas in this village was truly fantastic. We had a deluxe room near the pool and loved it. It was a decent size, with an enclosed verandah with a day bed, a balcony and an open air bathroom, which we love to have in Bali. Bathroom also had an enormous bath. The room was clean and bright and airy and we spent lots of time on our balcony enjoying the exceptional views. We also loved the infinity pool - great size for the number of villas and plenty of pool lounges. Breakfast here was delicious and plentiful. We had both our evening meals in the on site restaurant and found the food and service to be of very high standard, without the price tag. We will definitely be visiting here again.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had 2 nights at Sawah Indah Villa. The location is beautiful amongst the rice fields. My room was nice and clean & I do love a good outdoor bathroom. Sitting to have breakfast every morning at the restaurant was a lovely experience. I did the early morning rice field trekking which I thoroughly enjoyed. I also did a day trip to the East Coast arranged through the hotel with a driver which was great. The food and drinks were delicious, but I think the thing that made the whole place was the staff. Never have I had nicer staff at a hotel. Thank you so much for making my holiday a happy and relaxing time.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place really is gorgeous, but don't stay here unless you are familiar and comfortable with all kinds of bugs and wasps. The hotel itself is lovely as are the villas and this hotel is rural so the bugs are to be expected. However I was not expecting that many and checked out early because I couldn't relax with all the huge wasps.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have just spent two nights here and couldn't be happier! It is quiet, peaceful and set in beautiful rice terraced countryside. Our room was spotless, staff friendly & helpful and the food in the restaurant was great too!
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the time we spent at Sawah Indah and food in hotel was very good - breakfast freshly cooked although not wide choice. Evening meals excellent although again choice could be greater. We stayed only 2 nights. We felt that 3-4 nights would have been perfect. Absolute tranquility lying by the lovely infinity pool.We booked basic room which exceeded our expectations for the price. All very clean although you share with Geckos and variety of insects. Bedroom quite compact and not a lot of storage space, bathroom large and with shower but no bath. Great views from balcony over rice fields. I would recommend consider paying a bit more for villa with larger bedroom and balcony to make most of views. And rooms above ground floor have better views. There is an infinity pool with approx 8 loungers poolside and a few more on grass terrace below pool. Breakfast was freshly cooked to order and good whilst somewhat limited choice. Evening meals excellent although again a bit limited in choice. Chicken wrapped in leaves and pork ribs both excellent. Next door is an excellent Warung as an alternative. Other Warungs nearby. There is a temple within 200m which has regular celebrations in both day and evening but need to make sure ladies cover up bare arms and both women AND men need to wear a sarong.Sidemen village feels like authentic Bali. Fighting cocks in cages, rice and other food stuffs being dried on mats in sunshine, Arak being brewed, fields of rice, chillies, papayas, fruits etc. We booked a guided tour through rice fields with local resident Kadek (see separate review). Highly recommended in order to get a real understanding of village life. When we go back to Bali we will be sure to go back to Sidemen.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 2 nights, booked the deluxe room which wasn't available on check in but we were given the family room which was very spacious, had two connecting bedrooms each with its own bathroom and a separate outside terrace on both bedrooms with plenty of comfortable seating with a wonderful view. It was a beautiful room and would work very well for a family of four. The pool area was lovely with an infinity pool looking towards the stunning view of the rice fields with the mountains in the distance. The breakfast was reasonable and cooked to order, with fruit, juice and choice of eggs, pancakes or cereal. We ate dinner both nights at the resort and the food was excellent and good value. Nice touch that they come to your room beforehand to see if you are eating dinner and take your order and time you would like to eat so it's ready when you arrive. Helpful friendly staff. Would recommend if you are looking for a relaxing few days in the country.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We wanted to stay in a rural village in Bali instead of the touristy coastal areas for a change. It was beautiful & lush scenery, quiet & clean air. No air con or Tv which was fine but we used the mozzie net & opened the balcony doors for more air flow. The evenings are cooler here & there is a ceiling fan. The bathroom was open air but the water pressure was low. A great pool with food/drink service via a phone, excellent restaurant & the staff are fabulous. Massage girls need some training.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sawah Indah far exceeded my expectations! It was the cheapest accommodation we stayed in during 5 weeks in Bali and one of the best (equal in my estimation to the most expensive villa we rented). The design of the one bedroom bungalow was really cozy yet spacious and breezy - so much outdoor space with the patio and the bathroom split into indoor and outdoor sections. There was even a fountain next to the outdoor shower. The wooden interior and crisp white finishes meant that we loved coming back to relax in the villa.The view of the rice fields is impressed upon my mind, weeks after we left. One of the staff, Made, told us that Sidemen is most beautiful in rice season so we should come back another time to see the rice plants waving in the breeze. I loved admiring the vegetable crops they rotate with rice, though - chills, corn, snake beans, eggplant, even tiny pineapples grew on the property!The restaurant was also gorgeous - on the first floor with hanging vines and the same great views. We really enjoyed the food as well - lots of vegetarian options for us for dinner. We tried other nearby warungs and after waiting over an hour for disappointing food, we vowed not to leave the villa for our evening meal. They have a great system of offering to take your order around 6pm in your room so that food is ready when you arrive at the restaurant at your nominated time. The home baked bread and homemade pineapple jam at breakfast were highlights too.The ONLY downside I noticed initially is that there are no coffee and tea facilities in the room BUT as soon as I mentioned this to my partner, a staff member knocked on the door telling us it was coffee break time. Every afternoon they offer you free tea or coffee which they deliver with fried pineapple or banana! It's sweet gestures like this that made me fall in love with Sawah Indah. I'd enthusiastically recommend it to anyone and happily stay again.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although our room was not very large (but we knew this when we booked and it came with a large terrace), it was very comfortable and equipped with a fan, fridge and safe. The bathroom was fine too, with a cold water shower but who needs hot water in 30 degrees anyway?All of this is located beautifully, with a view of a small valley with rice fields and a few other villas. Here comes a little point of warning: the main photo of the pool area on most website must have been taken a while ago: although it is still a very pretty place the swimming pool is certainly not as in the middle of only rice fields as it looks like on that photo. There are now far more other plants but also other buildings surrounding it.There is a nice restaurant with a good breakfast on site, and food and drinks are also served by the pool (which is nice and large by the way). The Spa is located in a very pretty hut with a great view, and various other restaurants are in walking distance. Also recommended is a guided walking tour through the rice fields - it even included wading through a shallow river a few times.All in all a very nice place, and especially considering the price highly recommendable for a nice stay in the Balinese countryside.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is like heaven on earth. Everything is exceptionally beautiful, the setting in the ricefields is amazing, great pool and the staff is so super friendly and well trained...And the Villas - oh the Villas!!!If you can afford it somehow, splurge and DO STAY IN ONE OF THE VILLAS!!! They're so amazing it's well worth paying the 80€/night.We really felt like queen and king of the universe.The design ist perfect, the terrace and the bathroom stunning.Nothing more to say. Stay here and you'll love it.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Sawah Indah Villa for five nights, just a bit too long in our opinion. 3 nights would be more recommendable. The room (Deluxe) we had was nice and large with an outside bathroom. The bathroom was rather outdated and needs an update. The white walls are dirty and tiles lost their color as well as the wooden cabinet doors of the sink. The power socket in the bathroom did not close off the hole in the wall properly. The wires therefore were visable and could be exposed to water. When emptying the bath, the bathroom floods for 70 er cent. So, work to be done here. This is also the case for the swimming pool in my opinion. The wood adjacent to the pool, as you can see on the hotel's profile picture on Tripadviser, is not as nice as it looks on the picture any more. Some tiles have fallen off the sides of the pool and some tiles in the pool itself were missing as well. During our stay, the pool was not very clean and not completely filled. As if the filter system wasn't working properly. So, no infinity pool for us. Besides that, the picture suggests that there are not so many houses around, not so much true (anymore). More villas have been built and another hotel has been built on the top.When it comes to the restaurant, breakfast is just great! You can pick anything from the menu. Fresh juices, fresh fruit, pancakes, french toast, you name it. Breakfast however seemed to be the only good thing about the restaurant besides that the staff is friendly and they really seem to have much fun with each other. We had lunch and dinner at the hotel and, unfortunately, we can not be very enthousiastic about it for lunch and dinner. My girlfriend ordered a vegetarian ceasar salad at the restaurant. No meat in there indeed. However, there was a larve and louse in the salad. Then I checked my lettuce, same. Not the first time in Bali, so check your lettuce or just eat it without checking :-)Although the reveiw might give you a negative impression of this place, it is not bad at all. It is a great place to stay in Sidemen and we would certainly recommend this hotel. You only need to be fine with a lot of insects and reptiles. But what do you expect when you stay between the rice fields?! The hotel needs just a view updates to become "excellent" for me.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my partner for 3 nights. Up in the hills it's very remote and the views beautiful. The hotel grounds are immaculate. I stayed in the bungalow which had the wow factor. Spacious, clean, all the facilities you might hope for. The hotel also provides spa and trips at a very reasonable price. Staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful. Perfect for anyone looking to get away.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a wonderful family time in Sidemen. Absolute stunning views, nature, ...So calm, so friendly people, ... and all this comes back in Sawah Indah Villa. Price-quality this is really incredible: the family room is huge (easily 5 persons in 3 bedrooms!), nice terras, nice bathroom in open air, ... And also the restaurant, spa and organized activities were better than expected (in quality terms) and very well priced. I obviously can find details that can be improved - but I will save these for reviewing Oberois and peers when I pay their prices...This is a gem, just like it's location. Don't know for how long, but if you're a family that wants to see some of the old Bali, join farmers through their ricefield trips, I suggest to take this into your Bali tour for a couple of days (2, 3 nights is enough). Tip: being a Bowie fan, I wanted to see the house in Iseh where he stayed some decades ago. It's right here - just rent a motorbike (it's safe here unlike Ubud or the beach cities) and cruise around: just awesome sceneries!
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located litteraly in the middle of the rice fields. The hotel's surrounding really looks picture perfect! There is a gorgeous infinity pool where you can relax and enjoy the view. Cottages are very nice with a lot of natural elements. The lack of air conditioning might be a minor however our room was located in a more shadow area so it was really doable to sleep at night.The hotel also offers tours to explore the area. Unfortunately, as we only stayed 1 night we couldn't do that. We explored the area ourself and experienced the beautiful nature this area has to offer. Near the hotel are also quite some restaurants. We tried one (forgot the name) and the food was so good for only a couple of euro's. Food in the hotel is also nice! Especially the breakfast is very extensive and delicious.We would definitely recommend this hotel especially for the low price it is really worth every euro!
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had 2 fantastic days at Sawah Indah Villas and if our ongoing travel plans were not finalised, we should wish to stay longer. Everything was so relaxing and the nature surroundings are absolute serene and definitely worthwhile to visit. Our bungalow was very comfortable and the en suite bathroom is well-planned and spacious. The detail in the bungalow is beautiful and everything was clean and stylish. Breakfast was tasty, sumptuous and delicious. The view from the restaurant as well as from the stoop of our bungalow is really amazing. All staff members were very friendly. This was one of our favourite places during our 3 week trip in Bali and we will recommend to fellow travellers. We will be back in future!
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was perfect. It is a little paradise. It is quiet and beautiful. Staff is nice and try to make you feel as much comfortable as they can. I would definitely go back when I am in Bali again! The restaurant view is amazing! We were surprise the price was that low especially since we travelled in July.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here 2 nights in a familial villa. The room was big and well decorated, wooden floor, large bathroom and an amazing terrace overlooking the valley. This was the best of our stay. Staff are extremly friendly and professionnal, always with smile and ready to help you. Nice view from the pool and great rmassage spa too. Do not hesitate if you plan to go to Sidemen, book here, you will be in heaven. Price are very correct for what yout get.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Sawah Indah Villa last week and we just got our chance to share our nice experience after some time.We love our stay in Sawah Indah Villa. What not to love? First of all, we fell in love with the white wooden hut, we have all the clean amenities provided by the hotel. Even mosquito net was clean and have no suspicious chemical smell. We had one warm welcome by the cocroach which probably coming when we opened the window.When we arrived, the staff greeted us nicely and we had a nice fresh welcome drink. In the afternoon we also had this fried banana fritters and coffee/tea as complimentary from the hotel, we were wondering if we had the compliment due to the ceremony in the village which were not allowed us to do much outside our room. Best bet was either to join the ceremony (walking around the village) or stay in the villa. Staff were always nice and they did recommend us to take local guide if we want to explore the village, as the track might be tricky and we might get lost without local guide. Bathroom was rather sexy because they have semi open air bathroom. It was spacious and clean, so we enjoy good bath time. Because our room was next to staff's room thus we heard their noise, but still acceptable because they just chat nicely and it didn't last long. Not very long after, we heard the gecko and cricket sound back as our lulaby.Overall we love our stay! It was a loving romantic yet adventurous stay we had.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fabulous property, our Room 10 was a real surprise, the bathroom especially, it was peaceful and quiet. We could watch the Balinese harvesting their rice crop right from our outside area. The birds were a treat as were the butterflys. Staff were happy and helpful. The restaurant for breakfast was great with a view of Mt Agung. We only had one dinner at the restaurant as the local Warungs were a delight. Our room did not have airconditioning but the weather was gorgeous and no mosquitos so we had the overhead fan on and even had the windows wide open. .Fabulous infinity pool and the gardens were beautiful. All in all this is a wonderful place for a quiet relaxing stay. Will definitely return.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent two nights here - one on the top floor by the pool (deluxe double) and one downstairs (standard double) as the first room was booked out for the second night. I would definitely recommend the deluxe room - the room was very spacious and nicely decorated in a traditional style, the bathroom was quite cool and semi-outdoors, and we had a lovely terrace overlooking the rice fields. The standard double was still good value but definitely not as impressive, as it was quite small in comparison. There was less light generally and felt less private as well, as we were on the ground floor.There are only a few downsides with the villa itself - the food (both breakfast and dinner) was average, our showers were usually only hot for 1-2 minutes before going cold, and wifi was poor. On balance though, we would stay here again in a heartbeat. The service was always lovely and we loved our stay here, and importantly we loved our time in Sidemen - after spending a couple of days in Ubud, Sidemen and the surrounding villages were definitely refreshing and felt so much more authentic. Definitely recommend both Sidemen and Sawah Indah Villa!
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my 2 girlfriends stayed on the top floor room by the pool. We had a huge double room with 2 bathrooms and a large deck to look over the rice fields. The hotel was clean and the beds were comfortable. The pool was amazing. We hiked up Mt. Agung on the second day and after I received an incredible massage at their spa. The staff was kind and helpful. My laundry was done quickly and they did a great job. There is no need for air conditioning because keeping the side doors open and sleeping under the mosquito net is a wonderful feeling. The only small complaint I have is the food. I would rather eat more authentic balinese food for breakfast and didn’t think what I did order for dinner was very good. There is a restaurant next door to the hotel that is delicious. The drinks are great though! I would definitely stay there again and again!
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at Sawah Indah. Our room was the gorgeous no. 5 that sleeps 5 people. We loved the traditional Balinese design. We had 2 private balconies, an amazing view of our own, and a wonderful outside bathroom. Even without air-conditioning, the temperature was comfortable with an almost constant gentle breeze.The staff were uber friendly, professional and attentive. Like reviewers, we can recommend the rice padi walk. We also took the delicious cooking lesson, which includes a trip to Sidemen's traditional morning market.Sawah Indah's restaurant is fine, although tuned to Western tastes. If like us you want more spice, you only have to ask the chef.By Inexpensive motor scooter, Sidemen is within striking distance of Klungkung, Ubud and Bangli. We loved the winding mountain back road through Undisan.Highly recommended.
hotelName:
3    Sawah Indah Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing stay with great service especially from the employee sumar, great breakfast in the morning and I felt so welcomed into the huts also great spot to get around from place to place on the island, very happy!!
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exceptional value for money and set in an ideal location, very close to dream beach, devil's tear and Sandy bay beach club. The staff were very friendly and helpful. You can hire a scooter direct from the reception. Breakfast was simple, but fresh and tasty and cooked to order. Food and drink at the restaurant are the cheapest we've found in Bali. There are several other bars and restaurants within easy walking distance. The pool and gardens are beautiful. The outdoor bathroom to the villa was clean, attractive, and fully functional. The bedroom, while pleasant was dark with poor lighting and the bathroom door wouldn't stay shut unless locked, which can only be done from the bedroom side. The mattress and pillows were very comfortable, and the linens and duvet clean. The interior of the room could do with a deep clean. The sockets were grubby as well as the light switches and corners of the room. The air conditioning worked perfectly. Overall, this is an excellent place to stay and the negative points are only minor, but could be rectified very easily. We are currently staying in a rather expensive hotel on a different side of the island and would much rather be back at the Cubang huts where everything was much better for a fraction of the price.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for two nights while visiting Nusa Lembongan. The check in process was easy and our villa was cute and quaint. The outdoor bathroom was great, however just know that the shower doesn’t get hot. It’s luke-warm. Besides that little nuisance of the shower, the hotel is literally steps away from Dream Beach which has great food and drinks overlooking the ocean. The pool seems to always be a nice temp. which is awesome when you want a quick dip. Our breakfast at the hotel was great with prompt service! Through the hotel we were able to book a day trip to Nusa Pendia with a private driver that took us to 4 different beaches. Overall we had a great stay!
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The overall feel of this place, immediately upon arrival, was outstanding. While checking in we had a beautiful overall look at the courtyard and pool. The stacked pool and fountains were so nice to see. As we checked into our villa it seemed a little mundane. Aside from the huge cockroach that crossed my tablet late at night, the overall review is that it’s just a place to rest your head and sit by the pool. It is right in the middle of the devils tear, dream beach, and a short distance for surfing.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would highly recommend. The bungalows are adorable, the outdoor shower is great and walking distance to dream beach and devils tear!! Staff is very kind... great place to relax & chill out!! Would definitely come back!
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was highly impressed of the villas and the service. Everyone is very friendly and accommodating. Nice luscious garden and great pool for dips when it gets too hot. The restaurant is v good as well. Absolutely Love the outdoor shower! Thank you so much for a wonderful holiday stay x
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed couple of days ago in the hotel and I have to stay is really nice place relax and very to clean too. All the staffs they tried the best for make you feel accomodate will be in the top for sure. The food is the best in this island. Very recommended. Hopefully when I am back to Bali will be staying there.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Cubang Huts staff were incredibly responsive to my emails leading up to our trip regarding transportation from Bali to Lembongan and then to the resort, which was extremely helpful as this was our first trip to Indonesia. We were welcomed warmly to our adorable villa which was clean and had AC which was extremely important to us. You are less than a 5 minute walk from Dream Beach and a few restaurants. Caution as we were unaware of how quite this area of the island gets at night and there is no street lighting to navigate to some other local restaurants and bars. That being said, this is the perfect remote getaway if that is what you are looking for. The restaurant food is delicious and the staff kindly served us breakfast even an hour before the kitchen opened. We enjoyed our short stay here!
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although situated on a dirt track hidden away this hotel us a little gem. Check in was quick and efficient and although we were early our room was ready and we were when to our hut. Although there was not much storage the hut was fab and had everything we needed for our stay. The mini bar was well stocked and reasonably priced. The hut and outdoor bathroom were cleaned well and were spotless. I loved that we could walk out of our hut and straight to the pool. The pool area was never busy and we often felt like we had it to ourselves. Breakfast was tasty. The staff were really accommodating and went out if their way to help. Would stay again.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very Good. Nice and friendly people. Shower was outside and amazing! Good breakfast and possibility to also have Some lunch and dinner there. Closeby Dream beach which was Nice as Well so you can Enjoy swimming pool and sea at same day
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife booked thus place in January. We flew here on Wednesday and was due to stay here on the Sunday. The owner e-mailed us to say he had double booked and gave us another place to stay. We e-mailed back to say are you sure and he didn't reply. We originally booked through booking.com but he emailed back and said if you do it direct I will charge less, needless to say we won't be doing that again. Turns out we managed to sort out other hotels that fitted our holiday better and staff at the Naturale Villas. It's very similar to the Cubang Huts. Can't rate that hotel high enough.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an incredible stay at the Cubang Huts. The staff is incredibly on it and detail oriented. The hut was perfect and very comfortable. They organized a scooter for us and transport to Nusa Penida. We had excellent breakfast and lunch here. Around the corner is Devils Tears - a stunning series of cliffs with massive waves crashing in. It’s also around the corner from Dream Beach and a few excellent restaurants. 10/10!
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tucked away in a quiet corner of lempongan is this super cozy place with clean rooms and super friendly staff who are willing to go all out to help you out. Big shout out to Suma who helped us out even before we checked in and met him. The food in the restaurant also is customised to your taste and made to perfection. It's right next to dream beach and devil's.tear which are popular tourist attractions. Cons: it's far away from.all the action and has no vibe. If you are looking for a quiet retreat this is great but if you want to be in the thick of action this place is quiet dead. On the other hand, lempongan is tiny and a scooter can get you anywhere in no time. So this place is value for.money in that sense and very clean too.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would definitely come here again! The bungalow was one of the nicest rooms I have stayed in. Pool area was also great and very calm. There was also nice sunset spot nearby.Only negative thing was that we rented a scooter which brakes wasn’t so good.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice clean bungalows, friendly and very helpful staff. Very good breakfast and overall a nice quiet ambience. Outside the hotel area is another story. Trash everywhere and busy dirt roads with minivans transporting tourists around to visit the various attractions. But the Cubang Huts itself is excellent!
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great 2-night stay in the huts. Located a stones throw from Dream Beach, which was our favourite beach on the island. Really nice staff and cute little hut. We loved chilling by the pool too. We were also able to organise a snorkelling trip through the hotel reception which was great. My only qualms were that the huts were quite dark (not enough natural light / light bulbs!) and the bathroom was not 100% comfortable.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly highly recommend coming to Lembongan. Highlight of our Bali visit. The huts are really charming and the pool very refreshing and appealing. Great bedding and bed for a “hut”. Strong air conditioning if you need it. Friendly service that helped book us a snorkelling tour and motorcycle etc. The island is small and the location of the huts is by the best beach on the island (though dream beach isn’t swimmable because of the strong current). Perfect sunset views every night. And easy access to Ceningan. Great stay!
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay at this place. The huts are nicely furnished, and they overlook the terrace and pool. It is a perfect place to spend an afternoon lazing at the pool. This place is within walking distance to Dream Beach. Staff are courteous and helpful. We had dinner and the food is great and very reasonably priced. Highly recommend this place!
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very kind staff !! And also very good breakfast. The Cubang Hut’s is a very peaceful place, with a nice swimming pool and the accommodation are brand new (a very confortable bed :) ) Thank to the staff !
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited here for 2 nights on our honeymoon in Apr-2018. The property has 5 huts next to each other run by a family. Although they are now building new huts as well.Location: Approximately 200mts or 5min walk to the Dream beach (the best beach in Lembongan). Devil's tear is also on walking distance.Rooms: We stayed in the hut farthest from the reception. (5th hut). The huts are wooden built and are spacious enough with a comfy bed and a sofa as well. The huts have outdoor bathroom which are very comfortable with both hot and cold water.The locks of the doors could be improved. AC works very well as well.Food: We had dinner on the first night (ordered pizza, sandwich and a juice). We repeated the juice and couldnt resist having dinner the next night as well. It was the best food we had in Bali. The breakfast was also very good with fresh fruits, juices and the pancake was perfect. The lady cooks brilliant food.The huts are family run and they care about their guests. Very nice people and willing to help always.Would stay here the next time we visit Lembongan.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The accommodation, Food and Service were excellent. Memorable stay that could hold for long. Specially the serenity and calmness of the place was remarkable. The staffs are very friendly and cooperative at any time. Wish them all the best for upcoming days.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. First of all, Welcome drink was awesome... refreshed us within a minute. Hotel is really very neat and clean. Nice pool... obviously very clean. My wife usually not interested in swimming pool, but she liked it. They are vey serious about keeping the hotel clean. Enjoyed every moment here. Stay here is calm, quite and peaceful. Food is very delicious... and reasonably priced. We had our breakfast, lunch and dinner in this hotel... foods are very tasty and freshly cooked. Hotel stafs are very helpful, friendly and cordial.... especially Mr. Putu Suma, Mr. Putu Andey and Ms. Maley... You can ask them for any kinds of help... they will manage it for you..... quite environment along with cordial staff.... Cubang Huts Lembongan... made our trip most memorable one...... Highly recommended for peacelovers....
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All I can say is wow!!! What a great little find. Only 5 huts - with 4 more being built. The huts themselves are gorgeous, huge comfortable bed, outdoor bathroom which was great. Very clean throughout the whole resort. The staff were great and very helpful. Restaurant had the nicest food at great prices. Very close to dream beach and devil's tear. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hubby and I have just spent 5 nights at this beautiful little getaway. This is a family-run establishment and everyone was incredibly friendly and welcoming. The huts are very comfortable and the pool is generous in size considering there are only 5 huts. The quality and variety of food at the restaurant was also very comparable with other places around. We had a scooter for just one day to explore the island and Ceningan Island. After exploring the rest of the island we were even happier with our choice of Cubang Huts.You feel like you’re in the middle of nowhere but you are only 2 mins walk to Dream Beach, another 2 mins walk to the Devil’s Tear and less than 10 mins walk to Sunset Beach and approx 20 mins walk to Mushroom Bay. Would highly recommend.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there nine days while scuba diving and it was perfect. The people working there are really kind and try to arrange all the stuff you need. At the moment it's really private with just five bungalows but they are building some more. The restaurant is nice, especially the breakfast is great and they organized it earlier than normal because we were getting up early because of the diving. If I come back to Lembongan I'll stay here again.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great stay in this place. Really comfortable and clean.Putu was there to help us in all matters and a great staff. The location is pretty good just a 2 min stroll to the dream beach and devils tear.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you're after a really comfortable stay in a beautiful, lush setting but want to feel like you're "getting away from it all", then this is the place for you. It's only a short stroll away from Dream Beach but it is a million miles away from the chaos and noise of the hotels right on the beach.We loved, the individual huts (there are only 5 on the whole property) and the comfortable bed with overhanging mosquito net just adds to the ambience. There is no tv but there is a great balcony for each hut and a wonderful pool to sit by. The outdoor bathroom is cute but can get a little too wet if the rain is especially heavy.The staff are very sweet and incredibly helpful - nothing is too much trouble. As long as you're not after 5-star, this is the place for you. Great value for money.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Cubang Huts was probably the best place we stayed in all of Indonesia. The individual huts are all very well maintained with very comfortable beds and a great outdoor washroom. The kitchen there is also very good...We went to other restaurants but, just kept coming back to Cubang as it was the best. We had amazing service from all the staff. Suma at the front desk is very helpful. He arranged all our transport from the mainland and made everything very easy. It’s only a 5 minute walk to Dream Beach, Devil’s Tear and Sandy Beach. I would totally come back here!!!
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is a gem! The resort is nice & clean. I love the decor of the hut! It felt very welcoming and homie. Staff are friendly and super helpful with everything. Also, I cannot stress this enough.. the restaurant! The food was so delicious! Everything we had for our 4 day stay was amazing & reasonably price. This resort is only 2 minute walk to dream beach & about 5 minutes to Devil’s tear. Thank you Cubang hut’s Staff for a great experience! Highly recommend!
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Charming row of 5 huts in beautiful and tranquil gardens with nice swimming pool which is usually empty. Breakfast is a few simple choices which are cooked for you and brought to your table. The owner and her staff made an exceptional effort to accommodate a couple of special requests from us. This accommodation is within a couple of hundred metres of a lovely beach which unfortunately is not safe most of the time for swimming. Would recommend for travellers and couples. Easy base from which to explore the island on a mo-ped.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at The Cubang Huts for 2 nights and it was fantastic from start to finish. The staff are so friendly and helpful. The Huts are new and clean and the grounds are very well kept. The pool is also nice and it is close to dream beach. I would highly recommend.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in The Cubang Hut's only for 2 nights and I can say only positives. The nicest beach (literally, see the Dream beach photos), is like 4 minutes away and the staff is friendly and helpful. Swimming in pool after sunset is really refreshing and the bungalows are clean and place is super quite (perfect for honeymoons).
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for five nights, and there is nothing we can fault. The accomodation was lovely, really cute and clean. The staff were super friendly and could not do enough for you. They contacted us prior to our arrival and organised the boat trip to the island, which was great. Breakfast is included in the rate, also I would highly recommend that you try the restaurant for dinner. We tried other restaurants on the island but kept coming back here. Both the western food and Indonesian was Devine. The burgers were out of this world. The cook was amazing, rustling up any request at a moments notice. Thank you Cubang Huts for a lovely stay.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property stands out due to the great staff and beautiful setting. With only 5 bungalows and a beautiful pool you get a real personalized stay. The restaurants serves great food and cold beer. It's also a quick 3-4 minute walk to Dream Beach.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went to Lembongan without any reservation last christmas. We found these huts and stayed because of the good price. When we settled, we noticed this place is well worth the money. Beautiful garden, peaceful area, nice and clean huts, big pool and tasty breakfast. Staff was amazing, really helpful and friendly. Thanks for this experience and fresh mangos!
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was amazing!! we spent here two nights on our honeymoon tour. The style of hotel is breathtaking.Big bungalow, view from bed on beatiful pool, canopy bed,what a romantic,half open roof bathroom-free feelings,breakfast was included you can choose from three types. Super nice and helpful staff there.And food in hotel restaurant?Totally Reccomend dessert - chocolate fondant with scube of vanilla ice cream, like a heaven in your mouth :) and they also know how to make a good burger when you have enough rice :) :) ;)
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose The Cubang Hut's based on the many fantastic reviews and we were not disappointed. Suma and his team made us enjoy our stay from start to finish. Garden, pool and the spacious hut were very clean and the site in general had a cozy and authentic atmosphere. It was easy to switch directly into holiday mode.There are some warungs and points of interest (e.g. Dream Beach, Devil's Tears) within a walking distance, but if you are looking for more restaurants and activities, make sure to rent a scooter and explore the island by your own. Apart from that, don't miss out on having lunch and/or dinner at The Cubang Hut's as well as you get very delicious food for a reasonable price.We highly recommend The Cubang Hut's for your stay on Nusa Lembongan.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at the Chubang Hut's Lembongan. The staff is really nice and friendly and they have a quiet and big swimming pool to take rest. It's a perfect location for visiting Dream Beach and Devils Tear, both are in a walking distance.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was great! The shower outside, the honeymoon like clean bedroom, the service of the staff, Suma who booked us a trip to see the Manta Rays, the swimmingpool, the relaxed atmosphere en near Dream beach.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: + Very cosy, well designed, clean, fantastic staff, authentic food, prices. - none. The experience was brilliant. Very close to "dream beach". You ca rent a scooter directly from here. The pool is very cool. The water is clean and the temperature is perfect. The rooms have AC, minibar and the outside bathroom is beautiful.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay in the cubang Huts is so wonderful. It is 5 mins walk from dream beach , also walking distance to devil's tear.The staff there are super friendly ! They helped me a lot ! And my father had a good meal in their restaurant too !Cuma is so helpful. He helped me with other bookings and gave me many recommendations.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice and clean cabins, friendly staff, good breakfast and nice atmosphere. The swimming pool is amazingThe staff will help you with everything and the place is close to the beach. You can order bikes and activities.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A group of us booked out four of the five huts for four nights just recently and there was a collective 'wow' when we arrived, saw the facility's and double checked that a) we were at the right place & b) the price we were paying was correct for the duration, not for a night. Checking in was quick and easy with cc (3% surcharge) being accepted and Suma and the other friendly staff making sure you were aware how your room safe & other appliances worked, informing on local attractions & what time breakfast was served from. Once we'd settled in & although in full awe of our 'huts' (large bed, mozzie net, a/c, couch, outside shower/toilet/vanity, balcony, minibar & hot beverage making facilities) & how new and fresh/modern they appeared we had a quick swim in the pool whilst our nasi gorang was being cooked fresh in the kitchen. Once full of food, we realised we were fading rapidly and requested scooters to hire for our duration to explore the island further. & this would have to be one of the highlights of staying here - nothing was too much effort for the friendly staff to assist with, whether it be getting bookings made for excursions or recommendations of places to visit.Wifi was good, accomodation & location was excellent and the Bintangs from the bar were always cold - what more could one want...
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed for 2 nights in one of these bungalows and everything was perfect. The staff are super friendly and helpful, and the whole resort is clean and very new. Dream Beach is just a 3-minute walk away, where there is a nice restaurant overlooking the beach.
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Cubang Huts is a beautiful new place within a stone's throw of Dream Beach, Sunset Point and other nice locations on Lembongan. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The outside bathroom is lovely. The Pool is amazing. The staff were friendly and helpful. We will choose this place again when we visit Lembongan the next time!
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want stay closely with devil tear, dreambeach, sundibaybeach club and more ,, that place was awesome They have 5 huts , 1 twin and 4 is delux rooms, and how about the staff?? That was very friendly , and the motor bike only 85k a day , so you can ride around the island with motor bike So realy fun to be stay here,, Recomended
hotelName:
4    The Cubang Hut's Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Mansion is one of the most stunnig hotels in Ubud. Perfectly located, fabulous food and great service. The new wellness centre is amazing! The architecure is one of a kind, the workshops run by true experts in their field made me want to stay even longer. So much to explore! We truly enjoyed our stay and already planning the next one,
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having been there for 2 nights and it was amazing. This resort is just around 10 minutes drive to the Ubud Center. The room rate that i paid already included the breakfast and 6 times free shuttle service to Ubud center. It has 6 pools and one other right at the rooftop. The ornament of the hotel is really lovely too.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Incredible and majestic place. Everyone was amazing, very helpful. The resort was super clean and maintained. Love their new building and plumeria pool was stunning. I loved the combination of Indonesian nature and art. The sunrise in the pool by the restaurant was beautiful. It was actually a late wedding anniversary and my family they were blown away. Thank you
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This resort is very unique and classy. There are many beutiful spots to take picture with my kids and husband. The garden and landscape are family friendly.it has a mini swings for kids. Its staff are helpful and friendly.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Mansion is advertised as a 5 star hotel, in my opinion it has declined into a depressing, disappointing hotel, struggling to even retain a 4 star rating. Some of the reasons for this feedback:-wifi drops out, inaccessible most mornings and evenings. Had really impacted my ability to do a few things I’d planned to get done, especially in the mornings. Apparently, their wifi does not support Apple products very well?!!-breakfast buffet - food often runs out/gets cold. There is no proactive attention by staff to things needing to be refreshed, cleaned, looked after (reoccurring theme here of a reactive service vs proactive)! -The actual property (and rooms) are aged. In fact, the entire property comes across as being neglected and in need of a renovation.-The staff did not have the usual skip in their step, they seemed tired/indifferent. Lovely people when you actually need something, however, they did not seem happy and think this might contribute to their general apathy and lack of being proactive.With such a large property I was quite surprised by the lack of guests. Not many around. Following our first day, I began to experience a feeling of the place being a bit of a ghost town. Sprawling grounds, lots of space, plenty of service staff, but very few guests and many of the wellness related areas are closed!Sadly, my family and I would try and find things to do to leave the hotel and return late in the day to avoid the frustrating poor wifi and depressing atmosphere.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was nice place to stay. I was stayed with my family with two kids. The room was good, with many options of pools for adult and kids. Eventhough the playground for the kid limited and old but they manage to have kids club. The staffs services was wxcellent, everyone alwasy greeted us while we are walking around and going out from the resort. The thing that need to improve is the breakfast taste need to be more tasty. And need to check the freshness of the milk that they offered in the breakfast. And they are so far away to order menu lunch while we are playing in the pool. So overall experience was alright.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for three nights and enjoyed my stay. My problem with the hotel was that I didn’t sleep well because of the noise from the nearby temple. This isn’t the hotels fault, but there were problems with the communication from the staff. In the end the manager was very helpful and resolved the issue to my satisfaction. Drinks and food are a bit overpriced, but I guess you pay for convenience. It’s not centrally located and not really possible to walk anywhere so you need a taxi or the shuttle to get into town. The grounds are nice and the staff is quite friendly and helpful. Overall, I would recommend staying here. Request a room away from the temple if you can.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Mansion Bali at Ubud for 3 nights in the Grand Deluxe room . The resort is located in a calm and not so crowded place away from the main Ubud centre . The room provided to us was huge but it definitely needs a bit of renovation as the age is clearly visible in all aspects . The bed is huge and comfortable for 3 including a child . Resort provides a shuttle to main Ubud central area every 2 hrs and that’s very comfortable and good way to explore Ubud market area .
