Food at Hotel is very average and breakfast should be revamped to include more international cuisine . Overall my family was very happy with our stay and the Hotel but we could have explored slightly newer options at the same price point .
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: had an incredible stay at the mansion! - absolutely stunning grounds that keep opening themselves upto you - dozens of nooks within the property that have private pools and benches, perfect for relaxation and a little escape. the property has great onsite amenities like yoga classes, an incredible spa (highly recommend the massages!), and a complimentary shuttle service that takes you back and forth from the city center. the new restaurant plumeria was my absolute favorite in town - healthy vegan eats set against a stunning pool / natural background. must try the miso butter cauliflower & the incredible juices& smoothies! we loved our stay here, i'm sure you will too-
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent two nights in a villa with pool. The property is genuinely huge, with unlimited sight of plants, green spaces and pools. Extremely quiet and spacious, one could barely see the other clients. I definitely recommend this place for meditation and relaxation! I will come back again with my partner. The restaurant, Plumeria, is definitely a must, with a large choice of Western and Indonesian gourmet food.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really liked our stay at the mansionWhat we likedThe excellent staff especially Wayan and “uncle” who work in the lobby as porters. They made such a fuss of our 18 month old every day. Waiting for her after breakfast to take her to feed the fish in the pond outside. They made our stay here memorable Excellent swimming pools especially the one on crystal pool which isn’t easy to findLunch at the main pool area - good value and tastySize of the bedroom and bathroom Shuttle service to Ubud (although more frequent than 2 hours could be beneficial)What could be betterWe had no outside space in our room (candlewood 39)Breakfast was ok. Omelette station good but limited choice other than cereal for our daughter. Noise from adjourning rooms - you can hear everything due to shared roof space. Even when people next door as having normal conversations you could hear every word (not to mention other activities ) Location- not easy to access restaurants in local area. Overall a lovely hotel in Ubud
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Suitable for company outings. Halls available. A little bit maze-like. Can be challenging to navigate at night for lack of bright signages. Many spots to chill and work on your laptop. Good value for money.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found the lay out of the grounds to be unusual. It was an adventure to discover new areas. The rooms were clean and spacious but lacked a sitting area. The breakfast was great, offering plenty of options for vegans. Great raw vegan restaurant walking distance from the hotel called Moksa. They provide a courtesy bus to ubud central every two hours. Taxes cost $5 to $10 Australian dollars.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This has been one of the best surprises that I have had. I was not expecting to find a 5 star location with a 5 star staff and grounds. Whoever own this jewel is by far dedicated and passionate. The grounds are second to none ( I say that as I travel only in high end 5 star resorts). The rooms are slightly 1990ish but not bad at all and they are remodeling a bunch of them. We stayed in the Governer's rooms and they were spectacular. I want to place a shout out to Krisma who is one of the kindest front desk clerks I have seen ever. She is so sweet and helpful. The management should be very happy with her. All in all this hotel is by far more than the 4 it has currently. Not sure why they are a four but coming from the hospitality industry I can say this is worth of a great review.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Mansion Resort and Spa, along with the new wellness center on site is a must-visit, an iconic unique experience I will always remember and keep coming back to now that I've been lucky to discover it (after a couple trips to Bali! Can't believe I didn't visit it before).I stayed here for a week so far and am still discovering more amazing amenities and beautiful artistic places to relax, work on my laptop, read, heal, rejuvenate, or take photos/videos. The whole place is a like a work of art with stunning design, craftmanship, gorgeous details and special touches that are inspiring. Definitely not a cookie-cutter or modern-western type hotel where you could be anywhere. It's an impressive and rejuvenating mix of sustainability, nature, art, luxury, wellness, and spa services with 6 pools, 3 restaurants, fitness center, B12 shots and IVs, hammocks, hot tub, .... plus quite an array of weekly events like yoga and aerial silks, zumba, and special workshops. I only realized today they use a special non-chlorine cleaning system for the pools that actually infuses healthy minerals into them, no wonder its so refreshing. Admittedly I haven't left the resort much this week as there's so much to explore and experience :-) Maybe next week I'll take the free shuttle into town but I also want to swim in all the different pools, try the B12 shots, more of the classes + wellness elixirs, spa services and take more photos. Especially of their new Plumeria restaurant that has such a inspiring majestic beautiful feel to it. They have daily drinking water provided in a glass bottle rather than one-time use plastic, not sure if this is for every room but I would think so. Oh and no plastic straws. Enjoying the warm friendly staff and magical pathways and how they honor the local traditions and cultures yet worldclass international quality. A very special place.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was lovely and there are plenty of pools to use. Frequent shuttles in to town make it a good platform for visits in and around Ubud. Breakfast was fine but nothing spectacular. Didn’t have dinner so can’t comment further.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked The Mansion as a treat to finish our five months of travelling in South East Asia and to celebrate our engagement but we were sadly more than disappointed with our one week stay.Firstly, we booked the “Villa Residence” accommodation option. We arrived to be provided with the “modern” style room within the “Villa Residence” which was no more than a poorly decorated sub standard room. They did kindly put some petals on the bed and some towel art, which was nice, just a shame the room was not as advertised!). The half open air bathroom was lovely with a large tub but the rooms are advertised with photos of the wooden “traditional” Balinese style villa huts and not the awfully styled “modern” rooms. Do not be fooled, these “modern” style rooms should be in a totally different category to the “traditional” style Villa Residence rooms, they are not on the same level and shouldn’t be categorised together especially with misleading photos! Thankfully, one of the “traditional” Villa Residence rooms was available so we were moved promptly. I feel sorry for the other couples who came the next day and ended up with those awful “modern” rooms. Our bathroom had some damp but this didn’t bother us, it’s a tropical climate so we understand this is probably a common issue. Anyway, moving forward we received the room advertised and were disappointed again with the cheap furnishings within the outside area for the four rooms, this shared space for the four rooms was quite ugly, we expected a nice day bed or some lovely wooden style furnishings, but it was plastic cheap furniture. This really needs to be updated, you pay for a decent room for a reason! The resort itself is vast, lots of lounging areas but also crammed with mismatching furniture and tired looking furniture in much need of replacement. Please can this be looked into, especially when you are adding more rooms to the resort, at least get what you already have right first!Now moving onto the pools, there are six to choose from however the majority are what I would call plunge pools and the two main pools which you could really swim in were the cleanest and nicest of the pools but were unfortunately next to the construction whereby they are adding more rooms, this was not peaceful or relaxing for sunbathing, such a shame. We should be pre warned of construction, we would not have stayed here if we knew this beforehand! Please note, the pool by the restaurant definitely needs draining and maintenance, particularly re-grouting. Onto the Spa, very overpriced compared to amazing massages and treatments you can receive in the town and even just down the road! (Around five times the price!) We asked for a price list and were told to take photos of the prices shows at the spa desk with our phones; why they don’t have the prices in the room booklets is ridiculous! To be honest, we may have considered the massages and treatments if the hotel wasn’t so disappointing but as I said, you can get way more for your money elsewhere and there’s so many nice spas to choose from!Breakfast is between 7am and 10:30am, we’ve had far better variety and taste all over South East Asia particularly Bali, I am shocked how poor breakfast was, fruit tasteless, coffee weak, cold pizza (seriously, in a “four star” hotel?). The fried rice was barely ok and the vegetables were edible. I wouldn’t bother having breakfast here, it’s so not worth it! In addition, the room service food was terrible apart from the burger and the salads by the pool were again, awful. The hotel has so much potential, but needs de-cluttering. Seriously remove the awful canvas style prints dotted around the hotel gardens, they are tacky and make the place feel really cheap, some are even ripped. Some of the garden areas are lovely and the staff try their best to maintain the fallen leaves, but some areas are filled again with cheap furniture, it’s just not luxury as advertised. The whole place feels cluttered and mismatched, please have an interior designer come in and sort out this ugly mess! This hotel is trying to cater for everyone, which is difficult and hard to get right, it’s not enjoyable having kids running around whilst they are playing music such as “if you’re happy and you know it clap your hands” and diving into the main pools screaming, it’s just a shambles. The Wi-Fi for our room (47 Copperwood) was ok for browsing but Netflix wouldn’t work as the signal was too poor, strong Wi-Fi is a must in these modern times. Please improve this! The location isn’t great, (no views and not suitable to walk to the main town area) which we knew as we wanted to just spend our last week of our travels enjoying the resort and just a one day tour of Ubud, but as the hotel was so poor for us, we had to make use of the free shuttle to town often which became a pain and taxis aren’t cheap if you use them everyday, hence the free shuttle is highly recommended. If the hotel was up to the standard it should be, we wouldn’t need to leave the resort, such a shame!We only bought one half day tour through the hotel which was 500,000 rupiah for four hours, approx (£26) but we couldn’t complete visiting the three sites in this time so skipped the last temple otherwise there’s an overtime charge. (Please note, its only transport so you still have to pay entrance fees etc, which they do tell you beforehand). The only saving grace is we did like the room once we received what was advertised and despite housekeeping failing to refill the hand soap for a couple days, they were fairly thorough with the room cleaning. The staff overall are so lovely, they are nice people and none of the above is their fault. Poor management and maintenance is the clear issue for this hotel. We have stayed in two other three star hotels, one in Seminyak and another on Gili Trawangan and both were far superior to this hotel! We have tried to email the General Manager but three days and still no response. It’s with regret to say, we would never return to this hotel and it’s left a bitter taste for our last week in Bali. Absolutely disappointed.I will say Ubud is lovely, so we will return but we will definitely make sure to stay somewhere else!
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is beautiful with a very peaceful atmosphere. Stunning garden, swimming pools (there are a few of them)and plenty of places to just relax and unwind in the garden. Fantastic staff. All very friendly and helpful. Shuttle to town and back every two hours is a great service. The breakfast is very limited and not that great in taste.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In summary I would say as I write in the title.Located in a quiet area, a bit further from Ubud centre. Don't expect for stunning views or private space. Many rooms have windows facing public area.The hotel has several small swimming pools in different areas.Breakfast is very poor in variety & taste.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay in the mansion hotel was amazing. We got upgraded to the Royal Suite and this place was the absolute lap of luxury. We were there for New Years and the party was such a good fun time. They had an amazing DJ and fire dancers and the whole thing was incredible.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel simply has so many breathtaking photography spots within the property and their architecture and resort design is brilliant. It is serene, I think one of the best for honeymooners as it is located in Sayan, a relatively silent place and not in busy crowded area. The hotel has their own transport facility to Ubud town/market so commute isn't an issue. Loved the traditional Balinese short dance shows on Thursday night and the young ladies attire in ethnic Balinese style were really enchanting. Only challenge could be to find food options outside of this hotel, but there's a Warung Made right on the main road 100 meters away outside the hotel which will give you nice local food. Hotel's breakfast was good too.One star less because despite many rooms empty, they initially gave me a room that was in the farthest corner and upper floor - did not appreciate that. However, they changed it on my request. I was tired as I arrived late in the evening for the check-in from the day tour and expected a better room as they couldn't upgrade, which is fine.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best and most memorable part of the hotel are the luscious grounds. They’re absolutely stunning. They’re well kept with beautiful tropical flowers and vegetation. A number of swimming pools for cooling down and tables , benches, hammocks and swings for reading, relaxation or just enjoy so much beauty. The rooms are ok . As expected for the category. The lobby is a little cluttered with too much going on but it adds to the character. The service is impeccable. Everyone is striving to please and deliver excellent customer service. The only small negative is the quality of food delivered . Breakfast is just ok and the food served at the restaurant somehow is lacking in execution. Ubud is only about 10 min by car and about 25 min walking distance. They offer a shuttle bus into the village and back. Overall we had an excellent stay and I would not hesitate to return or recommend
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at The Mansion for 2 nights. Nice lobby and staff to begin, including valet parking. Grounds are typical Bali garden style which is what I like. The rooms we stayed at was the Grand Delux. The rooms are large and comfortable. 5 or so pools To choose from so the kids were happy. Little bit of maintenance around the pools is required so I can Only give this a 4 star, not up to 5 star quality based on other Bali 5 star hotels.Will stay again.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited mansion hotel. Staff were friendly but booked via America. Express. Room was full of ants, pool was dirty, rubbish around site.The facility needed renovating. Demanded money back but was basically told no. Left the hotel - no refund and cut my trip short by 5 days and went back to UK. Avoid the hotel at all costs. Used toiletries were found from previous guests in the bathroom and rubbish was found on site.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The mansion is absolutely a place for those who enjoy beauty. It is like a garden of eaden , such beauty by the waters and the garden. Never experienced such a friendly staff. Nothing is impossible for them to fix and with a smile Lovely food And amazing Spa. Loved every moment !
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in The Mansion Resort and Spa for 4 nights, and were really happy with the resort/hotel. It could use some TLC in parts, and they had started work in some areas of the hotel which was at times noisy but for the most part the hotel was clean, the service was great, and the hotel has a lovely peaceful and relaxing vibe.The breakfast selection had lots to choose from, and the one lunch and dinner we ate in the restaurant was of good quality.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing landscaping with a number of water bodies, gardens, sitting areas and nice interiors of the guest rooms, all done tastefully in Balinese style. It’s a huge property and you can spend almost a day exploring the various setups in the resort itself. There is a beautiful open area by the poolside and also a thatched roofed area nearby where you can enjoy your food. The guest rooms are well appointed with all the amenities. Given the appreciable distance guest rooms are located from the central building the service is a bit slow. The only downside is the food menu which I didn’t like and also the front desk which lacked professionalism and at times behaved rudely.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The resort is really cosy, quiet, tranquil and authentic Balinese. It felt like living in a genuine luxurious monastery hidden away in the rainforest. The only letdown was the restaurant. The food was not as good as you would expect from a resort at this level. So after trying to eat dinner there twice, we decided to go elsewhere in Ubud for dinner. Breakfast was also a letdown. No freshly pressed juices, bacon always finished, and the plates with the fresh fruits, salads and vegetables were filled with small fruit flies. And the plates with the sweet stuff were filled with small black ants. So bacon and eggs were the only thing you could eat, and the bacon was always finished, so eggs for breakfast was the only choice really. One good thing though was that the place was Chinese free. Almost every other hotel around Bali that me and my wife stayed at had loads of loud and ill-mannered Chinese people, who have no idea how to behave when they go to other countries and meet other people from other cultures. They spit and blow their noses in the pools, they are loud in restaurants to the point you no longer can enjoy a quiet romantic candle light dinner, their children run around screaming in the restaurants and resort premises without being told off by their parents and they leave their trash everywhere. Consideration to others seems to be completely unknown to Chinese people. So I would recommend and come back to this resort, just because there were no Chinese people staying at the resort.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The staff is truly 1st class/ 5 Star!! They are wonderful!! The grounds are beautiful. Lots of foliage to enjoy. However, the building structure needs some repair and updates. I would likely not return or recommend until this occurred.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent a few nights here but wish we stayed longer. The resort has a beautiful ambience and is very peaceful. so many pools to choose from. The breakfast was delicious, and the staff were so warm. Ubud is central, so its easy to choose from the many activities - rafting, atv, buggie, etc. We would love to come back!
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a really enjoyable stay at this lovely spa resort. Our room was of a very high standard and staff extremely helpful at all times. Breakfast by the pool was a great start to the day and the half board option was good choice as we didn’t need to take a taxi back to town in the evening. Taxi was cheap so no big deal if food hadn’t been available in the evening. Concierge was very knowledgeable about local area and helped us decide where to visit. Didn’t use the spa as it was expensive in comparison with places in Ubud where we had great Balinese massage. We used a hotel driver for a day trip and it was well priced. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just walking through the garden entrance of this resort gives you an overwhelming feeling of serenity and relaxation. Its so peaceful and calming. The perfect get away from everything that irritates you about day to day living. I spent some magical moments just sitting back on my recliner, reading and sipping on my cocktail. Life doesn't get much better that that. The staff are helpful and attentive and nothing is too much trouble for them to do for you, to guarantee you an amazing stay at The Mansion. Thank you for the happy memories made.!! I'll be back.!!
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Mansion for 7 days and throughoughy enjoyed our holiday. Our room was spacious and designed in a lovely Balinese theme which is totally what we were after.The free shuttle bus to the centre was convenient and prompt. Guest relations were friendly and explained to us the best sights to see. We had a fabulous all day tour white water rafting, seeing the temples and ate at some beautiful locations. Highly recommend talking with front of house for insights.There were many options for breakfast. Unfortunately it starts at 7am but we are super early risers so these times would be appropriate if not early for most people.We spent most of our time by the magnificent pool having lunch and cocktails. Truly a relaxing holiday. The grounds and the pools are just gorgeous. We tried all 5 of them. My favorite would have to be the main pool. Do yourself a favour and spend at least a day there with cocktails.Thank you team for a wonderful holiday.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Mansion resort, sayan ubud Beautiful balinese Art resort , We stayed here for 5 nights with our group of yoga for retreat, and we had found such great and complete facilities and such serenity with beautiful surroundings and arts, we had requested vegetarian menu and it was very nice and tasty, Spa is very very good our skin really glow after the ancient herbs treatment, overall stay was wonderful and relaxing experience.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there 3 nights. Very disappointing. Definitely not 5* service. Numerous things didn't match our expectations. We had to change the first room as it was so humid (no ventilation in the bathroom, no bathroom door to separate toilets from the bedroom) and bedsheets showed dirty brown stains.The place in general looked cheap and poorly maintained: cracks, falling paints, broken furniture, random equipment laying around, dust and spider webs in the bar and breakfast area. From the room we could hear farm noises from nearby and also the staff's smoking area, with constant disturbances.Breakfast was below average, definitely not a 5*. Cheap industrial bread and pastries, disgusting coffee, tasteless "local" dishes.Staff was difficult to communicate with and lacked training. One openly lied to me.Plenty of other very good hotels in Bali to choose from. Please avoid.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our time in The Mansion with a special honeymoon welcome. The staff were very helpful. We personally would recommend eating in the city or just round the corner at Cafe Vespa, but we couldn’t pick fault with the hotel for our stay!
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We choose The Mansion as the hotel has about 4 or 5 swimming pools. I'm not a good swimmer and not very confidence, that's why being in quiet pool is really importand to me and that's the best part.We stayed for one night on the 2nd floor. Upon arrival, we were greeted warmly by the lovely Reception, and checked in was quick. We were taken to our room, and a little tour on the way to our room. The room is adequate, lovely and spacious for 2 of us. An extra matrass/bed for the 2nd bed is available, to cater for family.Free shuttle service to and from Ubud is available, which is very handy as the hotel located out of the centre of Ubud. The Mansion has a stunning garden with ample of outdoor space. Perfect spot to spend the day around the hotel. The wifi is really annoying and there's no connection at all in our room, or even we've got the connection it's only one bar of signal and disconnected immediately. Breakfast was disappointed with very limited option, and the food served was below expectation.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spend 7 days with a big group of friends at The Mansion and I cant express my gratitude to all the team for making our stay more than perfect!We are coming back in 2 weeks and I cant wait!Good bfast, comfortable rooms, best views, pools and outdoor areas!Thank you thank you thank you!10*!!!
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The mansion resort and spa ubud is kind of amazing resort and Beautiful, staff very friendly and care with us my girl Friend really really Happy, the swinging poll very nice and large That we Like, food amazing ,and give us very beautiful moment, would be back here and recommen to all my friend when they get holliday to ubud come here.. ♥
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Always polite staff with very nice smile ,very very friendly and the accommodation we love it ,my family so happy and our room always clean ,we love the swimming pool and children play safe at the mansion , breakfast with salad bar, and lunch ,dinner was nice , high recommendation and would be back for sure , see you again thanks to all staffs being nice with us
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the mansion for 5 nights and were extremely excited as the pictures on the website looked incredible. However when we arrived and shown to our room there is a lot of maintenance to be done and it is quite dated. There was no door to the bathroom, which wasn’t an issue, but there was no shower curtain so the bathroom was completely soaked every time. The TV picture was horrendous and the fridge didn’t work. The air conditioning, after being left on during the night eventually started spitting ice out. When it’s directly above your head in bed it’s not the best wake up call. The free shuttle bus is a bonus, but the last one is at 9pm which is a little early and there aren’t many taxis in town. Maybe 10pm would be better. When one night we chose to get a taxi back at 10pm, we wanted to have a drink in the restaurant when we got back, only to be told they were now closed. They reluctantly let us order one drink (as long as they weren’t cocktails) and sit outside, but they closed all the doors on us, switched off the lights and all staff left - leaving us feeling like we had been a bit naughty by wanting a drink past 10pm! Upon checkout we tried to pay for our room via our STA MasterCard for it to be declined despite there being sufficient funds. The lady behind reception was very rude and shouted “DECLINED” for all to hear which was quite embarrassing considering we did have enough money. The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that the housekeeping staff are incredible and kind. They will go above and beyond for you, however the restaurant, reception and bar staff - not so much. Always having to ask for more cutlery at breakfast despite there being plenty of staff. The food in the restaurant is ridiculously priced for what it is. It’s like they believe because they’re a 5 star hotel they can charge those prices, but in my opinion they’re more like a 3 star. We stayed at a 3 star in Seminyak prior to the Mansion and would go back there in a heartbeat compared to this. That was more like a 5 star. Word of advice: stay closer to the centre of Ubud at a different hotel.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I highly recommend the mansion hotel, its like heaven on earth, the staff is very well trained everyone welcomes you with a warm heart 24/7, the place is extraordinary, amazing, beautiful , clean plus Mr. Dewa (manager) took good care of us and listens to its customer's need, its not a five stars hotel i give him 10 stars!
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our second visit to Ubud. From beginning to end this hotel was exceptional. All the staff were extremely attentive. The room was huge with a beautiful art. Lovely finishing touches. The breakfast was to die for and fully waitress service. The grounds were extensive and beautifully kept. Many pools, amazing spa with variety services. Would highly recommend.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly, the place is an incredibly beautiful resort. 5 amazing pools. Stayed here at the last minute as an alternate arrangement to their brother hotel in the centre of Ubud which we had problems with, so my girlfriend and I arrived extremely late. The staff here were lovely and accomodating. This hotel is far from the centre of town which we had not planned for, so The Mansion organised one free shuttle to a location of our choosing once per day during the duration of our stay which was a lovely compromise considering we had not planned to stay there. Because we arrived late, and could not get to any restaurants for dinner, they also gave us 20% off our dinner and 20% off massages (although we didn't take their offer for a discount on their massage, it was still nice knowing we could if wanted to!). My only real complaint is that it is far away from the centre and also that there were a few small issues in the room. The room itself is a bit dated. The safe had a malfunction and kept setting off a break-in alarm. The door to the bathroom would not close properly- you had to slam the door for it to close, and there were a few kinks with the aircon which had to be fixed by maintenance, however these issues were all solved quickly and promptly. The water in the shower would not drain properly, half-flooding the shower area and the toilet sometimes would not flush well (although about the toilet and shower, we did not complain because the staff were so nice). By one of the pools, there were pool lounge seats with a retractable roof. One seat had no roof, only a metal frame, and the other had a roof that would not stay extended, collapsing back into the open position. Staff told us there were pool towels by the pool- there were none. Weak wi-fi reception in the room we stayed in (Arjuna), so you had to move around the suite to find the best wi-fi area which was a bit annoying. These issues however were definitely small issues, and not fatal to our staying at the hotel. All-in-all, a beautiful resort, and considering the great amenities, it was a great stay! Great staff. The above issues are all easy to fix and I'm sure they will be fixed.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the mansion resort ubud bali , A true balinese vibes, We had such wonderful weekend at this resort through friend’s reccomendation, my wife loves the spa and our girls dont want to leave the kids club, very nice room by the pool, great food and cocktails,the balinese show is amazing, would come back for sure, thanks to all friendly and genuine staffs and good service.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positive:- Beautiful entrance, romantic- Beautiful gardens- 5 swimming pools- Friendly staff- Good beds- Good spa- Free shuttle to Ubud- Free airport transferNegative:- Bit outdated - Family room had strong smell. Probably humidity related, moldy- No shower in room, only bath- Moderate breakfast (and restaurant)
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 3 nights here for our first hotel in Bali, had a lovely spacious room which was actually situated in the conference/meeting room which lead off to 5 rooms inside the building. The room was massive with a big circular bath in the corner. The hotel offers a shuttle to the centre of Ubud and picks you up as well, the reception can give you the times which I believe was every hour or two hours. Loved the scenery around the hotel, with the treehouse situated in the middle and has great photo opportunities everywhere you walked around. The hotel has loads of pools with the main one next to the pool bar which is reasonably priced for food and drinks. We hired out a private taxi through the reception and the lovely man took me and my girlfriend around the centre of Bali, which you can choose and he'll also give recommendations of places that you can go too within the hours that you have booked the taxi for. I have still got the number for the man which you can email or contact him on Whatsapp if anyone wants it, i would highly recommened as that was the best thing we did in Bali. Went to the restuarant at night twice and was dissapointed with the service from one of the staff there who served us both of nights. He took nearly 20 mins just to give us the drinks and food menu and then another 15 mins to come back to allow us to order, which he got both our orders wrong on both nights. There was only a couple of other guests and loads of staff, after our meal on the second night when we paid, he accused us off not paying and eventually apologised and said he forgot. However, that was the only negative thing about this great hotel. Would love to come back to this hotel and when we are next in Bali, we will not think twice about booking again.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this on 5th Aug 1pm just before i leave for airport to go Bali.The price attracted me and booked a 1 bedroom villa.The check in was quick and we were led to the villa. The place is HUGE and we walked some 100m to the room. During the walk we saw many pools and the staff said there were 5 pools! He showed us the room and explained the use and the details in room. I must say, i was impressed with the room and the space. I ventured out that afternoon to check the place out and got lost in this huge resort.We decided to dine in 2 dinners and totally in love with the Grilled salmon and rice. The Mojito were just lovely!As we were there for sightsee, we didnt have time for the pool. The pools just kept calling to us. :(The breakfast is just so so... food like not warmed.Overall, its a great stay and the amount i paid just so shocking. Would love to go back for a longer stay if time permits.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at The Mansion Hotel Spa were phenomenal. The massage was excellent and very relaxing. The masseur checked in throughout to make sure I was comfortable and enjoying my experience. I highly recommend this spa for its fantastic massages.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have always loved the Mansion. I have been here 4 times in total, the first 3 with my family and recently in July by myself. I wanted to explore the Mansion and Bali better. The resort did not disappoint me but instead, surprised me with so many changes, updates, incredible features that I get to fully experienced, entirely. The services they provided, fulfilled my desires since I wanted to visit different temples and I got the chance to. Indochine restaurant was great with amazing drinks and cocktails which were my favs. My room was very nice and near the pools. Overall, I would definitely come back again. I love the Mansion and Bali, I hope to go back soon! Enjoy guys!
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of our first location of our time in Bali. We were eager to get a traditional feel of Bali and this hotel gave it to us.Hotel grounds:The grounds are stunning, and when we arrived we were given a tour realising how much bigger this resort is than we’d thought. The pools were gorgeous and plenty of sun beds and seating areas to relax in. Room:We stayed in Bambu Wood which was pretty basic and although the room is quite worn and could do with some refreshing, it maintained a true Bali feel. A large four poster Balinese-style bed and an almost water feature-like shower. Restaurant:We only ate in the restaurant for dinner on the night we arrived and sat by the romantic lit pool. Yes it is typically more expensive than most Bali restaurants, but expected from a hotel. It was average food but I would recommend venturing out as there’s so many impressive eats. We had breakfast included which was fine, plenty of fresh fruits and bread and an egg station.Location: This hotel is a little out from Ubud centre but we found a fantastic walk through to Ubud one lunch time. Turning right out the hotel as far as Cafe Vespas (great for lunch), then continue straight down a narrow road, rather than continuing round to the right or taking the left down another gravelled road. Down here you’ll find loads of little cafes, a gorgeous shrine on the right hand side and as you continue you’ll find yourself almost in Ubud centre (near Bridges restaurant a bit further to the right along that main road). We also found Sayan House which is so romantic and only a 10/15 min walk from the hotel (see review).You can also catch the free shuttle down to Ubud and ask for taxis from the hotel to your destination. We went to Bridges (see review) for dinner and only paid about 80,000 IDR which is less than £5 and even less coming back from a local taxi. Excursions:We did Mount Batur trek with Tour Bali Driver (booked online through trip advisor) which was worth doing although extremely tiring and hard work! But a great experience. We also did a one day tour with Hire Bali Driver (trip advisor also) and selected the sights we wanted to see.Overall I think this was a great choice of hotel and would certainly recommend if you want something traditional and staying for a short time.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is beautiful - it’s so large I got lost almost every day! It’s the perfect resort whether you’re travelling alone, as a couple or with your family. There’s plenty of room for everyone, with five pools and sun beds / relaxation spots everywhere. The staff are very attentive and caring of your needs. I felt safe and very special as a solo guest.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: if you want to stay in a place that is culturally beautiful then the Mansion is for you. We stayed in a private two bedroom villa with its own private pool. But the hotel has five pools, beautifully landscaped grounds and helpful & kind service people. The breakfast was included every day for our stay as well.
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros : Beautiful hotel. It's a huge complex. Insta-worthy pictures.Rooms at good rate. Approx. £50 nightRooms clean and less mosquito issues compared to other hotels.Staff are AMAZING !!! So kind and do everything with a real smile. Absolutely wonderful people. Cons : before you book, specify that your toilet has a door!
hotelName:
5    The Mansion Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really close to the harbour for easy access in and out of island. The most friendly staff I have ever met the whole time I’ve been in Indonesia. You can tell that the staff and owner really care for the place. Doing a tour of the island this was by far the most modern hotel/resort and you can tell alot of time and effort l went into the design and maintenance of the place. Had an issue in town and the manager Saptura took me In personally to speak to the local to sort it out and fixed the problem. Him doing this really showed he cares for the people staying in the resort. All the staff (Parni,Nusa,CaCa, Astuti and another young guy can’t remember his name) took the time to remember my name making it it feel more like a home than just a place to stay. I never write reviews so I give it a big thumbs up to you guys there. Great end to the trip
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommend we had wonderful day trip with Driver Slom! He took amazing pictures for us, drive safely and he was so nice. If you think day tour just ask to Slom. Thank you for everything for our honeymoon!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visit the Hotel for five days in July.Hotel and rooms are very clean.Breakfast, dinner and lunch are very tasty.Very helpful and friendly stuff, Astuti was very helpful.We would recommend the hotel.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly staff and big up to Slom who was our driver for a whole day and took us around the island to show us all the nice spots The manager Saputra was also really kind and helpful - definitely recommending this place
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was in a very convenient location. They provided us with motorbikes for a very reasonable price and made sure we had the best stay. Beds were comfortable & grounds were well kept. Breakfast could have been better.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel arranged a tour for us with Slom. The roads on Nusa Penida are not for the faint of heart but Slom handled them very well. We started early and were able to see all of the sights we wanted too. A big thank you to Slom for helping to make this such a memorial trip.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great time here. The hotel is very close to the harbour and you can easily rent a scooter to travel the island! The staff is very friendly and the rooms are perfect for a short or longer trip.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel stay was nice and cozy. SLOM was really helpful and supportive during our visitHe took good care of us all the time and checked all our needs :):) I would recommend to visit the island and embrace the lovely vieww
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Warm welcome from staffs Astuti,rina,urip. The staff are all very friendly with smiles. The hotel provided free pick up services from the harbour and also free transportation services to harbour for nusa lembongan. The hotel also has breakfast, lunch and dinner. There are many food stalls nearby the hotel as well. This place is worth staying. :)
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here 3 nights, but were out most of the day. This hotel is small and has a cute and comfortable pool and a . Breakfast is free at the restaurant too. Outside the hotel, there are 6-8 more restaurants where most of the tourists hang out. This was perfect for what we needed.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arsa Santhi exceeded expectations. Due to some bad weather if was touch and go whether we could cross to Penida. Manager Toya went way above and beyond to sort ferry tickets for us, even meeting us personally at the ferry port in Padangbai to make sure all was well. Hotel itself was great - check in was smooth and the room was a welcome sight after a long day of travel Big bed, spotless room and nice bathroom so we felt relaxed and at home straight away. Everything from pool to restaurant to motorbike hire was all great and hassle free. Special mention also to the restaurant staff who were all smiles and super friendly every day. Would not hesitate to return here for another visit. Thank you again Toya and team for making our stay memorable.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We did not stay here, but we were looking for scooter rental. Staff was very helpful. Eventhough we were not staying, the were helpful to rent us a scooter. Again, many thanks to the super friendly people. After our Nusa Penida trip, we had a few drinks. And again service was excellent. Maybe next time, a stay at these lovely people.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nothing amazing to write about but the place was clean and prices are good. There is nothing great on the island so you don't want to overspend and this fit the bill. The staff was great and they can setup trips for you as needed.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'd recommend the Hotel Arsa Santhi to anyone travelling to Nusa Penida, who is looking to stay over and needs a good base. The staff are friendly (as you'd expect with the Balinese), the accommodation is well priced and they have a restaurant that met all our expectations. Please try the fresh fruit juices!The hotel also arranged a driver for us that literally made our first day fabulous! His name is Annga. His English is very good, and he just did everything to make our day special. Finishing off with sunset at Crystal Bay was the perfect ending.Only draw back at the Hotel was the hot water. It lasted only 10mins max and then became luke warm to cold. Wasn't much of a problem for me but the Mrs definitely needed more time.B
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you visit Penida I highly recommend this place, beautiful hotel,very clean spacious rooms, giant comfortable bed, I have traveled throughout Bali and the islands many times and the quality of service here is second to none. Well done to all the staff. We will be back!!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visit the island is very niceThe hotel staff are very friendly and politeThe food is amazing teste very good price. The rooms are amazing and cleanWe had a great time in Arsa SanthiThank you for everythingBest regardsWilmer LozadaFrom Ecuador
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: close to the jetty, good staffs, clean room, average food, nice view, recommended, helping staffs, good price, memorable trip with friends, able to arrange diving and snorkeling so fast and last minute.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely and very basic hotel.Because the hotel is building new rooms, the noise of the construction site may bother some.The pool is nice, decent sized and the service is friendly. I would recommend the place!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice place to stay. Outside the room area is very clean and very Green. Big room, with air conditioning and big bed. Super friendly stuff. The pool area is also nice. Once elctricity went off on a whole island, but hotel has generator power so it was also a very big plus!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were clean and very spacious. It has a small garden and swimming pool which was clean. Staff was very courteous and always ready to help. It is located around 5 mins drive from the Nusa Penida harbour. There is a beach around 2 mins walking from the hotel which is not so good. Other tourist attractions like Kelingking beach, crystal beach etc are located around 45-60 mins drive.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Arsa Santhi. Their communication was above what we have experienced while traveling three months in SE Asia. They arranged for transportation to / from the ferry terminal and took care of all our bookings while on the Island. Very friendly staff, great communication, free breakfast, huge beds, clean facilities - good value and all you could ask for. There are decent restaurants within walking distance. We would stay here again.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was most impressed with their communication. I was arriving from mainland Bali and they were so helpful in directing me where to catch a boat to come to Nusa Penida. They arranged for someone to meet me at the boat dock to take me to the hotel and then brought me back to the dock when I was returning to Bali. They arranged 2 different tours for me, which were both amazing. I really liked the pool with it's wall that was a waterfall. The sound was very relaxing. They offered yoga twice a day with a woman named, Gizelle, who was quite a dynamic woman. She was super helpful in teaching me the proper techniques and poses. It was a class called sky flow yoga and I had never done this before. Great to have the option to do yoga right at the hotel. The staff was very helpful and I liked that breakfast was included. Thank you Arsa Santhi for a wonderful vacation in Nusa Penida.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Warmly recommend, friendly staff, good breakfast, clean rooms. Only one negative thing: the rooms are build so lightly that you can hear neighbours talking. They even picked us from the harbour.Scooter rental as well.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have nothing but good to say about this hotel. Easy access, close to harbour. High standard, modern clean, very nice beds and friendly staff who really made sure we had a nice stay. Nice pool with tempered water and enough chairs, restroom and shower. Good breakfast and Indonesian food in the restaurant. Organised transport to harbour for free when we left. Only bad was construction of new rooms from 8 am in January 2019, but they warned us before checking in so not a problem.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff really friendly, any problem or question sorted immediately. The rooms could not be more perfect, and also you get massive beds. Swimming pool is amazing. When the electricity gone in the whole island they just switched on a generator and we were the only place with electricity, which just make it legendary.Good value of money.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came here because of the reviews and the price, it did not disappoint. We called the hotel and they gladly sent a car to pick us up. They were very enthusiastic and informative on the way over to the hotel, and when I asked if they had coconuts at the hotel, they told me we could stop at a place that sold them on the way there. Great!The rooms were clean, AC was good, fridge even had space for a coconut :DThe atmosphere at the hotel was nice and relaxing. They even had a little hut to do yoga in. Not too many rooms so it didn't get crowded. Pool was nice and clean, and the food at the restaurant was decent. The staff however, were very nice and always greeted you with a smile and went out of their way to accommodate you.The management at the hotel also helped us with getting a driver to go to the destinations/attractions we wanted to go to for a very good price. Our driver was Slom and he was a great guy and drove us safely and promptly to our destinations. He also did a good job as our guide at the destinations we went to. Some of the roads are in very rough shape so we were glad he was driving us. If I ever come back to this island, I know where I'll stay! TLDR: Great place, great price, great staff
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rented two rooms here for 4 nights. One King, and one twin. Rooms a very clean and have great air conditioning. Grounds are maintained well and are very nice. Located close to the harbor, but if you have more than a back pack you'll probably want to get a taxi. The restaurant has decent prices and I recommend the chicken club sandwich. The hotel rents scooters at a decent price, but if you need more than 70cc check the harbor.The pool was having issues when we first arrived. The water was murky with white floaties creating the murkiness. The next day the murkiness was gone so we swam. But the following day it was back. Not sure what was going on there. There was a little pricing snafu at check out, but a quick phone call to the lady I made the booking with and it was sorted out. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall we were pleased with our choice to stay here. We booked for 4 nights then extended the stay for an extra night at late notice and staff were very helpful, rebooking us into our existing room. Reception staff were great with helping us to organise excellent drivers for exploring the island and they offered good advice on the best way to see the places that we wanted to visit (from our pre-researched list).The location was a short walk to the beachfront via a laneway, with a store conveniently next door for buying water etc. All staff had a friendly, helpful attitude.The room was clean, aircon effective, WiFi reliable bed was huuuuge and comfortable with nice sheets & duvet. There was a good sized portable drying rack in the room - very handy for drying bathers and hand washing. The only room downsides were the lack of a luggage rack for bags and the bath towels and bath mats have truly seen better days - they were permanently discolored and stained - the worst we have ever encountered!The grounds are lovely and well maintained, although there was a problem with the pool when we arrived (due to heavy rainfall apparently) - the pool looked cloudy and univiting and it took several days of staff working to resolve the issues. The day we checked out it seemed like the issues had finally been resolved.The breakfast menu was pretty standard - nothing to complain about. The restaurant was pretty full every night from people staying at hotel plus people from surrounding accommodations. We enjoyed the meals that we chose.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay there for one night. So room noise insulation is Zero actually impossible to sleep because of noise from other rooms and construction works in middle of place. Breakfast is under minimum standards. Rooms are clean and staff is ok.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed the hotel very much. The bed was huuuuuuge and all of the amenities were great; AC worked very well, bathroom was fine, pool was great, hotel grounds were extremely clean and the staff were extremely friendly. They have a driver onsite that can take you around the island for an affordable amount. If you have a group, it’s even cheaper since you can split it amongst yourselves. They also have motor bikes to rent out for like, $5 usd per day.The hotel is only a 5-10 min walk from the harbor so if anyone asks to take you, decline and just walk. Use your GPS and follow the road... it’s easy! I stayed in room 103
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We didn’t stay at this hotel, but we came here because the atm had run empty and we needed money to catch a boat back to Bali. We asked the staff if we could pay with card and get money in return and they gladly helped us! Without them we would be stuck on the island with no place to stay and without any money.Remember guys, always bring extra cash to the islands!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very kind staff that helped us whenever we raised questions or needed assistance (advices, phone call with our speedboat agency, free pick up from the port etc) We just spent there 4 entire days and we’re really surprised. It’s the most beautiful hotel I have seen on that island in those 4 days.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel, great pool, very nice staff. Made me feel at home during my stay with them. There is a lot to do on the island and they can help you booking with any of this. Talk to Arthur, he can help with anything! Thanks
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service I received at this hotel was incredible. Everyone was friendly and welcoming. Amazing rooms, super clean. Loved staying here, would come again. Don’t think twice about reserving this place!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a good two night stay at Arsa Santhi. Really recommend Ba Bars down the road for food if you visit. Positives:+ Huge beds which are incredible + We organised a tour of the West Coast of the island through reception which was really nice+ The pool is lovely + Banana pancakes at breakfast were great Negatives:- Construction work very, very noisy next to our villa beginning early in the morning. Not nice and if we hadn’t been getting up early to explore the island anyway we’d have been very annoyed at this. - Reception staff were pretty clueless about how we would get to Sidemen from Penida... The owner of the hotel promised us he would book our boat transfer and arrange a taxi then he disappeared and we never saw him again despite giving him our number for WhatsApp? We were also initially told by another member of staff we would need to get a two hour slow boat then 2 hour taxi but this wasn’t the case.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had such a great time at this hotel. The personnel was really friendly and the size of the beds is just insane! They help us the last day of our trip with the fast boats tickets (companies weren't sure to go because of the weather), organisation was well done !
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is adorable, clean, friendly staff, nice breakfast, cute pool. They picked us up from the harbor and brought us back, the location is great and they have a nice restaurant that’s open from morning till night. The “bad” things are very minor: no face towels, shower water current is very weak.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Arsa santhi hotel for 2 nights and absolutely loved it there. The breakfast was very delicious and the rooms were clean and beautiful. There is even the perfect pool area to just relax. And then the staff was helpful and kind all the time. Definetly can recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel, nice and cozy. Clean and spacious room. For the double bed, they combine two single beds into one extra large bed. Very comfortable. The staff is very attentive and helpful. The free / compliment transportation from and to the boat terminal is a big plus.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice stay, clean room ,near the port, nice restaruant,and modern hote,we stay 3 nigth here, the staff very freadly and helpuly ,beatiful island,also amazing view,the best for trip and explore the island
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spend some Time on the hotelIt was wonderful. The swimming pool is amazingVery good location and staff is very nice, they gave us good recommendations to discover the island The restaurant and breakfast are also good Arta is very nice and friendly
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best accomodation in Asia in a trip of 21 days. Nusa penida is just amazing and the hotel is perfect compared to other hotel with the same price.Arta, the Office guy it's amazing! He will manage for you everything in a very friendly way!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really nice hotel, staff was very friendly to help us! I recommend this hotel in Nusa Penida.Is located really close to the port There is a beautiful swimming pool and really nice area and bedrooms thank you
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very beautiful Hotel! Really clean. The staff is really kind and hulpfull. I want to come here again. The pool is also clean. You can rest here. Really quiet. The perfect spot for scuba diving. Perfect!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my wife stayed stayed for 2 nights ( should of been 3 ) in the beginning of August .Nusa Penida is a very “raw” island without all the tourist infrastructure that people are used to, and this hotel is the best place to stay.The staff is fantastic , very kind , helpful and always trying to help .Unfortunately for us during our stay we had a big earthquake in Lombok , that gave everyone a bad time !But one fantastic thing was all the staff , the general manager ( sorry don’t remember the name ) manage to get everyone in vans , take us to the top of the hill , got us waters and manage to stay calm in a hard situation. All this because a tsunami warning was there.All staff did fantastic.It’s a clean space near the road , with some nice restaurants all around and very close to the harbor.I highly recommend staying time in this place if you visit this island .
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very good day with Teja, the #driver of the hotel who brought us in the best places of nusa penida. He speaks very well English and pay Intention to your expectations and adapts the rythm of the tour depending on your will. Teja will make sure you have a good day, in a good mood (you can connect your own music in the car!) and see good points of view. Do not hesitate to book your tour with him when arriving at the hotel!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice place, good food and very friendly staff. Arfa was very helpful ! I definitely recommand Arta Santhi for anyone staying in Nusa Penida (beautiful island still preserved from mass tourism). Hope to be back soon !
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very good stay at Arsa Santhi. The rooms are spacious and clean, the pool is great if you want to take a break from exploring Nusa Penida, and the staff is very friendly. Most of them are quite bad in English, though, but the blonde guy (think his name was ‘Madhi’) spoke it quite OK and helped us with everything! Breakfast is included (and quite tasty), and motor cycles are for rent at the hotel. You can also ask for guided tours, but I didn’t do these.On the downside, I do believe they are asking too much money for what you receive. Other stays on Nusa Penida (f.e. Nusa Penida Homestay) provide the same level of cleanliness and friendliness but are way cheaper! The only big difference is the pool, it’s up to you to decide if it’s worth the extra bucks.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We, my 18 Years old childrens and me, found here a very nice place. The owner managed Hotel offers you nearly new, big and high,full climate rooms, with a terrace nice and quiet. Also the beds are big size and comfortable. They made it possible for us, to bring a third bed inside of our room(Pictures 3). You find a sufficient Pool and a Restaurant "in the house ", open during the whole day. On our 3 weeks trip, through Java and Bali, we found some different locations. Arsa Santhi is with big distance the best we met, in the middle price segment!The people that are working here, are proud with the work they do.I am really surprized of the warm hospitality at this place. If you need a support or a helping hand, they give it to you. Therefore 5 Stars, because it's worth! Sama Sama. Martin Gralki
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff were very friendly and accommodating, happy to help out with anything. Madi on reception was a great help from restaurant recommendations, sightseeing and booking boat transfers for us.Location is good as it is close to the ferry port. Rooms were immaculate, bed was huge, it was quite firm though. The walls between rooms slightly thin, you can hear your neighbours very easily. Breakfast menu needed more options.Would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is great for the fast boat from sanur. Staff are excellent and food was good at the restaurant. 3rd time to nusa penida and i'd go back to this place again.Good breakfist, good swiming pool,good garden, and free pick up and drop up from hotel to hor bour
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Artua, on the hotel staff, was great! He was very helpful and provided everything we needed. He made the stay easy and relaxing. If you go there, ask for him! The hotel itself was very nice as well. My wife and I loved it!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, friendly staff and with all of the amenities you could want from a hotel on this tiny island. Great location next to the harbor, walking distance to many little shops. Breakfast was tasty and the staff is very accommodating, ensuring you get the most out of your stay on nusa penida. If you’re looking for a place to stay, this should be your first choice.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really loved our stay in Arsa Santhi. There's not many good hotels in Nusa Penida, so we were really lucky to find this one. If you want one a room of good quality at good price and in a perfect location (walking distance from where the boat leaves you) this is definitely the one! We loved the huge bed in the room and the lovely pool. The staff was exceptional too, always smiling and helpful, especially Dewi at the reception. Thanks so much!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Arsa Santhi Nusa Penida
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the privilege of staying almost 3 weeks at Alam Sari, and was taken by the beauty of the place and the friendliness of the staff. Our room was ideal for us, who like to fall asleep and wake up to the sounds of nature. There was some noise from traffic in the daytime, but on the other hand you have the privilege of wandering around in the beautiful garden, picking flowers and fruit, or take a stroll in the nearby rice-fields. Getting to know some of the people working here was of special value to us. Putu who became our guide, driver and friend, is a living encyclopedia of knowledge about most aspects of Balinese nature and culture, and showed us a warmth and generosity, that went far beyond our expectations. Kerti - serving with the grace of a Balinese legong-dancer, treated us with flowers and offerings and Warsi with her gentle smile proved to be a capable masseur in addition to her many other functions. And Agung, with his wonderful sense of humor, and Wayan and...In short everyone there had their share in making our stay both pleasant and enriching. And the fee shuttle to and fro Ubud made it easy to stay out in the countryside.Sam Frankowska (painter) and Jo van der Eynden (writer) from Norway
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went here in the morning. Putri was a good tour host. We went around the garden. We saw the civets. There was free tasting of all their different kinds of coffee and tea. We bought mangosteen tea, lemon grass and vanilla coffee.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights in this fantastic little place, nestled amidst the lush tropical greenery and a far cry from the crowds of the major resorts to the south of the island. After a very long journey, it was immediately refreshing to be welcomed so warmly and we felt our vacation had really begun as we sipped our cocktails by the lovely pool, surrounded by the exotic sights and sounds of the forest. The staff were excellent - friendly, helpful, efficient and always greeted us with a warm smile - and the fact that they are all local people made this feel like an establishment that is firmly connected to the community.We would particularly highlight Putu, their guide/driver and all-round local expert, who took us on a fascinating tour of the village, and the hotel's organic gardens where he pointed out all manner of exotic varieties that we had never seen growing - nutmeg, peppercorns, cocoa, passion fruit, cinnamon, etc. He knew exactly the perfect time to take us for a tour of the nearby water temple at Tirta Empul, so that we arrived just as the ceremonies were reaching their climax. This is the kind of personal touch and knowledge that elevates a great experience into a lifelong memory. Our room was very comfortable, a 2 bedroom traditional bungalow which was ideal for us and our two teens. Everything was spotlessly clean, well-equipped, with a rustic charm that really added to the sense of being in the authentic Bali. There were several families with young children, and you could see how the staff went out of their way to make them feel at home. We never heard any other guests in the evenings and overall the atmosphere felt quiet and private. For us, being surrounded by the flora and fauna of the forest was a real plus, and it never made us uncomfortable. The butterflies were so beautiful and the geckos were fun - much better than listening to the drone of a TV as you eat dinner!We found all our meals at the restaurant very good, with breakfasts offering nice combinations of western and Balinese/Indonesian favorites and dinners expanding further into local cuisine. Again, everything was well done, prepared and cooked in-house, from fresh, many spices and herbs coming from their own garden.Many activities are offered to further enhance the experience, such as cooking classes and yoga.We would highly recommend Alam Sari to anyone looking for a restful and immersive vacation experience in the real Bali and we cannot wait to return.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although the owner might want to put a little more $ into maintenance of the property, overall experience was amazing. The staff went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. We had a great experience with all of them. Our villa was always clean, food at the restaurant fresh and tasty. They are all genuinely kind people. Great Balinese cultural experience!
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my partner over 5 days to experience the “real” Bali. However, I was incredibly disappointed. This place is really dirty and grimey. I wouldn’t recommend whatsoever. The bed linen is covered in mould and is torn/damaged. When I stay at a resort clean sheets is a must. The bed is nothing more than a foam mattress which is hard and makes for a bad nights rest.  The shower takes about 15 minutes of completely running for the water to be luke warm at best. No such thing as a hot function. The wifi signal is very poor. To the extent where internet pages cannot load. We’ve had to go into ubud to contact family. Additionally the free shuttles the resort provides are so unreliable. We were left waiting in ubud for an hour and had to pay for our own transport back. Totally not acceptable. The air conditioning is almost useless and we were constantly waking up hot.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed after a recommendation from a friend but unfortunately our 1 night stay did not live up to expectation. Positives: the hotel is beautiful, lush vegetation is all across the property. The rooms have pretty 4 poster beds & are unique with a mini covered garden in the bathroom & the pool area is pretty & well maintained. Also the receptionist went out of her way to help with a plug to charge our mobile phones. Negatives: the village tour is only available if you stay 2 nights. The doors to the terrace on the room we were initially given didn't lock which was a security concern and when we asked reception, they already knew! They gave us a new room when we were clear we weren't happy. We ate dinner in restaurant, having been told the food was amazing...it was not. I ordered a tenderloin beef dish, the flavours were lovely but the beef was so tough that I couldn't eat it. My partner had a bland green chicken curry. And when we ordered the chocolate sundae what arrived was 3 small scoops of icecream, a trickle of chocolate sauce with 4 peanuts on top! Breakfast was similar, could only have tea or coffee, wouldn't allow me a juice unless I paid extra.The quality of the food was passable. Very disappointed by the restaurant especially after previous reviews.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just spent 3 amazing days at Alam Sari. We stayed in Villa Tunjung and could not ha e asked for more. The staff were so welcoming and nothing was too much trouble they did everything they could to make your stay special. We took the free village tour with Putu and it was so informative and gave us a great insight into village life, he didn't rush it and was happy to answer all our questions. I can't praise the staff enough for the work they do to make your stay enjoyable and the villa had everything and more. We ate at the restaurant every day and the food also was amazing. I would certainly return and would certainly recommend it to anyone wanting the secluded rainforest experience.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Off the beaten track but great location if you want to do the white water rafting or Elephant Sanctuary which they can organise for you. Very reasonable prices at £23 a night - its essentially a set of self contained bungalows or a large villa depending what you book and they picked us up from Ubud - the drive up is stunning!!. The highlight was the walking tour of the hotels organic gardens with Wayan who was just such in interesting guide - across the paddy fields and meeting the locals included the Keliki Art school. Shame we only had 2 days - we'd stay here again in a heartbeat and alwasy recommend to any one who is visiting Bali - get away from the tourist traps and actually see Bali !! Loved it.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was fortunate to be able to join a yoga retreat weekend with 14 participants and the yogi, Lisa. It was really a magical experience for me and I put much of it down to the atmosphere of Bali that Alam Sari exudes. The staff and surrounds have a gentleness about them that immediately welcomes guests to relax. It seemed that a lot of thought had gone into the food and preparation and it certainly was appreciated by the guests with numerous dietary requirements. I will certainly be on the look out for more retreats at Alam Sari and particularly those guided by Lisa. Thank you to management and staff for a wonderful weekend.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Alam Sari is a place to go to relax and unwind. Set on a beautiful forest hillside, it has amazing views, a beautiful pool surrounded by greenery, and kind and helpful staff. The breakfast was substantial and delicious and the dinner we had there was also very good. The staff helped us arrange tours and transportation and looked after our every need.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Over the past 15 years I have observed Alam Sari blossom in to the unbelievable spot in paradise it is today. The staff is welcoming from the moment they meet you at the airport to the moment they hug you good bye. They are loving, kind, caring, and well trained. When you arrive you realize that Alam Sari truly is the essence of Bali. It is a lush surrounding that immediately gives you the feeling "I have arrived...ahhhhh!"It is perfect for an individual seeking solitude, a family wanting a safe and culturally rich environment to explore, a book club wanting time to read and chat while floating in the pool (especially nice during the Readers and Writers Conference in Ubud - check it out) or for those who want to learn more about Balinese culture while being pampered. Alam Sari offers unique side trips that only they can offer such as hikes through local villages or a day with Dewi in his family compound, cooking local foods in his home. Unbelievable. I still have to pinch myself to believe this trip was true. If you have one trip-of-a lifetime you want to take head to Alam Sari and tell them hello for me.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Alam Sari for three wonderful nights, in one of the family bungalows (tunjung 2).
