The staff were all amazing and so friendly and accommodating, the views from the room/pool were perfection, we just wished we had stayed longer!!They had a large spa treatment menu, which we took advantage of, and loved everything we tried.Prices were very fair, food was delicious, could not recommend this place more!Keep in mind it is a drive into Ubud, but very peaceful and worth the trip!
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed staying this wonderful resort! The staff was amazing and took excellent care of us. The food was delicious and the massages were some of the best we've ever had. We felt welcome as soon as we arrived. The setting was gorgeous and the villa was fantastic. Thank you so much for the hospitality. We will definitely stay with you again!
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a gem of a hotel. There are many lovely places to stay in the UBUD area but if you are looking for a peaceful place to stay away from the hurly burly this one is right up there for me ( in its price bracket). The staff are all from the local village of Keliki and are , to a man and woman , wonderful. Kerti, Agung and Warsi the waiting staff can't do enough for you. Dewa and Putu who act as guides are philosophers and will enrich your stay. Don't go to Alam Sari if you want a 5 star 'plastic' experience. Do go there for a peaceful and relaxing stay with staff with warmth. Ps although I say it's not 5 star I don't mean to suggest that it is not up to standard. The rooms are lovely. Each with its own bathroom and veranda.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice getaway hotel but it's located near the road. You have a feeling that you in jungle but noise from the road reminds you that you are not. The staff is very friendly. The hotel is located near rice terraces so you can book a driver for short ride.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my family: the family room was huge. This is not a 5 star quality resort, it has character and is boutique. My kids loved the staff; the breakfast, the restaurant was reasonably priced & we got the shuttle into Ubud each day. The pool was good (the Europeans there did the 'towel on the sun lounger' trick which is a bit irritating but there were enough to go around). Kids loved that there was wifi, we did the village tour which was really interesting. Kids are begging to go again!
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super Resort, lovely staff, exceptionally helpful and friendly. Rooms are stunning. Hotel restaurant is good quality and offers a mix of local and international dishes. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend to people who are interested in a retreat from all the noise.... more suitable for adults than young children.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Alam Sari is an ideal choice to enjoy the delights of Balinese village life, while still being close to Ubud and all that it offers.The staff are drawn from Keliki village and offer a range of local activities (walks in the village, Balinese cookery and drawing classes, teaching English in the local school, learning about their extensive organic gardens).The accommodation is excellent and the pool and grounds very peaceful. The restaurant is not of the best standard, but the staff more than make up for this. We would definitely staff her again.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there for a night on my special day and my main expectation was the room view and surrounding - peaceful wet foggy tropical forests , however it turned out to " didn't meet expectation" at allPROS :Friendly staffA cake set up in the room was a nice gestureFresh water in the pool and bathroom Beautiful green jungle view and organic garden if you go up.The one hard pillow and one soft pillow is a nice combo!CONS :You would sense a moldy / humid smell in the room, on the sheets and fabrics but (I personally thought) it's tolerable due to its location in the middle of the forests. However they put this automatic room air freshener on the top of the wardrobe facing to the bed and it sprays chemical fragrance every 20 minutes! Definitely a no no during the night time.I would suggest to use more nature products that you can easily find anywhere in Bali like coffee ground or lemon grass. I believe it costs less as well.WIFI was very weak, and did not work at all during our stay. Shared my feedbacks to reception and she said that iPhone often had problem with it. I did not comment more after that.Local cellular signal was also weak due to its remote location, so for those who needs good internet connection needs to be very patient as both connections are unstable.No hand spray near the toilet bowl (it's important bathroom feature for Indonesian/ Southeast Asian)Very limited basic breakfast options : started with a tiny cup of coffee / tea and a piece of bread ( 4 pieces for 4 of us!) and you can only choose 1 menu from the list (western or local delight). We chose fried rice which stated that it came up with chicken and I have confirmed with the waiter but we got fried rice which had been cooked in advance (the rice was not even warm when it served in our table) and it has no chicken at all - not even the shredded ones mixed with the rice. We did not report about the chicken to the waiter, and we also needed to ask for shrimp crackers (which was a major condiment for nasi goreng Indonesia and they should put it together already). Sambal sauce was not served unless you ask for it.Slices of tropical fruits included as part of breakfast would be really nice considering they have their own organic garden but nothing was given as it's one of the breakfast menu (served with yoghurt) and you could not choose others if you choose the fruits one.Bali is a tropical fruit paradise, meaning it's not cost a lot (or maybe you can grow them on your own garden) and they should have it as breakfast pass around.Drinking water was also will not be served unless you ask the waiter for it.Traffic noise was also an issue, we could hear it from the pool, the restaurant, the lobby as the main road was just down the cliff.Laying down on a sun chairs in the pool : pleasure to the eyes, no pleasure to the ears.Our main issue was the room, we booked a Deluxe Family Room which stated on their website to have a look out view over the swimming pool and coconut groves, with a really nice pictures with the green view, swimming pool, and a long chair on the balcony/ terrace however we are quite shocked to find out that the room we're given was facing to the walls and the restaurant / lobby rooftop with no view at all. no long chair on our terrace and we could hear people chattering behind the wall. I shared my feedbacks directly with the reception, told her that this was not as seen as in the pictures on the website, she kept saying that what explained on the website was a Deluxe room and not a family room, and she apologized that she could not move us to any other room because they were fully booked. (later I checked the room availability online (Agoda App) and saw they still have one Suite available on the same night, maybe it was an error from the online website or maybe The Suite indeed available but it was way more expensive than what we paid for so there was no chance to move us to that room). I did not tell the Reception about that as simply I did not want to be pushy on my special day.The lady who checked us in offered to compensate our inconvenience with a massage treatment for 1 person ( which I thanked her) but I had to reject it because that would be unfair for my other 3 friends.TIPS :If you're looking for a room with a nice view , stay away from Bouganville 1 & 2 !Pictures showed online could be really different with reality.This hotel is not suitable for elderly as you need to pass lots of steep stairs (could be slippery on rainy days) before you can reach lobby and some rooms.Be prepared to see some insects in the bathroom as it is semi open air with plantation inside and due its location in the mid of forests (pretty common in Ubud hotels )We had a chance to go up and see some other rooms and organic garden, indeed they have some nice rooms with jungle view. If you want to stay here, you better call them in advance and ensure you won't get the wall view.If you are sensitive with noises, this hotel might not for you unless you have room on the upper hill (not sure about the room type), but you will definitely hear it if you are in the pool chairs and restaurants during breakfast.Live Rindik instrument played was wonderful but breakfast experience could've been better if they are willing to pay some attention to the little things which matters like condiments, drinking water, some pass around like fruits or introduced some local "japan pasar" to their guests.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights. The surrounding natural beauty is breathtaking and the resort is rustic. I would recommend staying for the home made breakfast, using locally sourced ingredients...absolutely delicious. The resort is small and offers a shuttle service to Ubud three times a day. They can arrange a taxi for you and the staff are extremely helpful.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed around Alam Sari for 10 days on a yoga retreat and I am have many good things to say! The staff were all so lovely and happy to help us! I always left my room in a big mess and would come home to all my things arranged neatly and organised very nicely The food is yummy! They have tempura veggies, nasi goreng, spinach pasta and lots more! The coconut ice cream they use for dessert is addictive! And the coconut porridge is delicious. Everything tastes very fresh and they have many healthy options using things from the garden. The cooking class offered is an amazing experience, it was one of the highlights of my trip. You get to see the local village and learn about the culture and spiritual practices and also learn to make delicious food and eat it too! The village tour is also a nice way to explore and learn more, Putu allowed us to go where we want and also waited a very long time for us to stop for shopping, and was still smiling : ) the art school is beautiful The facilities are nice, there is a pool, as well as a smaller plunge type pool near the ganesha villa that used to be the spa/jacuzzi but no longer works. There is also a meditation room which has yoga mats and props! The spa is small but also nice :)
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our small family very much enjoyed our 3 nights at Alam Sari in June 2017. We booked on the recommendation of friends who had stayed there some years ago and were not disappointed. The resort is committed to eco-friendly practices (incuding limiting the use of plastics), employing local people from the nearby village of Keliki, and supporting cultural maintenance activities in the Keliki. The rooms are large and well appointed, Balinese-style, with air-con and private bathroom (our family room, Mangga, had 2 rooms and 2 bathrooms with a shower and toilet each). The staff were wonderful - super-welcoming and nothing was too much trouble. The pool is as good as the pictures look and we spent a lot of time in and around it. The restaurant was open all day and the food delicious and varied enough for all our tastes - some Balinese, Indonesian and more western as well - sometimes we ordered food by the pool, and in the evening we chose to eat at the resort rather than race around busy Ubud. There is a free shuttle into Ubud 3 times a day (9, 12, 5). We went to a dance show one night and arranged for Putu to collect us afterwards (100,000 IRP) - he was ready with a smile when we emerged and we had a late simple supper back at the resort when we returned. The absolute highlights of our stay at Alam Sari were the cultural elements: Putu guided us through the resort's garden and Keliki village the first morning we were there and this gave us a much greater understanding of the Balinese way of life. The tour included a stop at the Keliki painting school - a place for the village painting 'masters' to pass on their cultural traditions. There is no pressure to buy, but if you do, 80-90% of your purchase price is returned to the individual artist - many of them children and young people which helps them financially with their education. The second morning Dewa picked us up for a cooking class - first we walked around some more parts of the village, this time learning about the food production as well as some Balinese philosophies. We arrived at his family compound and had a cooking class where we learned how to cook 5 different dishes - all delicious! Our daughter (10) was captivated for the entire time too! We also learned a little more about family and village life which has been going on in similar style for over 800 years. The only negative for our stay was the noisy road below our family room: much (friendly) beeping to the spirits as bikes cross the ravine, and some very loud motorbike engines at times. There are 2 other family rooms and other rooms and villas which are not so noisy, but without the spectacular view to Mt Agung in the morning and/or proximity to the pool. If you contact the resort you can discuss your needs and preferences. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff at Alam Sari. We intend to return - having the opportunity to be shown aspects of the Balinese culture in such a welcoming environment is very special.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we arrived to the resort, we were met by Aprile, her general manager, Bagus and her amazing, generous and humble staff. We immediately felt welcome and we were treated like family from the moment we walked in. The resort is surrounded by nature and the grounding feeling of the earth, the trees and the plants is simply indescribable. Aprile has a deep and intense desire to keep the Balinese culture within the resort, to inform people of the beauty, the compassion, the purity, the love and the trust behind their gestures, their belief and their complete gratitude.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 1 week at Alam Sari, but we could have stayed for a month. I booked it because of the reviews about the service and it didn't disappoint. Every staff member was so helpful and accommodating and went above and beyond. We had one of their family rooms- it's like 2 adjoining suites, which was absolutely perfect for our family of 4 (with our 2 young ones, ages 3 & 1). The pool is great for the kiddos too because there are essentially 3 tiers of depths! They had a yoga room as well that I was able to use with the kids to do some yoga throughout the week. Use their drivers as well - they are all superb & very good - even from the airport, which was great! And take advantage of the free Village Tour they offer - we thought it was such a wonderful added bonus- seeing their organic garden and tasting a few of the fruits, walking through the rice paddies, etc. Not stroller friendly, but we had a baby carrier and it was perfect! And the spa was wonderful too - I got a massage and scrub & soak and it was worth every penny. The only downfall was that the internet was a little slow and spotty. But we found this to be the case all over Bali unless you go to one of the internet cafe/working spots. A little unfortunate that the internet can't be more reliable, but we got enough work done to get us through the week.  Oh and in the Keliki Village, there is a great Thai restaurant worth checking out too.  Ah....can't say enough good things about this place. We've been traveling all over and my daughter still says this is her favorite place to stay!
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I and our two year old daughter had such a beautiful time here. The staff was incredibly accommodating and friendly. They became close to my daughter during our stay and we were all sad when it was time to leave our new friends and this peaceful sanctuary. The food was some of the best we had in Bali so we ended up eating most of our meals at the hotel. We were able to schedule a cooking class with Dewa while we were there and that was a highlight of our trip. We were invited into his home in a local village and we learned so much about the Balinese culture, belief systems, their food and just every day life. For us that is the type of experience that we search for when we travel, to be immersed in the culture. We also enjoyed a visit to the Elephant Park and the monkey forest during our stay. They are both close by and they were a huge hit with my daughter who loves animals! It was such a great experience! I highly recommend Alam Sari!!
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The property was disappointing to say the least. Mosquitos were a major concern and the uncleanliness of the restaurant and kitchen lead us to check out of the hotel a day earlier. Even the room toilets need major improvements. Overall the property was not even close to being as nice as what the photos suggested. The location of the hotel is quite far from the Ubud town which makes the area very quiet which some of you may like or dislike. However the service offered by the staff was very good and friendly.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked a suite room over a month ago.. pictures showed room with an outdoor terrace and seating overlooking the landscape. When I arrived I was taken to my room to find out it was a completely different room right in the back corner of the hotel.. With no view and no terrace just a small walkway.. I was told one of the doors could not be opened as it led to managers area. There was a lounge next to the room but I was told that I could not use it. After checking the pictures I complained that this was not the room I booked and I wanted a room with an outdoor terrace as I had booked. I was then told the room I had booked was under refurbishement ! I had a look around and I said I would swap for a room by the pool. 2 of them were also under refurbishement, the other 2 empty but he said guests would be arriving to take them. The only other room offered was a small side room with no view again! I asked for a refund..which I was given. I wasted taxi money coming all the way there to find out many of the rooms are under refurbishement including the one u had booked. This is terrible service as I booked a month earlier they should have contacted me to let me know that the room wasn't available letting me decide if I still wanted to come before wasting time and money to get to the isolated location. I then asked to be taken back to ubud.. I had to wait a further 3 hours for the free shuttle bus as they wouldn't organise a taxi for me unless I paid $30. Overshadowed terrible service be warned!
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I couldn't rate Alam Sari high enough. What a beautiful place along with the most lovely staff My friends and I enjoyed a very tranquil stay here, taking full use of the messages, pool area and lovely food. One of my favourite nights was going to a cooking class (arranged by Alam Sari) where we were lucky enough to go to the wonderful Dewa and Jeri's home in the village nearby. We had the most amazing food, as well as an incredible experience. They fully welcomed us into their home and I was in my element cooking delicious food! That was possibly my favourite night of the whole holiday to Bali.A staff member (arranged with Alam Sari) took us to the traditional local village, where the locals were busy preparing for a mass cremation ceremony. We also went around the grounds of the hotel to see all the organic food and herbs they grow. I would definitely go in the electric bike tour they arrange too, absolutely amazing riding through the rice paddies!I really enjoyed my stay here. It was really relaxing and you really feel as though you're in the middle of he jungle (minus a few cars driving by).A lovely, lovely stay. Thank you.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is located 20-25 minutes drive from Ubud Palace, on the slope of the Kelusa village, Ubud. To reach to the lobby will need to climb up by the stairs. The staffs received us really well, the nature surrounds are beautifully arranged with green tall plants. But I wouldn't say it is a quiet area as it is near the main road.The breakfast in the morning is always something that our family look forward, unfortunately the variety and quality of the dishes need more improvement. The omelette can be cooked in a few different ways with some vegetables etc, not only sunny side up or fried. However, our 2 kids had a lot of fun spending the day in the Swimming pool. We also had some massages in the Spa, the staffs treated us respectfully. But we've noticed that the music is too loud to our liking, the way the massage is ended is too abrupt for us....maybe if we are allowed to relax and drink traditional hot jamu/ginger should be better. In one evening dinner, we ordered the dishes prepared by the Chef. I happened to order Tenderloin beef which they also going to feature on New Year Dinner with the guests. I was shocked that the beef is barely edible even it is cooked. It is hard to chew, cut and swallowed. The side dishes which contained the vegetables are good.The walk around the village and organic garden are good. The staff was kind and sharing the culture and beliefs of Balinese. We also would like to point out that the shampoo and conditioner containers which made of out ceramic may not be ideal. It slipped into the slippery fingers of our boy and it is broken to pieces in the bathroom.Overall, our stay was good, the staffs are friendly and willing to help but hopefully there are improvement on the equipments and facilities also the quality of works of the staffs.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 2 night with my family, husband and my two teenager. I just surprised the location is too far from Ubud. Be careful when you select hotel online. The location is too suburb, and the hotel did not have lobby and main entrance, you have to climb to reach lobby. Do not have enough parking lot, no TV in the room. Breakfast is not buffet...The view is just average... no padi view
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A perfect gateway from busy city life and where you can relax and enjoy the beauty of mother nature. The staffs are amazing and very very friendly, I was being helped most of the time by the friendly receptionist named bli Wayan - he was kind to help me check Mount Batur tour (even if he didi't get the best deal for me) and fix my room's door.The view from the room is amazing, I could see the majestic Gunung Agung out from my room in the morning. It's just perfect!it's not a good idea to reach the hotel at night as the road is a little bit dark and you might miss the sign of the hotel, not to mention you need to climb the stairs to reach the lobby hotel.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very pleasant stay in the forest and hills north of Ubud.The hotel offers great views above a river canyon and is just 500m from the village of Keliki. Rooms are comfortable and the large swimming pool is very nice.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed from 30th October to 4th November 2016. What a lovely place. Beautiful peaceful setting. Unfortunately the traffic from the main road down below can be a little bit disturbing, however not at night time which is great. The nights were quiet and enjoyable and I therefore had a good nights sleep every day. During the day we were not there as we wanted to see things. The pool is fantastic and there were plenty of opportunities to enjoy the surrounds in a comfortable deck chair. Absolutely lovely!. The ford was extraordinary no complaints whatsoever. Breakfast mmmmh. Dinner? No words to describe. Lunch? Were not there, better things to do. Service. Fantastic, friendly and spot on. Room service could use a bit of improvement as bottles, cups and other things from the previous day were not collected. Rooms: Lovely rooms, clean and no problems with mozzies. The toilet and shower area needs updating as due to consistent moisture as it is in the tropics cement deteriorates and falls out of grooves. There is definitely room for improvement and these areas need renovation to some extent. Staff very friendly and nothing is ever to much always with a smile and no complaints. Overall we had a wonderful experience. If however the areas mentioned are improved the experience deserves certainly an excellent. I would recommend this place if cement falling out of grooves in the bathroom does not bother you. Enjoy!
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spend the days exploring Ubud's many shops, restaurants, and cultural sites and then "come home" to this peaceful place amid tropical gardens. Relax by the pool, enjoy a world class meal, walk or ride a bike through the rice terraces, take a Balinese cooking class with Dewa. Spend a long weekend, a week, a month. You won't regret it.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 5 very enjoyable nights. The rooms are huge, bathrooms gigantic with large bathtubs. Loved the huge king size beds too. The hotel is a bit older, however, for the price and great service it simply can't be beat. It's a bit far from Ubud, but the hotel offers a free shuttle (limited times) to/from Ubud. Great pool too.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 8 nights at Alam Sari. Loved how it was away from the hustle and bustle of Bali's busy tourist areas. It sits 20 mins outside of Ubud. Free shuttle services operate every 2 hour to Ubud's market. Most of the villas overlook the lovely swimming pool. The staff there couldn't do enough for us. The breakfasts which are included in the accomodation where very nice with a mix of western and Indonesion foods on offer. Had dinner there several times. While not a large menu the meals we had where very tasy and fresh.Wife and young children also enjoyed several massages which where very cheap at about AU$20 an hour. We had the family villa which had two bedrooms and was very spacious with two toilets and showers.A big thanks to all the fantastic staff of Alam Sari. Would definitely recommend to others
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spend 3 nights of 4 at Alam Sari, just outside Ubud during our honeymoon, and it was such a wonderful experience from start to finish.Our hosts, Wayan and Tijer went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. They organized scooters, booked cycle tours, river rafting, spa treatments, taxi transfers, recommended local warungs to eat at, as well as arranging a night at a homestay nearby with a family who took us with them to the temple ceremony celebrations. The property is gorgeous and the rooms well-appointed, the food served is good (albeit lacking some heat/flavour - we feel they tone it down for Westerners), and the spa treatments excellent (go for the exfoliating massage with floral bath afterwards - HEAVEN). Really wish we'd spent more time at Alam Sari in Ubud. It's at the top of our list of favorite places in Indonesia.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my wife stayed at this hotel for 8 nights in September 2016 and have to say it was the most amazing holiday we ever had. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and the bathrooms had flower garden in it. The hotel is set in the middle of rain forest with a village nearby. Top location, 6 min to Tegalalang rice terraces and 15-20 min to Ubud by car. The food was excellent and service too. Thank you all for making our stay special and memorable. My wife had a birthday and the staff arranged and decorated a table full with flower petals and candles in Balinese style. Something that will remember forever. Special thanks to our waiters (Agud and Kerty) and our tour driver Putu who put their best to make us happy. Thank you very much. Strictly recommend this hotel, won't disappoint.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my partner stayed here for 5 nights and couldn't have enjoyed ourselves more. The hotel grounds were beautiful. The staff were friendly and welcoming. We ate at the restaurant a couple of times which was delicious and the breakfast was perfect also. The hotel organised various activities for us which was so helpful. Would definitely recommend the white water rafting and 2am hike up Mt Batur. Would highly recommend the village tour and speak to the hotel about organising a driver to take you around a few of the temples and other sites. The massage we had there was also great, slightly more expensive than in town though. The free shuttles also came in handy. Staying at Alam Sari was an amazing experience
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, with lovely clean rooms, great service, a good location and good food. Few highlights: The hotel organised cabs for us to get around Ubud to see all of the attractions, they also provided breakfast boxes when we were leaving the hotel before breakfast. And a lovely view from the hotel room just as the pictures show.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Grounds and rooms were lovely in an almost secluded location. Staff pleasant and helpful however there were chickens right near our room which woke up at midnight every night so bring earplugs! The only other thing I would say was the food menu was limited but tasty all the same.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Where do I even start, I needed a solo trip to find myself and I chose Alam Sari after days of searching for a hotel. I got there late at night and was escorted to one of the most beautiful rooms I've ever been in and it was all mine. Alam Sari is the ideal hotel for solo travelers wanting to find themselves, families vacationing and couples relaxing. It is beyond perfect. I woke up in the morning to a beautiful landscape, delicious breakfast and an eager staff that was ready to show me the time of my life. Ketut was such a doll, let me tell you, words cannot describe how much I appreciate her. I pretty much told her my wishes and she rubbed her imaginary bottle and my wishes instantly came true. She scheduled all my trips to Tanah Lot, Uluwatu, Kintemani, Dreambeach, Gili Air and many more, all sights I encourage you to ask her to set up for you. My amazing driver Putu was fabulous, he was diligent and taught me so much about the culture while driving me from temple to temple. He has the best music, ask him to play some while you're driving around with him, you'll love it. I did the village tour and I must say, you HAVE to do it. It was so great getting to see the rice paddies, the beautiful village, the amazing painting school while strolling around Ubud and taking in the beautiful surroundings, that definitely beat the hustle and bustle that is downtown SF where I live. But the super highlight of my entire trip was the cooking class, if you don't do anything your entire time at Alam Sari, please take the cooking class and prepare to be engulfed by the amazing history of the Balinese culture when it comes to food preparation and the delicious food that you will eat and learn how to cook when it's all said and done. You just have to do this on your own and I promise you it'll be worthwhile. So from the beautiful hotel, to the warm staff, to the amazing and delicious food, all I have are sweet memories and I can only so much encourage you to try it for yourself. Thank you so much to the Alam Sari team for giving me the solo vacation of a lifetime to help me forget the troubles that exist in my world. So much love and appreciation. See you again soon!
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of adults and primary-age children loved it here. Beautifully landscaped gardens and pool and an outdoor restaurant overlooking a verdant valley. Our adjoining rooms were also lovely, with good AC when needed (and a chatty rafter-dwelling lizard!) There are steep entrance steps that would challenge the less mobile. The road is noisy with motorbikes during the day but didn't disturb our sleep (we're city-dwellers) or affect the prevalent serenity, it just became part of the background. The food is great with lots of options and wonderful fresh tropical fruit. But it's all about the people here - everyone is so warm and friendly and as others have said, make your stay special - our tour of the gardens and local village but also our day trips organised with village drivers/guides were so rewarding. We plan to return!
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I could not recommend this hotel more. The value you get for money is incomparable and its in the heart of Ubud, surrounded by nature and quiet. The hotel provide a free shuttle which sets it above all of the other hotels - the more expensive hotels such as The Lokha might have all of the 'bells and whistles' however take advantage and charge big $$ for transport. At the Alam Sari, the transport is provided via a shuttle every hour or so. They also provide a free tour of their beautiful gardens and art village, which made my Bali experience feel so much more authentic. The staff are kind and welcoming, and really go out of their way to make this a great stay. I cannot wait to return :)
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful setting, lovely & friendly staff but we left after one night due to the unacceptable traffic noise from the road. Apparently when the resort opened 10 years ago, traffic isn't quite as bad, now local people use the road as shortcut. During morning peakhour the noise is deafening,& subsides somewhat thru the day then starts up again for afternoon rushhour. Fortunately evenings are quiet. We were offered an upgrade to a villa towards the back of the property, however, it was still too noisy & quite a distance from the pool. Staff were very understanding & gave us a refund for the other days
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are checking out today after 3 nights at Alam Sari. We have thoroughly enjoyed every minute of our stay. Upon arriving, tired from our flight and drive to Ubud we entered our private villa which could use an upgrade with some paint and maintenence. Our room was a little musty but we soon got over that. That was the only flaw during our otherwise perfect stay. The surrounds here are tropical and very leafy. The pool is devine. Best of all is the beautiful staff who can't do enough for you. We asked for a special dinner for our anniversary and the staff set us up by the pool with candles and a lot of fussing. There are free shuttle busses every 2 hours and pick up until 7.30 pm. Traffic is a bit crazy at Ubud central but the car never failed to arrive on or near on time. Drivers are cheerful and are all too willing to share any information or just to have a friendly chat. I wont thank people by name because I dont want to miss anyone but lets just say all staff were beautiful, helpful and smiling. Thank you Alam Sari!
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Alam Sari has everything you’d want in a boutique hotel: super-friendly staff, elegant rooms, and delicious food. Their onsite drivers are attentive, efficient, and very knowledgeable. The hotel pool and onsite massage service is a nice way to relax, and the staff has numerous activity options for you to try. We did a tour of the local village which starts off at the Hotel’s own organic garden (where much of the food they serve is sourced), we learned about the local village culture and lifestyle, then on to the local art school where we met with the resident master Keliki painter. We finished the tour at the home of the guide where we enjoyed a Balinese cooking class and beautiful meal. We would definitely stay here again, and can’t recommend it enough!
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Alam Sari made my first visit to Indonesia a truly special experience. The staff were beyond kind- and extremely helpful whenever we needed anything. The grounds are beautiful and peaceful, and our room spacious, clean and real comfy. This place is a beautiful tropical oasis w a genuine personal touch :) I'll definitely stay here again if I'm ever lucky enough to return! *Make sure to do the Village tour/cooking class- it's amazing!
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My group of 10 friends and I chose the Alam Sari because it was one of the few properties adjacent to Ubud that had Villa living and awesome reviews. Needless to say, from the second our driver picked us up from the airport, and dropped us off at the Alam Sari, we knew we had made the right choice! Firstly, the staff is top notch. This is a family owned hotel in which the family is hands on. We were doted on like kings and queens. Breakfast was included daily and we had our limitless pick of fresh fruit, omelets, and a number of Balinese dishes. EVERYTHING was delicious. While my friends and I chose to venture into Ubud most nights for dinner, we did enjoy one group meal at the Alam Sari. The hotel accommodated our large group with ease. The food options were diverse, and everyone was incredibly satisfied. I particularly loved the beef randang! The Villa accommodations were spacious, elegant, pristine and romantic. We even had a yoga room at our disposal and a lounge area with comfy couches and a beverage stocked kitchen half the size of a football field it seemed. Our group of ten had enough room to play games, workout, lounge, etc... We were in heaven. The pool was similar to a lagoon--it was the perfect temperature and had pool side service. We all enjoyed swims at various times of the day. The massage treatments had to be booked several hours in advance and were also top notch. Several of us had couples massages and were left feeling relaxed and rejuvenated for a marginal fee. The highlight of our trip had to be the hotel orchestrated cultural walking tour and authentic cooking class. Our guide walked us through the hotel's organic gardens where the majority of the hotel's food comes from. Once our group saw this, we understood why the food tasted so good and was so fresh! We learned an endless amount of information about how the island came to be what it is today and the culture and the belief system of the people. Most importantly, we were invited to partake in an authentic cooking class in a Balinese home. The meal was literally mind blowing, and was hands down my favorite meal in Bali! It beat out every fancy restaurant without a doubt! In short, I am thrilled that we placed our bets on the Alam Sari. It was an adorable hotel adjacent to Ubud, but private and peaceful. It was exactly what we all needed! ;)
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place demonstrates the process of how to make Luwak coffee. We were giving a tour then provided with a tasting plate of different teas and coffees to sample. Beautiful gardens and samples of the coffee beans and the drying process. Definitely recommend going there. We did it with a driver on our day tour.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Alam Sari was the perfect place to experience a traditional Bali. We loved being a short distance out of Ubud in a village. The setting is beautiful with interesting furnishings, excellent service and a relaxing atmosphere. We stayed 2 nights and had a midnight flight on the 3rd day. They let us check out late (7 p.m.) for 1/2 price. We ate our dinners in the restaurant and enjoyed the good food without having to hassle with going out. The breakfasts were generous and delicious. The Wi-Fi worked well if you sat in the reception area. The village tour was a highlight of our trip!
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just spend a wonderful week here for a yoga retreat. If you want to experience the true Bali, you need to come here. It is like coming home. The staff made us feel like family. We met their families, went and visited with a local artist at his home, had the best drivers. Happy and a great sense of humor. Cok the manager and his staff went out of their way to make sure everything was perfect. The rooms were comfortable and very clean. We had air. A beautiful room for a yoga studio. The food was excellent, and all from their organic garden. A great pool as well. They have it all. When in Ubud next, I will stay here again. Thank-you so much for everything. :)
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a party of 8 and had 4 bungalows, the bungalows are ok, comfy beds and nice semi outdoors bathrooms. Very friendly staff and the local guide (unfortunately i´ve forgot his name) was very helpful. I really recommend the free village tour.My only complaints would be a constant ant problem and poor light in the bathroom. Outdoor the road below the pool at times can be noisy.Wonderful view of the volcano in the mornings.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We (a group of 2 parents, 2 teenage daughters and one teenage friend) celebrated Christmas Day at the beautiful Alam Sari, nestled amongst the cool hills and in full view of Bali's sacred mountain, Gunung Agung.Alam Sari is a pleasant drive away from the often crowded Bali south coast, through towns and villages and farming land, and is located a little north of the bustling centre of Ubud.The location is perfect if you want a quiet, peaceful retreat from the beaches, crowds and heat of the coast, but is a comfortable distance (driving . . . or being driven) from some of the more interesting attractions and cultural experiences on offer in Bali. There are no nearby convenience stores, no nearby night-clubs, and definitely no nearby beach-going hawkers selling their wares, but there is a quiet walk through rice fields and the nearby village on offer from Alam Sari staff (no charge), and very close by is a bustling village night-market for those who savour the local food on offer.Rooms and villas on offer are beautifully presented, air-conditioned and with large mosquito nets gracing all beds. Staff are unobtrusive but friendly and welcoming, there is a restaurant in the grounds, and the pool water is actually cool, not warm.Recommended for getting away from it all, waking to the call of roosters nearby, and if you're lucky, early-morning views of Gunung Agung.
hotelName:
7    Alam Sari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon arrival at the airport, our driver from Grand Zuri Kuta was already waiting for us at the arrival gate. He was very helpful and patient as we got our SIM cards settled and friendly on the drive to the airport. When we got to the hotel, Lilik and Dian the receptionists were again very helpful with our questions and gave a friendly welcome. Our room was tidied and cleaned everyday. With them providing two bottles of new water bottles with each clean. The balcony was a great place to relax and have a drink and chat as well. However the walls are abit thin, and if you get loud neighbors down the corridor who leave their door open and talk at the top of their lungs at 6am in the morning, YOU WILL HEAR THEM. But all in all, that’s not the hotel’s fault but lack of common decency from the other guests. Thanks Grand Zuri, we’ll definitely be back again!

I will recommend this hotel.

review_body: Again, I highly recommend this hostel for budget travelers, and the location is perfect. It's near to almost everything. Seafood restaurants, Bar, beach, Art Market, Burger King, Mcdonald's, it's just around the corner. They allow you early check-in if the bed is available, they also offer free breakfast though it's limited to toasts and fruits and a cup of Balinese Coffee.We stayed in the Female Dorm, the beds were spacious! There are tiny compartments inside your "bedroom" and they got international sockets and usb sockets for your chargers so no need to worry about sockets! They also got a large locker, it fits my hand carry luggage. They got blind curtains as well so when you sleep you got privacy. The toilet and bath are in the same room in the floor, they got bidet! The soap and shampoos are in dispensers, too bad though they don't offer sleepers or toothbrush/toothpaste in their common CR. The hostel got rooftop! It was so nice to stay there at night! I think I love everything in the hostel EXCEPT THAT, this is the only downside for me, they don't have hot water in their showers. We wake up 3am everyday and we have to shower in the cold! We did not mind it that much since the weather is warm, but just imagine if it's cold and you have to shower with cold water as well!
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights and they were some of the worst sleeps of my 6 months traveling.The beds were comfortable but I think they have 24 hour check in, so the staff would come into the dorm room at 1am(?!?!), turn on all the lights, and loudly show guests to their bed. Absolutely ridiculous.The breakfast was very average, and the toilets/showers smelt really weird. Like bleach plus whatever smell the bleach was trying to cover up. It also didn’t feel very clean in the bathroom. Also despite there being 3 floors of dorms (with around 20 beds in each), there were only 5 toilets for women. The men had double the number of toilets. Go figure.Overpriced and waste of money.Staff were nice though
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at H-ostel Kuta for 3 days. The bed and locker were spacious. Prices were very reasonable as well. Great location - walking distance to Kuta/Legian Beach and Beachwalk mall. Upon check-in, you will be provided with a towel and coupons for free breakfast which was okay (not something you will be excited to wake up to though) but the rooftop atmosphere was really nice :) My only complaint would be encountering male workers, who were cleaning or fixing the sink, in the female only shower/bathroom even when guests are taking a shower or using the bathroom. This happened quite frequently, like 3 out of 5 times that I went into the bathroom area. Otherwise, it was a good stay and loved the building decor with all the recycled window panels!
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: H-ostel is a great location for the beach just a couple of minutes walk and close lots of shop, bars and restaurants. The staff are very friendly. I’d hoped to meet more solo travellers here but I’m the only one at the roof top bar currently Id still recommend this place though to start or end your Bali journey as it’s close to the airport and they offer a shuttle for just 100k Rupiah.

review_body: a very bad place to get juice with fast service, I waited for more than 30 minutes and the juice had not arrived yet I was unfortunately disappointed why just making juice takes a long time, this is very detrimental to me because I waste my rest time, to get a glass of juice is very long

review_body: I love this hostel. I have stayed there 3 times now. I really feel like the spaciousness of the cubicles allow me to have my own room. Yet, there are common areas enough to meet people. I loved that the cubicles have a flip down desk space they are so wide. I am grateful for enormous lockers to put everything in. The bathrooms are super modern and clean. Staff helped me with all kinds of things (sim, scooter rental, and general assistance). Super friendly service. Kuta doesn’t get any better and the location is exceptional.

review_body: Location: 3 min from Kuta Beach which means you can see beautiful sunset. And since the Matahari(Departmant store) is 30 sec from the hostel, you can buy beer!!!Staffs: Very kind (and they found my lost cellphone)Lockers: you don't need any locks cuz it uses own digital key to open it.Sanitation: clean at least for me. I slept in resort in Gili and there were soooo many cockroaches, but here? I've not seen them, and I don't think this place is dirty.Price: I just paid 10 bucks per one nightOverall: I love this place, and if I come to Bali solo again, I'm gonna stay here.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are used to staying in Hostels, you know what to expect. If you are a first timer, you may not be disappointed. The place is centrally located, just at the cross roads of tourist area, very near to beach as well just a few minutes walk. That was about location. Now the living part. The dorms are well air conditioned. Though these are capsule beds, the air conditioning is effective till the end of the capsule. Bathrooms are regularly cleaned, some compartment doors in bathroom area need the PVC beading to be installed as in its absence one can see inside from the gap. Towels are fresh. Though the breakfast is quite in name only, still something is better than nothing in this price. But you can always order what you like. The rooftop breakfast area has a good view. Plus point is you get drinking water all the time from dispenser placed at roof top. The resteraunt staff is very cooperative and nice. The front office girls are also courteous and helpful. The bed sheets are also clean, you have a nice folding table also inside your capsule with universal plug point ( a big plus). You can rent scooter from here at reasonable rates. If you are trying out such accommodation for the firs time, you will be in for a nice experience. Deducted one point for the absence of door beading in bathrooms ( an essential thing) , which I hope will be installed shortly by the management . Wi-fi is also great. So, all points for location, price, cleanliness and friendly staff.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place have everything im looking for in hostels, nice save loockers, the people that work there are super nice, good food and drinks at the rooftop for a good price. if im going back to Kuta ill definitely stay there again! Thank you so much!
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for two days including the “Day of Silence”.. During my solo trip I wanted to mingle with other fellow travelers, which I did during my stay in this hostel. The roof top restaurant offers limited but delicious items in menu.. combined with couple of bintangs .. Neat and cozy bed along with locker facility, clean bathrooms... Highly recommended..... for all especially solo travelers.....
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a total of 3 Nights. At first glance it seemed nice However things got worse quite Quick. A majority of their toiletts, showers, taps are malfunctioning and under maintenance all the time.And since you live in rooms of 22 it’s Alot more comfortable If atleast half the stuff works... next up there was the Food. We ordered a carbonara for 50k rupiahs. We got Literally 4 forks of Food. There was Almost Nothing on the plate, ridicoulose. What pissed us of even more was that we ordered a carbonara the day before and then we got about twice as much (which still was a small portion) we mentioned this to her when She served the Food since it Shocked us. She mumbled in a unhelpful manner that She Would look into it. She ends up not even Coming back with a compensation or even a response. Just totally ignored us. We go to her and make the contact. That’s first when She offers us to pay for 2 instead of 3. But really we got the Food of 1 so the compensation was just poor.Beds and location was the only positive things. Really dissapointed with the overall experience unfortunately. But some places are worse then others. PS. Also people selling drugs Literally 5 meters outside the hotel which kinda ruins the athmosphere too.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best thing about this hostel is that it is located in the center of Kuta area and it is priced very cheap. It is maintained very well and every thing is clean. It has got capsule kind of sleeping area and each capsule can accommodate two people. There are different toilet areas for men and women. We reached there by 12.30 pm but are not allowed to check-in till 2 pm. While check-in we received towels and free breakfast vouchers. The breakfast consisted of bread, jam and coffee.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful place on kuta square, perfect situated for a visit to kuta. The place is clean with nice staff, a small free breakfast, cool rooms with aircon and very nice staff. The hostel also offers motorbike rental, good price and decent motorbikes.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for one night in transit to Gili Trawangan where I live. The hostel itself was quite nice. Clean and quiet. Good wifi and aircon. My 3 star review comes from the customer service I received when booked a transfer pick up from the airport. I contacted them via email to organise this and confirmed all flight details. When I arrived at the airport I could not find anyone waiting for me so I called them and they said the service wasn’t available. I explained I had already had it confirmed. They were not helpful in any way. I then had to organise a car on the spot which cost me twice as much. When I got to the hostel there was no satisfactory apology for what had happened. I was very disappointed with being treated this way. I also emailed them to express this and still have not been contacted back. Like I said the hostel itself was pretty good but I would trust them to book another transfer.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my friends slept here for one night. It's great, everything is clean, tidy ... I like it. Next time I will book here when going to Bali.I have taken many 360 degree pictures, I will upload to google maps for you.Thanks so much.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: H-ostel baliThis hotel has a nice and eye catching conceptFirst i love about the design of this hotel...I came to bali last saturday and going to this hotel from airport. First the price to stay at this hotel is cheap Rp 98.000 (maybe $ 7 at this curency) But the quality about this place have amaze me...I stay at 3rd floor and my room is 312 and when i first come to my room... wow this like capsule hotel.. nice conceptFor take a bath i must go to 2nd floor but its okay the bathroom is nice too...Unfortunately i just one night stay in this hotel.. but i promise when i come to bali o will stay at this hotel again...See ya...
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel was really nice! I stayed in the female-only dorm, and it was modern, clean, and comfortable. There are places to charge your devices in the pod-style beds, along with a light. Although there was a/c in the dorm, it was still pretty hot, especially when you close the blind at the end of your bed, so a fan would have been a really nice addition to the pod. The staff are very helpful and friendly, and the location is right near Kuta Beach, shopping, and food. Pro-tip: Kuta is a very commercial area of Bali, lots of western stores, malls, and restaurants. Consider another area if you’re looking for a more local experience.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I could never ask for more. The location is very strategic. Near to the beach, bars, restaurants and everything exciting in Kuta. The dorm itself is AMAZING. The bed is spacious and comfortable. There’s a universal plug next to the bed so no need to worry. The rooftop is amazing for sunset and sunrise. Kuta Art Market is literally next to the hostel so it’s really great. There’s McD, KFC and malls nearby too. The staffs are also very friendly and helpful. The toilets are clean and chic. All in all, a very good stay. Way better than a hotel. 100% will recommend
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice staff, clean room, awesome rooftop view and cafe ...Very cheap price they really care about customerEnjoy it so much with beer in the afternoonWill recommend you all to try. Definitely coming back
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel has a very cool sense of aesthetic. The exterior is a cladding of old windows. The cafe next to the reception is small but chic. The beds are comfortable and spacious. The toilets clean. The roof top cafe is gorgeous- simple yet beautiful. Had a good stay! And it is very economical too.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hostel for two nights with a friend I was travelling with. It's basic but just right. The rooms are clean and modern, you're provided with your own sleeping quarter in bunk bed form and a large locker to store personal items. Unfortunately at my time of stay the hot water wasn't working (or it's simply just not hot enough) and several showers were awaiting repairs due to blocked drains. Breakfast is included in the price but this is only two slices of toast, if you wish to order more you can at an additional price. In all, bed was comfy, location was perfect (right next to the beach and town - walking distance), price was fantastic and staff were friendly. I would return!
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To me the best thing about the hostel was the location. Close to the airport, beach, restaurants anything really. Secondly the capsule style offers you more privacy that other hostels. I snore from time to time so it's great I wouldn't be bothering others so much. The rooftop terrace is pretty cool actually for having a beer or two. Maybe not the best hostel to meet people but that's fine too. I'll be definitely considering this hostel if I had to be in Kuta for some reason.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You’ve got all the facilities, good wifi, a really nice bed closed off from everyone! Close to everything in Kuta. People are pretty loud though(don’t know what the staff can do about it though). The free breakfast is really good but they need some vegan alternatives like soy milk and breakfasts without meat. I enjoyed my stay
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was good, the art & decor are really cute, staff are friendly. The room ( ladies only ) where I stayed was ok & quiet, I like the rain shower. Breakfast at the rooftop was very welcoming & nice atmosphere. Meet many tourists and chatted with them. Omelette was yummy. But, need air freshener for the room & shower ( MUST) and need more hooks for hanging clothes both in the room & shower room ( URGENT)
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel was clean and modern. Very cool. We only stayed here for one night. The staff was really helpful with what we needed. Breakfast on the rooftop was nice, but very simple. The wifi connection was good.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a group of 4 girls who went back packing and our stay at H-ostel was an amazing choice. The hostel was clean and tidy. Good Internet access. The location is superb. Its right in the center of Kuta. Close to the beach.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is absolutely amazing! The staff is super friendly and will help you with anything you need. I stayed there for my two first nights in Bali and I will definitely return. H-hostel is also a great place to meet other travellers, you won't feel alone a single minute:)! Also I recommend hanging out at their roof-top, which has the greatest atmosphere with a beautiful view!
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service and the people is absolutely fantastic, nothing to complain about. The rooms are cozy and the beds are some of the best i've tried for a hostel, during my month of traveling around Thailand and Bali. The hostel, bathrooms and so forth, is very clean. They do not offer that many facilities, but they do have a really nice rooftop, where you eat your breakfast and get some work done. If your are looking for a cheap place and a lot of very friendly travellers, you won't be disappointed with your stay here.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice clean hostel with comfortable beds and friendly staff! Good lockers also do everything was secure. Perfect if you want a quiet place to rest after a few days heavy party like was the case for us
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 1 night on my way through Bali with a friend. The hostel is very clean, in a good location close to the beach and not too far from the city centre.The breakfast included was only toast and coffee but given how cheap the accommodation was, you could easily go out for breakfast. Not much of a social atmosphere around the hostel though if that's what you're after.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very competent and friendly staff. Rooms very clean and spacious beds. Best location in kuta. It's located right in kuta square, so you can walk everywhere. It als has a rooftop bar and serves free breakfast. The staff can organise you various things like transportation and tours
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel located at center of kuta. The room is new and clean and the price is really great. It is cheaper than the price for transportation from the airport to here by taxi lol. And the staffs are really helpful. They help me find everything from taxi to iphone charger!
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and comfortable beds. Lockers to store valuables. Quiet and able to get a good night sleep. Good location. Breakfast included. Bathrooms always appeared clean. Very cheap to stay. Staff helpful. No concerns
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for three days had some amazing food a peacful sleepita one of the cleanest and affordable hostel in not just kuta but all over bali,They have a awsome roof top terrace where you can chill and they take care of your tours and travels
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 4 nights and was very pleased with H-ostel's staff and facilities. First, the hostel is in a great central location, very close to Kuta beach. The capsule style bed are clean and comfortable. The capsule space is well thought out, each bed has 2 universal outlets, and small drawers at the head and foot of the bed. There is also a space for your footwear and a personal secure locker (automatic lock) beside the beds.There were always plenty of clean washrooms and showers available with all of the necessary amenities (tissue, body wash, shampoo). A modest breakfast (toast, jams, coffee, tea) is included with each day's booking, served on the rooftop common-area. A food and drinks menu with more options is also available at a cost.The staff were always kind and helpful. A couple of the staff were particularly engaging and went above and beyond with helpful tips and recommendations.They are currently expanding the ground floor common-area to include a cafe/bar (I think). It is always good to see money being put back into the hostel to improve and upgrade the facilities.Overall 10/10 stay, I highly recommend staying here.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it is like "capsule hotels" in japan. every guest occupies a cubicle with personal light, power point and writing desk. each has a curtain for privacy. this is much better than bunk beds as beds are not shaky. i enjoyed 3 nights of good sleep
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My favorite place when I stay in Kuta. Very clean, affordable, and the staff is very friendly. Always come back here when I go to Bali especially Kuta. The location very strategic near the Kuta beach and Legian.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel looks modern and impressive!It's got spacious capsules and the beds are just heaven to sleep. The capsule room is well air-conditioned and clean. Bathrooms are neat and tidy, hot water, shampoo and shower gel and are equipped bidet and hair dryer.The staff are very attentive and well-spoken in English.All is for USD 6. And yeah it's only 10 mintues ride on a motorbike (with trafic maybe 15-20) from the airport!The only minor inconvenience is that the male bathroom is located one floor below. So you have to go down everytime but that's okay.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in Kuta Square and Not far from the beach,nice and clean capsule bed,clean Bathrooms and Restrooms,friendly staffs. The breakfast was just 2pieces of dry toasts and a cup of coffee.luckily that i can have a full breakfast in yoshinoya which is just opposite the hostel ,but Over all was great for me ;)
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really good hostel! Very clean and friendly staff!! Close to airport and good facilities. Central to Kuta so lots to do but hostel is also peaceful so you can sleep!!!!! Would definitely recommend this hostel
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommended, great social atmosphere, very friendly staff, nice location. I had a good time here. Easy to go everywhere ..and 3or 4 minutes walk to beach ..the bedroom and shower room also very clean ..and the bed is very comfortable..actually I booked only one day but I extended 3 more day ..the staff also help me a lot ..really appreciate that ..
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The H-ostel is very well located in Kuta and offers good prices. As a capsule hostel, you sleep with many people in one room, but with the capsule you still have your privacy. They offer a lot of space for your stuff and a secured locker. Nevertheless, the air in the rooms is very bad, the bathrooms are right next to the sleeping area, so it is very wet and smelly. and it has too few air cons for the big, windowless rooms.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice and clean hostel!It's close from everything (coffee shop, restaurants, beach, atm, etc).Beds are confortable. Don't expect a nice breakfast.. it's only 2 toasts with tea or coffee.. that is the only negative point for me!
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Used Bali as my hub to fly to the other islands and Stayed twice at H-ostel! It is clean, comfortable, safe, staff is friendly, centrally located, everything is within reach and very easy to arrive from the airport! Breakfast could be better though.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: H-ostel is the perfect backpacker choice if you like the crowd, Kuta and Legian is what we mean is not it? This place is located behind the Polo which is on the street of Kuta Art Market, it will be a little tricky when you first stay here. The first impression of entering the lobby at night, (around 7) is quite OK, looks very quiet, there are only 2 female receptionists who in my opinion need to improve the hospitality. I just hope they smile and ask me, but that is OK (in the lobby of the hostel they sell mineral water and beer).I got a room on the 1st floor, bed 110. When I entered the room I just realized why the lobby is quiet, people prefer to be in the room and chatting after bathing because they will soon party at this weekend. Some guests greet friendly, yes most of them are foreign tourists. Oh yes, all the rooms in this place are mixed male female. Wall plug in this place is compatible with different kind of plug type. Moreover, it also provides a USB plug with an output power of 2 Ampere!. The mattresses and blankets are padded and comfortable. The only thing that I feel can be improved is free slipper to be used in the hall, people come and goes with dirty and sandy feed living the hall floor feels dirty and gritty. The bathrooms is very good and everything that should be there is well looked after (soap, shampoo, hand soap). So, you just need to bring a dental kit. Hair dryer and zoomed Mirror are also provided. The water current is very good. However, the shower floor part is a bit slippery. The next day, I got up a little earlier, I decided to take a shower and enjoy breakfast in the lobby of the hostel. There are 3 choices of drinks provided, tea, coffee and black coffee. For food, the hostel will provide 2 slices of bread (which can be roasted or eaten directly). The choice of bread contents is assorted (butter, chocolate, blueberry, etc). Then I decided to go to rooftop hostel to see the "bar" there. Unfortunately, when I visited this bar is under renovation. Location wise, this place is excellent. You can see the street of Kartika Plaza and Kuta Beach from this place. For those of you who want to see the sunset but are a bit lazy to walk to other places, this rooftop is an OK place. Highly recommended Hostel with very affordable price!
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: its new hostel in the Kuta city. Good location that is nearby kuta beach, restaurant, massage shope and shopping centre of Kuta. the staff was all nice, there always help for infomation and sugestion. They all are new generation, younger and active. we rent a motobike at the hostel to explore Kuta. Love the place.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dorms/beds - super clean and comfy beds with a pull down blind for privacy and an international plug socket, stow away table and personal light. Towel provided. Lockers very secure and safe. Air conditioned. HOWEVER - do not stay in the female dorm which is on the ground floor, it means the bathroom is on the next floor up (annoying) and very noisy as right next to reception. I was woken up several times through the night.Staff - always smiling and helpful with questions but indifferent. Bathroom - so clean!! The staff are obviously on a rota with cleaning the bathroom. I was very impressed - and I have high standards. Showers have hot water and good pressure. Maybe wear flip flops.General - didn't think much of the communal area, in fact the only time I sat there I got mosquito bites. I stayed here to try and meet some people but to be honest it was very quiet, a few friendly people though.Would definitely stay here again but would go for a mixed dorm upstairs.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Close to the beach and not far from the airport (approx. 15 min.) Very friendly staff. Clean. I liked the handy single cubes in the dorms equipped with table, light, sockets. Lockers in the dorms with electric locker (you get a wrist band). Rooftop terrace was under construction during my stay.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: PROS: A short walking distance to Kuta beach, Beach Walk Shopping Center, restaurants and shops, cheap, in a busy/central area so it is safe, and easy to meet new people. CONS: - VERY LOUD! (I was on the ground floor so can't speak for the other 4 levels.) There is NO sound proofing. The front desk is right by the door and is always blasting music. Which is okay, but they should sound proof the door! The small common room is also on the ground floor and people were up until 3am at times. Remember, NO sound proofing on ground floor! Bring ear plugs! - Shared bathroom on first floor only. For boys and girls (No separate stalls for genders) and decently clean for Bali hostel standards. In the shower stalls there weren't hooks to hang/store any of your items. Don't expect hotel cleanliness!- No extra space to store larger luggage. You get a small automatic key locker, but no way it can fit a backpackers bag or standard carryon bag. People's bags are all on the floor or in corners in the room. Recommend bringing a small lock for your luggage. - Lastly, I don't know if this happens often, but the middle of the second day I was there, the water stopped WORKING for the ENTIRE BUILDING ! They said it should get fixed by that evening.. but even late into the evening.. NO water anywhere. It was disgusting. I had to use the toilet middle of night in unflushed toilets . In the morning, STILL no water. I was very irritated and booked for a different hotel right away. We only got 50% of that night only and nothing back if we had booked for future nights. - I booked this hostel bc of the good reviews, but now I'm really questioning all of the good reviews! If you are on a strict budget and don't mind the those cons.. then it might be okay for you.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed only for 2 nights and it was perfect breakfast is simple but enough. Rooms are nice and cold and the capsule style beds are great. Staff helped organise our boat to Gili. Location is very central everything you need is walking distance. Would recommend for short stays but not sure if it is a good area for longer stays. Kuta is very busy and touristy.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is clean and the staff is very helpful and friendly. The maintenance of the place is lacking a bit though. It is not a great place to visit if you travel on your own since there aren't really any common areas to hang out in and most people seem to want to stay close to the airport right before leaving.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hostel because it was affordable and close to the airport. The staff were friendly and the facilities were really nice! Each pod has a clean bed and blanket, a table, an international socket and two USB ports, two little cupboards and a towel rack. There's also a large locker for each person which fits a big backpack. A towel is provided and shower stalls have body wash and shampoo dispensers. Breakfast is included in the morning with toast and coffee/tea. If you have big heavy bags like I did, not to worry as there's a lift in the hostel! Location is perfect - a minute to Kuta beach (where they release turtle hatchlings in the afternoons) and lots of food and shopping areas! The only thing is that the Kuta area in general is pretty touristy so prices are a bit higher, which makes it even more amazing that this hostel is priced so affordably! I left for a week and came back later on because I enjoyed my stay so much.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very cool looking, clean and comfy hostels. The beds are comfortable and have blinds at the end, so you have your privacy. The lockers are huge, my backpack did fit in. The bathroom as well as the whole hostel is very clean.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed here only for 1 night and it's good. The bed and the toilet is clean, it's near Kuta beach. There's a lot restaurants near by so it's practical to stay here. They have secure locker and also a rooftop which you can hangout with the other travellers.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my first time stay in hostel like this,and i think is so funny and cheap,all inside in our bad so cleaned,and all staff so friendly and funny mention for bli faisal he take care about our refund rent motorcyle and take care for our early check out also.position hotel is so near to kuta beach and shoping central.for traveler must to try this hostel
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is great, super clean, great lockers, beautiful large pods. The staff are all just so lovely. I stayed here on my first night to gather supplies, it's perfect, right in the middle of the shopping malls. The pods have little pull down tables, USB chargers and power points in them, great touch. Crisp airco too! Thanks h-ostel. See you again in a few weeks
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very central in Kuta. Attentive staff. Clean. Cool pods to sleep in with roller blind for privacy. Quiet. Lockers for valuables. Never had to wait for showers. Breakfast included - couple of slices of toast (various spreads including nutella) and coffee but it was enough surprisingly :)
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Close to everything in Kuta and the airport, the staff are so lovely and helpful, I felt safe at all times, beds and rooms are always kept clean even with all us travellers dragging sand in from the beach!
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I could not image a better place to stay for two nights with a large group of people for so little money. The bed stays were incredible: clean, pretty and comfortable. Breakfast in the morning was simple but fine. Clean toilets and showers. Only problem was the ac, we had no control over it so it became pretty cold in the room..
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just as advertised. The bedroom/dorm layout is actually much better than the usual bunkbeds, although good luck getting to the top bed if you're drunk! The A/C everywhere, scooter terrace and rooftop terrace are nice add-ons. Free breakfast = 2 toasts and a coffee or tea. Overall, good value for the money!
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We wish every hostel was like this ! The beds are super comfy and big the staff are friendly and efficient, 10/10 from us! I only took photos of the downstairs (sorry) but the rooms and bathrooms are really nice and look like the photos already posted. Oh they also offer two slices of toast and a cup of coffee or tea in the morning ( complimentary).
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you're looking for a friendly quite and a place full of interesting people this should be your hostel. I stayed there for 2 nights and the people I met and staff I dealt with were just amazing. If I ever go back go bali I'm definitely staying there longer
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
