review_body: After a delayed flight arriving into Bali, and a taxi driver that dropped me on the wrong street, a couple of local guys helped me find this place - it was super easy, in the end! The staff were very welcoming, and everything was just so easy! I greatly appreciated the showers and the comfortable bed I had. It looks like you're sleeping in a cupboard or on a shelf, but it's so comfortable and accessible. The mattress was soft and the pillow just right.Everything was clean. The only qualm I had was that the sinks in the bathroom were under maintenance when I was there. But generally the facilities were really good and the roof terrace well worth a look!
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would've give more stars but those damn loud foreigners just made my experience so bad. They came back to the dorm at 3AM and chatting LOUDLY. F**g hell. I wish the staffs would have just try to warn them before entering the rooms. They put the signs on the doors but did nothing to warn these guys. I chose this hostel because it's cheap and close to the airport since I'm only staying for an overnight transit. But I ended up not being able to sleep! Everything else was fine actually. Beds are comfy and wifi worked fine.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I checked in here for 2 nights at the end of my stay in Bali as it's close to the airport. It's also really close to the beach and shopping/markets. The beds were comfy and there was privacy with the blinds at the end of each bed. I was happy that it included breakfast as it's not something you usually get in the (already cheap) price for a hostel. The only thing stopping this hostel from 5* is that there's no real social area. They have an amazing roof terrace but not many people know about it or go up there because it's not really equip for anything. It could be sooo much better with a few added touches and actual alcohol behind the bar up there.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm a huge fan of capsule style dorm rooms and H-ostel does it right. Each capsule is very spacious with a comfortable mattress, a light, an outlet and even a fold down table. The capsules also have a blind/curtain that pulls down offering you total privacy.Apart from the rooms, the hostel is relatively clean, offers good wifi throughout, and has friendly staff. The hostel has a fairly convenient location - about a 5 minute walk to the beach and a 10-15 minute walk to the main nightlife area on Legian. As far as negatives go, the breakfast is weak (two pieces of toast and instant coffee) and there's no real hangout area.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for one night. Staff was friendly and spoke very good english. The capsule and bed was great. Good and working air-con. The showers and toilets were clean. The wifi was not the best in the capsule though, but everywere else it worked just fine.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is right up my alley! For starters the first thing that meets you is a beautiful facade and friendly staff. They have a elevator and cheap beer. The beds are really comfy and feels more like a hotel than a hostel! The showers must be some of the best I've had and for once the wifi is working really good! 10/10 would stay here again!
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here as our final place before we left back home too Norway. This is a lovely hostel, with very nice facilities. You get a very big comfy bed, with a nice duvet and poofy pillow. Dorms and bathrooms are both kept very clean. Staff is very helpful, and speak good english. The only bad part is the WiFi is very unstable.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hostel with friendly staff, good wifi and air conditioning. It's a great place to stay in Bali if you want to be close to the airport. Good location too near shops and restaurants. Large lockers are provided and the capsules are very comfy.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bed looked modern and was comfy. Toilets on our floor under maintenance so unfortunately had to go down 2 floors when you needed to go. Could have been cleaned more. Simple breakfast, young crowd, good for backpackers. Scooter rent and drinks for good price.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The good: great accomodation, beds and internet connection. Excellent place to rest.The bad: the staff is the low point here. If you need someone to guide you in Kuta or Bali this is not the place. And well Kuta by itself is another low point.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 4 nights in H-Ostel and we were fairly disappointed due to one main thing: The room in the 5th floor with the double beds smelled like sewage or like someone vomited. It was not coming from the bed (this was fresh) which is good but it was still there 24/7. They tried to battle it with strong ventilators and room odors but it did not help much. We complained three times but it never changed significantly. The other floors of the hostel did not have the problem but they did not have double beds. Staff was generally friendly but not overly helpful. Breakfast is minimalistic ( two slices of bread + jam&co + tea/coffee). Design is cool though. all together I would not recommend to stay there despite all the other positive reviews. Considering other accommodation prices this is expensive for a hostel and does not meet the standards. Maybe due to the proximity to the airport a lot of people think that this is a cheap price and they can't expect more but this is not true. there are better places.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm a solo traveler at the end of my budget and decided on h-Ostel for its central location warm atmosphere and great staff. It's located close to shopping, beaches, upscale and local restaurants. Very comfortable mattress and down filled duvet, the showers and toilets are kept spotless and the staff are beyond out going. They offer a free breakfast of toast and tea or coffee. All the workers were warm and welcoming but wilna especially stood out to me, taking interest in my daily activities and helping with whatever he could.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were clean,bathrooms were generally clean, but could use a little more attention.Staff were very friendly and helpful, they moved us from the 5th floor to a different room when we complained that the AC was broken and the room was too hot. Good service and resolution to the problem. Lockers were very secure, However the little beeping they make every time they are opened can be very disruptive to sleep at night. Breakfast was basic, toast and assorted spreads, with coffee. Location was great for exploring the touristic areas and beach. Lots of restaurants, shops, and spas in the immediate area.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for two nights while we were in Kuta. It's centrally located, close to all the restaurants and shopping areas. It's walking distance from the beach. All the hostels are capsule style. Overall, the capsules are fairly spacious and very well built. Each capsule comes with a hanger to hang your clothes, a little desk, and storage areas on side of the bed. It's evident that each capsule was designed to be your own small room. Each capsule is assigned to a locker. I had the top capsule as well as the top locker. It was too high for me, and can be annoying to get to. Overall, there're a LOT of capsules in one room, so it can get a bit crowded. One complaint is that the bathrooms can be pretty humid and damp. This is likely because most of us hit the beach and wash our swimming suit and leave our wet swimmimg suit in the bathroom. it'd be nice if the hostel can arrange some place to hang our clothes in the rooftop. Also, there isn't much of a common area as well. Overall, good location. Well thought out capsule. Would recommend it.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was very friendly and welcoming, the beds were clean and comfortable, the location was good, close to shops and waterbom and Walking distance to skygarden. The Breakfast was basic toast and jam
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: PROs: Nice "room" - the bed is big enough (I imagine capsule hotels in Japan are smaller), comfortable bed, big lockers, acceptable breakfast. They have hairdryer, thank god! CONs: I hope there are more hooks in the shower area where you can hang clothes on. Also, no space to put your toiletries while you take a shower, you have to put them on the floor. A small counter will make a huge difference. Lastly, it would be nice if the people at the front desk can recommend tour providers. I asked them and one of the girls simply said "I don't know." I know it's not their job, but that extra effort to help and provide assistance to their guests (aside from just the lodging) will be very appreciated, I assure you. Overall, it was a good stay, the only bad thing was my noisy roommates who talked so loudly when they came in at 1 am from Sky Garden, but that wasn't H-ostel's fault.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in the heart of Kuta, the location is ideal for easy walking to all the local activities (beach, shopping, eating, nightlife). - My stay was only for transit purposes to Gili the next morning and the accommodations were really sufficient. - I requested a corner and floor level room capsule and was glad I did....less disturbance and easier to enter/exit your room.- There is a secured locker activated by your electronic room wristband and a privacy screen for your room. - Rooms/Beds come in single or double and mattresses are really soft, comfortable and cozy with comforter and pillow.- Solid wifi. USB and AC plugs are located near your head for easy access. Also a handy drop down table for your laptop which folds up and out of your way when you're ready to sleep.- Showers have hot water and include body wash + shampoo dispensers which is a nice touch (towel is included at check-in). - Breakfast includes coffee or tea and 2 slices of bread + jam. Enough to kickstart your day. - In Summary, rooms and bathroom/showers were clean, comfortable and sufficient. Price is very reasonable. I paid under $20 for online booking but assume this is dependent on method of booking, availability and type of accommodations. Will be back as it was very convenient to everything in Kuta.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this place by walk in. It was quiet there and we got beds in the 20+ bed dorm. The beds were clean and comfortable. There was lots of space in the bunk. Each had a light, outlet and USB plug in. The locks were all along one of the walls. They are self locking ones and the hostel provided the keycard for it. My 40L bag fit in there nicely. Hostel is right in Kuta Square but is surprisingly quiet! Breakfasts are toast and tea or coffee. Staff is very nice. Showers were hot and great water pressure! We ordered a uber to take us to the airport and our driver was worried for safety picking us up in the square by the aggressive taxi drivers. If you order one walk away from the square for pick up!
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay in this hostel after a failed airbnb attempt. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The beds are comfy, clean and the place is quiet. Standard hostel breakfast of toast and coffee or tea. Wifi is good and showers are good. Good value for money.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is located a block away from Kuta beach, a half block away from the shopping mall street, and a few steps away from restaurants and bars. The staff here were very kind, accommodating. The sleeping capsules allowed for privacy and the beds were comfortable and spacious. There was a shade for each capsule that blocked the light coming in which was a nice personal touch. The rooftop had great views of the ocean and busy streets below--it was also an area where a lot of socialization occurred during the day and at night. When I return to Kuta, I'd stay here again as it was safe, clean, and I really enjoyed interacting with the staff.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Near airport, In the middle of Kuta square, nice to walk around at the area near by. Local food and seafood surrounded in reasonable price. If you wanna travel in Kuta and just want to stay in a place that nice and clean, soft mattress, low price and very friendly stuffs. This place will be the one! I personally will definitely come back to Bali and stay here again. ;)
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I tried 3 hostels in Bali, but so far h-ostel is my favourite. The location is great, staffs are very helpful, nice interior, great capsule with a lot of space to put your stuffs, bathrooms are nice, breakfast are simple but worth the price. Would be even better if they provide mirror inside the capsule. Definitely will come back here on my next visit to Bali!
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location - official airport taxi was 150000IDR because of the new one-way streets taxis need to drive further to get back to airport and there higher cost. I used the hostel transport to Ubud which was 250000IDR in their van.. Uber would have been about 150000IDR and taxi dependent on traffic. The staff were quite friendly but should have more in-depth info about things like transport options and costs from bus and others. The showers only had hot water 2 / 4 times I used them. Scooter rental was available right from hostel for 75000IDR and lower for older models. GPS around Kuta central isn't accurate and not updated with new one-way streets making it harder to get back to the hostel via scooter. The capsule pods were pretty neat with lights, usb and other types of power sockets. The AC in the room was cold but once you closed the shade of your pod may get a little bit stuffy but nothing really bad. Oddly, during my stay there were no friendly travelers.. i.e. they didn't even respond when you said hi to them. Breakfast was simple toast, coffee, tea but they had many spreads (jam, margarine, peanut butter, chocolate spread).
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All staffs at here are friendly , I forget my picture at Tana Lot at here . They kept it for me and you can get others support from them , The rooms , toilets are clean . Near sea , restaurants and bars as you want.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For my first stop in Indonesia, I decided on H-ostel, and what a beautiful decision that was! I arranged an airport pickup, and saw a nice smiley face with my name on a sign to pick me up. The hostel is only about a 20 minute drive from the airport. I was then welcomed by the reception of friendly faces. The mixed dorm is spacious and includes lockers, and the capsule-like beds are amazing... So comfy, the sheets and towel smells so fresh, and include your own charging station and light. The bathrooms are clean. The breakfast is simple, yet a good way to start the day. There are also computers to use and a rooftop! It is walking distance to the beach and heaps of shops and restaurants. I was also able to leave my bigger luggage in a secure room while exploring for a few weeks for a small fee.The best of all though is the staff. Everyone is always so friendly and willing to help you with anything... booking something, explaining words you don't understand, getting transportation... I asked SO MANY QUESTIONS and just wanted to learn, and they were always there to teach me and share with me the beauty and kindness of the Indonesian culture. Special shout out to Ari especially, Faisal, and Sri. They were so beautiful and kind to me, and they were the best first impression that lasted all through out my few weeks adventuring Indonesia... and will be the faces I remember whenever I think of my travels in Indonesia in the future (:
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I arrived around 2 a.m. and the friendly staff are really kind & helpful to gave me lower bed. The bed was clean, comfortable and have power & USB socklets. They also provide a bar to hang your towel. The breakfast was toast & various jams, coffee and tea. They also provide free drinking water. The Wifi was fast and reliable but you can also use 2 desktops on the lobby. And what I love from this small but cute hostel is they have an elevator, so if you have enormous luggages you don't need to drag them upstairs.The toilet & shower is pretty clean, they only a bit dirty because the guests weren't using them properly. Also, the price is so cheap & it's just near from Kuta beach & the shops.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The pods are nice, spacy and clean. The first time I slept in a soft bed while travelling in Asia! There could be more racks to where hang stuff, though, cause the space is so limited.. The corridor or bathroom weren't super clean but not so dirty it would have bothered me. Nice hot shower. Ok breakfast. The problem in here was the heat. I was sweating the whole time. There's a problem with the A/C in our floor (5th), I don't know if the other floors would have been better. Location is good if you enjoy Kuta-beach. We were looking for something calmer so it was enough for us to stay 2 nights in this location.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I fell in love with the bed, its fresh and clean and mattress is very comfortable. You have full privacy in your capsula bed, all made for your comfort, like table, usb ports and sockets. Location is super close to the beach, shops and restaurants. Its the best showers I had during my Asia trip, proper shower, with good water pressure. No complains at all. The only thing is that social area is way too small at the reception, where you have kitchen and few tables. You pay more then in other hostels in Kuta, but at least you can be sure you get clean towel (free), clean bed and good shower, plus breakfast.
hotelName:
9    H-ostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed here on 3 occassions in the last 2 years. A hidden gem in a picturesque village. Villas and rooms are large, clean and are beautifully fitted out with Balinese decor. They offer great activities. The food is beautiful the staff are very friendly, professional and obliging. Special mention two valuable staff members Gede Bedug who on all 3 visits has gone over and above in delivering excellent professional service. Also sharing his local knowledge about the village and surrounds. Gede also offered curteous service driving the shuttle into the town centre offering valuable information about the town . Ib Putra Yana also offers excellent service. Ib has been our favourite waiter when dining at the restaurant. Ib also goes over and above to deliver the best waiter service and also sharing in his local knowledge. Ib arranged a beautiful dinner when we celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary. He decorated our villa surrounds and was our private waiter serving our dinner. We return to this resort due to the excellent service and treatment we receive from these two gentlemen and other staff at the resort.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superb hospitality! You can feel the warmth welcoming immediately when you first arrived at the hotel car park as you will be greeted by the friendly front desk staffs and a welcome drinks.Under the leadership of Made and Vtari, the front desk is ever very cheerful with many junior staffs and trainees who are utmost very helpful and polite to provide whatsoever assistance you may need. Keep up the good works!The Kumud restaurant was simply awesome. Every servings was very nicely presented, you will be tempted just by looking at the dishes and you can't agree more that the foods are prepared with hearts of the wonderful chefs when you taste them. It was very delicious and satisfying. To make it more perfect, we are being taken care by a group of well mannered, extremely polite server like Tama and IB Putra and many more of them who treats you like VIP each time you dine there.Me and my wife was on a wedding anniversary celebration and we was glad that we chosen Sankara Resort as our accommodation for 5 days. We was very well taken care of during the entire stay and we enjoyed the quiet and relax environments that Sankara could offer.For visitor who wish to have a nice, quiet and beautiful stays, we definitely recommend Sankara Resort without any hesitation. I am sure you would like it, if not loving it.PS: The resort visitors are generally well manner individual who respect the presents of other visitors. I have not seen any rowdy visitor during my stays. To me this is a Plus Point for choosing Sankara.To all the staffs of Sankara Resorts, thank you for taking good care of us and giving us a wonderful Bali experience.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We started off our trip to Bali with 4 nights here. Right from the start they were so welcoming. We arrived at 1 am and of course restaurant was shut but they had sandwiches and fruit in our room. We were on our 10th anniversary and the room was laid out so romantically, with petals and flowers in the bath.Yoga every day, very nice pool, we had a lovely massage included. Breakfasts were so delicious and a good range all freshly cooked in a delightful setting.We normally avoid tourist shows like the plaque but they did Balinese dancing one night with a set meal and it was superb. Lovely intimate setting and the dancing was amazing. Food was really good too!In terms of location too far to walk in to town really but free shuttles laid on. Taxis are cheap back but you have to haggle! Absolutely lovely restaurant , Sacred Rice is two minutes from the hotel and few other places nearby too. Would recommend the morning walk they do too. Get to see more local people and sites and visit lovely coffee plantation and try out about 12 teas and coffees(all free!). Yes, the coffees are amazing.Thank you to all the staff, so many were so nice, dont know where to start.......cant wait to come back and we cant give a better recommendation than that.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Whenever you meet the staff they are very friendlyThe rooms were very clean and the room we got was very bigThe area around was very quiet outside of the main town / VillageThey offer a hourly shuttle to town
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved my stay at the Sankara. I had a private pool villa which was beautifully set up with views over the rice paddies. They offer morning yoga everyday which was excellent & a delicious breakfast was included too. The location was on a quiet street away from the hustle of central ubud. There were great cafes and restaurants nearby. I would happily stay here again.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I have just returned from a 2 week trip to Bali where we spent our first 4 nights at the Sankara Resort. This was by far our favourite location and hotel of the 3 we stayed at. The service from the staff was exceptional, nothing felt like too much! The little things we were extremely grateful for, such as having a sandwich ready for our 1am arrival, and refilling our drinks bottles with cold water each day. I honestly can’t recommend it enough, our room was wonderful, the pool delightful and food in the Kumbuh restaurant was delicious We both had our first Balinese massage in the spa and it was incredible. The hotel ran a regular shuttle into Ubud centre throughout the day which allowed us to explore and do all the activities which we wished to, with easy communication via WhatsApp when we were ready to return. When we get to return to Bali we will definitely come here again.Thank you! :)
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is magnifique, extremely beautiful, all staff was wonderful and very helpful , my husband and me were very much happy with al the place, spectaculare , the view can be better , mercie bocu mamuase.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for 4 nights in a 1 bedroom Pool villa - it was really beautiful and quiet.The hotel itself had a great restaurant and the staff was very friendly and made sure we did not lack for anything.When we come to Bali again - and we will, we will be sure to stay there again.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel for our honeymoon and we made the best choice. All the staff is amazing and very friendly. The food was amazing. The best of all in this hotel is the private villa room with your own pool!!! If you want to relax and have a great time you must stay here!!!  Thank you so much all the staff you are great!!!
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A beautiful place and very friendly service. Little mouldy smell because of the high air humidity, would recommend the renwal of some points, then it would be more comfortable. There should also be a better light in the rooms, especially in the bathroom.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Accidentally wrote this review in the sister resort, so will repost here!Sankara is located just outside the main bustle and noise of Ubud centre which makes it a very welcome retreat! The staff are so welcoming and friendly which makes for an amazing stay. The room was really spacious, clean with a great balcony and big bathroom. Every night the mosquito nets were unfolded and room was prepared as well as being cleaned daily. The breakfast was amazing, a la Carte which is much better than buffet! And had great variety. Plus lots of fresh bottled water in your room daily.I would say it was a little noisy to the far left of the property where music and shouting could be heard from the neighbouring resort but luckily the latest that went on was 10/11pm.One great tip I would give is to visit Sacred Rice for lunch or dinner, it’s right beside Sankara and is beautifully romantic with amazing food.Sankara also run an hourly shuttle to and from Ubud centre which is really handy.All in all a very good stay, made especially so by great staff. Very good value for the level of service you get too.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This has to be the best place i have ever stayed. Staff were excellent friendly could not do enough for you.Room was excellent had everything you needed and more very clean.We had breakfast included which was the best one i have ever had whist on holiday. Food is of a very high standatd and reasonably priced. Pool is small and cool only down point was there wasn't a lot of sun coming through due to the surrounding trees.There's a shuttle car to the town of ubud every hour or so. I'd like to thank all the staff for making our stay a wonderful one.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights during the Ubud part of our visit to Bali. Everything we experienced was amazing - the setting of the resort nestled in the lush natural vegetation, the clean, comfortable and well appointed rooms, the superb service (the most friendly, helpful staff one could ever ask for), good food at their restaurant, activities organized regularly (including a traditional Balinese dance one night), and shuttle service to the nearby town center. I would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've very rarely been to a hotel where the stafgcared so much like in the Sankara! We were really sar when we had to leave this hotel, which will be definitely our first choice for the next time we come to Bali!
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was by far the best hotel we stayed in whilst in Bali. From the moment we arrived the hotel staff could not do enough to make you feel at home. The free shuttle was very helpful and the rooms both beautiful and clean. The pool was lovely and the hotel grounds beautiful. We loved our 5 night stay and wish we had booked longer! I cannot recommend this hotel enough! Absolutely amazing and we cannot wait to return.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Full amenities WIFI cable cell and fantastic suite with great design and execution. Infinity pool is very good for swimming laps. The staff provide excellent concierge service with free shuttle to Ubud.The setting and layout of the grounds are very beautiful. The spa setting and masseurs were the best; definitely do it. My wife enjoyed the two hour walkabout while I slept in. We did not wake up for the yoga.You could just stay here and relax.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really amazing property. We stayed in a One Bedroom Pool Villa which was the height of luxury. The staff were all so lovely, the breakfast (included in price) was massive and had several options. We ate dinner there on all 3 nights and each meal was great and also great value for money (NZ$40-60 for dinner and drinks for 2 people).There is a free shuttle bus into Ubud which takes 10 minutes. My only negatives were there was some maintenance work going on and there was loud hammering for several hours each day which was incredibly annoying. Also 2 nights there was loud drum music from the club next door which affected our sleep.We did the free yoga class one morning and it wasn't quite suitable for beginners. I'm not a beginner but my husband is and some poses were inappropriate to encourage inexperienced people to do (wheel pose). Also the lady had her breath instructions the wrong way round (breathe in when it should have been out. I imagine just a language barrier issue though).It's worth going for a walk down the road as there is a small shop (very cheap local beer), another lively restaurant (Bali Pesto) and a pool club (Titi Batu Ubud Club) which has several massive pools, sunloungers, a gym, exercise classes, dancing, restaurants etc.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel deserves all of the great reviews it gets. We stayed at Sankara for our first time in Bali for our honeymoon. Coming from the east side of the United States it took over 33 hours to get to Bali. We could not have asked for a better paradise than the Sankara Resort. The staff goes above and beyond for the guests and are so helpful and kind. The rooms were amazing, the food was amazing, don’t skip this place!
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Let me say we searched Trip Adviser extensively for the best places to stay in Bali. We eventually settled on Sankara in Ubud and we could not have been happier with the result. There are several things that we loved about this hotel, but out of all of those the most outstanding was the staff and their incredible service that they provided us. Everyone is very nice and always helpful, willing to do whatever they could to make our stay as nice as possible. We stayed in a One Bedroom Pool Villa and it was very nice and relaxing. We loved the amenities that were provided and we enjoyed the private pool right outside of our room. The price of the hotel was well worth it and the help that they provided for our trip was fantastic. The only issue that we had when we arrived was the noise of the outside village. On certain nights the neighboring community center plays loud music well in to the night. The first night that we stayed here the noise kept us up at night, but the next day we requested to move rooms and this was no longer an issue. If you are booking excursions I would recommend you book them directly through trip adviser, since booking them through the hotel might be a few dollars more. However, if you need a private driver or a trip to the city center the hotel is very willing to help.Overall, this hotel was fantastic and I cannot thank the staff enough for making our honeymoon a magical trip. I would absolutely recommend Sankara to anyone that is looking for a quiet oasis tucked in the middle of Ubud.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Out of the 3 hotels we stayed at in Bali this was my Favourite, staff were amazing, nothing was too much trouble & they all knew you by name, rooms were large and very clean, food in the dining room was masterchef quality.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had four nice days at sankara resort. The whole stuff was so kind and friendly, you feel like family.The food was very good, espsecelly the breakfast. Not so nice was the Skatepark very near, much noise beginning early in the morning.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The epitome of a boutique Hotel. There are only 30 rooms and the staff are incredibly attentive. They really do make the difference and are just phenomenal.Multiple different options for rooms but I highly recommend a 1 bedroom pool villa. Open air kitchen and poolside seating area. Comfortable canopy bed in the air conditioned bedroom opening into an open air bathroom complete with rain shower and stone bathtub.There and included activities everyday like cooking lessons, yoga, or making Cenang Saris. The hotel staff are just a WhatsApp message away so you can communicate with them while you're out and organize a shuttle back from town. Breakfast is included and not a buffet, they have Western and Indonesian options on the menu every morning all complete with fresh fruit.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Sankara as a couple for 5 days in early March 2019 and each single day was amazingThe room we had was very comfortable and spaceful, and always super clean.They serve great local and international food at their restaurant.On the monday evening of our stay, the hotel offered an acoustic show by the pool which was very enjoyable.We also had the chance to be in town during the Niepi day eve where the staff help us enjoy this local event with the villagers. Something to experience at least once in your life!Finally, to the whole staff which made our stay unforgettable, You are all so kind! Thank you!A special thanks to Gede who was our guide during this trip and help us discover this beautiful island.Mrs Prisca & Mr Nav
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment of arrival and for the whole week's stay, staff were incredibly friendly and helpful; they were only too willing to provide extra service beyond contractual obligation.The resort was spotlessly clean and well-kempt. The hourly shuttle to and from central Ubud was completely reliable. Tours were arranged simply and without fuss.The ambience of this resort played a major part in our relaxed holiday being so successful.I have no hesitation in recommending it wholeheartedly and would very much like to return one day - soon.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great place to stay.The rooms are spacious, comfortable and cool in the heat.From breakfast to evening meal the food is excellent.The staff are friendly, helpful and nothing is to much trouble. A relaxing stay, thank you.Michael and Pauline
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Husband and I spent 4 nights in the Titi Besi room. This a very nice resort on the surface; however, the lack of attention to detail really left us disappointed. Things we liked: —Private pool (in our room)—Strong AC —Good food—Lovely landscaping —Decent bed/pillows—Large tub —Small refrigerator—Helped is quickly coordinate a scooter —Very friendly, well-meaning staff Things we didn’t like:—Painfully slow breakfast service in restaurant. We did it once and gave up. —Never once got our in-room breakfast order right, and we ordered the same thing every day—Only provided 4 small bottles of water to drink per day. We had to go to the store and bring in our own. Other hotels had in-room water coolers. —Wooden lip around bed wrecked our shins. Bad design. —Long, uneven walk to lobby (not great for older or partially disabled) —Very difficult to communicate with staff. I don’t expect them to speak English, but just know that you’ll struggle at times. —VERY loud health club next door—basketball, skate park, kids swimming, DJs until 10pm, Ex-pat American hippies singing chants —Dog barked one evening right outside our room for 4 hours straight—Shower has only 1 glass wall, water goes everywhere, all over the floor. Bad design. —No in-room coffee maker, just instant coffee and a kettle with no creamer and no stirrers —Didn’t replace hand towels 2x—Sent us a random bill in the middle of the stay with no explanation. Turned out to be “a mistake.” I really wanted to like this place. Based on the reviews it seemed like this place would be top notch. It really isn’t. Of the four properties we stayed at while in Bali, this was the worst by far.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sankara resort is a small very nice resort situated between Rice FieldsFirst breakfast you can choose between 5 different Choices so there is no buffet which is actually no Problem. Staff is always very friendly and helpfulBook the private Pool Deluxe room so you always have your private Pool in Front of your room, the Public Pool can be crowded.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our villa with private skimming pool was beautiful as is this tiny resort. Just outside ubud makes it a perfect location and an easy ride in that Sankara provides as well as pickup. What truly makes this place special is the staff. They are beautiful, super friendly and can't do enough for you. Thank you from Paul and I for a wonderful time
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A beautiful resort ... staff was very friendly, we loved it! The breakfast left nothing to be desired. It was amazing !!! Also the dinner ar TOP! We felt very much woh. If we come back to Ubud then - only to you!
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is great and the staff is very friendly, flexible and with amazing energy.We decided to extend in one additional day our stay and we intend to reutrn.Points to improve: Drop off point of the shuttle should be at the main street of Ubud, breakfast should not be optional fruit platter or juice.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I chose to start our Honeymoon in Ubud for 4 nights at the Sankara Resort in the 1 Bedroom Pool Deluxe room. What a great stay we had. Upon arriving at the resort we were met by smiling welcoming faces and that continued throughout our entire stay. It was amazing after a long day of walking around Ubud to be greeted with “Welcome home!” We really did feel like we were at home!The room we stayed in was gorgeous. The private pool was so nice to relax in. The room was very comfortable and had plenty of room. I especially liked the open bathroom set up. You felt like you were showering and bathing right in the middle of the jungle.We enjoyed the resorts restaurant 3-4 times for breakfast and lunch. The food was very good and although it doesn’t seem like a lot in quantity, it is sure to fill you up. I especially liked the various smoothies they offered.While at Sankara we indulged in the Spa services. We decided on the couples package and couldn’t have been more impressed. It was a very relaxing massage and facial that I wish would never end. I do not remember the drivers names (I believe we had 2 different men) that operated the shuttle, but I especially wanted to thank them. They were very pleasant during our rides downtown and were always very accessible if our schedule changed.Thank you to everyone that works at the Sankara Resort. My Wife and I were so happy to have gone with your accommodations and cannot wait to visits again soon!
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is honestly a 10/10! We stayed in a deluxe villa with a pool and it was beautiful. The staff are so helpful and friendly. We had a seafood dinner and watched some traditional Balinese dancing at the restaurant while we were here and it was so lovely, food was delicious! We also got some treatments at the spa here and came out feeling so relaxed! This place is fantastic if you just want to relax and not do much they also have a free shuttle into town and some free activities such as yoga which is on every morning. Would highly recommend and we will defiantly come back :)
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our experience two years ago was great! But ghen it was just the two of us. Now we were with 18 (!) people. There are a lot of challenges when a large group visits your hotel but the Sankara staff never gave the impression to be overwhelmed or under staffed. Always friendly, always quick to assist. Always with consistent quality. Everyone in our groip had a more than pleasant stay. This place is a true gem. A real recommendation. 5 out of 5 doesn’t seem nearly enough.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoy our experience staying at our villa. All the staff are super friendly. They often pick the perfect time to clean our room so that we always come back to see everything tidy in the room. The food in the restaurant are amazing. We would recommend this villa to my friends for sure.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing time there. The room was huge and clean, with very comfortable bed.We had an amazing decoration as it was our honeymoon.The staff was very nice and helpful.The SPA was a bit expensive compared with the most of the places in Ubud.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the private pool villa for first part of our honeymoon and it was fabulous. The staff is really great here, very welcoming and speak great english. Very helpful also on asking about local activities , areas, etc ; the amenities are also great, from the fresh soaps they provide to a “travel kit” in case you forgot anything like hair nets for women , combs for men, etc . Would highly recommend if staying in Ubud and would come back next time in Bali.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a tranquil 2 nights here in a deluxe pool villa. Very clean and well equipped, with an indoor and outdoor shower. The room had a safe and kettle and the bed had mosquito netting around the outside which was useful. There is also an outdoor incense burner designed to keep mosquitoes away which seemed to work really well. There are a lot of lizards/ insects around with the resort being located in the rice fields and we spent one night with some sort of creature, possibly a tree frog, making noises in the rafters of our room! However it’s definitely worth putting up with a few creatures to stay in such peaceful and beautiful settings. The staff are extremely helpful and the shuttle bus to and from ubud is excellent. We did the morning walk run by the hotel around the local village which gave us a chance to appreciate some of the local culture. Thank you for a wonderful stay!!
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at Sankara are so welcoming and helpful, they really made our stay. I would highly recommend this hotel.We were greeted with a welcome drink and our room was ready before check-in, bonus!Food- we stayed on a bed and breakfast basis. There was a good choice from the menu and it was all table service. The food was high quality. We ate at the restaurant most nights, it was a similar price to eating in Ubud and it was delicious. Try the cashew chicken. The hotel offers a complimentary afternoon tea between 3-5pm which was a pot of tea and three mini cakes on a tasting plate.Room - it was spacious and had everything we needed. The air conditioning was fantastic. Mini bar items were very reasonable. The room was cleaned twice a day. Amenities- the pool was clean and a refreshing break from the heat. There are only 8 sun beds around the pool, it is quiet most of the time but it was full one afternoon so we couldn’t get a bed. A few more sun beds or chairs would be good. The spa treatments are fantastic! It was about £22 for an hour massage. The hotel is a 10 min drive from Ubud, they offer a free shuttle service every hour until 10pm, this made getting to and from Ubud very easy. Great wi-fi. Staff- every single member of staff we met were so friendly and some knew our names after the first day (the has never happened before) a shout out to Merry and IB who were just amazing. Well done Sankara, thank you for a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We unfortunately didn’t stay here, we were accidentally taken to this hotel instead of the Sankara ‘suites and villas’ which is the sister hotel but THANKYOU to the staff who upon realising, swiftly called the other hotel and had a driver come and collect us. Whilst we waited they gave us a welcome drink, water bottle and let us put our feet in the pool. This was so lovely of them considering we were not even paying guests. Thank you so much, we will be sure to return the favour and stay next time! :D
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely stay at Sankara.The staff are amazing always happy and willing to help you work out what you need and where to go.and they remember your name . I recommend this resort if you are staying in Ubud.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Extremely kind staff, sincere smiles rare to find elsewhere in the world. Great location just deep in the forest, very charming and relaxing mood. Good shuttle service for the city center of Ubud (free) and well organized SPA with skilled staff. Food is delicious, try the Pad Thai, probably the best I’ve ever eaten. The fruit was not so tasty, probably because of the season. At the restaurant I found Mr. Ib, particularly gentle and friendly but all the staff was really great. What else to say... First time for me in Ubud, but I would hardly recommend this resort. If I’ll have the chance to be back in Ubud that would be my choice again.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we came to Sankara, I mentioned that I had bad nights at the hotel we stayed before. The front desk staff was really nice and helping us with getting us a great room. Mr Gede is very nice and helpful, he accomodate us with his services and informations about Ubud. He was very genuine, all the staff are very Genuine and friendly.Mr Gede took us to the coffee plantation the next morning, and he washed our car.. eventho we didn’t ask for it.. he just did it because he just a nice person and love to takes care of his guests.I will be back again for sure, and this resort is highly recommend!!, and of course we love to see Mr Gede and the rest of the staff!❤️
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very attentive staff, you won't want for a thing! Service above and beyond, and quality ambiance and food in a traditional Balinese setting. If you want peace and quiet with a really good food then this is the place to be. So good we have booked again for later this year!
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The grounds are gorgeous and the staff are very friendly- treating us like we were part of the family. The shuttle is a great option, but traffic in ubud in the afternoons is busy, sometimes it may be better to walk if you don’t want to sit in traffic. Breakfast was included and great options. Complementary yoga with Sukarmi every morning was a great way to start the day!
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have been there for 5 amazing days, and very appreciated food, pool, resort organisation, staff, great vibe of the place. Nice shows in the evening (sometime free, other for extra-charge). Maybe best room view until now..
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with 2 other friends. We arrived at 2 am and were greeted by the front desk with water and sandwiches. They arranged pick up for us from the airport for an extra 550 k, but it was so helpful not having to try and find a taxi in the middle of the night. The room was very clean and always re-stocked with complimentary water. The continental breakfast was very good. We booked a few tours through the hotel as well and the drivers were very professional and always easy to find. One thing that sets this place apart is how kind and helpful everyone is. The service we received throughout our whole stay was above and beyond.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the most peaceful resort we have ever stayed at! I felt such calmness & peace while staying here. Very good food & free shuttle into Ubud. If you want to experience the Bali culture, this is the villa for you!
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a room with a very private setting with our own pool. So worth it! Restaurant staff is excellent along with delicious food. Shuttle service to and from Ubud town centre worked great. Loved it
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely peaceful hotel. Unfortunately there were building works going on whilst we were there which we were not informed about. Therefore all we heard whilst laying by the pool was machinery. We would not have stayed there if we were informed, such a shame as the hotel seems lovely but unfortunately our stay was not peaceful or enjoyable whatsoever.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff (locally owned and run) are amazing, attentive, friendly, and aim to make your stay the best it can possibly be. We would go back in a heartbeat. The location and services were top notch and it made for a comfortable and relaxing stay.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We’re spending 6 days here. Every aspect Of our stay has been wonderful, from checkin, the pool, the room and restaurant. The spa also provides excellent services for a good price. I asked the resort to organise something special for my daughter before our arrival and this was expertly taken care of. The staff also went over and above to prepare our room as a surprise for my daughter. The comfort of the beds also is outstanding. I highly recommend Sankara Resort as a wonderful destination in Ubud. Will definitely return. Won’t mention any staff names, as everyone provides an exemplary friendly service, and work really hard to provide a holiday experience that you won’t forget.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay. Very nice ambience. Calm and peaceful for our honeymoon. We enjoyed the pool, food and great service. The honeymoon suite was really great and they decorated it really special for us.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Every hotel in Ubud has the luxury of a gorgeous landscape and beautiful views, so it is not the beauty of Sankara Ubud that sets this resort apart. Rather, it is how detail-oriented, authentically caring, and devoted every member of the staff is. From the moment my grandfather and I stepped onto the property, we were well and truly taken care of. Every single request we had was answered and the staff, especially Suartama, Merry, and Ngurah, greeted us continuously with an authentic smile, a desire to help, and always the question, “Is there anything else I can do to make you more comfortable?” This resort deserves a 5-star rating and all the praise in the world.
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You know how it is - you search for a hotel and read all the positive reviews on TripAdvisor and sometimes doubt if the hotel really is THAT great. Well, Sankara Ubud, certainly deserves its great reviews. Our family stayed for 4 nights and in hindsight we wish we would have booked a longer stay. The hotel is great, very relaxing atmosphere, super nice rooms/villas and so on. We enjoyed the beautiful infinity pool every day at different times and almost always had it for ourselves. Also got a very relaxing massage in the spa. But the best thing about Sankara is the amazing and genuinely friendly staff that goes out of their way to make you feel comfortable. We stayed in several hotels in Bali and staff is usually nice, but Sankara was a totally different experience. Among other things we really appreciated that they took care of our little toddler at breakfast and when we had lunch at the hotel so we could eat in peace. And our son sure loved the extra attention he got :)Just as it says in many reviews the location is a bit outside central Ubud. Which in my opinion is to prefer because it’s located in a more peaceful environment. Very easy to use the free shuttle to go to and from town. There are places to eat close to the hotel too and one of the best restaurants in Ubud, Sacred Rice, is just around the corner. Make sure to make a reservation because they only seat 28 guests for dinner.The complimentary morning walk was definitely worth getting up a bit earlier for. Interesting to see the surroundings and to do coffee tasting at Ubud Sari. There’s also a sports club next door with gym, playgrounds for children and a lot of other activities. Another tip is to use the laundry service on the opposite side of the hotel entrance. Only 10 k idr for 1 kg. Really loved our stay. Hope to be back one day!
hotelName:
10    Sankara Resort Ubud
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A wonderful place for a relaxing holiday. Luxurious rooms, super friendly and helpful staff, fabulous restaurants, beautiful pool and beach areas and the most amazing day spa! Have fun with the water aerobics and don't miss the Teppanyaki. A touch of Balinese paradise
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you to your wonderful staff for making our family vacation so wonderful. We loved the kids club staff, the pool was stunning, and the location was perfect to visit the market, it's just across the street! Also a quick taxi ride into the city to visit malls, water park etc.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel grounds and pool were absolutely fantastic. The quality of the food offered at the Garden Cafe was well below our expectations for a Hyatt Hotel. We will certainly be going back. Loved the 8 days we stayed there!!
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed three nights in the South Village which is great as it's nearer to the beach. We were initially given a room in the West Village but asked to change and the hotel kindly obliged. The stay was great. The hotel has a beautiful and clean private beach. It is a short walk to Bali Collection - a "village" of restaurants, shops and even a supermarket - so it's convenient for when you don't want to dine in-house. Otherwise, there's a few shops and quite a number of restaurants within the hotel too. We were at the first floor and loved it. Our terrace overlooks a pond with ducks every morning. We can see the sea too. While the room is not spanking new, it's comfortable. Room service is a bit of a hit-and-miss depending on the food you order. Love dishes tend to be bland (perhaps catering to Caucasian taste buds) but dishes like fish and chips are okay. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. Thanks, Frnd Hyatt!
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing experience staying at Grand Hyatt! The ambience, staff, views, all make up for a memorable and satisfying experiences. We were 2 families and had the best time enjoying its facilities. in addition, we are vegetarians with further dietary restrictions. Luckily, every day, Chef Ashish, Lia and her team made it exceptionally easy for us to have food. If you are a vegetarian and have Jain food dietary restrictions, this is the hotel to stay, where i highly recommend Chef Ashish's culinary skills. The room we had was nicely positioned between the lobby and various pools, and nusa dua beach. Overall, we had a great time at Grand Hyatt! I would absolutely go again and would recommend it to everyone! Many thanks to entire team at Grand Hyatt!
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The first room we were taken to was old and smelled very musty .I think the culprit was the bamboo blinds and the fabric on the old daybed. It was also a long walk to the lobby and other facilities. The next morning we asked to change to another room, this was not much better so we declined and asked for another. They took us to the North wing and the room had been renovated. This room was much better. It was also very close to the Lobby, the Garden Cafe for breakfast and the balinese pool. The resort itself has over 600 rooms and four wings North, South East and West. Not good for people with disabilities as can involve a lot of walking, easy to get lost and hard to navigate your way around. We couldn't find our first room very easily. The grounds are beautifully landscaped with flowers, frangipani trees, water lily ponds. Staff always sweeping and cleaning. Great choices of restaurants. Food is good at Salsa Verde and the Garden cafe but reasonably expensive. We didnt try the other restaurants.We used the lovely balinese pool near our room which was great as not many people were using it. The pools at the front looked great for kids and adults and close to the Salsa Verde Restaurant and beach. There are also some sun loungers on the beach and this area is great! Bali Collection is just across the road and the Water blow hole quite close. Also have a few shops in the resort. We missed out on the cultural evening with dancing as it was at another of the resorts restaurants. We asked if we could sit down for 5 mins to watch as there were plenty of chairs outside. They asked us to pay - Ive forgotten how much. We declined as we didn't think we should pay since we had only just eaten at one of the resorts other restaurants. Management should address this! Good location in Nusa Dua. Overall it is a lovely resort it was a great experience.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just like coming home. The staff at he Grand Hyatt Bali are just fantastic. The children love the hotel as it offers so much for them to do. The beach is great, the pool is amazing. The perfect place to spend your last couple of days before heading home. The access to the hotel make it ideal for late checkout and easy late night trip home.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Grand Hyatt is in a great location right across the road from Bali Collection. The room and bathroom was spacious and the Grand Club facilities were nice. Check in was smooth - many thanks to Dhany.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had an amazing holiday with family travelling from UK and Australia. Hotel was beautiful. Pool bar staff were amazing, nothing was ever too much trouble. Breakfast was gorgeous, rooms were huge, shower & bath great. No complaints, would definitely love to return.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first trip to bali and we did it in style. This vast and beautiful resort was great for our family of four. We had a suite which was big, beautiful and had amazing ocean views. The grounds are impeccably kept and every where you look there is something interesting to look at. The staff at all the restaurants were friendly and accommodating.The waterslide entertained our two active sons for hours which was a good thing as there is an additional and expensive charge for the Kids' Club at the Hyatt that I didn't appreciate so we didn't use it. This is generally my only criticism. The cultural shows each night were just wonderful. The direct beach access and beautiful breezes make the resort such a pleasure. There are other reviews that make a great deal about renos being required but that was not our impression at all. My only suggestion to the management would be that at the time of checking in it would be nice if a staff member spent a bit of time taking you through how things work eg. where are kids allowed and not allowed, what are the hours and rates for kids club, what time does the slide and pools close each evening what time does breakfast start and which restaurants serve it -that sort of thing just to give you more orientation. We worked these things out anyway but some info would've helped and perhaps in their defence I guess we could've asked. Food at the various restaurants were similar prices to Sydney but that is to be expected at a resort of this standing. I would certainly return to the Hyatt and have no problem recommending it to others.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights and on the whole the place was brilliant, but, one big problem let it down.... I kept waking in the night hearing strange noises. One night I got up and spotted a mouse in the room which then quickly ran away and into a void the ceiling. I had a look and spotted that the mice hand made holes behind the spotlights to get in the room. This was quite concerning due to hygiene concerns with food being out etc. I'd also had lots of disturbed nights sleep. The management at the hotel said they would get pest control out to have a look while we were out, but it turns out all they did was spra something - they did not attempt to block to the holes where the mice were getting in. We were offered a free meal, which was not satisfactory in my opinion. This a top class hotel and for this sort of thing to happen and then be treated with such disregard is really disappointing.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this resort on June 2019 for 3 nights in connecting rooms 1436 and 1437. We bought the voucher by travel agent, got cheaper price even when compared with World of Hyatt member rate. Breakfast for 2 person is included. I usually book the hotel stays by their own websites. Because sometimes I got free room upgrade or else. So I expect nothing here. Check in time was longer than usual. Maybe because of high season. We got our room at 3:00 PM just at the normal check in time. Waited for about 1 hour but we got Veranda beverage voucher so we can wait more comfortably. Rooms a bit old but comfortable and the air con works well. The amenities were missed here and there (no toothbrushes), but we can call the housekeeping and they will provide. Keep in mind that the resort is very huge. We got lost on the first day during our walk from the beach area. There are 2 restaurants used for breakfast. The one near the lobby and Salsa Verde near the pool and beach area. Breakfast was good. I love that they serve honey pork slices on breakfast stall. The best part of the resort is their beach. We stayed at Inaya Putri and Ayodya Resort just on the other side of Grand Hyatt area, but Grand Hyatt beach is the best by far (The beaches on these three resorts are the best to play with kids and dip around Nusa Dua). Hugh beach area, because the resort itself is huge. Good tides during our stays. At noon there were no tides really. You can just dip and sit in the shallow water. Heaven. My son and daughter, 8 and 5 years old loves the beach and pools so much. We love the lush garden with the shallow ‘umbrella’ trees too. Good job Grand Hyatt Bali. I hope to visit the resort again in the future with my family. Hope to get a better room next time. Oh and at night we can spend time chill at the Bali Collection. Just across the hotel, few minutes walk.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently spent a week in this beautiful resort, enjoying the delights of a club room. The complementary breakfast and evening canapes and cocktails made our holiday that much better. I certainly could not fault the staff in the club lounge or in the resort generally
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bali is beautiful, but what we will remember most is how the staff helped me and my wife feel so valued and cared for. They went above and beyond at every juncture and made this stay amazing.Susanto the manager was so helpful for navigating tough issues. our AC stopped working and he helped us get in another room in the middle of the night. Even helped us with getting back to airport safely.I've always wondered what the concierge does, but Unita and Sukriani helped me see them in action. They called the airline on behalf of me and my wife when we got stuck on Gili Islands due to bad weather. Unita worked tirelessly to find a way to get my sick wife home even when my passport was locked away in our room safe many miles away. From start to finish she took care of all our appointments and arranged our transportation. They took care of all our contacts outside of the hotel.We will always remember the kind service of these people, but every Kriya Spa attendant, room service person, technician, and housekeeping member was professional and kept our needs first. We saw some foreign guests during our trip discontent with service they felt entitled to, inside the hotel and outside as well. Although people make mistakes and fail our expectations at times, Grand Hyatt staff and the Indonesian people really do give it their all to consider the guest more important than themselves. I think we need to honor the local people better!Fantastic stay and unforgettable honeymoon. Terima Kasih banyak!
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is one of the best hotels at Nusa Dua. A fantastic location and lots of activities.The hotel is so big that you always have the sense you are the only people living there.A large number of restaurants and each one is a Culinary delight.From Frangipani(Italian) on the beach to the Japanese there's a place for everyone there.A huge swimming pool with a slide for the children,biking and an excellent Spa.The bar has a limited selection of snacks but an excellent vibe.Staff are friendly and courteous and there are some good places to shop within the hotel.The balinese dance is a must watch.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent place with serene views of the sea from the room. Polite & courteous staff but the room service leaves a lot to be desired. Lot of red ants and mosquitoes in the room. We left a tea cup on the table next to my wife's purse. Next morning not only the tea cup, but even the purse had ants all over. Beds are comfortable. There are multiple interconnected pools and they have numerous activities throughout the day. The hotel’s beach is very neat and offers great views at sunrise.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent place, for family if you want to enjoy and dont have to worry about kids and want to think of activities for them. The place is excellent to offer them many activities and safe space with very kind staff
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quiet safe location near Bali collection. Staff so helpful. Fantastic warm pool with slide. Food was expensive in Nusa Dua so include meals if possible. Great for little kids not teenagers.Negative was - No kids meals at pool bar.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have been staying at the Grand Hyatt for over 15 years and have always loved the experience. The resort facilities, grounds, pool areas are simply stunning. We upgrade to the Club lounge that is absolutely stunning, the evening drinks and breakfast offering is the perfect way to start and end the day. As a family that travels extensively this resort is a family favourite. Well done to the entire team at Grand Hyatt, thanks for another perfect holiday.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Unless you have a huge family of bratty kids - go somewhere else. Nothing was impressive. The Hyatt Regency in Denpasar is FAR superior. I had a very unfortunate visit to the nail salon. Do not use!All food and drinks were very unimpressive.The bathroom should’ve been cleaner. The only saving grace was the gym and Jasmini. She was wonderful. However, being solo - I couldn’t take single class offered.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second stay at this resort. We requested the same room we had previously stayed in and were pleasantly surprised to be granted our wish. Our room overlooked the tranquil emerald pool which is a great spot sit or swim for a few hours as it is away from the other pools and noise. We stayed for 8 nights and intentionally chose to stay at the Grand Hyatt for the first part of our Bali holiday to unwind and relax. The resort is full of Balinese architecture and the gardens are beautifully maintained. We loved how expansive the grounds are. We visited the Kriya Spa a number of times and the surrounds and service there are outstanding (tranquil and professional). Staff were incredibly helpful and cheery at all times. The room we had is a little tired but everything was in working order, the bed was comfortable, the air con worked perfectly and everything was clean so we had no complaints at all. The resort is in a great location and the beach at the front is kept immaculately. We ate at the Salse Verde and Garden Cafe (buffet breakfast) and the food was great. The cultural night dinner is a must. The entertainment and food was fantastic. Breakfast got a little busy but that is no different to every other hotel we have stayed at that supplies a Buffet breakfast. It should not be a shock that you may have to wait a bit for an omelette to be made up or wait for the toaster. For me the stand out of this hotel are the beautiful grounds and the ever smiling and helpful staff.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having stayed in several hotels around Bali, this is the pick so far. Amazing gardens and pools, great location, friendly and effective staff. Breakfast at the Grand Club was up there with the best hotel breakfast I've ever had. It is very nice to have the beach-side trail so handy and good quality gym - will definitely be back.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent two nights in Bali at the Grand Hyatt..... and everything from the gorgeous hotel, the beautiful grounds, the fabulous room and - most importantly - the unbelievable service from all of the staff was completely over the top. Specifically, the Club staff - Suderti, Yani, Bagus and Sarly - provided the most personalized, professional, friendly, efficient service. And this was all under the direction of Wiji, who went out of her way to make certain every part of our experience was above and beyond. Bali is truly amazing - and staying at the Grand Hyatt makes it even more so. A big THANK YOU to all who made it so.......
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Terrible Club Lounge food! One of the worst I’ve been amongst so many Hyatt hotels I’ve been to. Vastly needs improvement. Can you imagine even basic food like bacon and sausage was not available every day? I only had it twice after staying there for a week!
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel.The staff were very helpful and friendly. The property itself is huge and lots of places to explore. We found every convenience we wanted especially since we were travelling with kids - atm on the property itself, 5min walk to Bali Collection etc.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Here for a second time in 6 months and cannot recommend highly enough, the most amazing staff to create a memorable holiday, Mr Amrit, Bagus and Urip in particular (not taking away from all the other staff) this is becoming a second home and somewhere we will visit many many times again in future.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we arrived we were more than happy with our decision to stay here. The rooms were fantastic and ideal for a family of 5. The pool and waterslide were a sure hit with the kids with the poolside cocktails a sure hit with us. The staff were outstanding. All restaurants were delicious and the luxurious spa on site was brilliant.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a fantastic hotel to stay at.. the hotel could not have been more accommodating for my family.. the food and drinks are great.. will stay here again.. thank you to all staff who made our holiday so much better..
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow, we just had a great holiday through lux escapes staying for 10 nights with breakfast and dinners included. The hotel is everything you would hope for as far as a tropical holiday with fantastic service, rooms, food, pools and beach. Unfortunately though, despite the deal we purchased stating "And don’t forget children aged 11 years and under stay free with breakfast - now that’s holidaying!”Kids under 3 aren’t allowed in the kids club. I don’t know about you but my definition of little one means kids including under 3 unless stated otherwise. Other places we have been to allow either a parent or guardian to accompany kids under 3 into the kids club but this place doesn’t allow that. As we have a 2 and 4 year old, the kids club was useless as our 2 year old would just lose it if we tried to put the 4 year old in without him. Even for kids over 3 you have to pay in 2 hour blocks or for half/full days. We wouldn’t have minded paying but this should also be advertised. From our observation alone it looks like a good kids club for those that are allowed to use it. Noting we purchased through lux escapes and it was their description that failed to mention this rule this is their fault (it is on the Hyatt’s direct website but we didn’t think to check that before staying there)I would happily recommend the resort to anyone who doesn’t want kids club for under 3s
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very large resort that is directly on the beach so it's easy to find places to sit and many areas are shaded by trees. There are multiple pools with plenty of areas to sit. The resort's overall maintenance is good even though you can tell it's an older resort. The service levels are very good considering that this is a big resort with many rooms. Everyone we met was friendly and professional.We are big fans of Hyatt and so we have stayed in many Hyatt's across the globe and this Grand Hyatt matches up well with our expectations. The Grand Club lounge is beautiful and well worth the upgrade cost. We enjoyed the ambiance of the open air lounge as much as we did the food and service.The Italian restaurant on site was amazing. We normally try to only eat the local food on trips because we enjoy discovering new food we might like but when we did end up eating at this restaurant at the end of our stay, we wish we would have found it earlier in the week. We did leave an item behind in a public restroom on the day we were checking out. After we left, we contacted the hotel, they located the item, and have made arrangements to return the item. We have not received the item yet but the communication with the hotel staff has been great. Overall, the resort is pretty affordable for the quality of the resort. The reason for a 4 star instead of a 5 rating is that it's an older resort and the lack of personal service touches from most of the staff, even in the Grand Club.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A 65th birthday treat! - the Grand Hyatt Bali was chosen because of its location and our previous experience of the Hyatt group of hotels. Our faith was justified and our expectations exceeded - a wonderful location and set amidst the best maintained gardens we have ever seen. Great food, great service - wonderful staff - thank you.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Awesome resort, restaurants all really good, service wonderful, upgraded to garden room worth every dollar overlooked pond ,gorgeous, 4 pools &lots of sunbeds to choose from, private beach with beds under beautiful trees, we felt very comfortable walking up the esplanade,
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 8 nights on a luxury escape package and the value for 2 adults a 5yo and a 2yo was incredible. Most impressed with the size of the resort and the grounds/landscape is impeccable. Plenty to do within the resort for everyone. The service from everyone was amazing. Rooms were good, little dated but larger than most. We loved our time there and will definitely be back!
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
