review_body: We chose Grand Hyatt Bali for our family trip. It was a very fantastic and pleasant stay. All staffs are very kind and the hotel was very well landscaped. The view of the private beach in front of the hotel was very beautiful.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We can not fault at all. This was our second stay there and we are now planning our next trip for next year for my 40th...absolutely the most perfect place to stay in Bali. Couldn’t ask for better service or accommodation
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was so helpful, the check in experience also good, we wont wait for long to be assist.The pools are suitable for family and kids and enjoyable. The room spacious and good thing, the clean up the room 2 times in a day. I wish we can coming back again for Holiday.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned home from an 9nights,stayed at Grand Hyatt,It was absolutely sensational from start to end of stay.All the restaurants are great,the staff amazing and the facilities superb.Out 2 kids loved the kids club which was also included in the price. They watched a movie at the outdoor cinema every night, giving us the opportunity to indulge in lovely dinners and surroundings.We would go back in a heartbeat
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best Room: We LOVED room 3107.Best hotel: Grand Hyatt Bali!! It's soooo beautiful, classy and has the best service of anywhere we've EVER stayed!Tip: If you have food allergies, let them know ahead of time. Octarina was the one I emailed and she was so friendly and helpful plus fantastic in letting all their restaurants on the premises know about my food allergies.My impressions of the resort:You really realise where you’re staying is truly special, especially as soon as you walk out the beach-side gates. There is a footpath (or sidewalk) that runs alongside the beach. You can walk through the gates to access other properties. As soon as you do, you feel like you’ve left a tranquil, wonderful paradise behind and entered reality.The beach becomes more narrow. Lounge chairs are crowded next to each other, almost touching and there are rows of them all close together. There are so many people and you’re forced to walk the gauntlet through rows of vendors hawking their wares. Maybe a good place if you’re a kid going on Spring Break. But I want a tranquil haven so I turn around and walk back through the gates to the Grand Hyatt. As soon as you enter The Grand Hyatt grounds, the beach is wider and more spacious. There are beautiful shade trees that have lounge chair underneath and beside. I go back, find my husband and I lay on lounge chairs all day because they’re so comfortable. You can stay in the shade or sun without anyone close to you except occasionally friendly waiters to bring you refreshing drinks. It’s like living in a Corona commercial.TIP: the bar usually runs specials so ask your helpful waiter about them. If the beer special is buy three (or more) at a special price, ask him to bring them in a bucket of ice to keep them cold.TIP: they now carry Prost beer. Give it a try because it’s even cheaper than Bintang and my husband said he liked it better.TIP: As for Masmita - he did a wonderful job bringing us beer and wine.If you decide to go to the pool, you have plenty of different types of pools to choose from.TIP: if you get too hot, ask where the Cool Plunge pool is to cool off. It’s next to the hot tub.TIP: ask for two towels instead of one at the towel stand. It will always come in handy.TIP: if you have food allergies or special requests, be sure to email them in advance so that they can best accommodate you.I usually dread travelling because my allergies make it difficult. But I don’t worry when I come to the Grand Hyatt. This is our second stay here and the staff here is so fantastic.From the moment we arrived, we were greeted by name and remembered by old friends Heru and Roro. In fact, we saw several Hyatt employees that still work there that we met three years ago. It says a lot for a place that treats its staff so well that they work there long term.We were treated like celebrities. Not only was my food allergen-free, it was deliciously prepared and charmingly served. Everyone was great: from the room cleaner, room service, chefs, servers and managers.I can’t name everyone but here are some star performers.TIP: if you need excellent advice, ask for Heru at the Concierge desk.TIP: if you go to the Garden cafe, Adi S and Roro are wonderful managers.Dewi: always remembered our name and room numberExcellent servers were Yumi, Siti Sri.A and Arti.The Chefs, Sudiata and Widi both came out to discuss how to best accommodate my food allergies.TIP: at Salsa verde, ask for Meri, Roy, or Perry.TIP: go to the Salsa Bar at sunset. It is located above Salsa Verde and has the best views. Ask for Sartika or Tansana.Best TIP: get the upgrades. You’ll be glad you did.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are vegetarian bit trouble but others it's awesome and very well maintained. Location is awesome so as hotel rooms. Swimming pools are good but timings are not acceptable... Staff was polite and helpful.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel grounds and facilities very good, staff extremely friendly.Number of things however were disappointing and would put us of staying again as a young family, beds uncomfortable with low quality bedding, plastic feeling, Kids club is for 3 year olds up and you can’t actually go play with your kid there, drop and go set up, we also had a one and half year old and we couldnt go play with our two kids there which is standard in any other hotel with such facilities, last issue was we arrived late on first night and our two young kids were sleeping at breakfast time the following morning, we asked to take some croissants back to the room and this seemed to be an issue for the breakfast receptionist even though we had paid in full for breakfast. Again hotel is nice and facilities great but there is some improvement needed
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1. For those who likes to drive on their own this hotel provides valet service (some 5 stars hotels do not provide valet service), the lady at the front loby really quick on helping us and also greeted us (feel welcome)2. checking in was fast3. There are 5 pools in total within the hotel, but we can only use 4 pools, cant remember the reason why we cant use the fifth one, but great pool, my family and i really enjoyed spending time in the pool.4. The hotel has their own private beach, real nice and clean, happy to see my daughter enjoyed playing here5. Walking distance to bali collection6. Breakfast was just ok, ( for those who never stay in this hotel, when you get your room, ask where is the breakfast for your area, we didnt get the information as we walked quite a distance to a restaurant near the loby just to get turned down as our room number was not supposed to have breakfast there,little bit upsetting)7. The hotel is quite old, so dont expect too much, for example our room8. The baby cot we asked for is dirty, we ended up not using it9. I think only the front lobby hotel that will make you feel welcome, the rest are notBut all things aside, We will be backPersonally
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: -Stayed for a week with my partner, another couple and their two boys aged 18mnths and 4. -Beautiful rooms, gorgeous established property, amazing staff, range of great restaurants, pools etc. -We had the add on of the Club Package (I think that’s what it’s called) and would really recommend this. It meant breakfast was included and access to the club pool which was beautiful. Also a big range of food and drinks available from late afternoon (which fed the kids easily) -Great kids club and family pool with slides-The staff went above and beyond to help us when we had a medical emergency before arriving at the hotel. One of the duty managers Sarly, came with us in the hotel van to hospital and stayed to ensure I got medical treatment needed and was so well taken care of. When we got back from hospital, there was a sympathy card and flowers in our room. -Beautiful spa facilities -5min walk to Bali collection for cafes and shopping-My partner proposed while we were there and the staff helped him set it all upWould love to stay here again and highly recommend
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am on my last night of 8 nights staying here. On my 4th day I went down the waterslide with my daughter and when landed, a broken tile on the pool floor cut my foot open. It was so bad that I almost needed stitches, I couldn’t swim for the rest of my stay (doctors orders said I couldn’t get it wet or dirty). Upon asking the hotel for a copy of the incident report to provide to my insurer, they have flat out refused saying it is internal policy not to provide one. I am extremely disappointed and upset. I missed out on 4 days of enjoying the resort facitilies because of the hotels negligence and now they are refusing my legal right to a copy of an incident report! Will never be back.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 10 days, great service and nice having a choice of restaurants. Quiet and secure. Didn't take long to get to Kuta with 'Grab'.They were the only hotel that would guarantee adjoining suits for the family, thats what was our deciding factor
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly and helpfull staff. Good value for money. Location is perfect and the staff are very friendly which made everyday a joyfull experience. The food was good and everything was very clean and tidy.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 8 nights. Food was lovely and our service from Lisna (Cafe Garden) was exceptional, who just remembered all the small details on our trip.Hotel located near the Blow hole (10 min walk), great beach, pools and surrounds lovely.All staff extremely considerate,polite, attentive and courteous Wish the hotel had a courtesy bus for surrounding areas to visit
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is surely one of the most wonderful resorts in Bali .Beautiful gardens wonderful well trained English speaking attentive staff nothing is to much to make your stay perfect .try to avoid school holidays if older as the children can be very loud screaming parents not caring let them take over pool and Resturants but apart from this 2019 parent problem most are great rooms large fantastic big beds veranda beach clean and perfect pools fantastic gym great food wonderful
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This resort is very tired and in need of much love. It is also not as children/family friendly as we had be told.We stayed here for 3 nights with our 3 children following 7 nights at the Padma Legian hoping that we would just be able to relax and enjoy the resort in Nusa Dua but the Padma Legian was far more relaxing and a lot better for kids with a more appropriate children’s pool and more slides.Kids club is also not free at the Grand Hyatt like it is at the Padma and many other resorts.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would like to express my special thanks or gratitude to your staff for making my stay feel at home and providing me with the best service renderable. The members who stood apart were Parnata from the pool area as well as Ravitha from Garden cafe. The extraordinary and remarkable service made my stay delightful yet entertaining. I really enjoyed myself. I would consider my stay at Grand Hyatt a golden opportunity, thanks to them.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tonight we attended the Barong Dance at one of the great restaurants at Grand Hyatt, Nusa Dua. The atmosphere, ambiance, and restaurant setting was lovely with the sea breeze flowing through. Meal - delicious, varied and plenty. The waiting staff in our area were May (‘May Lucky’) and Sri (‘Sri Lanka’). They were very kind, polite, and interesting and provided excellent service. Their Manager was excellent and a lovely gentleman also. Thank you - a most enjoyable evening.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stay Duration: Three nightsTotal Guests: 4 adults and 2 kids in 2 roomsWhat we sought out: Our two families wanted rooms close to each other in a hotel which had a lot of moving space, easy access to clean beach, good food and a quiet place for the adults to relax. Verdict on our expectations: Met on all counts and exceeded on a few. Location: We were told time and time again that Kuta/Seminyak was the place to be when in Bali, but we decided against all those advice and chose Nusa Dua, specifically Hyatt. A great decision!! The beach was so close, so clean and beautiful! Its in the newly developed Nusa Dua area and therefore is humongous in hotel grounds. We later found out that its walk-able distance to the Bali collection shopping mall - shops and restaurants are super close. But if you are looking for an active night life, this may not be for you, as this area is geared more towards a relaxed and laid back atmosphere. Room: Our room was perfect! It was decent sized with a separate bed in a nook for our boy. The bed was comfortable with pillows of different softness. The linens were clean. We had the garden view in one of the rooms where there were no railings separating the room and the garden. Both us and birds were crossing each other's territories pleasantly. But closeness to the garden also brought some small millipedes in. We just flicked it out and made sure the lights were off. Bathroom: Separate shower cubicle and a bath tub. Really clean at all times. Wardrobe closet available within the bathroom area for easy access. Only one pet peeve is, could've used a lock on the room to prevent little ones running in unannounced. The bathroom wooden door also got stuck a little bit, preventing it from being closed fully, as it might have expanded due to the heat and ocean air. Food: We had visited only Garden Cafe and Salsa Verde during our stay. Our first day lunch was in Salsa Verde and it was really really good. Sizable portions of tasty food! There were enough vegetarian options available for us to choose from. The staff were very courteous and friendly. We spent almost 2 hours of our first day just relishing the food and atmosphere there. All our subsequent breakfasts were in Garden Cafe. The breakfast buffet spread was huge and varied! It did get a bit crowded in the mornings and that's the only time you realize that there are so many guests in the hotel. The staff therefore got a bit frazzled and curt, but nothing major as to be a turnoff. One lunch that we had there wasn't noteworthy. Pool and Ocean: The pool was really nice and very kid friendly with water slides. But the ocean is the big attraction. The beach was very clean and we actually witnessed it being cleaned every morning around sunrise. Lots of loungers with sufficient tree shades. A beautiful swing right in the middle of the beach for those instagram clicks. I could've spent our whole vacation in that beach, just lazing and reading a book! But note that the waves are not for surfing, they were more mellow. Grounds and others: The hotel grounds were beautiful with many water bodies with beautiful water lilies. There were birds, aerial and aquatic - freely and unobtrusively going around. The small bridges that dot the grounds are so cute. There are enough clothes, knick knacks and toy shops within the hotel premise, not to mention an ATM, a money exchange, a small temple, a conference center, a wedding area, a kid club etc etc. The hotel itself is so huge that its easy to get lost. During couple of our walks, we had to refer to strategically placed maps to find our way back. Transport: They arranged our airport pick up in a big vehicle (Toyata Hiace). The pick up was smooth and went okay without any hitches. Check-in/Check-out: Again smooth - no hitches. A must stay if you would like to have a quiet place away from the hustle and bustle.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had booked ocean view but when we checked in , we were told that it has been upgraded to Executive view. Not sure , why someone will upgrade unless there is some issue with the booked room .I expressed my wish to get me the same type of room which I had booked, but that might not be available. Though, I had the ocean view from my room but it was little far. That is still ok. The only problem is , It should be communicated with customer in advance , so they wont be surprised at the last moment. That was the only concern.Otherwise, it is a very awesome and large property. You have ATM, Shops , Restaurant etc. Staff is friendly. For vegetarian , there are very less options. For non-veg, there are plenty. It is very beautiful and scenic property.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the largest resort we stayed at while in Bali (out of 6 resorts). This place had consistent hot water and water pressure, major plus in my book. The room was nice, it overlooked the golf course, lotus pond and had a beautiful ocean view. I did get a picture of a Monitor Lizard (maybe a Komodo?). Lots of wild life here (not in the room, no critters spotted in the room).Check in was nice, staff was pleasant and welcoming. They have a little shopping village on premises (and are right next door to the Bali Collection). Room is a good walk to the front desk area. Beach area is very nice, kid friendly. Nice water slide and pool area. Great pizza at the Italian Restaurant!They were having a conference when we were there. Prices seemed to reflect this as we were quoted $29 USD for a ride to the airport. We called our driver we had used during the week- $15. The room itself was the smallest we had stayed in during the 12 days in Bali but it was still very comfortable, and once again, they did have the best water pressure! Check out was smooth even with the buses of Chinese guests leaving at the same time as us.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would never go there again. Breakfast at the grand lounge was sub optimal. Went to the regular breakfast buffet also. Staff at the entrance were absolutely rude and unfriendly. Untrained and very poor comprehension added to the problem. Croissants and bread was stale. The suite was a lovely size and well appointed. However the bed curtains were torn and lacked a privacy partition between the bedroom and bathroom especially if traveling with friends, this is a big problem. Overall the property is quite old, but maintained well. However it is not worth the price at all compared to several other hotels in Bali. And most disappointing is the poor standard of training and service offered by the staff on several points of contact. I would not recommend this property. And will never go there again anytime soon.
hotelName:
11    Grand Hyatt Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The girls running the desk are lovely and welcoming. Bed was very comfortable. Nice shower and bath products. Grounds very well kept. Nice quiet part of town. Short (adventurous with the motorbikes) walk to the center of Ubud. Monkeys to entertain. Breakfast was lovely and the restaurant hosts an open mic night Thursday worth checking out. Great value and stay.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We love everything about Bali Bohemia. The room, the pool, the staff and the breakfast....they were all to a high standard (the breakfast choices are really good!). We booked the standard room for 4 nights. And we’re really impressed. The highlight was the surprise birthday breakfast for my partner. I requested to the staff & they well executed my request. The flower decoration “Happy Birthday” on the floor was also nice.The quiet accomodation also right behind the monkey forest and to have the short cut to the busy part of Ubud nearby were also great.If we can suggest anything it would be an improvement in the room lighting. Thank you.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in een mezzanine room at Bali Bohemia Huts for two night. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Location next to south entrance of Monkey Forest. Still quite far from ‘downtown’, you need a taxi or ascooter. There’s a lot of attention to decoration (a bit hysterical in my opinion), but not too much on practical things. Adequate lighting was missing, so in the evening we could barely see anything. No closet or place to store clothes/suitcase and no curtains on the window behind the bed so we woke up when the sun rises. Swimmingpool is pretty small and the evening when we arrived there was an ‘open mic’ evening, which caused a lot of noise. All in all it’s pretty expensive for what you get. We were quite happy to relocate after two days to a more central ánd more scenic location with 2 large swimmingpools, a bigger room, free shuttle service around town for only half the price of Bali Bohemia!
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful place, next to monkey forest but only a short walk to the hustle and bustle. Can’t praise the staff highly enough, friendly and couldn’t do enough for you. We loved the music and asked who was playing, the girl made us a list of the singers. Only ate the breakfasts here but these were varied, tasty and well presented. They had an open mic night on Thursday, the standard of music was high and created an awesome vide. We stayed for a week in the Eternity villa, beautiful decor, private pool and garden with fish pond. Finally, the monkeys.... we loved them visiting our garden and watching them at play. Will return when back in Bali.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bali Bohemia Huts is located steps away from the entrance to the sacred monkey forest in Ubud, and is a treasure trove of colour and delightful design. We had a luxurious double storey, two bedroom ‘hut’ with its own pool, Khoi pond and friendly monkeys sharing the private garden with us. The staff were amazing and the breakfast delicious. What more could one ask for!
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The most beautiful accommodation. Colour, art, music, nature and chilled, positive vibe in abundance. Cannot fault accom, food, service, location - all exemplary and the most warm, kind staff! I/we will be back as soon as possible to live this experience again.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a lovely welcome from the staff upon arrival as we were greeted with welcome drinks. We had the deluxe mezzanine room which was lovely and we were also visited a few times by some cheeky monkeys on our balcony. It is about a 10 minute walk to the main strip into town via a narrow route next to the monkey forest which is shared with many mopeds, so you must walk with caution if you take that route so be prepared to walk slowly and in single file. As a whole, our stay with Bali Bohemia was lovely and we probably would stay there again... The only reason we have not given 5 star rating was that we were made to feel quite uncomfortable upon check out, when 2 members of the team (who we thought were coming to help with our bags) burst into our room and were running around checking we had not taken anything... Which is understandable but not very nice whilst we were still in the room! In addition, we were questioned about the location of the small bottle of mosquito repellant they had provided alongside shampoo and shower gel. We didn't know where it was and were made to pay for it - a small amount but strange nonetheless when this has been provided for use free of charge, and we assume no charge would have been made were the empty bottle left on the room. We felt this wasn't dealt with particularly professionally or in the manner we had been accustomed to from otherwise very kind and pleasant staff.The restaurant is great, breakfast is fantastic and lots of options, we enjoyed the stay but were disappointed by how it ended.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is very nice, staff are very friendly and so helpful. Tried the Arabic breakfast at the hotel restaurant and it was very well cooked and very nice presented. Unfortunately the stay was for one day only so i hope to be back again and explore more.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bali Bohemia exceeded my expectations a real gem of a place .. Beautiful bungalow great beds power showers everything you need .. the staff are exceptional people who can not do enough to help .. the gardens a pool are very clean fresh flowers every day location is great very central but very quite perfect thank you Bali Bohemia you have got it so right ! I will be back .
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I have stayed in ‘heritage hut’ for the past week.. we are sad to be checking out today! Our stay here has been perfect in every way. The staff are all amazing, so friendly and attentive. The hotel itself is beautiful; comfortable, clean, quirky, colourful, the list goes on. The location is great- only a 5-10 minute walk to the centre past the monkeys, and if you want to go out further then taxi/bike/scooter rental is on the same road. I would recommend Bali bohemia to everyone, thanks guys :-)
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: These huts are so magical. We had our own pool, a huge master bedroom, and bath and bathroom and down a hall there was a sitting room as well. private and fun. The breakfast cafe is also wonderful. The grounds are well kept and a great location by the monkey forest. Easy to walk into town!
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful location, friendly staff that are dedicated to making sure that your stay is enjoyable. The restaurant is superb. Highly recommend his place! The monkeys are always entertaining to watch, but they will take your things if you leave them laying around. Just keep your personal belongings secure in your room.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this place as it looked so colourful and different and we weren’t disappointed. The staff were so kind and helpful and when they found out it was my birthday they gave me a lovely sarong as a gift. The pool is small but more than adequate and you can be entertained by watching the odd monkey here and there when they venture out from the forest next door. We loved our bungalow and the food in the restaurant was delicious, so we ate there more than once. They also have live music some nights and art exhibitions. We would definitely recommend this place.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a fantastic place, one of a kind... a great combination of uniqueness, bohemian and artistic but without forgetting that they are hosting guests and they are providing a service: very clean, with all the amenities you might need, including a very effective mosquito repellent. My bungalow was dreamy, beautiful... staff were friendly and efficient and to top it off, the breakfast is excellent!
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved this place! Stayed here for 3 nights. Clean big rooms, good aircondition, staff is very friendly and helpfull. The room had that little extra (mosquito repeallent, toothbrush, air freshner, music speaker). We also rent scooter from the hotell and got help with transfer. Yoga barn is 10-15 min walk away, so if you like yoga its perfect. The look of the hotell and surroundings is beautifull, we highly recommend this place! And the monkeys hanging arround was just fun ;)
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A night on my own before the start of my holiday with my husband. The resort is tucked away but very close to Ubud town and across the road from the monkey forest. My mezzanine 'heart' room was perfect. It had a suspended egg chair on my deck that was very comfy to read in, and i had the pool all to myself for a few hours to float around in. I had a healing massage from Wayan which was fantastic ($20).The staff are super friendly and welcoming and breakfast was delicious, ordering from a choice of 3 menu.There are things that some may not like: monkeys are very close and sometimes roaming the resort. (Tho, I loved watching the babys play during breakfast). The balcony rail could be a safety risk as it didnt seem that secure (this does need to be fixed). As the roof is very high, the air conditioning did not seem powerful enough for the size of space, so while in bed it was warm and the mozzie net couldnt be used as this made it even more uncomfortable (this may not seem as bad in peak season?).Otherwise, the location was great, and i loved the individual artwork everywhere. I recommend and would return.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed here at the end of October for three nights.   *Room* We stayed in Wonder, which is one of the deluxe rooms with the bed on a mezzanine level. The room was spotlessly clean, and we loved the quirky decor. Although we had air conditioning and a fan in our room, we did find it quite hot in the night… I think the thick mosquito net kept all the heat in! The only thing the rooms was really missing was somewhere to hang clothes, or a place to put our cases. Not a huge problem because we were only there a few days, but some may find it annoying. *Pool*There is a great little pool area with lots of seating options (sunbeds and bean bags!) It was very quiet during our stay so we often had it all to ourselves. Occasionally the monkeys pop by for a visit which was a little intimidating for me, but the staff quickly came to our rescue!  *Breakfast* Breakfast is served in the restaurant just outside the complex, and it was consistently great… easily one of the best we had during our stay in Bali. There were so many western and Indonesian options, and portion sizes were generous.   *Location* The huts are situated right next to the Monkey Forest. In fact, to get to the centre of Ubud with all the bars and restaurants, you need to walk for 5-10 minutes along a path through the forest itself. Ideally you’ll need a torch to watch where you are going, but we actually managed the first night without one since there was always a number of mopeds going by to light the way!  *Finally* One of the best aspects of this hotel were the staff, who made us feel so welcome and always looked genuinely pleased to see you! I would recommend Bali Bohemia Huts to anyone wanting to stay somewhere a little different and close to the centre of Ubud.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very cool accommodation. A relaxed bohemian hippy vibe, amazing staff, very clean, best place we stayed in for a long time and bar far not the most expensive. I’m sure I will return one day. We stayed in the deluxe room with were spacious and a lovely mezzanine level. Fabricated from bamboo the style is funky. Breakfast and food menu was very good.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Definitely my favorite stay in Ubud! The huts are beautiful and cozy and the staff is amazing! I would recommend this to everyone. I only stayed for two nights in the La Boheme hut but I could live here!
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came here for the first time And it's an experience the resort I'd lovely quiet and peacefulThe staff are lively and helpfulBeing right next to the monkey forrest was a treat They came to visit a few times The restaurant bohemian cafe I'd wonderful they have music nights wonderful food .and all and all our experience was great we stay in the etertnity bills I would recommend you Ask fur extra airconditioner fir for the lounge it's a bit hut in there of an afternoon if you want to read etc no TV's so you have to be content with your self internet Is limited so no Netflix of a night lol Apart from that great I order a healing massage they do it on the pool side deck beautiful it's a morroccan feel Very peaceful atmosphere
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here sadly just for 1 night between Xmas and new year dec 2018 . If we had known how amazing this place was going to be we would have booked longer . We are most definitely planning on coming back later part of this year .  We were lucky enough to stay in the Lotus 2 bed villa myself , my wife and 2 young children 5 and 7 yrs . The villa was perfect ! Beautiful private pool , lovely rooms and bathrooms . Just everything about this place . It’s in the heart of monkey forest so gives you a personal experience with the monkeys that will just chill at the pool side with you . Staff here couldn’t be more helpful with all needs . I couldn’t recommend this place enough ...... Food is incredible !!!
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place really lived up to the photos. It’s gorgeous. We loved the room decor, the pool and gardens. The staff were fantastic, kind and friendly. They even stayed in touch after we left, in case we needed help on our Bali travels. A yummy surprise was the authentic Middle Eastern food in the warung. It’s a great location, with fun monkey activity to watch. It’s adjacent to the forest and a park and five minute walk to Ubud main section.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A sweet little retreat with a great room overlooking the cutest pool. Super clean, friendly staff, lovely gardens and walking distance to yoga, shopping and restaurants. Loved everything about it and a highlight of our holiday.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was lucky enough to be the first guest to stay in their new Lotus Villa which is totally divine. Swimming in a private pools while watching the monkeys play on the surrounding walls has to be one of the highlights for me. The staff are delightful and the food in the restaurant is delicious. I can't wait to return :),
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Bali Bohemia Huts and it was superb! Lovely bright and cheery rooms, a good breakfast at the restaurant and entertainment from the monkeys from the nearby monkey forest. Very helpful and happy staff - would book again without hesitation
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have visited Bali many times and this is the first time I have stayed in Ubud for a couple of days.Bali Bohemia Huts and it’s beautiful grounds is a truly wonderful place to spend some time! The staff are so lovely and will help you with any request.Breakfasts were yummy and watching the morning antics of the local monkeys made it the highlight of the day.The rooms are wonderfully decorated and very whimsical. I enjoyed staying here but would recommend hiring a scooter as otherwise a $10 taxi ride to the Centre of UBud, as the Bali Bohemia Huts are situated at the back entrance to the monkey forest. Evening meals and cocktails at the restaurant was also very enjoyable and a good price
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am in love with this place, will not go any where else. The staff go above and beyond, the location is great the atmosphere is bliss, and food is so yummy and fresh.Thank you so much for a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: AMAZING! What a place. Never stayed anywhere like it. My bungalow (Freedom) was beautiful. The food was great and so cheap. The staff were very helpful and polite. Absolutely loved my stay in this little slice of heaven. Would highly recommend the full body massage for just £10!!! Would definitely return!
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: everything about this place is simply amazing. every detail is colorful and lovely. we stayed in room heritage and it was directly by the pool. staff is nice and helpful, everybody is very joyful. we had breakfast included, it was delicious- they even bring it to your room. and what’s important for me... they had great coffee ❤️
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 4 nights and felt immediately at home in my hut named Life... the bohemian decoration is so lovely and joyfull. The staff will help you for everything you need. I’ll try not to cry when I leave tonight..... see you soon!!!
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel, and I must say, it was absolutely great. The rooms are very well equipped, and also very beautifully decorated by local Ubud artists, as is the whole place. See pictures. The staff is very sweet and polite and are always willing to help with anything.The location, straight opposite the entrance of Monkey Forest, is wonderful. Waking up and finding a monkey on your balcony, was very nice ! Breakfast in the restaurant was also very good. And do not hesitate to have dinner once or twice. Some lovely food on the menu. I can only recommend this great place and will surely come back. Thanks Bohemia Huts for making our stay in Ubud so wonderful.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights and the accommodation was first class in all respects. The staff cannot do enough for you, and are always smiling. Highlight had to be waking up to sight of the monkeys every morning and witnessing them retreating to the forest each evening.Memories we will always cherish.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bohemia Hotel is one of the most amazing hotels I have ever been. This was our second time there and for sure we will go again next year. The Indonesian bungalow is really nice and confortable. We also enjoy a lot with the monkeys around jumping on the trees and roof. But not only the hotel itself is really good. The staff is really friendly. If you decide to go, don't hesitate to ask for Koming. I'm sorry because I don't remember the name of the others. Next time we go we will ask all of them :D.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place, well located, very helpfull and friendly staff and a really beautifull room in Ubud style with the visit of some sweet monkeys gives u the perfect vacation feeling! Also the breakfast served in your room is a big plus :)
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay here, the place is beautifully decorated, well kept and the rooms were very comfortable. The staff are great, very helpful and we felt they genuinely wanted us to enjoy our stay. The pool was clean and a nice temperature. It's quite a small pool and space around it is a bit limited. It wasn't a problem while we were there, but I can imagine it would be crowded if all the rooms were taken. The restaurant and bar have a great atmosphere and had live music twice during our stay. Sitting on our balcony the music was just loud enough to enjoy, but didn't disturb us in our room. The food here was a good standard, we had breakfast every day, but only ate once in the evening as the menu choice wasn't to our taste, but lots of local restaurants nearby serving great Indonesian food. There are monkeys around at this hotel! We weren't stupid enough to eat on our balcony, but they were still a nuisance at times. We had to bring our drying rack inside as they will take anything - yes I did get my bikini back!This is a lovely area just out from the centre of Ubud, with a 15min walk down a path into the town which was a bit like running the gauntlet of monkeys and motorbikes but we didn't have any problems, although we used a taxi at night.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just perfect when staying in Ubud!Right next to the Monkey Forest, its location is perfect if you want to be close to Ubud yet out of the city center frenzy.The staff is always very helpful and smiling. The rooms are definitely very nice, especially the rooms with mezzanine.I would definitely go there if I come back to Ubud!Special thanks to Dewi who as been very helpful all along our stay!
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in these quirky little huts for a week. They were clean, roomy and comfortable, there was a bit of a musty smell though. The grounds were beautiful and staff excellent. It was very quiet and peaceful and a great place to relax. The food at the restaurant was different, but very tasty and very nicely presented. My only concern was the proximity to the Monkey Forest, they visit daily to find food which we found a bit intimidating, but staff arm you with a sling shot and they are usually on guard too. You are a bit out from the city centre, but taxis are available and cheap and there are some very nice eating places nearby. You can take the shortcut into town via a walkway next to the Monkey Forest, but after being confronted by a monkey on our first morning, we didn’t attempt it again. It was really very lovely and unique.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Of the three places we stayed across Bali this was by far our favourite!Perfect location right next to monkey forest and not far from lots of restaurants bars and shops. It’s cafe is lovely with amazing music nights and great food! Having breakfast each morning there with the lovely tinkling music and watching the cheeky monkeys try to break into cars was one of a kind!We stayed in the heritage hut and it was so bright, colourful and fun! Clean, great aircon, mini fridge, mosquito net, safe etc. The staff were all amazingly helpful and lovely and happy for us to hire one of their scooters for the day. The setting is beautiful with the loveliest bridge over the pool, flowers and plants everywhere, and this nice old man appeared every morning to dot petals around the place - so sweet. We felt incredibly relaxed and happy when here and it was the best place to explore Bali from - far enough away from the crazier areas to avoid them but close enough if you wanted to go there for the day. You also aren’t far from lots of great sights & activities so a great central base. If you aren’t sure about booking - I 100% recommend you do!
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bali Bohemian is not like any other hotel we have stayed before. We decided to choose this hotel due to its peculiar design. We stayed at deluxe mezzanine room (Heart) and fell in love immediately at first sight. Colorful, rustic, bamboo, mixed between Bali/ India/ Thai fabric and attention to the details. Koming, the cheerful front desk officer, greet us warmly and we had lengthy chat. We stayed for 3 nights and always had breakfast in their vibrant restaurant. Food was delicious, tasty and service was prompt. Due to its location, which is next to Monkey Forest, every now and then the cheeky monkey come visit our room. However, we didn't get bother by their appearance.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff were excellent and the room was very clean and comfortable. The food in the restaurant was superb. Reception willing to help us wherever possible. Monkeys on the balcony was a treat and very fascinating.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights, Bali Bohemia is such a beautiful place, very relaxing and a great place to unwind and chill out. The Bohemian atmosphere is beautiful, the colourful rooms are divine. Very old world Bali. Breakfast was included and was very good, lots of it and great coffee. All the staff were very attentive and lovely. We would certainly recommend it to a friend. Great time had by both of us, the monkeys from the forest next door were very entertaining. But if you don’t like monkeys this is not the place for you
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We held our wedding here for 37 people over the course of 5-days. 21 people stayed with us at Bali Bohemia, with the remainder in nearby villas. The friendliness of the staff and the intimacy of the venue made for a stay that exceeded our expectations quite considerably.- The rooms were full of character, clean, spacious, comfy and very unique.- The food was some of the best we tried in our 18-day stay in Bali. - The staff were by far the most friendly we have encountered on our global travels. - The setting, 5metres from the Monkey Forest, made for an environment we will never be able to replicate. - The walking-distance proximity to central Ubud made everything very accessible. - The unique decor and atmosphere meant it took hours to relax, not days. - The price was incredibly good value. It didn't break the bank, in fact, quite the opposite.Most importantly, Jessica and her staff made this stay a 11 out of 10 for us. I wish I could be as consistently upbeat and as full of energy as her team. Each of them were a pleasure to get to know.You could spend a fortune and stay at a 5* venue with far less character and come away thinking 'that was nice', or stay here, for a very reasonable price, and come away thinking 'that was something special'. Whether for a wedding or just passing through, please strongly consider staying here, you won't regret it.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So.. our first trip with a baby... everyone says Bali is easy with a baby - nothing is easy with a baby. However, the crew here has done everything in order to make it easier! We needed diapers, the found out where you can get diapers without perfume (pampers in the big Delta supermarket). We needed a high chair as we didn’t bring one, they asked their driver to pick up two! One for us and our further travels and one for them :)Right now we’re eating breakfast while the staff is playing with our baby.. what a treat!For reference, our boy is 8 months old.The room we’re staying in is spotless, plenty of hot water, cleaned daily. Pool is good and clean. Breakfast is plentiful and there’s a lot to choose from. Coffee is good and strong!The entrance to the monkey forrest is 20 meters from the hotel.Would I recommend this to friends? Absolutely!
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent three nights in this Ubud oasis, set against the monkey forest. Adorable colorful clean huts. Amazing breakfast in their adjoining restaurant, with a great music venue at night! This is the place to be! They also offer a free complimentary airport pick up. We were greeted at the airport by one of their associate guides and driver. We were immediately impressed with him. He presented us with flowers. He spoke english well and we were able to convey to him, what we wanted to see on the island. His name was Deka. He was able to show us things that we would not have known about. We hired him as our driver, he was very considerate and sweet. We enjoyed his company and would highly recommend him!
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights for a friends wedding a few weeks ago, hired out the place. It was a perfect venue and the brilliant attentive staff made our stay even more special. The bride and groom had their ceremony on the bridge over the pool and 30 guests attended. All the rooms are individually decorated and unique and of the same high quality and standard. We stayed in ‘heart’ which had 2 levels and I think was the closest to the cheeky monkeys who come from the monkey sanctuary next door. Monkey etiquette, don’t smile at them (bare your teeth) don’t carry plastic style bags as they’ll come looking for food! Staff are on hand if they get too close, all you need is the (unarmed) slingshot to make them run, we didn’t have any problems. No mosquito bites either! I Imagine in the ground rooms you don’t get to see as much monkey action! If you have walking difficulties or mobility problems stay in ground rooms as all one level. Two storey rooms had tricky wood steps leading to bedroom, bathroom downstairs. Potentially dangerous for elderly or frail. ALL rooms unique and are kept equally to a high standard and decor, all rooms with varranda or balcony face the pool and gardens. Breakfast was amazing, on the hungover morning post wedding celebrations staff brought breakfast and a herbal tea to our balcony! The town is an interesting 10 min walk through a wide path through jungle, wide enough for walkers and scooters and monkeys! The people are lovely and I felt no threat walking alone, even did so at 10pm after a massage in town! Must add, on site massage better! It’s a very slow pace of life here and you’ll never want to leave, hidden from roads and any noise. All staff are just wonderful and can’t do enough to help. Thank you to all who made Laura and Toms wedding celebrations such a perfect day and night.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent three nights here recently with a friend in a mezzanine room. We couldn’t fault the place. It was as perfect if not better than the photos. It was peaceful (be prepared for music nights in the restaurant a couple of nights a week), extremely helpful, friendly smiling staff, went out of their way to help, amazing rooms, spotlessly clean, beautiful decor and the food was amazing. We ate dinner elsewhere one night and wished we had stayed where we were. Right near the back entrance to the Monkey Forest so you can sit in the restaurant and watch the world go by and the antics of the monkeys. No need to pay to go inside. A short 5 minute walk along a path into the town which runs alongside the forest as well. Try the massage, an hour was not enough! Transport to and from Bali Bohemia was by the driver Deka, he was fantastic and so sweet, we miss his laugh and great music in the car. Can’t wait to head back here.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very polite and english speaking staff, nice room and whole resort... excellent restaurant / bar with delicious food and atmosphere (especially during thursdays stage party). Tasty and really artistic breakfast and superb trips offers (highly recommend Deka as a driver and also company)Thanks Bali Bohemia - once I will came back ;)
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You will never believe your eyes till you really get to step foot in there it’s soooo amazing I was speechless it was the best place for food, lodge and entertain as they had this restaurant by the road very close to the monkey forest we went there every single morning and night that we stayed there. They had these little reggae music at night and it was the best. And also don’t be scared at night if you hear a sound of hitting on the door as that’s not a robber or someone it’s definitely a monkey hitting on your door so just keep jigging with it. ✌️Enjoy the trip I recommend this place 10 out of 10
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are very thankfull and happy with our stay at bali bohemia! Absolutely everything was perfect! From the people to the houses to the food! They like to help you whit everything you need, the monkeys are also great to watch while eating breakfast, overall a very big earned 10+ !!!Suksma and see you guys again next time!
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and I booked our 4 night stay in Ubud at Bali Bohemia huts and we stayed at the Momentum room. It was a very comfortable room, air conditioned, spacious, quiet and peaceful! The complementary breakfast was very delicious with a nice view of the monkeys located right by the monkey forest entrance. The hotel staff as well as the hotel restaurant staff were very attentive, friendly- always smiling, and accommodating for our requests-we even got early breakfast packaged to go before our early flight! Thank you so much for our pleasant experience, we very much enjoyed our stay in Bali! :)
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here on our first trip to Bali and we are so glad we chose this place. The staff are wonderful, helpful and the accommodation is super funky and quirky while being clean and comfortable. The tours are great and good value for money and the food in the restaurant is soooooo good! We will be back for sure. Highly recommend.Oh and the cocktails at happy hour go down so well. :)
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The landscaping of the gardens and pool was very nice and the design of the rooms was quirky and comfortable.The staff were a delight and I really enjoyed my stay.It's conveniently located next to the Sacred Monkey Forest, but this means there are many monkeys around, so watch out for your belongings!The restaurant was good, but I would have liked a bit more variety than mainly middle Eastern cuisine.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our visit was very nice! The hotel staff was super friendly and helped us with everything we needed. The hotel rooms were cool and every day cleaned up, so that was also very nice. We enjoyed our stay here, and recommend it.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: THE BEST HOTEL EVER. beautiful design. Super friendly staff, fantastic atmosphere. Starting from super comfy beds, through nice spacious rooms, amazing food and even mosquito( organic) repellent and a torch in each room, cannot be better really. Fantastic small pool.Perfect stay.
hotelName:
12    Bali Bohemia Huts
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing! Loved the view / Great activities / The Best Staff / Pool is lovely and the food is pretty good too! We stayed in a Hilltop Villa and was fantastic - bed very comfortable and room was very spacious with a deck overlooking the spectacular view
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay here for 5 days was absolutely amazing! This resort features most spectacular mountain views, yoga classes, lots of activities organised by the hotel, two restaurants and swimming pool with spa. Our package had all meals included, which was fabulous. Deluxe rooms come with balconies, are large and clean. Be prepared for lost of stairs though...
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At about an hour's drive north of Ubud, this resort is away from a center of tourism. Nice stay for 3 - 4 days. Due to altitude of location the weather can be unpredictable and we experienced 2 days of cloud & rain. I recommend day trips that to rice fields, waterfalls, temples or even Ubud when weather is poor. On sunny days great for pool area. Resort is beautiful however the service is not 5 star. For example, paid extra for 3rd person in villa yet towels & glasses, water bottles only for 2.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our five days at Saranam Resort went so quickly ( our choice, in seeing everything we could in the area taking in waterfalls, rice fields, lakes, Munduk and Lovina ) However if you want to chill out and stay within the resort boundaries I'm sure you would enjoy that just as much. To wake each morning and watch the sun bathing the mountains and hillside outside your room was wonderful. The many reviews we read prior to our visit gave the pool a chilly wrap up but we found our daily 7am swim to be refreshing and no cooler than the ocean at home. The warm shower afterwards was a great way to start the day. We had a great deal of praise for the activities staff who put together a great weeks daily activities . The ones we did were fun, started on time and conducted enthusiastically by the staff. Our room was very nice and the food offered in both restaurants very nice. Maybe a little more variety with the Luxury Escapes menu. Overall a great experience at a lovely resort in a beautiful part of Bali.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we absolutely loved this hotel. It is away from everything and has a tranquility that begs your attention. The meditation and yga room overlooks the mountains and food is very satisfying. The staff were friendly and cooperative ..as we were vegeterians they were happy to prepare meals for us at our request.I must say the only disappointing was that there do NOT HAVE A SPA...it is makeshift facility.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my family stayed for a night. We booked the royal suite Villa. 1. The in room dining is tasteless and over priced2. The outdoor light was all broken. ( Approximately 12 of them )3. The worst breakfast I ever taste and the diarrhea I experienced after.4. Arrogant staff5. Mini bar scam. I called and asked the front desk at the previous evening if the product on the fridge is consumable and complimentary and they said yes. On the we checked out, we are very dissapointed that the man at the front desk told us that it is not complimentary. And forced us to pay the thing that we were told was complimentary.the manager keep saying the whole hotel crew understand that the minibar is not complimentary ,which means I am making up a story so I can steal their cheap sodas. ( Paid the room approximately 500 dollar/night , and it seems the hotel staff thought we can't afford their cheap sodas )
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: How would we describe Saranam? Quirky. Some amazing things and some areas that could be improved with just little tweaks.Gorgeous setting with amazing views. It really is up in the mountains, so the weather was variable during our stay - even though it is the dry season - so plan accordingly.Staff helpful and friendly - even when faced with disgruntled guests, they smiled and were courteous. The room - particularly the bed - was lovely with great views.The pool, cafe and gym were excellent. The entertainment was cute but a little amateurish and there was nothing to do once dinner was eaten. Luckily the TV signal and wifi were good!So now for the easy fixes:1. Bedroom - the musky smell comes from the heat and humidity - we recognise that - but the mould in the shower - behind the shower door - could easily be removed.2. The yoga studio mats are very thin and not nice - need to be replaced more often.3. The food - the set menu choice is too limited - needs to change more often. We didn't know that dinner was either a buffet or set menu until we arrived at the resto the 1st night. To our palette the buffet food was ok but not hot enough and not replenished quickly enough. Same for breakfast - the egg ordering was not efficient but the omelette was lovely once it appeared. Wine was super expensive for average wine and they ran out of rosé twice while we were there.4. Lovely swimming pool - although a bit chilly. The sunbeds however, while comfortable, were very stained.5. Post dinner - why not keep the Café Toya open later into the evening for guests who just want to chill and chat - I am sure us Luxury Escapes clients would all spend even more money that way ;)6. Saranam Resort and SPA - basically 2 bedrooms. I have a very keen sense of smell and the fausty smell of the eye masks and covers was not compelling. For our included massage, there was no music - which was ok as we could running water - until someone started banging something and moving furniture in the room above. I asked if we could have some music and the masseuse said it was not working in the room but she could put her phone on - better than nothing. The actual massage was excellent - one of the best we have had.Would we come back? No, but mainly because there are so many places to go...
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved every moment of our stay at Saranam. Peaceful area, good location for sightseeing in the north of Bali. Lots of tours operated from the hotel daily with a good range of options. We chose the trip to Jatiluwih rice terraces and the temple lake at Candi Kuning. They can also take you to the Git Git waterfalls and Pacung village. We requested a private trip to Sangeh monkey forest (better than the Ubud forest in some people's opinion).Delicious Balinese options at breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Had an amazing view down from L'Altitude restaurant, which is at the very top of the resort, every day. Great place for kids. The kids club is super cute and has a huge cubby house. Not many children here so sometimes the room is not attended. This was fine with us as we wanted to stay and play with her. Good program for older children.Unbelievable warmth and hospitality from all the staff, especially with our 2yo. They let her feed the fish a few times, and won over even our shy toddler. She also loved riding the 'inclinator', a lift from the top to the bottom of the huge property.The spa was modest - not the 'luxury' spa some people might expect from a luxury resort - but the staff were very good at their jobs. We added extra massages to what was offered in our package. Our favourite place was definitely the pool. Perfect water temperature and well taken care of, surrounded by lush gardens. Relaxing music from nearby Cafe Toya and lots of daybeds on the lawn to stretch out on. Good rain showers for a post-swim rinse.Rooms were lovely. Bed soft and luxurious. Again, great views from our suite. While we loved this place, here are a few things we would suggest:- offer room service dining option as part of package deals (we have a little child so sometimes couldn't make it to dinner if she fell asleep)- quicker check-in when arriving late at night - less soft drinks in the mini-bar please (coke and sprite are not the healthiest options)
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time i arrived at this resort we were impressed by the view and the property it self.Located near to every tourism objects.Room was big and the facilities are quite complete.We have to use inclinator when we were about to go to our room, its like AMAZING! Pool are big and facing to the jungle. The view are stunning !However pool were very dirty !!!! I just dip for a moment and went up less than 5 minutes.There was a big jacuzzi as well, and fortunately was clean, however the bubble only ON in the one spot. Breakfast experience was amazing, love the service and the view from the window !!!!However only black coffee and black tea included, we need to pay more for cappucino or latte. Variety of the foods also quite a lot for breakfast.The service was lovely. All the staff are very friendly and well trained !
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very relaxing 7 days as part of a Luxury Escapes package. The staff are so friendly and welcoming. The LE package means you are offered a set menu separate to the a la carte menu, and although limiting after a week you can still have the normal menu and the value of your LE meal is deducted from the price. We spoilt ourselves with pre booking 4 sessions at the day spa so that we wouldn't miss out, and ended up adding more once we got there as the experience was so good. The view from our balcony and the dining area was stunning and would never get tired. Highlights would be the Spice Class with Giday the Head Chef and the cooking class with Sandy. We couldn't fault the staff or service and would love to return.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was lovely, food was great, Staff were amazing. For me the staff here were the difference between good and great. They knew your name and room number after a couple of hours of arriving. Reception staff were super helpful at arranging excursions for us. And our dining waitresses were absolutely fantastic. We miss seeing them every day. So friendly and happy to greet you every meal and no request was too bothersome. Such a lovely place to just chill and relax. Beautiful surrounds. Need to travel to markets or waterfalls etc but that is part of the adventure. Would definitely go back here.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this resort as we wanted to be away from the most touristic and crowded places in Bali, we could not have made a better choice! Saranam resort is a hidden gem, surrounded by magnificent views towards the rice paddies and the lush volcano jungles. Saranam staff is the key factor that will make your stay unforgettable; the most caring, loving, kindest and respectful people I’ve come across with. As a bonus they prepare delicious cocktail/mocktail concoctions made with local farmer fruits. Most of Saranam raw ingredients are sourced organic including meat (whenever possible) and from their own veggie garden; their Balinese cuisine dishes were all tasty and delicious. We found everyday a plate of fresh seasonal fruits, bottles of spring bottled water were supplied very often and the mini bar was refill with the same amount of drinks no matter what we had consumed (impossible to get thirsty here) plus the bed open every night while we were having dinner. Plenty of little details that made our stay magical. Highly recommended, especially if you’re interested in knowing a more authentic Bali.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would have given this place "Excellent" if only the whole place is top notch. Please don't get me wrong, the resort is beautiful and has amazing view of the mountain and rice fields, it's for sure enough to make you feel grateful and relaxed. I just hope the resort will keep the beautiful grounds and buildings in best shape for long time to come. When I was there, I noticed few things that are not working like the water fountains along the path down to the pool, it was left empty and looked so sad. I saw signs of wear and tear like chipped tiles of the floor, peeling paints etc which makes me wonder if they notice that and if they do, hopefully they'll make some necessary renovations. The small details matter, that's all I'm trying to say. Regardless of my view above, the place itself is amazing and just magnificent, a great place to relax and unwind from the beachy scenes down south.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To be honest we booked this week's accommodation for a full week in the mountains to get away from it all after a year of troubled health issues. Well an escape is what we got. There's literally hardly anything else around close by so you're almost forced to relax. We were pleasantly surprised to the upside with the quality of the food. In fact, the Chef was amazing and bent over backwards to meet our requests. The hotel itself is more than comfortable offering Yoga and meditation every day. The massage that I had at the Spa was probably better than what I had in a more expensive hotel the next week at four times the price. The staff were amazing and friendly and always offering to assist in some way. When I left there, I mentioned to my wife that I had never felt so calm and relaxed in quite some time. Highly recommended
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first time to this resort, the location is central Bali up in the mountains: quiet, clean air, amazing views. Swimming pool so large and tranquil. We stayed in the upper section of the hotel, views from our room were fabulous : green hills, rice fields and amazing sunsets. Staff very friendly and helpful, especially hospitality staff. Very relaxing quiet resort.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a location! The views from the restaurant and rooms here is absolutely spectacular. The pool is a bit chilly but idyllic and every view is to the mountains and rice terraces. Truly gorgeous. We loved our 3 days here and used it as a jumping off point for Jatiluwih, Angseri Hot springs, lake beretan and nearby waterfalls. We rented a car each day for approx 50usd and had a wonderful driver who helped with entrance tickets and booking the private sauna rooms at the hot springs. Staff in the hotel are super friendly. Food is great in the beautiful restaurant. Breakfast buffet is generous with eggs cooked to order and a mix of hot and cold choices. Couple of cons. We originally had a room in the lower building but it was very moldy and immediately our noses started running. The front desk upgraded us to another room in the higher building with no fuss. I think they maybe need to close those lower rooms til the mold is sorted out as it would make guests sick if they slept in there. We have two babies so were compelled to move but I can imagine I might not have bothered if I was alone,and would have ended up really ill. My food was cold a couple of times but they were quick to fix it when I asked. Maybe they need to organise their timings with plating up so stuff doesn't have time to go cold? All in all a wonderful stay. The problems we had were fixed quickly and professionally which is all you need. This was our favourite part of our bali trip as we had the space and quiet to unwind and just enjoy the mountain surroundings.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went to this place for a “spa get away” we booked a 3 hour package. The hotel woke us up at 7am to confirm the booking. We didn’t go on any tour that day as we were gonna start around 3pm. We arrive at the spa on time and they messed up the booking said they didn’t know about us. We complained to spa desk and they told us “miscommunication” and said we could have a one hour massage at separate times. Not even a sincere apology. You made a mistake and you made zero effort to fix it. Your breakfast was also always cold...
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The scenery is amazing, lush greenery & rice fields. This place is designed to accentuate its natural landscape. The room is superb, very comfy bed and have all the necessity you need during the stay. Many choices for breakfast and all is delicious. The resort also offered many activity for adults such as yoga, trekking, learning Balinese culture; and for kids too, the kids club is amazing. Will be back if we're visiting bali again. Very recommended
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you’re looking for a Bali holiday where you walk out of the hotel and into a crazy busy shopping environment this may not be for you. The location is in the mountains so make the most of it. Having travelled to Bali several times it was nice to get out and visit highlights in the mountains. We stayed for 7 days on a luxury escape package. Met other visitors, did yoga every day in some beautiful settings, massages & facials. Food was fresh and simple. Try the Rum Bongo cocktail. Came home very relaxed. Enjoy.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot believe the reviews I am reading. We are trying to get dinner and drinks - not too much to expect from a restaurant? It’s 8 pm. They have run out of 2 of the starters on the menu. We have been waiting 25 minutes for our drinks. No one appears to have a clue what is going on.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros:1. Good location. Though it is still 15 minutes to Bedugul, I found the location brilliant. It is surrounded by rice fields and lush forest. The traditional pasar is also near2. Great design. The design perfectly highlights the location and the view. You can see a majestic rice-fields and valley from almost every point of the resort (lobby, restaurant, pool, room)3. Our room is on the higher floor so the view is super beautiful. The room is not too big and not too small but very convenient. Bathroom is spacious. The bed is very comfy. Balcony is large enough for lounging while enjoying the view. Electricity sockets are properly located as well as all lighting switches. We love how practicality is not sacrificed for the sake of design4. The food in the restaurant is amazing especially the desserts. We had a dinner in the restaurant and the lava cake is super. But the hot dishes are also fantastic, Try the chicken thigh it is wonderful. Breakfast menu is pretty limited but again the taste is great. Strawberry juice is lovely5. The service in the restaurant is also fantastic. Our waitress is super friendly and helpful6. The resort offers variety of activities which we love a lot. There are morning yoga, trekking, cooking class, and learning Balinese language7. The swimming pool area is really the highlight of the resort. We really love the view and spaciousness of the area. You can do jogging around the spacious lawn or simply use the gym which located around the swimming pool too. There are enough sun loungers to useCons:1. Our luggage handler is not very friendly and seems in a hurry 2. If only the pool has a heater it would be one of the best hotel pools in mountain area in Bali. The heater might also attract more guests to use it and generate extra revenue for the resort3. The management need to take extra care of the maintenance as some area are dirty and not attended by staff4. The TV is not very clear but this is not very important as we spent most of our time outside our roomOverall, we love this resort and will definitely comeback. As mentioned in the title of my review, this resort has a huge potential to be on par with Padma, Alila, and Maya Ubud. Just need extra promotion and better maintenance to achieve it.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a short wonderful experience. Everything was beyond my expectation. I love the room, I love the stunning Mountain view from my balcony. This Resort surrounded by breathtaking view. It is very good and highly recommended if you want to have a quiet place for escape from your busy routine. The resort offers you many choices of daily activities. Friendly staffs, good service. The lady at the Restaurant were so nice but I didn't know her name. Thank to Mr. Sova (or Sofa?) at the Front Desk he was super kind and helpful. Also Mr. Arta who escorted me upon check in. They were so warm and I feel so comfortable, unfortunately it was a short stay. I wish I could stay longer but I will definitely comeback again next year!!!! Last but not least, Thanks to Mr. Alessandro the General Manager for making my stay memorable, he was so kind.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What started out as a quick stop for lunch ended up being one of the highlights of our trip. The lunch offering was a buffet that looked incredible but we weren't hungry enough to do it justice. We ordered some delicious a la carte items and were impressed with the views, food and service. What really blew us away was the deal they had offering a one night stay, dinner and breakfast for only 1200000 Rupiah net for TWO PEOPLE! (About $108 Canadian dollars) Even though we had an Air BnB back in Sanur, we decided to stay! This resort has incredible views of rice terraces, mountain vistas and amazing sunsets. The dinner and breakfast were great along with the service. There was a slight mix up when we checked in our room as it wasn't quite ready, but it was a non-issue as we were going to spend some time around the gorgeous infinity pool anyway. When our room was ready, it was clean, comfortable and had all the toiletries we needed as this was an unplanned overnight stay. One of the best parts was when we checked out, a manager apologized for the room not being ready and offered us a free upgrade next time we visit. (Which we intend to do!) It was a non issue and they wanted to make it right regardless. Highly recommended. We wish we have had more time to partake in the many, many activities they offered.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: rooms look bigger and more beautiful on hotel site. Nice location, nice view ! Breakfast service was slow- many bees on the breakfast buffet :-( Swimmingpool was very cold !Evevators are very slow, many stairs but good for our condition... dishes in restaurant are minimalist small. Dish with salmon...needed magnifying glass to find a piece of salmon.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 5 nights at this resort as we wanted to see another part of Bali and have an opportunity to really relax. This resort enables you to truly relax in beautiful surroundings. The view is absolutely spectacular and you're able to take in the view from your room, from breakfast and from the gym/pool. We were upgraded to a junior suite which we were thankful for as we had a day spa treatment in one of the standard rooms (they had no actual Day Spa set up) and as per other reviews, it was very damp and uncomfortable. Our Junior Suite room was very spacious and comfortable however on our first night we were missing a lot of bits and pieces such as shampoo/conditioner, body wash, milk, and one of our pillows was very dirty. This was all rectified the following day though so no big issue. The main restaurant is a real let down with a very basic and overpriced menu. The cafe down by the pool however, was amazing with so much fresh, delicious food - I highly recommend the buckwheat pasta. The free activities at the resort such as yoga, meditation and Bahasa Indonesia were a great inclusion & lots of fun.
