There is not much to do within close proximity outside the resort, many guests took a day trip to Ubud. We enjoyed our stay at Saranam Resort but there definitely needs to be better attention to detail to justify a 5* rating.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank u for make happed our anniversaryFor cake amenities Good hotel good view nice pool Nice ambience for resort ,,friendly staff and help full specially Julia receptionist staffOverall good and recommend hotel for holiday when you come to bali spend time whole day with couple or family
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just left Saranam and have to say we were not impressed at all. The view is actually really nice but lack of staff made it very difficult to enjoy our stay. The staff were really nice but you can obviously see that there is not enough of them. There is a restaurant near the pool but when we arrived it was closed due to the toilet issues so there was nobody to serve the drinks. The next day when the large group arrived for the seminar the restaurant was open but had private function but even then we could not order a drink. Obviously the large groups are much more important for them than holiday makers. The food at the restaurant upstairs are trying to be upmarket so it’s overpriced but the food is not that great so we decided to skip few lunches and dinner.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first ever 1 star review.Pros: The location of this resort is absolutely, jaw-droppingly beautiful.Cons: Everything else.We paid for a deluxe king room though luxury escapes.We were early for check in on 25/10, as we wanted to make the most of our day. We were told the hotel had no transport and could not organise any transport for us. We wish the resort could have told us this prior to our arrival, as we would have made arrangements ourself. This is very odd, as even our budget accommodation stays have been able to provide this.Luckily, we found a driver off the street. That afternoon we finally checked in. However, we found that construction was taking place directly outside our room. It was extremely noisy, as boulders were being split into pieces and removed from the ground. We were told they could move us to the same type of room, however when we were shown the new room it was actually a downgrade (smaller and only a queen bed). The new room smelt, however we were very tired so tolerated it. We covered the drains and assumed it might dissipate. Wrong. The next morning we awoke feeling nauseas to an extremely strong ammonia gas that was foul, and enough to make one light-headed. It took an hour before a staff member would come to look at it, and the smell was so awful that even with the drains covered the man refused to walk into the bathroom. We could still smell it strongly on the balcony. It was clearly a safety hazard, yet we were offered a de-humidifier at first (from staff who would not enter the room let alone stay in it?!).We've stayed in many places where drain smells are inescapable - but this was different. The gas that was being emitted even after covering the drain and blocking the door with towels was eye-watering.The staff then said they would make up a third room for us on a lower level (a second room downgrade), however we would again have to wait until the afternoon, and by now we had already wasted so much time. We checked online and read reviews from people who left the resort early because the lower levels are very mouldly, which is not suitable as I have asthma and high levels of mould spores would put my health at risk. As a result, we had no choice but to leave. We are extremely disappointed that the room we paid for was not able to be provided, and concerned about the questionable sanitation system of this resort.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for six days and enjoyed every minute. Every day there were at least six activities on offer, all free. There was also one paid excursion that was well worth the money - up to Beretan Lake and the temples there, and then to a local market. Our resort guide was extremely knowledgeable, which made it far more interesting than if we had gone there on our own. It gave us a true feel for the area and the people. Other activities at the resort were yoga, water aerobics, guided walking tour of the local area, etc etc. The nature walk of the rice paddies and organic gardens gave us an insight into traditional farming. The swimming pool was clean, with no chemical odour like some places. Very friendly staff, and the chef was wonderful in catering for my special and complex dietary needs. The massages were divine. Wish we'd booked for a longer stay. I was very pleased that it gave us an opportunity to see how the regional Balinese people live as it's not a "touristy" area. But the resort facilities, including our room, were luxurious.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent place promote wellness. It is a healing place. It is place to switch of and relax. Beautiful seenery. Free yoga and meditation classes. The resort is far away from busy city . It promotes feelings of rejuvenation. Organic foods, five stars service. You feel the feeling of the relaxiton. You can swim, enjoy for a massage. The Saranam hotel is a place I recommend for everybody who wants a relaxing good quality holiday. I will come back again.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second stay at the resort having stayed 4 nights last year with husband I came back for 5 nights with my mother. Overall, the staff are very friendly and accommodating so whilst the resort covers a big physical space, you feel like you could be in a friendly smaller run resort. I feel the experience of this hotel depends on the room. We had a room on the second floor of the main building close to the second inclinator. I couldn't stand the constant grinding of the inclinator and the resort moved us to a villa after the first night. The villas are in a quiet part of the resort and therefore much nicer to rest on the balcony so it is something to think about when booking a room and if you plan not too spend too much time in your room the inclinator wouldn't be an issue. I didn't want that background noise on my holiday when I live in a busy city! My mum had her second hip replacement earlier this year and was looking forward to resting at this resort. She loved it, found it very good for recovery and enjoyed the cleanliness of the pool. The resort offers fun daily activities to help pass the time and there are some really nice places to see in the local area. We enjoyed the food on the menu made from local foods and found the local warungs nice to break up the resort food. I have given it four stars because of the room issue which was resolved and because they haven't set up a proper spa area since the last time I visited. I believe a resort like this is missing out on business because they haven't finished their spa centre in the time the resort has been opened. Having said that, we did get two facials in the 5 days we were there but was looking forward to a pedicure as well, which they offered last year but won't have available they said for another month or two. I also really like the gym and where it is located in the resort.Overall, we would be happy to stay here again if we visit this area of Bali and feel we will next year as there is still so much to see and experience in this beautiful part of Bali. We hired a tourist driver from the local area to drive us to Ubud one day, it would be nice if the resort run a shuttle at least once a week like they do to the temple and I would have been happy to pay a small amount. Finally, they were using paper straws in my drinks which is a huge positive for me however the complimentary water bottles in the room are no longer in glass, but plastic. I feel it would be a nice touch to have these in glass as they must go through a lot of plastic this year.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in Hill Top Villa. To reach the Villa; from the lobby, get off using the elevator then inclinator. The inclinator was quiet slow. Then we were taken by buggy to Villa. The Villa is high up and steep, however it's nice villa and has amazing view. At night, outside the villa and path were very poor lighting.For 5-star hotel, the design of hanging space in wardrobe is weird (see pic).Good size bathroom but the amenities is not represent 5-star hotel. Kids Club near main pool.Breakfast was average. But you can enjoy morning view while you are enjoying breakfast. It'stunning view...Chek-in/check-out process was quick. Staff was friendly and helpful.Overall, we enjoyed our stay.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Been to Bali numerous times but first time to this area and resort. Only been open a year so everything is new. We have a deluxe room and the view is fabulous. Food is outstanding and had one of the best massages. Great place to just chill, try yoga, meditation if you want. Highly recommend. Is a 2 he drive from airport but well worth it. Staff are very friendly and obliging.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just want to put a few of the negative comments on this forum into perspective , firstly you can always find fault with anything if you want to look for it , secondly you pay for want you get and sometimes you get value for your money and that is what I want to share with you. The Luxury Escape 5 night stay was in a quality room with balcony ,unlimited WI-FI , 42 channel TV with a large English content ,large bathroom , soft bed with a turn down service every night may I say, reading desk , safe , Tea / coffee and daily fresh fruit . Each day breakfast ,lunch , dinner served in 2 areas ( menus attached) , 4 massages , daily refill of mini bar ( beer , soft drink , sparkling water ), 6 free daily activities to choose from, a tour to Beratan Lake & Temple ,a coffee farm & a local market at a cost of AUS $10 for the 2 1/2 hour tour the resort also provided a drop off at the airport in a private car which is a 2 hour drive all the cost of $999 , that is value for money .The staff and manager were warm , friendly and helpful , spoke good English and genuinely cared for your well being , the resort is beautifully set out on the side of a hill with stunning views from your room and whilst eating in the restaurant , the food is of a high standard with a choice menu for lunch or dinner with the option of the buffet for dinner , the head chef even does an cooking actively. We celebrated our wedding anniversary I asked the staff where to purchase flowers they said leave it to us , later that night going for dinner they had set up a table, organised a menu ,special anniversary cake making the night very very special. Overall the negatives comments need to be balances with the many positives myself and other guests spoke with each other about . I would have no hesitation in returning to the Saranam Resort & Spa and will recommend to anyone, thank you Mr Alessandro Migliore and your staff for amking our stay so memorable .
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Looking on the pictures of the hotel, we thought we had found our next superb 5-star hotel in the nature of Bali. But except for the view, we didn't find anything from a 5* hotel. First of all, the greetings may happen in a gigantic room with a splendid view on the valley and mountains, it seriously lacked warmth and smiles from the staff for a hotel of this standing... For sure, we hadn't reserved a villa (which externally look really nice, I must admit), just a basic double bedroom for a one-night stay to decrease our driving time between two hotels. But after almost 10 minutes walking and waiting for the elevator to get to the room, we discovered that our room was extremely -extremely- humid and had the weird humid corresponding smell that didn't make us want to sleep in here. Some stains were seeable on the bed cover; the floor from the shower was partially broken in a corner and showed starting moisture; finally, sitting on the toilet let your knees only 10cm room with the facing wall - such unpleasant things can not be found in a regular 5* hotel, even in the most basic room. The restaurant was ok but the diner was pretty far from our expectations and corresponded far more to a 3* hotel - really, there is room for improvement. The breakfast was better. All in all, we wished we had skipped this hotel and gone directly to the next one in Kintamani. Definitely not what we expected.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The view from the lobby of this hotel takes your breath away! And we had the same view from our room so we were very lucky. The room was very clean and big, the mini bar which was free of charge was refilled every day. I agree the LE menus are limited but you do have the option to have a buffet dinner every night which always changed, and there are 4 or 5 options for each course on the set menu (plus there are two restaurants to choose from). The massages were AMAZING unfortunately there is no spa it is in a rather dingey hotel room, this would be my only improvement. Cannot fault the ladies doing the massage though. Happy hour every evening made cocktails etc affordable and there was always space by the pool (which is huge and refreshing). Aqua aerobics was hilarious can highly recommend. We loved our stay thank you very much.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We did originally book a twin room and then was given a free upgrade to villa N°3. We were taken by buggy and could request it at any time. Although the rooms and villas are very tricky to get to as the inclinators (it’s like a lift) are very slow. It’s layout was incredible and the views of the rice paddi fields and the rest of the resort were amazing. But very unclean, the dust from beneath the beds and on worktops was vile! A tiny place under the stairs for wardrobe “space” and the mini bar was empty upon arrival and still wasn’t filled properly when asked! When housekeeping came everyday they would never take dirty cutlery from room service or used glasses from the night before. Speaking of room service -it’s average and extremely overpriced. You could eat in the local warung’s for 5 nights on the trot for the same price and same quality! Hotel is supposed to be for relaxation and for trips to the spa. The spa hasn’t even been finished built! And as for relaxation I do not appreciate falling asleep or waking up to techno or house music. As for the restaurant very basic, not worth the money. The steak was extremely thin not like a ribeye at all and the lamb had barely any meat on the bones, the burger was abit bland and I asked for medium not well done very disappointing. Although I did have a soft spot for the traditional desert ‘pissang goreng’ and because of that I ordered it the second night and it was just all slapped on to the plate. Considering a lot of staff do not speak a lot of English there was a lady called Carolina who could not do enough for you and spoke incredible English, her service was perfect Infact I could not fault Carolina as she was very warm and friendly. This hotel has EXTREME POTENTIAL. But I just don’t think anyone quite knows what there doing. This could be a dime spot but do not advertise as “relaxing resort and spa” when I’m being subjected to listen to cheesy pool party songs, if I wanted that I’d go to Benidorm!!!! Although Great things nearby -the waterfalls, unesco rice paddi fields, Local tea and coffee plantations and the floating temple. Highly recommend the trips! The last four are of those, the rest the hotel
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Oh how did I look forward to this place All looked amazing on paper!!!It’s what comes from top management down is what makes a place memorable!!!So where do I start!!!The only person who saved this place was a young man who had AMAZING customer relationship skills!!! At check In Suyasa KomangRoom noise from inclinator please refuse any rooms on level 150 and upThis machine is a killer plus management KNOWS!!!!!We arrived later in the day by dusk Showed the room 156 Excellent I was in heaven!!!Spacious room nice decor nothing to fault However as I opened the veranda door I could hear this roar of a noise .I lay on the bed ...grrrrrrrrrrrrrr is all I heard Off I went to reception explaining I would not unpack and need a quite room I believe it was my honest determination of truthfulness that made it happen After a while we were told all booked but could have a villa BUT high up and very steep!!!At this stage I would have walked up Mt Everest just to get peace and quite!!!So we had the noise solvedThank god we are younger at age as the steep walk would have meant to get transport up and down every day which we did not need 2No space to hang up clothesSee attached photo Where on earth could I hang my dresses I asked for a solution They placed a hanging trolley in the room(5star resort !!!)3FoodWe stayed 7 nightsEvery day same food and COLD!!!!The best was the coffee!!!4 StaffLovely people They did their utmost However had not much training!!!5Full dining!!!As we had prepaid!!! One night we were told all booked out We could see all tables had reserved but it was 3/4 empty In the end we got a table right at the entrance Bearing in mind we were long staying clients!!!!!!We have stayed with luxury escapes before and were over the moon Bali Nusa Dua 2017 Grand HyattNow we are staying at TSSuites in Seminyak This too is wonderful Please just don’t expect anything if you go to Saranam Don’t accept any room with the inclinator noise Refuse to unpackA special thank you to the young man Teacher who was wonderful in yoga meditation and walking excursions I love the Balinese people as they are so giving and work hard However I have no time for management in their ivory towers who know damn right there is problems at the coalface and do NOTHING I was watching the same young man who dealt with us at check in as he had to deal with so many complaints it was not funnyPlus none was his faultHe was so polite and helpful Hat of to him I truly hope management will take this to heart and change things so that other tourists will have a great timeThank you
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 5 nights in the Hill Top Villa with the Luxury Escape package. The villa was nice but very basic, not a lot of room but a lovely 4 poster bed, no storage or hanging space. An electric kettle with no where to plug in and 2 cups is the only facility. Good size bathroom that was clean but not sparkling. Good hairdryer. When we had used the first shampoo and soap it was replenished with very budget plain packs. Great towels.We were in the top villa, very poor lighting up the hill path, none outside the villa. there is the golf carts to assist however these are unmanned so to avail yourself would have to go up the single inclinator, plus elevator then back to get a ride. The inclinator is a good idea however just like having a very slow lift (only one) for the whole large hotel.The food on the package is terrible... this was marketed as a health and wellness retreat! we had one menu, one page(see the photo) for lunch AND dinner for all 5 days! the chefs choice was often not available and many of the other dishes when asked were also not available. and the dining area so dark everyone was using cell phones to read menu and even see their food.There is no Spa!! this isn't a new hotel but the Spa hasn't been made yet??? go figure?? lovely ladies working out of a damp, smelling empty hotel room. Massage ladies devine... the only thing we were impressed with :) Jacuzzi doesn't work.There is absolutely zero entertainment in the evenings... the same repetitive sound track of instrumental sounds played all day and evening??? the restaurant at the top has no atmosphere and slow service... again the same set menu for the whole time!We were bored with the food, bored with the hotel. Very happy to leave. Don't recommend at all!! I know the hotel manager will respond with BUT it was a package deal and a good price... which is true however we had purchased a LUXURY escape as a treat not to be treated like the budget guests at a hotel.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at the royal tulip saranam resort and spa and were very fortunate to be up graded to a villa but we had no hanging space except for a few shirt length articles and one drawer in the stair ( the other one did not open at all , so we lived out of our suitcases .) The views are spectacular every where you look ( a photographers dream ) so for that we were happy but for a resort that touted yoga and healthy eating as a draw card that’s where I truly think that they should not mention the word yoga as it is simply a small room with a few mats and as far as the healthy eating goes well it is truly a job in itself to find anything on the restricted luxury escapes menu that is super healthy , tasty or innovative ( some in fact I could not even eat and I hate wasting food ( one meal in particular I won’t forget was the pile of green peas ,chickpeas and carrots, no dressing with a few slices of corn cake . It was so bland and had no taste and I would say took no skill at all . ) Now I know that the manager Alessandro M . will reply to this by saying that we only paid a reduced special rate but I would counter that by saying that just because we were lucky enough to get that special deal doesn’t mean we don’t have access to the whole menus unless we pay for it as an extra . The meals were included in our deal why give us vouchers so we have the restricted menus and quite honestly felt like we were second class guests . Surely the special rate that we were lucky to get is an incentive for us to recommend you to other people . The gym has a damp smell that is caused from leaks coming from the roof that are obvious and the spa was not working whilst we were here as well as the inclinator that does not stop at number 2 door . We had probably the best massages we have ever had but the massage room ambience was lost when they had relocated that to an empty hotel room that smelt damp and dank and had a water leak on the floor ( towels were placed there to prevent clients from slipping ) Another negative was we were told at breakfast we could not be seated at a particular table because it was for 4 only but as we stood there another couple walked in to that table and sat down .........Another positive is the staff , they have been very attentive and always smiling so that was nice to see . We will sadly not be recommending any of our friends to this place as it was such a disappointment , it really is so easy to supply and offer great tasting food !!!
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've been so spoiled. The food was great and so was the service. A beautiful and tranquil place to enjoy peace and quiet. The staff were all so welcoming. Massages and activities are perfect as well. Thank you!!
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Big buildings with modern rooms admittedly lacking charm... but the view on the valley is great from all places in the hotel. Good pool area, greatly appreciated by the kids. Good restaurant - breakfast and dinner.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were so disappointed with this Luxury Escape trip. We spent 5 nights and were considering leaving earlier. The meals were terrible, cold and the same menu everyday. The rooms were damp, the staff friendly however communication with nearly all of them with the exception of a lovely waitress in the restaurant was difficult. The rooms were damp and smelly, the inclinator was very noisy and there was absolutely no information available on any tours or sightseeing. There was no courtesy bus to take you anywhere and the hotel arranged transport was very expensive. We survived the earthquake which was terrifying and the management was very disorganised with Hotel guests on the lower floors, not being notified that we were to evacuate. The scenery was pretty when the clouds cleared away, but it was freezing !!!!. Several activities were cancelled due to the weather and the overall cleanliness was poor. I was shocked that a supposedly 5 star hotel only had a two slice toaster in operation for breakfast, really !!!! get your act together but we certainly will never go back.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a Luxury Escape 5 nights package. The view from our 1st floor room is nice. Earlier they had a different food menu for Luxury Escapes package but after few guest's complaints, they included everything in the dining menu. The staffs are helpful and always carries a smile on their face, although not fluent in English.The most notable part of our trip is the 7.0 scale earthquake that hit nearby Lombok island, the entire hotel was oscillating like crazy, all guests were scared, fortunately, no injury or damage was there!Overall, it is a nice resort for 2-3 nights stay, 5 nights stay sometimes feel boring as the resort is far away from most of the tourist attractions. The weather is cold and it rains almost every day in the afternoon.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked from Sydney as a Luxury Escape 5 night package at a fab discount. Included all activities and all meals. The trip from the airport for 1.5 hours was included. If you want a noisy activity heavy holiday this is NOT the place for you. I wanted to wind down with yoga and meditation, some cultural pursuits, massage and swimming. All of these were great though some days were too cool to swim. The outlook is beautiful, the trip to the temple and lake was great, close by, but too short. I should have asked for a day trip. All of the staff were lovely. They should all be praised for their helpfulness & beautiful smiles.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I have just spent five wonderful nights at this resort. It is a magical place, high in the mountains. Every afternoon the mist comes down and one night sitting in the restaurant with all windows open to the spectacular view, the mist filled the room and created a fairyland. Staff are beautiful, they cannot do enough to please and I have to say our bed was the BEST we have ever slept in all around the world.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just spend three nights at the Royal Tulip Saranam, after a 2 hours ride from the airport, we were pleasently surprised by the beautiful view from the hotel room (we booked a deluxe room), which was located at nearest the highest point. The hotel and pool area were quiet and relaxed, however they may have been too little sun beds for the amount of guests. Staff is very friendly and very much trying to accommodate in any need, however it is far from five star service. The rooms are spacious, but noisy, we were often woken by other guests in nearby rooms. The breakfast is terrible and requires a great deal of attention. There’s flies and other insects on the buffet, the bread was hard and the scrambled eggs tasted and looked like plastic. Overall prices are higher than in the rest of bali (let’s say 1,5 times the average). In case you are planning to stay at this hotel, don’t forget to book a taxi in advance, since it will take them up to an hour to get to the hotel (we ended up booking a private driver for 700k rp).
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is new, rooms are good. Staff is not competent and not used to work in an hotel of such category. Our smartphone has been stolen in our room during diner. It took 2 days to the direction to see the image of CCTV. A room boy came into the room during our dîner, but it was not sufficient proof for the hotel ! Incredible !!Prices are really expensive : lunch and diner are twice the price of other hotels, for a similar quality.Kids club is well furnished, but staff is totaly bad : at first we had to wait for 1 hour to find someone to take care of the kids. There was an activity to build kites, but there was not string to fly them !!disappointing for our kids !
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 4 nights here in a beautifully appointed mountain view room with amazing sweeping views of the valley and rice fields below from our balcony, bedroom and even bathroom. The day we checked in was extremely busy due to end of Ramadan and school holidays so the hotel was stretched to the limit and we had to wait until 4pm to get into our 2pm check in room.We were tired and there was no offer to compensate for our inconvenience (just a free drink in the bar would have helped) There seemed to be no plan in place to cater for such times including breakfast service. After that the rest of the days were quiet and things ran smoothly. Breakfast buffet was superb in a beautiful setting overlooking the gorgeous view. The coffee was fantastic! We ate in both their restaurants but were disappointed that we could not have Two Islands wine by the glass (as per the menu) When enquiring we found they did have bottles of such wine but they did not offer to open them for single pours.We suggested that we had a bottle with us to take to dinner but they came back that the corkage fee would cost as much as buying a bottle! The main restaurant, l'Altitude's menu was quite limited and expensive and we were surprised how empty it was for a hotel that was fully booked. The next night we tried the other restaurant, Toya,at the bottom of the complex reached by inclinator and found the menu very enticing and it delivered an excellent dinner - a beautifully presented Himalayan salt and pepper cured salmon with radish and wasabi, mains of chicken sous vide beautifully cooked and an innovative beef rendang. By this time they did have Two Islands wine by the glass - yay.Though we had a rocky start we really enjoyed our stay in the hills visiting the botanical gardens, market and Jatiluwih rice fields. We can recommend this resort and with a few minor adjustments we would have rated higher.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is impressive and I highly recommend it.The check in was great and the staff seemed open to accommodate any reasonable request. The rooms and facilities of this hotel are one of the best I have seen in South East Asia. The view of the mountains and rice-trass is amazing. I walked couple of time to Baturiti town (10-15 minutes) and really enjoyed the market. Very happy with our choice.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice view, great food, competitive price, stay with family very enjoy, good for honeymoon also never get boring. One thing may be hotel need to have warm pool cause the pool is cold even day sun.Good breakfast, hope can be back soon. Many thanks.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We wanted a place to rest and enjoy the beautiful country side, it was perfect. Quiet, comfortable and staff were great (as they always are in Bali). The pool area is superb with great views of the rice fields and scenery.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: hey please help me.i accidently choosed wrong check in date. instead of 7 july i choosed 6 jun. please i want to change my check in date. please i am not that much rich. i made a mistake.its my humble request please help me. my booking was on agoda :booking id 277326545i beg. for help.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has and amazing view on the valley and the rice fields.The hotel is a very big building but in harmony with the nature.The staff is kind.It is a luxury hotel but with some inattention: in the room there is a bad smell of humidity and in the toilet a bad small of sewer, you can hear what your neighbor are doing alla the night. And the don’t fill us the free fourniture in the room (tea, camomille , soap...).The breakfast is very good and with a large choice.We had a Balinese massage (very good moment) you have to fill a number of question asking you which part of the body you want to mass more and the do what they want. The massage for 90min is about 720k.You can rent a driver with them, 160k per hour, is better if you can find another one by your self.The restaurant is quiet good.The city of bedugul is not near to the hotel and there are not a lot of restaurants in the neighborhood, so you are obliged to spend your time in the hotel if you don’t have a driver.
hotelName:
13    Saranam Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I have just got back from two weeks at Puri Bagus Candidasa. We had a fantastic time there, the room was lovely, clean and comfortable. All the staff were very friendly and attentive, they quickly learned our names and addressed us with a friendly greeting each time. We ate in the hotel a few times and the food was very good. Candidasa itself is a 10-15 minute walk away, although lots of restaurants there will transport you if you want. It’s a quiet town, with plenty of great restaurants and dive centres . Aimed at 50-60 age groups. We took trips to nearby beaches, markets, gardens and palaces. Also did a boat trip to a good snorkelling location. We made friends with a local who showed us around his family farm and home. Typical of how kind and welcoming the Balinese people are. Wonderful hotel and a great holiday.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you were to come to Candidasa, but wanted to stay out of the busy tourist area, this is the place to be. Only 5 minutes away from the buzz, you find Puri Bagus with its beautiful garden and fine pool. The staff in the hotel is great, as they are very helpful and open to suggestions. The rooms are spacious and well maintained. Ours was a garden view deluxe room, but we could see a bit of the sea as well. Not that you’ll spend much time in your room though. You can chill out at the pool or at the gazebo’s on the seaside. There is no beach at this hotel, but the water in the pool is of perfect quality. Beach/Pool towels are provided at the pool for free. Next to the pool there is a small restaurant for lunch and dinner. Dining upstairs in the restaurant is also possible.Are there no downsides? Yes, unfortunately there are two. The hotel asks you not to consume anything you bring from outside the resort, on their premises. There is no shop on-site and the minibar menu is very limited. There are no bar snacks. We considered this a minus. On our first night we had an absolutely underwhelming dinner. The indonesian food on the menu is limited (mostly western, but the kitchen staff is Indonesian), and it seems the crew doesn’t master all dishes. We suggested to slim down the menu, and only serve amazing food that matches the surroundings. We hope management takes our suggestion into consideration. As of now, we decided to go off-site for dinner the remaining two nights. For that we ended up with Vincent’s in the town.Should you want to explore Candidasa, the hotel has two basic bikes available, which you can use if available. Nothing fancy, but good enough to save you the walk and have a nice look around.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We hadn't been to Puri Bagus for a few years and had forgotten what a relaxing, peaceful place it is to stay. We were welcomed back and some of the staff remembered us which was really wonderful. All the staff are very friendly and are always willing to help. Breakfasts are really nice and we especially like the garden restaurant. The pool area is a pleasant place to read, relax or swim.It is only a short walk to the main street with a selection of cafes and restaurants.We will be back.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Puri Bagas for eight nights earlier this month.We were looking for a relaxing place to celebrate a significant birthday and definitely made the right choice.Our sea front bungalow was extremely comfortable, spacious and has an amazing ocean view.The outdoor bathroom was very nice with the only drawback being its proximity to the one next door.Breakfasts served in the upstairs restaurant were very good {either a la carte or buffet depending on the hotels level of occupancy) and the evening meals and cocktails we enjoyed at the poolside bar were also excellent.The location of the hotel directly on the beach and set in lovely well maintained gardens with a great swimming pool was ideal. The beach itself is not exceptional but is sheltered enough to swim safely in. Hopefully future restoration work will return it to the way it used to be.It only takes ten minutes to walk to the main street in Candidasa (a free shuttle service is also available) and there are plenty of good restaurants of varying prices to choose from as well as a reasonable number of shops.The biggest highlight of our stay however has to have been the amazing staff.The Manager, reception staff,room attendants,pool attendants,gardeners,restaurant and bar staff (including the lovely trainees) were all really welcoming and we were always greeted with friendly smiles. To be greeted at our door by a large contingent of staff songing Happy Birthday and presenting me with a nice birthday cake was a special and very nice surprise.We had a wonderful stay and hope to return.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were visiting here for business purposes but decided to take a break at this lovely location on the water. Our breakfast was included with our villa and with the dining room overlooking the ocean it made for a very pleasant morning coffee. Staff arranged a charming and well informed driver to take us to the Water Palace. This adventure was the highlight of our Bali trip. Room service was excellent and well received after a long day of sight seeing. We will return on our next trip. Thank you for a lovely stay.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Puri Bagus Candidasa for the first two nights of our tour of Bali and we were thoroughly impressed with the wonderful location, beautiful hotel and traditional villas which were extremely comfortable with wonderful outside showers. We enjoyed a welcome massage and traditional Candidsa full body massage which was absolutely incredible and probably the best massages we have ever had and the spa was set in beautiful surroundings, we felt truly relaxed and tranquil after our massages. Breakfast and dinner were exceptional with the most beautiful fresh food and drinks, we enjoyed all our meals and trying different Balinese food. Having a cooking lesson at our table of the traditional steam boat was wonderful and we truly enjoyed speaking and getting to know all the staff that looked after us. You gave us the best start to a holiday we will never forget, thank you!!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came now for the 9th (!!) time to this hotel.Here we feel really at home. Very nice room, everything clean, extraordinary good service, beautiful pool. The garden looks like paradise.And when you like snorkeling or diving: it is all there.But the most important is:The staff, from manager to gardner, are so friendly, you would not expect this in a hotel.So, if you want to feel very well and have a wonderful vacation: come to Puri Bagus Candidasa!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: During our eight night stay, the staff was extremely helpful and kind. Located at the end of the Candidasa beach, the small resort was very peaceful. The villas with high ceilings, large bedroom and bathroom with outdoor shower were serviced twice a day. What made our visit so enjoyable was the staff. The food , including afternoon tea with pastries, was delicious as well as gluten-free for me. We ate most dinners at the resort overlooking the water listening to Balinese music. We took a guided trek through rice paddies and jungles and visited several traditional Balinese villages. Another day, a driver took us on a six hour trip to visit a floating palace, fishing villages and white sand beaches and in very good English told us about the culture, religion, education and economy of Bali. We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have enjoyed the warm and genuine hospitality of Puri Bagus three times in the last four years. For each of my stays, with my family and twice with a large group of 30, the resort exceeded our expectations. The staff is professional and well informed on the local tourist options. Within the lovely resort grounds, Krisna, the General Manager and Ayarthi, the Quality Manager, lead a friendly staff that anticipate your needs and seamlessly accommodate your requests. In the beautiful restaurant, Sudiastari, oversees an delicious selection of Indonesian and Western foods. She and all of the restaurant staff are almost as fantastic as the view. I felt privileged to be their guest. My pre and young teen kids were treated respectfully and had an incredible experience exploring the grounds and hanging out at the pool. The cooking classes were excellent and really fun. (I’m a professional chef) Though I didn’t experience the yoga or spa, friends positively commented on their experience. As the sign in the room reminds your “Bali is not heaven...”. I wish the beach in front of the hotel were restored to its former state, and efforts are underway to restore the protective reef. When everyone hits the restaurant at the same time, there might be a wait. The facilities are not brand new but are very clean and well maintained. Great beaches, and diving, and hiking, and restaurants are close by. I have plans to return in both summer ‘19 and ‘20. You should too, but not at the same time!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was glad to find well-designed villas in this property. Big, modern and very clean kept. The floor was shining in sunlight. Plenty of space, bed comfortable and bathroom well equipped. It was outdoors - yes - that took a while to get used to. Coffee and tea making facilities well appreciated. I was lucky to have my villa in the end of the lane, and was able to enjoy my morning cup of tea in peace and harmony. The gardens and pool area were kept clean. Pool attendant did his work attentively. Canopies pure luxury. Pity the beach - you could not walk along the beach for more than few hundred meters. Breakfast was good. Service too - a bit slowly occasionally. Some problems with comprehending English language. Within easy reach of the hotel are couple of local restaurants, which serve very tasty meals. Walking distance to the shopping street and lily pond and temple manageable.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Puri Bagus does not disappoint. From the splendid welcome from individual staff and the management team they ensure everything thing you need to feel special. This is our third time to stay. The traditional influence remains strong, the resort gardens and accommodation are excellent and beautifully maintained and manages to convey Ballinese culture and values at a high standard.Food is excellent and encouraged me to take part in a cooking class. I was transported to the market early in the morning to purchase ingredients for the menu agreed with the kitchen head cook. Mattie explained every purchase and the process. The chefs and restaurant staff carefully guided me in each step in each dish. We prepared seven dishes and the result was first class. There was enough food for lunch and dinner and both were superb. My wife enjoyed food she usually would not choose.The cooking class is an experience that should not be missed. I love the fact that I now have recipes and knowledge to repeat when we return home. I would award the experience as 5 stars. Thank you all for sharing your skills knowledge and laughter.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel and we really enjoy especially the New Year’s eve party with the Live Band music. The Staff put a lot of effort to make the celebration for the guests enjoyable. I can understand that many of their guests are repeaters, they come extra every New Year to stay in this hotel for what I hear for the last 16 years. Although the hotel is quite far from the airport and centrum of Bali, it was 2 hours drive, but it was worth the travel. The place is quiet and good to relax. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We ordered food which were not in the Menu, but they made an effort to grant our request. This is definitely a good place to stay when you want to explore the nearby attractions from Candidasa.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: thanks for inviting us Krishna as we really enjoyed our stay. So tranquil, sedate and relaxing time with great service, food and staff. We highly recommend your resort to anyone who wants to get away from it all and chill out
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were greeted with a Kia ora! Me and my 15 yr old daughter spent 3 nights here - everything was perfect and all the staff made us feel so special. They took the time to chat and were interested in us. Highlights for us were the amazing towel art, papaya smoothies in the cabana, the sate for dinner, snorkelling at blue lagoon and the spa treatments. All the food we ate was delicious and we also had a couple of meals in the town which was only a short walk or even shorter taxi. We can't wait to return - thank you for making my birthday holiday special !!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay here as the staff was very helpful arranging drivers for our day trips, and assisting us with a variety of services.Room service was excellent and the food from the main restaurant quite good as well as the snacks from the bar. Location is excellent, grounds are beautifully kept. We will definitely be back.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Puri Bagus for 3 weeks during yoga teacher training. The rooms are comfortable and air conditioned, the delicious Balinese dishes and smoothies are served at a beautiful Pool Bar or upstairs in Dining Room. You can relax by the pool or in one of the many open cabanas overlooking the ocean. Snorkling is a must at the White Sands Beach or Blue Lagoon.The staff are the most genuine and kindest people ever. They can help you find a driver to bring you to the temples, villages, Water Palace, Bat caves, etc. or just drive you into town to do some shopping for yourself or loved ones. They even graciously allowed me to dress as a Balinese woman and take pictures around the property. Much thanks and love to the Managers, Krishna and Anynihta. Was a true honor! You must take advantage of their Spa. Feel like royalty for an hour or 2 with the many treatments and massages. I went 3 times!! Thank you, Sariani, for last send off massage, body exfoliation, and milk bath w/ flowers. A truly wonderful send off! You will meet some of the most beautiful people at this beautiful Resort! Don't miss out on such an amazing experience!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rave reviews for this resort! Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The food was excellent: a nice variety of choices for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, lots of healthy organic fruits and vegetables, and VERY affordable prices. The open-air oceanside settings of the restaurant and bar were beautiful and the breeze made the setting extremely comfortable.The grounds were spotless and the landscaping was beautiful. In addition to the plantings, flower arrangements were placed throughout the facility in the lobby, restaurants, the pathways and our rooms. The attention to aesthetic details was very evident.The spa was a beautiful, tranquil setting and offered a really nice variety of options.Off ground activities were easily accessible: boats to take us out snorkeling or to other beaches and taxis to take us to town or other cities. If any assistance was needed. the staff was very helpful in setting up transportation.Last, but certainly not least, the staff were incredible. Everyone we encountered were friendly, warm and very kind. We felt very welcome and well taken care of. Not a day passed when we didn't comment repeatedly on how nice the staff was.We stayed for a little over 3 weeks and never tired of this place. It was a wonderful place to stay.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice villas, friendly staff, delicious food, clean rooms, comfortable beds, cosy atmosphere - this is for what I recommend it for staying for a 3-4 days. Disliked the pool - water in it could be not so hot.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Puri Bagus for 3 weeks during a yoga teacher training course. The resort is beautiful and central located in the quiet town of Candidasa, close to beach and boats to take yousnorkelling and the staff are incredible. Amazing people who are always happy to help. Highly recommend this resort!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for five nights. The hotel itself is ok. We didn't like the breakfast too much, neither the rice wine we got as a gift. The rooms are sort of dark and beds are uncomfortable and hard. Nevertheless, staff is very attentive and we got an extra matress topper after mentioning the uncomfortable bed. The bathroom takes some time getting used to: It has an open roof and you here what exactly your neighbors are doing there.The garden, on the other hand, is wonderful! So is the pool. You can just let the day pass, read a nice book in the shade and enjoy your vacation.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent two nights here celebrating my anniversary with my husband and the hotel helped to make it a really special and memorable anniversary. The rooms are rustic and beautiful, and being about two hours away from the crowds of Ubud and Seminyak, it really is a retreat. We had a romantic dinner which also came with massages before dinner, and it was such a relaxing experience. Service staff were always smiling and happy to help us with whatever we needed. Only thing I would not is that this isn't a beach resort - there's an ocean view, but there isn't a beach.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Puri Bagus for 3 nights prior to heading to Ubud to teach a week long yoga retreat. This is an amazing location. Cabanas right on the beach. Great swimming and snorkeling close by. !0 minute boat ride to the white sand beach. The staff is incredible and they have three yoga pavillions. The grounds are incredible and there is an ancient temple on the grounds. I loves my stay here and I am already planning a trip back. Krishna and Anynihta are the BEST!!!!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I could not be happier with my experience at Puri Bagus Resort. Right on the ocean - it is an absolutely beautiful place with amazing views and an exceptional staff. The pictures online don't even do it justice! The staff was so friendly, and really catered to any need or request that my group had. The breakfast buffet is wonderful and has so many fresh juices, fruits, and other delicious food items. The Spa treatments were so relaxing, therapeutic and I loved my therapist, Putu! I highly recommend this resort to anyone visiting Bali! 5 stars! I will be back.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved practically everything about my stay here! The bungalows were clean, comfortable and had excellent aircon and WiFi. The location and grounds are beautiful and the breakfast was delicious - don’t miss it! I used the spa facilities which were lovely and enjoyed my treatment, however my appointment was at the end of the day and I felt it was rushed. I finished 10 mins early and it was not as comprehensive as my friend who had the same treatment the day before. Also the windows and door at the front are open, so you run the risk of people walking past seeing more than they bargained for! Having that said it was still very enjoyable.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a vacation like a Dream. The Service was Great and everybody was very gentle and nice. I will always remember those vacation Days.Thanks a lot for this incredible Time at your hotel!!! I will be back- that's for Sure!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service and staff is excellent, the property is breathtakingly beautiful. Yoga shala was amazing, spa services were much needed after traveling and the experience was wonderful. Perfect place for a retreat. I will be back.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My first holiday in Bali with yoga group. ...... The best holiday ever! Hotel spotless! Food is delicious! People friendly and 24 hours helpful.Definitely coming back next time with family! Thank you!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Always 4 units build together and although already a bit old, the bungalows are really nice, partially with connecting doors if travelling with children. The bathroom is partially open air with the disadvantage that you can hear the other 3 showering and ... The garden is really beautiful and away from the beach (waves) the resort is really a quiet place without rooster & dog noise (happens not often in Bali :) ) For beaches on does not come to Bali as often rocky and with manmade wave breakers, but the beach at Puri Bagus is compared to many others quite ok and Virgin beach is not so far.I recommend this resort very much and would return anytime.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great views of ocean while having a very enjoyable meal . Great service and will definitely try to stay here next trip as hotel and grounds are very inviting. Rooms along the front beach area look perfect.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Once again I took my group to the amazing resort on the east coast of Bali. The group was surprised and thrilled by the beauty of the place to start with. The resort is tucked away down a lane off the main road where it is peaceful and quiet. We were greeted as if we were part of the family. Everything had already been set up so that our late arrival caused the least aggravation for our group who immediately were able to go to their rooms. Their luggage, which came before us, was already in the proper rooms. This was a blessing to the group who were very tired after a long journey from Flores having an extended delay in our flight to Bali. The breakfast left nothing to be desired. The selection of fruit, breads, and ethnic foods was extensive. A personal cook to made eggs as one desired. They were even brought to one's table. The lovely gardens outside the private villas entices guests to stroll and enjoy the flowers and plants. The property is flush with the ocean so that some people spent time on the bales (raised platforms with mattress and pillows covered by traditional palm fiber roofing) enjoying each other, the ocean, reading or meditating. In the afternoon, after we had toured, we swam in the crystal clear pool next to the ocean. Refreshments were close by and the pool staff was attentive. After a delicious dinner served on the lawn next to the ocean we were treated to a dance performance. One has the opportunity to ride in an outrigger canoe with eyes painted on the hull to the rocks beyond the surf. Locally this is close to many interesting sites of Balinese culture, Ujung (the water palace), the Amlapura Palace, Tirtaganga (water terrace gardens), Tenganan (the Bali Aga historic village), Klungkung Palace and the Kerta Gosa (Hall of Justice), Mt. Besakih Mother Temple, etc. It is nice to come back to such a welcoming place to spend the rest of the evening relaxing and enjoying friends.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We return to Puris Bagus again and again. It is the most amazing place. The day beds are out of this world, the staff are so kind and friendly and the atmosphere is calm and relaxing. The rooms are very generous in size and the resort is quiet so get a great sleep. Lots of activities for the adventurous, snorkelling, Fishing with the locals, outriggers to gorgeous beaches and cheap motorbikes if you like to explore on your own.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel 3 nights in a sea view suite. Very nice, clean and quiet (only the noise of the waves can be heard). The pool is big enough for all (one for little children as well) . The staff is is very kind but some of them have troubles with English language, which caused mistakes at the restaurant (bar restaurant)If you need to change money DON'T change with the hotel. Was written 1euro = 14400 IDR as the REAL rate was 17100 (27th September ) and he said no commission. The guy lied to us and we have lost money. The rate in this hotel never change. Each day is was 14 400 ..... GO in town for money changer.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beatifull relaxing and adventurous experience with high hospitality standard and most charming treatment. A good base to tour the still authentic parts of the Island or exiting dive in adjacent waters. On returning enjoy exquisite homegrown organicte food and beverages and treat the tired body with a soothing massage in the spa.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful stay for 6 nights at the Puri Bagus. I was here last time four years ago and it is still a very lovely place to stay.The gardens and setting are beautiful, the employees attentive, very friendly and so helpful. The breakfasts with gorgeous view are absolutely delicious. Great vegetarian options for breakfast too.I would recommend the Puri Bagus to anyone for a luxurious stay with fantastic employees
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all, I must say that, like everywhere else in Bali, the service we received here was exceptional. You feel like nothing is too much and there is always someone on hand to help. It's a well set out hotel, right on the coast. I won't say it's on the beach as there isn't much of a beach where the hotel is. The restaurant for breakfast is located on the second floor above the lobby and gives you stunning views out above the palm trees to the ocean. This made me look forward to getting up and going for breakfast which is a miracle!The food and drinks are good and reasonably priced as were the spa treatments. The only downside to the hotel was that the rooms and bathrooms felt a bit run down. There were no major issues but it just seems like the turnover of guests over the years has started to show. I don't think it would cost too much to re-tile where needed, update electronics etc so maybe this is something worth considering for the management as this is literally the only fault I can find with this hotel.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was there with my family for two weeks, separated by a couple of weeks in the Ubud area. The hospitality couldn't be any better. Well managed, even during the earthquakes that were happening on Lombok, but also affected Candidasa. The food was good, rooms very spacious. We had no problem with insects in any of our rooms. I happen to love the outdoor style bathrooms, brilliant for that climate. The evening entertainment was great, good local band and delightful Balinese dancers. I do believe it's the best hotel in Candidasa. Awesome pool.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's expensive for what you get. 10-20 years ago when the place and fittings were new, perhaps it was worth it, but now, it needs some serious renovation. You have all the facilities, and service is fine. But you can get all that for half the price or less in nearly resorts. My main negative, besides the price, is the electrics in the room. They did give me an extension, but it was still difficult to get things working. The outdoor shower is nice, but after a rainstorm, half the bathroom was wet (don't hand up you clothes if there is a danger of rain).
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked the 3 days yoga retreat package at Puri Bagus Candidasa, which included a private yoga class every morning. I was more than satisfied with my choice, the hotel was just what I was looking for. My yoga teacher was great and the massage (included in the package) was very relaxing. My room was spacious and clean, good a/c and had a nice bathroom. Breakfast and dinner were also included in the package and I had the chance to attend a balinese cooking class (included in the package).The staff was very very friendly and I felt welcomed and comfortable at the hotel during my stay. I recommend the hotel and would definitely go back again. Thank you very much for everything, it was amazing!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Puri Bagus Candidasa was a lovely start to our Indonesian adventure. We arrived to such a warm welcome and from beginning to end of our stay the staff could not do enough for us. At one point in the stay I had a health scare and the staff helped us to make phone calls and identify a local doctor for me to see. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable with big bathrooms which had baths as well as open to the air showers. There is a spa at which we all sampled a massage at very reasonable price (approx £16 for a 1 hour luxury massage). We enjoyed the Indonesian food here - accompanied by traditional Balinese dancing one night and for more international food there are other restaurants nearby (we would recommend Vincent's). This hotel is a great location to do diving and snorkelling from and a highlight for us was our trek up Mount Batur (with Tour Bali Driver).
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient located hotel if you arrive from Lombok and do not want to stay in Padang Bai harbour. Very friendly staff and reasonable restaurants. However major downside of this hotel are the run down rooms. Nicely located into sort of bungalows with own terrace, it is obvious that the years of intense use have taken their toll; the bathrooms urgently need to be renoved, electronic equipement is outdated etc.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Last week we stayed for four nights at Puri Bagus in Candidasa. It was kind of a coincidence because our plan was to take a boat to Lembongang. Because of the big waves we had to reschedule and we decided to go to Candidasa. What a great choice that was. Not only the friendlyness of the staff, the excellent food and the fully ecquiped villa with great beds were a revelation. A special gift was the view..like a painting from nature itself..the view on the sea in all her colours and conditions..really breathtaking!!This added to the beautiful surroundings of the estate of Puri Bagus made our stay to a unforgetable part of our holiday on Bali.Ad Schenkels Gameren Holland
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff here could not be more friendly, every single person welcomed me and attended to me as a dear friend throughout my stay. You could see that care extending to all guests, exemplified by the years of stories from others who come back again and again. The rooms and grounds are absolutely beautiful, allowing you to soak in and relax into the gorgeousness of Bali. And this region of Bali is spectacular, lush forests, lovely beaches, good snorkeling, graceful temples, and, each place you go, the sweet welcome & kindness of people surrounds you.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small charismatic hotel, with very friendly staff. Next to the beach. Delicious food in restaurant. Good pool with lot's of lying chairs. Romantic sheltered beds to relax in next to the pool with view of the ocean.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were referred to Puri Bagus Candidasa in Eastern Bali and we were delighted with our visit! Such a beautiful relaxing location. Especially after the chaos of Seminyak, it was so relaxing to be able to sit back and enjoy the peace and relaxation of the true Balinese culture and people!The resort has lovely rooms, maybe a little dated and the ‘outdoor’ showers are a quirky but nice feature! The restaurant service and food was superb! For those yoga enthusiasts, there is amazing areas for you to enjoy! There are tours to outer islands, fishing trips, a brilliant pool and massages overlooking the ocean! Pure Bliss! Lots of sights to see locally! The Water Palace is a must see! Plan a little leisurely sightseeing on the drive to and from the airport or southern areas! Well worth staying a few days!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just returned from a fantastic 10 nights vacation from Puri Bagus Candidasa and can highly recommend the hotel.Here are our impressions:Staff: Very friendly, hospitable and professional. Everyone greets you, even by name if you stay a little longer. They do everything to make you feel welcome. Plus if you have a request or are not happy with something, just tell them and they will fix it right away. They are simply the best!Hotel:It is wonderfully set in nature. The pictures on this site truly reflect reality. We were told that the resort is approximately thirty years old and that the rooms have been renovated three years ago. This means that this is not a contempary design hotel, which may be cool in trendy places, but would look odd in rural place like Candidasa. To us it looked like a very authentic hotel in the tropics where local materials and design elements were used. Details such as wood carvings on the beams of the roof that you could see from your bed, are so nice. Everything was clean. But don't forget Bali is in the tropics and Candidasa is a seaside resort (i.e. there may be a gecko in the room). Food and drinks:We were very happy with both. Breakfast has good choices, lunch and dinner offer many options. Since we really like indonesian food we were spoiled. Western cuisine is also available. They also do buffet evenings with entertainment such as legong or bands. To us, who live in Switzerland, the price level in the hotel was very reasonable. It all depends from your perspective. There are plenty of places outside the hotel were you can go for dinner and prices are even lower. But keep in mind that at the hotel you have a very nice view of the sea and a light refreshing breeze. How can you beat that?Pool:Nice, clean and no it is not olympic size but big enough to swim properly.Beach:Black lava sand, yes you can swim. Yes there a locals on the beach. Some of them may want to sell you boat rides or excursions but it was not bothering or intense during our stay. None of them approached us on the hotel ground.Diving:The dive shop ORCA was top and Gili Tepekong and Gili Mimpang (island and rocks right in front of the hotel) offered beautifuly corral reefs and fish. Amed and Tulamben are just 60 min. minibus ride away from the hotel and offer more beautiful dive spots.To sum it up Puri Bagus is a lovely, quiet, relaxing place with good food and most important very friendly staff.Terima kasih
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a day and night before setting off to Padang Bai to get the fast boat to Gilly T. Really loved the staff, the pool, the beach and the Spa - the couples Balinese massage was lovely. My 4 rating is purely because of the bed... the pillows and mattresses need upgrading. The rooms are fairly basic in comparison to other hotels we have stayed at during our 3 week visit.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Puri Bargus for three weeks while attending a Yoga Teachers Training. Everyone at Hotel go out of their way to make you feel welcome and make every effort to accommodate your every wish. The grounds are immaculate and heavenly. I loved just to wander the intricate pathways and discover the beautiful flowers and statuary. The rooms are large, with an open air bathroom and woven rattan high ceilings. Showering by the light of the full moon was a special highlight. After staying in the busy areas of Abud & Seminyak, Candidasa was a nice mix of stores and restaurants with easy access to amazing mountain temples and snorkeling in Amed. The only thing missing is a beach. But the view of the local islands and outriggers bobbing in the sur, f along with the gorgeous pool, well and truly made up for the lack of beach.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our experience at Puri Bagus was amazing. The staff could not do enough for us,and were so helpful and friendly, nothing was a problem. In particular the staff at the Geringsing restaurant made for a special atmosphere. The location of the hotel was great. Beautiful ocean views and an easy 15 min walk into town. We loved our room it was very clean and spacious, would highly recommend the Seaview villas. The outdoor shower was a highlight. Definitely will return for a longer stay, a week was not enough. Thank you management and staff at Puri Bagus.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stay for 4D 3N and all i can say is i wish i stayed longer.The villa and surrounding are clean and well maintenance. There's nothing to complain about through out our stay. Foods are delicious, staff are friendly. Not to forget the hotel's activity are vary and interesting. They arrange us snorkeling to gili tepekong & pasir putih, diving, and the morning yoga.Look forward to go back there again anytime soon. Thank you to Pak Krisna and all Puri Bagus Candidasa team.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Believe us, you should visit Puri Bagus Candidasa! Why?As experienced travelers, we find here the best hotel of Bali!The staff was again perfect and very friendly for us and we felt home!Since 2010 we stay here every year and the service increases every year!The huge garden is amazing and surprises every day with the most beautiful flowers!The food here is excellent, especially the famous Nasi Radja.Every morning we looked forward to have surprising breakfast with the exiting view like a fairytale to the sea with all the typical jukungs.The large rooms are very cosy and built in groups of four individual houses.The hotel is traditional with a very modern management.We love this hotel very much and advise everybody to make this great experience too!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a return visit and it lived up to our expectations from we arrived until we left. It was super to be welcomed as returning special guests. We spent three weeks being looked after at a very high standard by all staff. Food was excellent. Accommodation lovely and well looked after. Reception staff,Kitchen staff, restaurant staff, housekeeping, laundry staff,spa and pool staff. Gardeners and maintenance staff all contributed to an excellent holiday.all were friendly helpful and interested but not intrusive. It was really good to have yoga sessions, special meals and attention. The gardens and environment are beautiful.This is my second review and my comments made before all still apply. We intend returning next year.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I thought the hotel was amazing with great food and amazing staff!One in the staff, a girl named Ayu was so friendly, introducing me to all kinds of new fruit. We became great friends and I highly recommend you book this hotel! The service was simply outstanding!!!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a fantastic week here with the staff and management of this hotel whilst at the same time celebrating our wedding anniversary. Everything about this hotel and the staff and the way they look after you is excellent. They put on a special dinner for us and the food and service was the best. Happily recommend this to anyone who wants a beach front location with excellent views relaxing on the day bed, great food, great swimming pool, great staff and management who will go over and beyond the service you want. One small criticism, “you need a new toaster” See you again soon.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 4 nights in beautiful tradition bali bungalows.Lovely friendly staff, bungalows are well maintained spacious with outside big bathroom.Great places to relax around pool or on day beds overlooking the ocean. Nice hidden white sandy beach 10 minutes away to visit and snorkel.Great food at puri Bagus with walk to main Candidasa. Loved our stay
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2nd time in the hotel for Yoga practice (Swiss group) and it's a just a beautiful place to be there. Staff is very attentive, good food and service; separate beautiful place and atmosphere for Yogawill definitively come back ... :)
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent two weeks in this quiet, peaceful hotel. Pool in good shape, deep enough to allow for diving. Roomy rooms. Nice breakfast and other food, great to be able to sit outdoors while enjoying it. High quality, versatile massages available. Decent snorkling available 20 -30 minutes from the hotel by boat. Very nice New Year party, food and music to meet needs of blues rock lovers 45+ years of age. Good value at reasonable cost.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently were back at Puri Bagus and that was the second time this year because it is still our favorite place. Have travelled all over the world but we always come back to Puri Bagus.The location is very close to the village so you are able to get a feeling of real life on Bali. The rooms are spacious and in traditional Balinese style.The staff are the ones that make your stay so unforgettable.Have not stayed somewhere where their staff could compete with theirs.Hope this review will put Puri Bagus on your bucket list.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights after returning from Lombok. Candidasa is a beautiful quiet little place, with lovely restaurants and a handful of bars and shops. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the main road and is located right by the sea although there is not really a beach here. It feels very private and is extremely quiet. Staff are very helpful and friendly, especially the pool attendant who was always so happy and friendly.The rooms are decent sized with plenty of storage room and we had a sea front villa with fabulous views. Bathrooms are semi outdoor with open roof shower area. This was no problem for us however you can hear neighbors over the wall!! Only downside for us was breakfast. We opted for freshly cooked omelettes most mornings which were fine, however other food was laid out buffet style and was always cold and often empty trays. In such a quiet resort I think a small menu choice to be cooked freshly would be a huge improvement. Overall we would not hesitate to stay here again. We loved Candidasa as a resort and this hotel was a great find and very good value for money.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Puri Bagus Candidasa is a quaint traditional resort with villas set in a lovely garden setting, on the beach and serviced by very friendly and charming staff. The resort is associated with scuba diving and snorkeling with a good part of the swimming pool at 3.4 metres deep and the Orca Diving business right next door. To the left is a pleasant beach area with easy access to ocean swimming. The villa is large, clean and comfortable with an outdoor bathroom. Don't expect a large flat screen TV; you get an old 21" CRT circa 1990's with limited channel selection. With a lovely outdoor aspect and glorious sunsets, why watch TV?I couldn't fault the food or the service provided by staff - both were excellent.The main road Jl Candidasa Raya is about 500 metres away along a narrow road with a nice and very new warung "Mocka" near the intersection. The elegant Vincent's restaurant is a little further south along the main road.Only a few gripes: Smoking is allowed in the restaurant Not enough shade around the pool, excluding the pavilions Ambiguous room rates - breakfast included/not included ( a minor detail but annoying)Bottom line: a great place for peace and quiet, great service and staff, a great place as a base to explore further north to Amed. Highly recommended.Col & Gem Villa 213 Jan 1 - 7, 2018
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
