review_body: It was an incredible time at Puri Bagus! Especially the massages in the spa were amazing with the woman named Ekha!! The staff is kind and helpful and friendly. It was a pleasure to stay at this resort!!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bali is overall costly location compared to many other locations in Indonesia, especially Java, Sumatra and Sulawesi. On top of it, the island is vastly and ghastly famous so the south if the island is always crowded. Travellers seeking tranquility venture to the north, particularly east of the island. So did we, after staying 3 nights at Nusa Dua. Puri Bagus may be the top property in Candidasa as per tripadvisor but my rating of three stars would be completely attributed to two points, views from the resort and the nature of staff. So, let me start from the star winning points.We checked-in on 12 Nov at room 102 which had seaview room. Marvelous setup it is. Sunrise is not directly viewed because the location is along the mountain on the side. This is east facing so sun sets in opposite side of the island. So you have a very subtle view of the changing colours of the sky. The rooms have verandah and along the seaside are beds with shades to relax the whole day. Ours was corner villa and the population in such resorts remain limited plus the villas are spaced out so you enjoy open spaces and fine views. Two out of three nights, the breeze was fantastic. Next is the staff. From e-mail coordination to pick-up from Nusa Dua to room service to bar service to restaurant service to spa services, the hospitality of the staff is very warm. They make you feel as their family guest. Always smiling, always happy to chat and serve. Very sublime gesture.Now translate that home and personal hospitality with the charges and rates. I am sorry but the infrastructure is old and not up to the international standards. Room has no safe which is ok but the almirah is rustic with paint worn off the sides of the wall. Beds and bedsheet are far below in standards and quality than what you get in a modern resorts. It rained on 13 Nov and the water seeped from the open bathroom side in the room all over the floor, luckily only near the almirah side. So the solution they came up was that multiple staff with their gamboots on are all over my bathroom and rooftop trying to detect and fix the problem. Again this is height of hospitality that I feel I am at their home so I have no privacy and they can spend their time trampling in my room and bathroom. I was shocked. In other resorts, the quickest options provided are change of rooms if there is such a leakage.Next is the provision of drinking water. The per day rate I paid was practically more than top resorts of Nusa Dua and all I am offered is literally 600 ml of drinking water for 2. You need more water, pay room service. I might have considered it norm of the land in Bali had I not stayed at Nusa Dua because there I had more than 2 litres of water per day complimentary.Food menu is limited but there are good restaurants on main road should you want to try more. Breakfast spread is again limited but more importantly when you know that it is hot and humid climate so flies are common and therefore you should cover all the items but unfortunately egg station at breakfast buffet had all cut items exposed to flies. Sorry but it ia unhygienic from all standards. From order perspective, food portions are big.Last but not the least, is the exposure to the local crowd. I think our corner villa was unfortunate in that sense. The nearby village crowd assembles in the morning and evening near the corner of the resort when they go for fishing and when they return at evening. So they is always noise of children and adults alike. And then when you are resting on one of the beds, you would be approached by local fisherman for sea activities, etc. This actually violates the definition of private beach for me. So this kind of exposure of privacy was disappointment for me.Overall, the value for money lead to loss of stars for me which I could have given to the resort. For this price, the management should seriously think to revamp the infrastructure to meet the quality standards of a four, if not five star resorts.Be advised that there is no white sandy beach per se. There is volcanic black sand and actually small dykes are built to keep off waves along the sealine. Local fishermen's boats are always parked there so there is little space for you to take the dip in the sea.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel for one night. The beach front is small but clean and gorgeous views. The food was not bad and the room had plenty of hot water. It is basic and not luxury but the coconut drinks were delicious! We would stay again, although not for long as we like smaller more boutique style hotels.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently returned to Rama for another visit and found it was even better than the last visits.A few small changes were delightful with lovely big lounges on the sand outside the Restaurant lovely to have a relaxed lunch on, although they do need back cushions.The soft furnishings in the rooms have been updated and this added a lovely bright color to our rooms.Pool towels are now placed on the daybeds and you no longer have to sign for towels, the white toweling covers on some daybeds were great and the new layout of the daybeds with some facing the ocean was a great idea.Loved the new Breakfast idea and as always the food was fantastic.We really enjoy the free activities and this trip we did the towel origami, the art class, the massage class, the yoga and the basket weaving. All these classes are outstanding with the hand picked local Balinese running the classes with all the love and care you get from these beautiful people. The staff at Rama seems to remain the same and I'm not surprised as they really are a caring and attentive team. I have been in Motel Management here in Australia and I could only hope my guests leave with the beautiful experience we had at Rama.I booked for a return visit before we left and yes we did have a small hiccup on checkin but the wonderful Manager and team more than made that up to us.Special mention to the Food and Beverage Manager, a lovely gentleman doing a fantastic job.Regards Julie
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Already the reception when arriving was charming. Beautiful hotel compound with aesthetic rooms, good restaurants looking to the seaside, nice Balinese dancing performances, excellent choice for the breakfast, friendly personelle. I did not feel well when arriving and enjoyed a very good light meal brought to my room. Nice pools; Good spa with Balinese massage. Next time a place to stay longer!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for six days and had a really good time in Puri Bagus. The rooms are very big and generally kept very well. Cleaning could perhaps be a bit better sometimes, but thats really a minor.Surroundings are fabulous with direct access to the beach, where you can go snorkeling right in front of the hotel (might be a bit rough in high tide and mind the boat traffic). Pool is also nice and clean and we never had problems about getting towels nor sunbeds. Breakfast is excellent and service here absolutely above average. Even when we decided to climp Mt. Batur and came back from the trip 10 minutes after closure, then we still got the opportunity to have breakfast. Wifi is generally working - not fast, but its working fine and should fulfill the need of a vacation in Bali. In general we had a real good experience here in and should we ever return, then we will definitely choose this hotel again.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a perfect stay at Puri Bagus. The food is lovely, the staff are extremely sweet and polite and very good at languages and the whole setting is beautiful and restful. Any requests were dealt with promptly and without any hassle. The spa treatments are excellent and they have free yoga classes. There is a very good dive school on site (orca dive club) through which we were able to get our padi open water certification during our stay.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms of the hotel were clean and comfortable. WiFi connection was working fast and without disconnections. This hotel is the best way of starting a restful vacation. On the other hand, the local center is rather far away and there is not much to see. The toilet was the most exceptional toilet ever; no roof at all and we shared the same walls with the next door neighbor, also noises from the each others toilet activities.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here because of the paragliding tour my husband was doing. They fly off the hill beside resort.First impressions were of a calm professional resort, we arrived later than expected because it took 2 1/2 hours queued up immigration at airport, ggrrrr, so we were tired and cranky on arrival but they made it pleasant and quick to check in.Bungalow is large and spacious, hard bed but ok. Only two pillows so I asked for two more, no problem.Bathroom at first glance is beautiful, partially outdoor shower is great. Then on closer inspection we noticed that it needs updating. Toilet seat is marked, not dirty though. Hairdryer is so old it seems dangerous. It gets very hot in my hand. Definitely needs renewing. Bathroom cabinet has a definite slope to it, needs propping up.The tv was old style and really really small. In 21st century there is no excuse for this type of tv.All staff were wonderful, nothing was a bother, everyone says hello. Especially liked young bar server, but can't remember his name, great smile.We were not harassed by hawkers on beach, once a day the boat drivers might ask if you wanted to go out.Short pleasant 10 min walk to Main Street. Great resort that just needs minor improvements to bring it up to speed. Recommend.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ideally located in the south-east part of Bali, this very cosy beachfront resort is a good option for those seeking a balanced cultural and diving experience in the Island. The staff is extremely friendly, accommodating and helpful. The beach however is not to be recommended-A short, unexpensive boat trip will lead you to white sand beach in 15 minutes. The on-site Orca diving club will allow you to discover the underwater beauties of Bali.Delicious and affordable meals, pretty comfortable hôtel... Excellent spa services... but the best part of this remains the smiling balinese people who will make your trip unforgetable.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The sea view rooms are only metres from the breakwater and the views are spectacular. Rooms are very spacious, we liked the outdoor bathroom concept and didn't have a problem. With mozzies. Staff are wonderful and meals were good by Bali standards for This location over 2 hours away from Kuta. We also had the pleasure of taking a snorkelling tout with a local fisherman in his traditional boat which was a bit daunting at first but turned out fine and was absolutely idyllic and personalised not being part of a big group. No picking up from multiple locations just walked straight out our room and 20 metres to the boat!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was clean, comfortable and spacious. The outdoor bathroom took some adjusting to, especially as someone who mosquitoes love. Also, each area is composed of 4 units, so all 4 bathrooms are in the middle area and you can hear your neighbors when they are in the bathroom. We really only coincided a few times in the morning so it wasnt that bad. The pool was maintained very well and the chairs were comfy. Ordered several drinks around the pool and the staff was great. We took advantage of the scuba school on site and it was a great learning experience. The breakfast buffet was delicious and the fruit juices super fresh. Did not have dinner there. We went to restaurants in Candidasa which all provided taxi service to and from. The ocean view was beautiful and the sunsets amazing. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my 5th time staying at this amazing hotel in Candidasa. Guest rooms are very clean and comfortable. The restaurant food quality is excellent and I especially love the tomato soup. All hotel staff are friendly and helpful, especially the General Manager Krisna and Adi in the restaurant. The pool area overlooks the ocean with beautiful views of offshore islands. You can't go wrong with Puri Bagus Candidasa!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The views on the beach here are amazing, especially at sunset. The hotel itself is quiet and comfortable. Our room was nice, but the bathrooms were a bit odd. The entire bathroom is semi-outdoor, with only walls (no roof) separating your bathroom from your neighbors'. One morning, I took a shower while listening to someone vomit in the room next to me. Otherwise, service was good and the staff were friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and i recently spent a week at Puri Bagus. It was our 3rd visit within the last 2 x years, travelling with friends. On each occasion we enjoy our stay more and more. The staff are fantastic and the hotel itself is a little slice of heaven. The rooms are large and extremely clean. The grounds and gardens are very well maintained...and peaceful. Breakfast is excellent and nightly meals just as good. If there is something not on the menu that you fancy...talk to the staff...they will do their best to assist. White Sandy beach is a 25minute boat trip away, just walk down to the ocean out the front of hotel and talk to 'Made' (boat operator), he will have you relaxing on the beach in no time. We are planning another visit to Puri Bagus later this year with good friends. Cant wait....just one question....Who is Henry ? ;-)
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We travelled with friends and both had Deluxe Sea View rooms. The rooms were lovely and spacious and the view breathtaking. I loved that the shower in the bathroom had no ceiling giving it a sense of outdoors with sky and tree views. The gazebos on the beach front are fabulous and the four of us enjoyed sundowners here every evening. All the staff were fabulous throughout the whole stay. We spent time relaxing by the pool and the spring rolls were wonderful. We had dinner at the resort a few nights and the food was lovely. Snorkelling at the islands just off the Resort was amazing and a must do.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Last week my husband and I came back from 9 days staying at the Puri Bagus in Candidasa Bali. 6 of those days was an organised yoga retreat. This was my 2nd time there and was just as good. The food was great staff treated us like Kings and Queens and our whole experience wonderful. We've come back tanned, relaxed and feeling like we've had a real holiday.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't recommend this place more highly. It's lovely, relaxing and the staff are just amazing. Couldn't be more friendly or helpful.The rooms and bathrooms are really nice and comfortable and the beach outlook is fantastic.Will definitely be back
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We happened to come across the Puri Bagus Candidasa Hotel by chance. We had just been on a sightseeing trip to an area on the east coast of Bali known as Blue Lagoon. This is a small town known for its diving and snorkelling. It is also a ferry terminal for Lombok and some of the other islands off Bali coast. This is an interesting place to park up for a couple of hours or so and explore the town. We later had lunch at the Hotel mentioned above. Wow how nice this hotel is, so secluded and right on the beach with really clear blue ocean. We will be spending more time at this hotel in the future.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed here for 8 nights with another couple. The hotel was right on the beach with beautiful gardens, exactly as shown in the photo's. Our room was clean and had a fabulous view of the ocean. An in-room safe would have been nice but we made use of the safety boxes in reception and this was OK. Staff were very attentive, friendly and always ready to help. We ate a few dinners at the hotel, which were delicious. Breakfast was a good, leisurely meal and staff welcoming each morning. The Hotel has a great swimming pool and plenty of loungers for all guests. You could also swim on the adjacent beach as it was very clean. There are lots of places to eat in Candidasa and we enjoyed every restaurant visit. The hotel is an easy 15 minute walk to town although restaurants provide a free taxi service if requested. We also enjoyed a day cruise to White Sands Beach with snorkeling on the way. This was one of the highlights of our trip. We went on a few sightseeing drives too. There is plenty to do at Puri Bagus as well as being a very restful and peaceful place to stay. We thoroughly recommend this hotel and look forward to returning soon.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow, amazing hotel, i stayed her with my parents, my sister and my boyfriend for a week in May, occupying 3 rooms. The rooms were fabulous, huge, plenty of storage space, lovely bathroom, i couldn't get enough of the shower (the novelty of an outdoor shower), and the bath products smelt divine. The beds were comfortable and the air conditioning excellent. The hotel itself was not too big and not too small, just right, and thankfully not too busy. we were greeting by friendly staff at all times and nothing was too much trouble. The pool was probably one of the most beautiful pools I've seen, very inviting and i found myself thinking back to it a lot upon my return home, stunning colour, brilliant depth, they hadn't gone overboard with chemicals (the last hotel I was at had so many chemicals in it that it was really painful to open your eyes). The food was delicious and my dad became obsessed with the crab soup from the restaurant by the pool, chicken lumpia were also divine. the cocktails, wow, the one in the coconut was by far the most entertaining one I've had and hysterical to receive. Definite cocktail envy by other guests on one night. The Spa looked great although I was somewhat put off by the prices, that being said, my partner had a massage and raved about it. The wifi I am also pleased to say was very good. I'm sure the setting was much nicer than the independent massage parlours down the road. All in all, an excellent hotel, I would love to go back again one day.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We discovered Puri Bagus Candidasa "accidentally" - and what a lovely surprise! The setting is beautiful, the staff and management are very welcoming, and the rooms are lovely, with pyramidical ceilings. We didn't join the diving facilities this time but did have a wonderful morning fishing & snorkeling with one of the very friendly local residents. You will leave feeling rejuvenated! Excellent security for motorbikes also Highly recommended!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful beachfront resort, staff very friendly, accommodating and helpful. Excellent, delicious meals, accommodations very comfortable. Spa services excellent and at very affordable prices. Every evening we had great entertainment with dancers, music and more. Felt welcomes from the very start.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is the service that makes this place special. From the reception staff, to the pool attendant, restaurant staff and even the gardeners...always a smile and friendly and helpful service. The beautifully maintained grounds are an absolute credit to the staff. Obviously, this is a well-managed property and the management keeps the staff focused on exceptional service in a very competitive market. The room was super clean, comfortable and spacious. The pool was well maintained and a delight. There were enough sunbeds whilst we were there, but it could be tight if there was full occupancy. The breakfasts were good, although other food was somewhat ordinary. However, there are other places nearby that one can walk to or take advantage of pickup services. We had a very relaxing stay and highly recommend this property.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had 2 nights, wish it was more but we had no idea how beautiful it would be. Villas were amazing in traditional Balinese style. Next time we would spend a week without hesitation. Thank you to all the staff, had an amazing stay.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and a friend spent 2 nights here last week in an ocean facing villa. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough!! The view is out of this world, the pool is heavenly, the food is delicious and the staff are so amazing. They put attention to detail into everything they do, and you can see the pride on their faces when they do something as simple as present you with a menu. The guy at the pool was so lovely! We did the snorkeling day trip and our guide, Made, made it very special for us. We also loved the area of Candidasa as it was not overrun with tourists and just had a generally magical feel to it. I would highly recommend a visit here and would definitely return!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic hotel. Beautiful bungalows, perfectly manicured gardens, and a deep pool with stunning views round out this awesome property. Onsite restaurant is superb; grilled squid was delectable and my wife raved that the chicken wings were the best she has ever had. Friendly and professional staff. Well run dive shop on location makes this the perfect retreat. 10 minute walk to main street, Vincent's is the best dinner in town.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for two nights in the middle of our Bali trip. The property itself is beautiful...right on the ocean with amazing views. The rooms and amenities could all use a facelift. Worn towels and bed linens, a bathtub I would never want to use because it was cracked and looked dirty, constantly running out of toilet paper, shower gel and shampoo that fall short, etc. All in all we enjoyed our stay, but it could be a truly exceptional property with a bit of care and investment.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there during our vacation. We had a villa sea facing. We had great service. A personalised menu for our group according to our taste.The staff were very efficient. Hotel very clean. We will come back.Nitin
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a gorgeous, friendly , beautiful place. I had a beach front bungalow- just gorgeous. The grounds are beautiful, the pool excellent, and the massage amazing. I had a fabulous seafood grill one night- best seafood I've had in ages. The prawns were perfect, as was the tuna and the salad was delicious. But the best part is how lovely all the staff are- super friendly and welcoming. Thanks Wayan ( sorry if I got your name wrong !) at the pool especially ! It's a bit out of town, but the free taxi to Vincent's in town was quick and easy, and if you can drag yourself away from the resort, it's worth the trip. Definitely worth a visit. I snorkelled with one of the fisherman , Made, one day- lovely ( especially with the turtle I cruised along with for a while)!
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was amaizing stay. Wonderful place with great service and very kind, helpful people. Very good food and beautiful landscape. We felt very relaxing and happy. Thank you for this time. I hope back to Puri Bagus Candidasa very soon.
hotelName:
14    Puri Bagus Candidasa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poppies looks like a hidden garden. Staff really cares about fauna in this place - each morning they cut grass with scissors, clean the paths and sweep. They even put a frangipani flower on the top of the figures that are in the garden - super cute :). The pool is in perfect size to swim a little and cool yourself. The hanging pink flowers add charm to this place.Rooms are clean, spacious, equipped with small fridge and air condition. The best is bathroom - is made outside with a big shower. Don’t worry about the insect, there are non due to net on the roof. Staff is super nice and friendly and always helpfull. It is a perfect place for a honeymoon or just to relax and take a deep breath among such pretty surroundings. Higly recommend!
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Short walk to crowded Kuta beach but step through the gate into Poppies compound and it's quiet and beautiful. Meander through the gardens to your own private bungalow and its so peaceful. The bungalows are spacious and have the 'Bali' touch! Bathroom has a sunken bath, shower and everything you need. Breakfast on your front porch, Poppies restaurant a short stroll down Poppies lane - its just paradise..
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from 8 days at Poppies Cottages, staying in a 3 single bed cottage with my 2 sisters.Beautiful tropical setting with maximum privacy and security.It would be easy to just spend the day by the pool and in the restaurant.Daily servicing was quick and efficient - bottles of water replaced, clean glasses and mugs etc with pre-breakfast bananas and newspaper.Our package - 7 nights, get 1 free, included airport transfers,1 free massage per guest, breakfast daily at Poppies Restaurant which is about 20 metres down the lane, from a great menu, a tasting banquet of 12 dishes for 2, and 10% off every purchase at the restaurant, which negated the 10% tax for something, ;leaving only 6% service tax to be paid on top.All the meals could be delivered to you at the poolside or at your cottage.Water pressure was poor, resulting in long showers to remove shampoo and conditioner, but the ambience of the garden bathroom was amazing. The sunken bath provided the opportunity to relax further after a day out and about.We walked the streets in the surrounding area, purchasing a few items such as batik bags, shorts and dresses. MATAHARI store has a good supermarket, about a 15 minute walk from Poppies.Also we chose NORMIE BALI (see FACEBOOK) as our driver for 3 days to go to ULUWATU and SEMINYAK, UBUD for great silver jewellery, and MASON ELEPHANT SANCTUARY, just a little further north than Ubud.Next year's trip already to be booked!
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Despite operating for decades, Poppies Bali is a totally unique and great way to enjoy some quality accommodation, at an affordable price, within a step to the shops and other Kuta offerings. Literally an Oasis that we stay for the tai lend of every trip to Indonesia. We aren't tempted to do any shopping throughout our visit in the knowledge that this can be done once we check in to Poppies and that we can return to the accommodation if we get tired or simply overloaded with purchases. Staff are incredibly attentive and professional. Rack rate for the accommodation is very competitive and combined with very reasonable bar prices and an icy cold bar fridge that is provided empty to cater for self help options, absolutely perfect. Indeed the beer from the local super market was more expensive that buying one at the pool. Go figure. There is absolutely no noise from the busy Poppies lane and the restaurant is a few metres walk away. Free and quality airport transfers just make this a quality accommodation option.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is just perfect! My family has just spent 3 weeks here in a beautiful, spacious and incredibly clean cottage, the bed was really comfortable, they made up beds for our twin girls that were also perfect and took up no space in the cottage at all, the staff were all super friendly and just absolutely lovely to our little girls, the pool we practically had to ourselves most days and is just like the photos, magical! Food was cheap and delicious, from either the restaurant or by the pool.My husband and I love Kuta for everything it has to offer, the affordable food, beach sunsets and market shopping, but to come home to Poppies after a day out was just serene, we loved it! and will be returning without a doubt.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had one week to escape work and chose Poppies again. This is our seventh stay at Poppies Cottages and it is one of Bali's best tropical boutique hotel. Small, intimate and peaceful, the Poppies staff will ensure you relax and enjoy yourself. If you're considering Poppies Cottages as your accommodation don't hesitate, you'll really enjoy the hotel.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This lovely resort is in kuta area, bali. 15 to 20 mins from the Bali airport. Quite cozy cottages, upto 3 family members can stay comfortably.Its got a nice ambiance.There were certain issues regarding the toiletries. As they just refill the bottles the next day...If 3 people are sharing the body lotion it really bcomes difficult to passon the bottle. Due to inconvenience n hygiene factor kindly provide extra toiletries to people on request. Secondly the milk provided with cornflakes and tea is hardly anything. So ps make sure the milk is more..We had these few issues but once i spoke to the manager they undetstood our needs and did try to make things easier.They took care of our airport transfer too. Their restaurant next door is also nice. We had dinner there a couple of times. Im all a good place to stay. Im sure if the staff works on these few things it will b good!!
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wife and I stayed from 03 - 10 Jan 19 in bungalow 23 and had an absolutely wonderful time. We thought the room, bathroom and amenities were fantastic and all the staff extremely warm, welcoming and professional. Nothing seemed to be a problem for the staff and being offered a free nights accommodation and courtesy return airport transfers, were very much appreciated. All in all, we would not hesitate in staying at Poppies on our return.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An absolutely beautiful haven. An amazing discovery. We were so surprised at the lush sculpted gardens and the beautiful pool. The bungalow was charming and very comfortable. A place to relax and enjoy.....
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poppies is a beautiful, peaceful and relaxing place to stay away from the noise of Kuta. The hotel staff are extremely friendly staff, and they go out of their way to make your stay pleasant and no request is too small.The rooms were clean, light and comfortable with an outside bathroom. The air con worked very well. Breakfast is delivered to your room every morning and is delicious. The pool spa and gardens are gorgeous. Airport transfers were included in our package and the driver was waiting for us at the airport.I would not hesitate to recommend this wonderful hotel and I will be staying there again on my next visit to Bali.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful small hotel. Only 20 cottages, so dont be surprised if they get booked easily. Each cottage is a gem. Fabulous pool. This is a true oasis on Kuta. Dont pass on including breakfast - its worth every penny. order off a menu - not a buffet.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this hotel much at the moment I stepped into the hotel. The staff of receptionist and porter represented the unique Balinese hospitality. The cottage was assigned to me was numbered 31, not too far from the reception but very private. The cottage accommodated a terrace, compact dining/sitting area, bedroom and spacious open bathroom with a tiny Balinese Garden. Perfect. the amenities and facilities inside the cottage were almost excellent, lighting was great and power sockets were available throughout the space. But no slippers (lol). Every part of the cottage was well maintained (considering the compound was established decades back) and clean, very clean. I checked the pool (not have a chance to swin in) and it was really a mini lagoon, very pretty and relaxing. The other plus point was the garden in the compound, its pathway were well designed (Balinese), well paved and aesthetic. Even though the hotel was located in the busy area and small road of poppies lane in Kuta; the compound was very quiet and tranquile. To be in the compound filled me with the ambience of Balinese style resort in the 1990's. Other interesting things : 1. The food was good since they also have a fine dining Indonesia restaurant next door2. be prepared to bump into geckos and squirrels which are very common in Bali, (I'm personally bit nervous of facing these cute creatures) but they are harmless.Verdict: recommended
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poppies Bali is one of the best hotels I have ever visited.Beautiful cottages, great pool, wonderful gardens, open bathroom (totally private) and almost everything to offer was perfect. Special mention of Poppies Restaurant, again possibly best restaurant of Kuta region. Cannot fault anything here. Great service and hospitality. Look forward to visit again in future.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poppies cottages, are a hidden gem amongst the hustle and bustle of Kuta. Beautiful little cottages, set in manicured gardens, with a lovely outdoor pool. Rooms are well appointed, with a large bed, tv, wifi and indoor / outdoor bathroom. They are located close to the beach, and busy district of Kuta
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No much to say other than a lovely, peaceful and very clean place to stay in the heart of Kuta. The huts look more traditional and are all separated by paths, plants and ponds. One of our favorites in Kuta without a doubt.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed the privilege of a two weeks stay at Poppies this time and we loved every minute. Needless to mention all the good things since they all have been described in previous reviews. The majority of people at Poppies that we met are guests who are returning regularily during many years as we do. Of course has the hotel undergone a lot of renovations and updates but it never changed its spirit. If not for Poppies,Hotel and Restaurant and the lovely staff in both places , we would not stay in chaotic Kuta. Although just returned, we are already looking forward to come back next year.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poppies is possibly the best place I have ever stayed (and I have travelled extensively). It’s a beautiful little haven in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Kuta. The cottages are spacious, clean and comfortable, with lovely touches like locally sourced kimonos and toiletries. Each cottage has a terrace and is surrounded by jungle so it’s peaceful and relaxing. We booked a room for 2 nights via their website which included breakfast (served to our room) and a free 1hr massage each. The pool area is wonderful - surrounded by bourgainvilleas and lots of other plants you forget you’re in Kuta.Well worth the price and would definitely go back without hesitation.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poppies is an oasis in Kuta. Quiet, restful and serene, you would not know that it is located right in the heart of the action! A small, boutique hotel, the rooms have a traditional feel but with all the facilities and services of other high class hotels. The friendly and obliging staff provide excellent, thoughtful service, with the acclaimed Poppies Restaurant (adjacent) providing the breakfast/room service meals. Set in the most beautiful garden you can imagine, why would you stay anywhere else?
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we stayed 14 nights in poppies me hubby and grandson in one bunglow sis and her hubby in another we loved it we cannot fault anything and kuta is lovely this was the perfect holiday thanks poppies xxx
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enter through a gate and you walk a few meters, you feel immediately away from the noise of the city and sound in this little gem where you immediately feel at home. Can be advised after a long flight to start their vacation before heading on to the island. The breakfast is nice and local.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our last stop on our honeymoon trip. We were really happy when we came to Poppies as the whole place looks really nice on the outside.First night, dinner and breakfast were really good. When we came to suite for the last night, we found small poop near the pillow. We didn't want to cause any problems so we decided to just sleep thru our last night, but we were woken up in the middle of the night by some weird noises for which we were sure it was a mouse. We had to tell this to the receptionist and we were told that it was probably a squirrel, but we weren't convinced as we know the difference. :/Too bad for our stay, because it's a really nice, cute and quiet place in the busy Kuta.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed at Poppies recently for four nights. The one thing I have to praise highly is the beautiful grounds at Poppies, paths are dressed in colourful flowers and lush greenery, nothing short of a tropical oasis in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of Kuta. I also loved the pool area, very quiet and relaxing, surrounded by palms, bougainvillea flowers and white umbrellas- simply gorgeous! Aside from the grounds of the hotel my partner and I struggled with the rooms, we found them to be very dark, dated and small. I love the traditional look however strongly feel they need a renovation in order to help restore their beauty especially seeing they have been there for many, many years. The room also has an unusual smell due to the thatched roof which they tell you about when checking in, I understand it cannot be helped but just be ware. The bathroom was of a good size however did not like how the shower/bath are one, the shower floor was very old therefore wasn't inviting to have a bath at all. I definitely think the rooms could use some TLC to bring them back to life! The food at Poppies restaurant was great, very tasty and reasonable in price. A great choice also, very extensive menu offering both traditional food and american meals. If there I recommend trying one of their Mango Juices, super delicious! When staying at Poppies breakfast is included, you can request for it to be delivered to the room however I would recommend walking across to the restaurant as this way you will receive it hot and fresh, tried it in the room one morning but it wasn't great. Lastly the service, the staff are very friendly and lovely however I feel the service can be a little slow. Many times around the pool we had to go to them in order to place a drink or meal order, instead of them catering to those around the pool. I usually don't mind but noticed they were always standing under the hut doing nothing so couldn't understand why the couldn't come around the pool to guests and serve? Also organised to check out at 11am on our last day, however no one came to the room to help with luggage so found myself wheeling two large suitcases along the brick path myself- wasn't great as our room was the furthest from reception. Felt if they knew we were checking out they would send someone to offer help. Also passed many people who worked at Poppies while making my way to reception and not one person offered to lend a hand, was disappointing as they would have seen me struggling. Aside from the service and dated rooms I have still given Poppies a four star rating as I think value for money is great and the grounds are incredible, best I have seen in Bali after many years of visits. Poppies has great reviews on TripAdvisor but unfortunately this just wasn't the best place for my partner and myself therefore will not be staying at Poppies again, we will venture elsewhere.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had been to Poppies restaurant but had never stayed at Poppies Cottages so we decided to end up our stay in Bali with 2 nights at Poppies. What a good decision that was! The hotel is conveniently located near Jalan Legian and Jalan Pantai Kuta so is within walking distance of many bars and restaurants in Kuta as well as Beachwalk Mall. It is a bit tricky to find if you are coming by taxi as the lane is so narrow that taxis won't enter- we got dropped and had to walk the last bit to reach the hotel. Check-in was fast and efficient and we were shown to our villa (#24) which was lovely, surrounded by the beautiful gardens at Poppies, a riot of color and different sorts of plants and flowers. The villa itself was lovely with a beautiful terrace at the front with a table and chairs to sit and relax. The room was spacious with a large, comfortable bed, a writing desk and enough outlets for devices, a seating area and table and a nice flat-screen TV. The air-con was slightly problematic but we called the front desk and they sent someone immediately who fixed it. The indoor/outdoor bathroom was interesting and beautifully designed, a really nice feature of the villa.If you wander in the gardens you will eventually find yourself at the small but lovely pool which was never very busy during our stay. There is small bar and sitting area that has a lovely view of the pool and the surrounding vegetation. Also in the garden there are small sitting areas, a beautiful lotus pond, all of which make the gardens very appealing.The breakfast we had across the street in Poppies restaurant was excellent- a beautiful setting and the breakfast selection was great and the food delicious- a lovely way to start off the day! The hotel is just a couple of minutes' walk from Un's, one of Kuta's best restaurants where we enjoyed dinner one evening. It is also just a short walk to the Hard Rock Café and Jamie's Italian as well as a lot of fast food options, so a convenient base for visiting the local bars and restaurants. We walked up to Beachwalk Mall to see a film and have dinner one evening and it was very pleasant walking back when the temperatures were beautifully cool.We would definitely recommend Poppies if you want to stay in the heart Kuta. It is a very different sort of place to Seminyak but it is an excellent location for exploring south Bali and it is also very close to Ngurah Rai airport. The hotel will pick you up and take you to the airport, which is very convenient.I think that Poppies is probably more suitable for couples rather than families simply because it is such a small property; the staff all seemed very pleasant and helpful. Staying somewhere like Poppies is a very different from staying at one of the large resorts in Nusa Dua but it is such an iconic Balinese style hotel that has been offering wonderful accommodation for so many years, I would have no hesitation whatsoever in recommending Poppies to anyone coming to Bali and wanting to stay in the Kuta area.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We will always stay at Poppies when visiting Bali. The service is second to none and the personal touches such as welcome flowers in the room do not go un-noticed. Many of the staff have worked for both the Resturant and Cottages for many years which makes my stay so personal, a home away from home. The staff are very professional and the rooms have been upgraded recently which is lovely. Even though you can now make tea and coffee in the cottage the staff are more than happy to bring a pot of ready made tea!! I can highly recommend Poppies! We will be back next year!
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came to the hotel on a friend's recommendation.The hotel provided a free airport pick up serviceIt's a quiet and relaxing place to stay in hectic Kuta. You can have the breakfast delivered to your room, but we enjoyed them more when we had them at the restaurant.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Behind the stone wall of Poppies, is another world. The rush and fast pace of Kuta simply vanishes. The cottages are in a garden setting and the layout of the path adds to the privacy. The cottages all have thatched roofs which add to the charm. While the cottages look charming, they have all the creature comforts that you expect. There are little touches like leaving a local English written newspaper and some bananas on the porch table every morning that makes you feel like an honoured guest. Poppies is close to a number of restaurants as well as Kuta Beach is a short walk away.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love Poppies Cottages 1 Bali, we stayed here for 3 nights, they picked us up from the airport and quickly arrived at Poppies. Walked into the grounds and was very surprised of the hidden gem behind the stone walls. We were welcomed with a fresh tropical drink then we strolled through the lush gardens to our beautiful cottage. The cottages were large and roomy, window seats with table. The shower and toilet were outside in a covered area with gardens and stones. Loved the outdoor bathroom. Cute balcony to sit on whilst we waited for our kids. The pool was only small there isn't a bar if that is the type of thing you like. The Grounds are very quiet considering it is surrounded by busy streets. Step outside the walls of Poppies Cottages and you are on Poppies Lane which has lots of bars and restaurants close by. Walk to the end of Poppies Lane to the right and you end up on Legian Street go to the left and a short walk to the beach. The staff were lovely and friendly. We didn't get breakfast included as we wanted to try a few smoothie bowl places. They offered us a free transfer to our next hotel which at the Grand Inna which was really helpful since the Grand Inna wouldn't help us out (see review for Grand Inna) Poppies Cottages I highly recommend we had a great stay and would definitely stay there again. Wish we had booked longer.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a one day stay but still love it. Beautiful garden and well designed house. Very quiet with easy access to Kuta beach. Staff was really friendly and helpful. We woke up earlie to catch a boat and this place is in the heart of the city.Hope to come again.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are staying right now in cottage 31, and we love everything about this resort. The cottage, the gardens and the pool are so beautiful, the staff is so friendly, the food is so delicious, I couldn't rate this little gem high enough.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: there are two Poppies hotels in Kuta. We had a private bungalow which was decorated in traditional Balinese decor with pitched thatched roofs and great air conditioning. The grounds and pools were really nice as it provided an element of serenity which I did not expect as Kuta is very busy and lively, but inside the compound, it was quiet and relaxing. Room service was fast and the dinner meals we had were wonderfully tasty. I am Dutch Indonesian and I have always been aware of good Indonesian food so I speak from experience. Having said this, this hotel is a pit stop for us either before we start our Balinese trek around the Island or when we are about to go home. I never spend more than two nights here, because if you really want to experience Bali, Kuta is not the place to do it.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poppies is a lovely hotel in the middle of bustling Kuta, but as soon as you go through the doors there is peace and you will not hear anything from the outside. Beautiful bungalows with an outdoor shower, toiletries and hairdryer are available and there is also tea and coffee and 2 bottles of water every day. there is an outdoor terrace at each bungalow and if you do not have breakfast in the restaurant, they deliver it and cover the table on your own terrace. Breakfast is very good, you can order everything separately and there is something for everyone. Poppies has a beautiful swimming pool to cool down when you return in the afternoon. And there is a pool bar. It is a quiet hotel, it is not a hotel for children, who may come there, but the pool and stuff is not for children to play. There is a free shuttle service to and from the airport. They also arrange a scooter if you want to rent it.Poppies is located in the middle of Kuta and as soon as you walk out of the doors you stand in the bustle of it.All the staff do their best and are extremely friendly and helpful.We have not been able to discover any negatives. A hidden gem in Kuta, Bali.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here again for a couple of days before moving on, really loved our time (again) and will definitely come back. Love the serenity, the staff, the cleanliness, the pool and the breakfast. We enjoy eating our breakfast on the porch outside our cottage, bliss. Only thing I find a tad difficult is the lack of light in the rooms. Would love some brighter illumination. Thanks for a wonderful visit.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow..from the monent the included transfer picked us from the airport to being raken back there we have had 6 nigyts of shear bliss. The checkin was easy and we were taken to our cottage through the impeccable and beautiful garden. The cottage was beautiful, which included outside seats and table in the porch, entering inside the cottage there was a king side bed with crisp white linen. A good size tv with dvd player discreetly installed in the wardrobe. Dining table and couch., fridge and coffee makibg facilities. As well as the air con there was also a ceiling fan. We could not gave wanted for more. The bathroom which leads from the bedroom is partially outdoor and massive, again very well equipped, especially enjoyed the sinken marble bath.  When we returned each evening the beds had been turned down and frangipani flowers placed on yhe sheet, also electric mosquitto replellant had been plugged in. Also a mosquitto coil had been lit outside. Each evening we hung our breakfast request on the door which had a large bbc aried selection which was delivered promptly to our room at our requested time each morning. The breakfast was of a very high quality and coild not be faulted.The swimming pool was inceedible, very well designed and the mature plants and trees thar surrounded it just increased its appeal, also there was a spa which was very relaxing after a day of shopping. The pool was serviced by a small bar which also served food from the poppies restaurant.It was to imagine that we metres from poppies lane as there was so little noise.We definatley will not stop anywhere else again, this has everything you could want and more.. thankyou for a memorable trip and see you again
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poppies is a delight in all ways - once you are inside the hotel and can escape from the roar and smoke of motorcycles. I've stayed in the cottages for over 30 yrs and would again - with its lush plantings and Balinese antiques, spacious if now classic and a bit dated cottages, exceedingly evocative and pleasant pool & bar as well as smiling and accommodating staff, it is great value. Breakfast is included - generous, delicious, and very pleasant in the hotel's restaurant across the 'gang' from the cottages. The only drawback is ... Kuta. Alas, the traffic and the deterioration in the neighbourhood detract.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Paradise in the heart of Kuta, situated on poppies lane 1, behind the stone wall are old style bungalows . Beautifully situated amongst lush gardens , each cottage has its own privacy. Inside is just gorgeous , wonderful comfy bed, a small table & nook where you can read, eat, or just play a game of cards . All windows have flys screens, in room safe , tea and coffee making, outside bathroom with shower which can be transformed into a bath . Great storage space for clothes . Smart tv and wifi. Breakfast can be bought to the cottage every morning or eaten at poppies restaurant .breakfast is basic but plentiful , coffee is awesome . It has cold aircon and also a ceiling fan. One concept we thought was great was the fridge and shopping facility, you ring number 3 and they will do your minimart shopping , stocking the fridge with Bintang , water , whatever you need . Saves carrying those huge water bottles back to the bungalow. Water pressure could be harder but it was hot. Pool area is beautiful, and comes separately with a spa near it ( we used the spa quite a bit) , pool is very private .Only annoying thing is the RUDE PEOPLE that constantly put towels on pool chairs and then go away for more than a hour. Now hear this GUESTS the pool area is for all guests and you are rude putting your towel there stopping anyone else from enjoying the space . Get a villa if it’s a private pool you want . I think staff need to take towels off the lounges if the guests have left them more than 1 hour . Poppies lane 1 can be annoying with motorbikes and cars , be careful stepping out of the gate into the lane . It’s in a great spot / area of Bali close to shopping and great food also the beach . It traditional and we love that , it’s the tri Bali let’s hope they remain that way forever .
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our fifth stay at Poppies and it's become a home away from home for us. We stayed 6 nights including Nyepi, the Balinese day of silence. The cottages have had some minor changes since we last stayed, new toilet, shower fixtures and wifi connection is now through the new smart TV. One other change is that they no longer leave black tea outside your room in the early morning, I understand many probably don't it, but we always enjoyed having our tea in bed, and it was such a small tradition from the past I'm sad to see it's gone. Other than these minor changes Poppies remains an oasis of quiet, calm and beauty in the madness of Kuta. Nyepi was extraordinary, so quiet and the night so dark I've never seen so many stars. If you are looking for a traditional and beautiful small hotel in Kuta then Poppies should be top of your list.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been visiting Bali and staying at Poppies Cottages for some twenty years now. Unfortunately, the time since my last visit has been about three years, much too long. Poppies gets better and better. Once inside you will be welcomed by very courteous and friendly staff. The entire property is all lush and green, with many flowers, trees and garden areas. There is a swimming pool and several fish ponds. The whole place attracts many kinds of birds and there are many opportunities if you are a photographer. The cottages are really special, in traditional Bali style with thatched roofs, marble and dark wood furnishings and large, comfortable beds. The bathroom area has a sunken bath which is very relaxing. The veranda is a perfect place to sit and relax, and the cottages are arranged for a good level of privacy. Kuta is a very crazy place, and Poppies is a real and welcome oasis to escape to from the surrounding madness. I would never stay at any other place in the Kuta area, and I hope to make many more visits to Poppies in the future.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Boutique hotel in the heart of Kuta.The warmth and personal attention was amazing! the level of comfort and cleanliness tops.Lovely rooms -so private amongst all artfully grown flora and fauna.The beautiful pool is the heart of the hotel and it is almost like heaven in the open air jacuzzi.The meals and bar in the Poppies restaurant were so addictive that we left the beaches and bars to come back to it everyday.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A garden paradise in the heart of Kuta. Step out of the bustling streets to a whole different world. Stayed here for the 1st time, it's my 8th trip to Bali and won't be staying anywhere else. Beautiful, quiet, perfectly manicured and you get the added bonus of poppies restaurant menu and very reasonable prices. Rooms are beautifully presented with those gorgeous original thatched roofs that have that hay smell in the rain that just fills the senses. Pool is sparkling clean and very homey. I've already booked again in May. No dissapointment saying here. Love love love. See you soon my little paradise
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you Poppies for your "Great Escape Package". What a wonderful idea for a quick getaway to recharge my batteries... exactly what I needed. Included in this package was a one hour massage which you can choose to have either at the pool side or in the privacy and air-conditioned comfort of your room. Also included in this package was a Rijsttafel dinner at Poppies Restaurant or you can also choose to have it in your room, which I did and what a delicious treat it was. Sadly I was not able to eat it all but it was a great way to have a little taste of everything I enjoy about Balinese cuisine.This was my 4th visit to Poppies and it was as beautiful as ever... the room, the gardens, the pool and of course each and everyone of its staff was simply outstanding. I also got to spend a little more time with their beautiful resident puppy, "Barong" which was really nice.Thank you so much Poppies for your warm and friendly hospitality and I hope to see you again soon. Much love, Sam xx
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poppies is an excellent hotel. Based on our experience it is in top position due to genuine customer reviews. Nice and quiet, in the centre of Kuta! Lovely breakfast and excellent staff along with quality comfortable beds. Our air-con broke down and was fixed within hours, they had someone on site who could take it apart, diagnose the problem and replace an electronic component. Not an easy task, such expertise in a small hotel. Although not a modern hotel everything was maintained to high standards, quite an achievement when they are not charging Shangri-La or Manderin Oriental prices. I'm really impressed with Poppies.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poppies is located in a very narrow busy street of Kuta. Right from the entrance to the Cottages everything is very very unique.... Its like living in a forest resort. Every cottages are surrounded by lush greenery. The staff is very nice, welcoming and helpful. This place is very quite and peaceful. If you are looking for a relaxing and peaceful environment with sate of the art property, Poppies is the place you should be at. Coming soon Poppies.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed in December. We loved this hotel. It was like a little haven in the middle of busy Kuta. The staff are warm and friendly, the pool is to die for and not too hot like other pools we visited. The rooms are spacious and spotlessly clean and everything is replaced daily. We will definitely be back
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poppies Cottages are simply gorgeous. Totally hidden away from the busy streets and part scene within the area of Kuta!I’ve been travelling to Bali for a very long time and had only eaten in the signature famous Poppies restaurant prior to my stay this time. I will definitely be returning. The cottages are all set in their own private garden, have their own private balcony and out door bathroom. The breakfast choices are plentiful and are a mix of local and western. Read the in room dining pages in the hotel booklet in your room prior to ordering breakfast so you get a proper idea of what to order.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the W for the first leg of my trip and followed it up with poppies. Frankly, I think I felt more at home at poppies even though the W seminyak was at a different league. Poppies feels like you’re in Bali. It’s intimate and quaint. Their breakfast is exceptional. They have 20 rooms all of which are the same. There is a Bluetooth system which has a DVD player as well. The bathrooms are spacious and well maintained. The air conditioning is excellent and there is a safe in the room. The beds are very comfortable as well. The pool is big and good enough for some laps. My only complaint is the Bloody Mary which we ordered at the pool bar. The pricing and the drink which eventually came by just does not match. I would however definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Honestly my fav part of being in kuta (which is otherwise a bit busy and a bit dirty for my taste - though can be fun as well). This place is green and lush with lovely Balinese decor. Amazing pool area and super helpful staff rounded out the trip. And bonus - their restaurant next door is pretty good too!
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Still up to its high standards, Poppies is the ideal place to start or end a Bali adventure. Lovely cottages, beautiful grounds and pool combined with warm and welcoming staff, make this perfect little piece of paradise. Their restaurant across the street is reasonably priced and atmospheric. The wide variety of food offered is consistently tasty.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a lovely spot. Definitely an oasis amongst the hussle and bussle of Kuta.Perfectly located to food, massages, bars.The cottages were large and comfortable and gardens and pool were green and does.Would highly recommend Poppies to anyone looking for a relaxing break to recharge the batteries.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We asked for the airport service and were picked up by Putra, he was very nice. Even though our baggage had a delay, he stayed to wait for us. At the resort we were treated very nice and correct. Best hotel to kick our honeymoon off!
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place is great and secluded in the heart of Kuta. I was traveling by myself and did not want to stay in a chain hotel that had no identity or soul. My cottage #31 was next to the wall, but you did not even notice the noise from the outside lane. The cottage was beautiful in Balinese style. The room had a refrigerator (good for my beer), wash clothes (it amazes me how many nice hotels do not provide them), safe, robes, umbrella, etc. I love the bathroom with part of it open on the top (true Balinese style). I read where one person complained that birds were noisy in the morning (stupid). I did notice the birds in the morning, but it made you feel you are one with nature. As for the staff (I stayed 8 nights), what can I say but "Outstanding". At the end of my stay, I consider some of them as my friend, and I am Facebook friends with them. They would recommend places for me to go and tell me places I should not go that were overpriced and gave a bule (foreigner) price. All their recommendation were spot on. The breakfast was excellent served on your front porch of your cottage. It came from Poppies Restaurant which serves excellent food (ate there one night). The pool was small but nice and secluded and did not have the boring chain hotel look. It blending perfectly into the garden surroundings with a natural stone look. Would I recommend this place. Let's say, I would not stay anywhere else in Kuta, except here. To all the staff and the hotel, keep doing what you are doing, and I look forward to coming back in the future.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poppies is a beautiful quiet haven within busy Kuta. Despite its excellent location right in the heart of all the hustle and bustle it provides a tranquil and serene escape. We loved everything about poppies, free prompt airport pick up, breakfast was delicious, staff were super friendly, villa very clean and comfortable and pool and grounds very well maintained. After I had left poppies I realised I had left my necklace in the safe at poppies, one of the staff very kindly brought it to me at my next accommodation in Seminyak. Thank you Poppies, would highly recommend!
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poppies is a very charming place with only 20 cottages, offering a calm oasis in the bustle of the Kuta neighbourhood. The cottages are very cute and nice and the staff very helpful. Only downside I'd say is that it's located about 10 minutes walk away from Kuta Beach - if the beach is your thing - and getting to and from the beach is a long parade of people wanting to sell you things, offer you massage etc.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poppies was fantastic! The staff is very helpful and always smiling. The drivers, especially Gede, are wonderful. I had an hour long ride with him and we talked and talked the whole way.They are in a great location right in the mix of things but it's so quiet inside the property that you wouldn't even know you're in a crazy busy town.I would recommend this place 100%If you're thinking about staying here just do it. You will not regret it.
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, great staff, great service. I loved It. Cozy bungalows, beautifully encased in a garden with ponds, plants and statues. Clean and tidy. I think, in 2 weeks of visit, the best hosting we had. Cherry on the cake room service (flawless) and a quiet and relaxing breakfast in intimacy delivered ti your Door...a must try!
hotelName:
15    Poppies Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 4 days here with my family of 4 adults and 2 children (5 & 7). Had a lovely, clean 2 bedroom villa with small kitchen (sink & fridge). Outdoor/garden bathrooms and our own private plunge pool. Friendly helpful staff and location was heavenly. We dream about returning here.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a beautiful relaxing place to stay . Stag a very friendly kind and always a smile . Such a credit to the hotel . Very reasonably priced and great value for money . Simple breakfast but enough to eat for sure . You will love your stay here
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My 2 friends and I stayed here in April for 2 nights. We shared a familyroom with seaview and we will surely recommend it to everyone. Beautiful rooms. Very spacy. Very good restaurant and reasonable prices. And we love the infiinity pool.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decided to take a break away from busy Kuta where we stay each time we come. Booked this place and were delighted to get a suite right on the sea front. Beautifully presented and clean. Loved the outdoor bathroom with shower. We had our own small pool and loads of outdoor area where we could sit and enjoy the view of the ocean. We found Candidasa very quite and relaxed. Plenty of choice of restaurants. We made a day trip to the water palace which was so beautiful and then onto Amed to snorkel. A great stay away from the hustle and bustle of busy Kuta.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful property set on the ocean..First class everything.Been coming here for years.Say no more.Wonderful staff,great restaurant and pool.Close to town.Lovely gardens,everything to relax youwell worth a visit
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A friend and I spent 2 nights at Bali Santi recently and were thrilled with the accommodation. Right on the beach, our room was lovely. There is a gorgeous infinity pool and a cafe serving food and drinks next to the pool, overlooking the beach. A short walk to warungs and restaurants and beautiful rice fields across the road. A great find.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were thrilled when we were taken to our room at Bali Santi.We were in the Courtney Love Suite or #11 which had a sea view.The room was mazing with your own fully serviced kitchen with full sized fridge.Massive semi outdoor bathroom.TV,Kettle,Beanbags for the pool,infinity pool and the restaurant was right next door to us.We just sat on our verandah and watched the sea.We had our own spa too but we only used that once.Food at the restaurant was good and reasonably priced.Ice cold beers and cool drinks.You can only walk a small distance along the beach at low tide and swimming was good.No snorkelling.You were just outside of town but close enough to still walk in.Outside the hotel there are rice fields and a couple of restaurants if you dont want to eat in the hotel.Im not sure if they had a courtesy vehicle to take you into town or not as we just walked.Everything about this place was perfect for us.You can have cheaper rooms with perhaps more privacy but we had a chat with everyone as they went past.Cant help ourselves
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Bali Santi Bungalows is a small property on the beach with a small swimming pool and restaurant. The bungalows were clean with outside bathrooms, they had tvs and video machines so you can play any DVDs you have bought. The staff were friendly and the hotel reception helpful with any requests. This place is not 5 star but was comfortable and quiet and reasonably priced, nice for some real rest and relaxation. The town is about 15 minuets away and the hotel offers car service to town for a few dollars which can be useful if raining or very hot.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here and what a hidden gem! Our little bungalow was beautiful! Spacious with a gorgeous bathroom with an outdoor shower . Spotless . Had a small kitchenette and outside a deck with views of the sea , just lovely! The restaurant had a beautiful view and good food . Quieter part of Bali ,but we loved it , would definitely stay again!!
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here 18 months ago and while the place is still very good you can see signs that is may not be being maintained as well as it could be.That aside the pool is great and it is great to see that you can now swim out the front. Last time the tides were far to high.We booked a sea view room and while it is great as it is very close to the pool the down side is it is next to the restaurant so what ever they are cooking you can smell in the bathroom and sometimes in the room itself.Additionally the staff are quite noisy when they start work around 6am making a sleep in impossible.If booking Seaview room, ask for room 1 as it is on the other side and not likely to be impacted by smell and noise.The wifi however is really really really poor. Last time we had not issues.Unfortunately many of the other guests were very selfish hogging day beds even though they weren’t using them or the pool leaving other guests who wanted them not able to use them
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2nd stay at this lovely hotel.Deluxe ocean view room with the most spectacular view ❤️- rooms at this hotel are appealing, clean, modern, spacious, smell nice, super comfortable bedding, good quality linen, good water pressure, great views, everything in tip top condition. Beautiful restaurant setting right on the ocean good food & service. Our go to in Candidasa ❤️
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a very nice time at Bali Santi Bungalows.We booked a standard and a deluxe room but as there were a bit far from each other, my mum wanted us to be closer and thy were kind enough to upgrade us on a private villa.No sea view but private pool and very nice room.We really loved it a lot.Restaurant facing the ocean, breakfast ok but would have like more options maybe....Reception staff were very helpfulRecommanding this hotel to anyone who want to relax in a nice place
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Based on the reviews i was expecting more, but the quality is just fine for the price. on the booking.com its says this is 4 star resort, would not believe that. our bungalow had very old decor and a bit dirty and smelly, but staff was very nice and friendly. breakfast very basic
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely stunning ... quiet and relaxing away from the noise of Kuta .... Lots of restaurants within walking distance and lots of local eating places ... fantastic staff...room spotless and cleaned daily .. highly recommend this hotel
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The garden is nice and gives you a tropical feeling. The restaurant is good, while it seems not very fancy. The bungalow was clean and stylish. We would recommend this place to relax and to visit the beautiful white sand beaches. However do not expect to have party’s in the city during the nights.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely beach view room, very spacious & clean, with its own plunge pool and kitchenette and balcony with the most beautiful view of the ocean.Restaurant good food & service with stunning view, very enjoyable way to have a meal. Gardens & swimming pool beautiful. Staff awesome.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 5 evenings there and couldn't fault the place. Staff were friendly and helpful. The bungalows were clean and spacious, the aircon ice cold and the showers piping hot. The bungalow was serviced daily, with fresh towels always provided. The breakfast was good, just enough to get your day going. I would happily return there.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: nice spacious bunglow with huge open air bathroom.very clean. every day they cleaned the bungalow, fresh towels etc.there is a little swimming pool looking over the sea. also providing towels for the swimmingpool.breakfast was good and wifi also.candidassa is a bit boring, but ok for a few nights
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The 20 bungalows, some with ocean view others with gatden have all been recently renovated to a high standard. Elegant furnishings, very large ensuite, with all the extras - tea/ coffee,tv, bar fridge, complimentary bottles of water, a/c, fans, toiletries, walk in wardrobe area, lovely verandah.Welcome drink of very fresh orange juice. Swimming pool overlooking the ocean. Staff very friendly and helpful. Room rate included breakfast with good choices.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had been here last year and were very happy to come here again. Friendly staff as always, nice, comfy room. Arranged for a scooter too. Good breakfast. This time we made ample use of the pool tool. Will surely return.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We like this place very much :)Very nice breakfast, professional staff, beautiful exterior and interior design.There is good restaurant nearby with spectacular view to rice fields and mountains!The beach is with black sand and many peaces of coral.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quaint hotel on the beach with nice pool. Good was good. Breakfast very good. Nice surprise to get upgraded from a garden view to Ocean view since the hotel was very quiet....not many tourists around due to Volcano. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: These bungalows are so beautiful. Especially the bathroom, we had a beautiful little pond inside the bathroom. The pond was filled with fish and surprisingly there were also two turtles swimming around in the pond. The area around the bungalows is beautifully green and there is a lot of vegatation. There is also a nice infinity pool located. Unfortunately, we were here only one night, the bungalows are definitly a nice location to spend more nights.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a beach front bungalow which was superb. Very clean, included breakfast was plentiful, restaurant menu for dining in covered a variety of dishes and prices comparable to outside eating places. Above all, staff very friendly.
