Very relaxing atmosphere. Although located outside the main centre, it is in walkking distance to the restaurants in the centre.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly thank you to Bali Santi for laying out HAPPY BIRTHDAY on the floor of our suite in flower petals. It was such a lovely surprise gesture, since we were saying on my 40th birthday.The hotel grounds, gardens, pools and rooms are gorgeous. I could have definitely stayed longer than 1 night, although I’m not sure the simple breakfast would excite me for too long. The suite was large, light and airy and served us well. There is some obvious wear and tear but it doesn’t affect the function of the room. The only issue we had was the extra bed that we’d paid an extra $28AUD for. It was just a mattress on the floor with a stained bedspread. We tried not to look too closely at the brown blob and stain on the bedspread, but it did look suspiciously like rat poo. Despite the extra bed, we enjoyed our stay.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place had a lot of mosquitoes and spiders, even inside the house although it was moderately clean! There were a lot of stains in the bungalow and some parts were sticky as well. The location is alright - in the middle of Candidasa town where you could easily walk out to restaurants and spas.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very well located, Santi Bali is well integrated in its environment. Away from the main road. The Bungalows have charming decoration and their own style. It is intimate, fits for a romantic stay with your lover or for quiet break with friends. The swimming pool although small is very nice and facing the sea.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For $50 AUD a night this is incredible value. Bungalow is quite big with comfy bed and a couch. Huge outdoor shower. Satellite tv with plenty of choice. Breakfast included is not huge but more than adequate. Property is well maintained and gardens are very pretty.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have just returned to the hustle and bustle of Kuta after spending 4 nights at the idealic Bali Santi Bungalows. This hotel is just perfection. The rooms are excellent and the restaurant can feed you for your full stay. Breakfast which was in lncluded in yhe room price was very nice. We had orange juice, omelette and bacon plus toast and jam and all the tea and coffee you desire.Our room (suite) had a 4 poster bed complete with a mosquito net which was not used. The outdoor shower was a shock at first but when used was a great addition.Would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the first review I've written where every single thing about the accommodation was perfect! We were in Viewbay rm 14, one bungalow back from being beachfront and think it had been recently renovated coz it seemed brand new! Lots of space, large comfy four-poster bed, TV (limited channel choices however), mini kitchen, large outdoor bathroom with good hot water and pressure, balcony with seating and oh that ocean view. Plus the little things such as: shampoo/conditioner, soaps, lots of hangers, safe, twin vanities, lots of shelf space, drying rack. No issues with plumbing or aircon or electrics. Wifi worked well outside, but a bit dodgy inside the room. Pool towels were provided direct to each room along with bath towels; however could've done with a hand towel, and could do with suitcase rack. Breakfast was included and was a simple menu, but adequate and always nice, served in the ocean front restaurant, which was open all day for meals/drinks, with ++taxes. Small Bintangs were Rp25,000, cocktail happy hour was 7-8pm with limited choices. The beachfront infinity pool was inviting, but a bit cold, with limited sun beds yet no problem with acquiring one. Bali Santi has about 19 bungalows angled to face the ocean, each with a verandah. There is also a private 2 room villa and a honeymoon suite. The location is walkable to the main eateries of which there are plenty, and candidasa is such that you don't get hassled to the point of frustration by hawkers. And Ketut from the spa charged Rp100,000 for a massage.There's no blue birds (local taxis) but lots of drivers, or hire a scooter to get about. The hotel has its own vehicles and charged Rp450,000 for airport pick up which is quite reasonable - we found a driver that did it for Rp350,000; and another for Rp400,000. With no traffic hiccups, roadworks or processions, the trip takes about hour-and-a-half.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second visit to the Bungalows and it did not disappoint again. The staff are great and always around to help. The rooms are clean and have everything that you need including a TV and DVD player. Short 10 mins to town plus plenty of places eat even nearer and good food from the street carts. For the price, location, infinity pool and service definitely worth a visit.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely small resort, garden outlook right on the ocean. Ocean view bungalows are good as you get a lovely ocean breeze. Short walk to local restaurants, great value for money. Lovely small infinity pool right on the ocean. We would stay here again. Candidasa was very quiet, maybe only for a few days relaxing.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was recommended to us and we understood why. Small, quiet, reasonable and clean with a great staff. Had a Seaview bungalow which was close to the pool and restaurant. About 8 sun chairs beside the small pool and others on other side of the restaurant. Had a small area for massage- great not having to go far to get one- and in open air, with just light curtains and the sound of water falling.We sat at the restaurant overlooking the sea most evenings enjoying the sunset.We ate there one evening and the food was good and well priced. So convenient.Had lunch by the pool one day- just 6 m from the restaurant do easy to get food and drink as you laze. Room was fine, a little older but great value for money. Lovely open air bathroom but had a glass door between this and the main room so while it was still relatively private it may not suit everyone. Enjoyed sitting on the verandah outside enjoying the breeze. Laundry service was very reasonable ( cheap) and we used their driver for a half day trip one day. Staff very accommodating.Free Wifi was spasmodic but that is common in BaliThere is a coffee shop - Loaf - just across the road and it is a short walk to a number of restaurants, shops and Alpha Marts. We enjoyed the quiet of this place, not big or commercial just real Bali.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Writing this review on our last night stay in bali santi. In love with this place, the view, the room, the surrounding, the restaurant. Had lunch at their restaurant and it taste good. The price were also very affordable. Will back for sure
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'd never been to Candidasa and Bali Santi didn't disappoint.. I just lounged by their infinity pool all three days.. next time i will venture out and travel around the countryside but I was seeking was some down time with my book.. the room I had was so cool.. an outdoor bathroom, a walkin robe and comfy bed.. so clean.. my was a deluxe garden view.. a few steps and I was by the pool and overlooking the ocean.. as the tide ebbed out I went down and had a swim.. nothing better than ocean washing over your skin.. I'll be back..
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice and quite we stayed in #20 was spacious outside toilet and shower.The breakfast was limited but o/K.It takes a while to get to Candi dasa about 2 hours drive to get there.There is not much to do there,but it was low season.The staff are great,the massages are nice and peaceful the wife had a few.Also there is no beach to speak of.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cute, typical little thatched roof bungalows. So cozy and romantic and lots of privacy. Some little ants in the very big bathroom. Toilet seat needed to be rehinged but we didn't mention it. Just a small inconvenience. The restaurant on the water and right beside the infinity pool is pretty amazing. Food is good and staff very friendly and helpful.The location is right across from rice paddies though the neighbourhood is quite simple - a village with several storefronts, diving providers and quite a selection of restaurants within walking distance - once you are used to walking in Bali !One of our very favourites !
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are clean and tastefully decorated. Right on the shoreline so it's wonderful to hear the waves crashing in. Good location close to some fantastic eating places. Staff are exceptional. Bar and restaurant was nice and good food. Breakfast was a little basic but was good. I would not hesitate to return.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a Deluxe bungalow with a sea view for a week. I wouldn't pay the extra again for the sea view, since the rooms are not set up as well as the others, (the others had walk in closets, and a more private bathroom) and you can take just a few steps out of any other room to see the same view. Breakfast was good, with a choice of eggs and bacon or sausage, pancake, or just toast, along with coffee and juice or fruit. The staff was always pleasant, and our room was serviced daily. If I were to return to this part of the world again, I'd stay here again.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked Bali on a whim as we needed to relax away from the crowds and pretty well do nothing but take care of ourselves. This is the place to do it! Lovely rooms, great breakfasts at the waterfront, lovely clean infinity pool, friendly staff who always have a gorgeous smile and tons of peace. You can easily walk to many bars and restaurants outside the property and there are some great places to get a massage nearby.The only couple of thing I would change are the pillows that are just too high (I used the pillow from the couch) and the mattress is very hard.I would definitely book here again
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Balisanti Bungalows is hidden gem in quiet town of Candidates. If you want relaxing stay with sounds of ocean and birds, free roaming chicken, cute and hungry cats it's a place for your.I stayed in beach front bungalow with private pool. As mentioned here before, there's no actual beach at Balisanti ( couple of nice beaches close by and hotel provides transfer) but the view from restaurant and infinity pool is nevertheless stunning. Staff is always friendly, smiling and helpful (as pretty much everyone else in Bali). Breakfast was included in price, dinner was extra. I had dinner in Balisanti almost every day of my stay, food was delicious and prices reasonable. If you want to tour around Bali, then Candidates is bit too much "out of the way". There are some local tour organisers (you can also book through hotel) but selection is better in Kuta, Denpansar or Ubud area and prices also bit lower.Couple of things to whine about: Bungalows are bit too close together, so not much privacy unless you close all the curtains; breakfast was bit inconsistent, some days fruit platter arrived before main, some days together with main, some days after and quantity of fruit also varied, some days additional cup of coffee was free, some days it cost extra.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came to Candidasa purely for some rest and relaxation, and that's exactly what I got.My bungalow was huge, with a mini kitchen, an outdoor bathroom and a front porch with a recliner that was perfect for lounging about on when I wasn't down by the pool.The pool is small but there weren't that many guests so it wasn't an issue. The restaurant next to the pool served decent fair at reasonable prices, and most of the time I ate here because it was convenient.All in all I was very happy at Bali Santi and will return again. I felt it was great value for money and enabled me to relax and have a well-earned break. The only things I would change was a) the pillows - all 4 were very high, so I had to resort to using one of the cushions off the sofa and b) my room was set well back from the restaurant and it was difficult getting wifi coverage, so I had to move down to the restaurant when I wanted to use this.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Bali Santi Resort for 4 nights and everything was perfect. We had our own spa pool and the room was huge with massive bathroom. The staff were so lovely and friendly and the food at the restaurant was great.We really enjoyed our stay for the 4 nights and really relaxed in the beautiful setting of this hotel. We will definitely be back.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is amazing, a beachfront bungalow with spectacular views. The food is good and the staff also very nice. We stayed in bungalow with sea view, just next to restaurant, a great place to spend the night. Wifi is good enough, and they have direct access to the beach, that we can enjoy the beach just few steps away. Hope there is another change to get back here with more nights...
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Originally we were book for 5 nights but due to family commitments we could only have 3. Sadly. We checked in late at night so couldn't see what was all around us but woke up to a little peace of heaven. For everyone that goes to mainstream Bali this is the total opposite. A little oasis on the edge of the ocean. We booked an ocean view bungalow and we literally 10 steps away from the infinity pool and the ocean. The restaurant / bar area is on the water and the staff are so very welcoming. Breakfast was included and there was a choice of 3 items with fresh fruit and fresh juices. Just perfect. Our bungalow had an outdoor bathroom which was just something so different and lovely. There are a few local restaurants which will pick you up but the food at the restaurant was lovely and so reasonable. We can't wait to go back.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Accommodation is excellent on the ocean, clean big rooms with modern outdoor shower/ toilet area. Very private. Restaurant nice food all meals well priced. Good location to other restaurants and local town.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely place at the beach, a bit far from the center, but plenty of transport options. Good food at the beach side restaurant at a reasonable price, small portions again. All bungalows are different, so cannot recommend any.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love this place so much. I can highly recommend staying here. The staff always made me feel right at home. I look forward to returning to sit with a drink in my hand by the pool and watch the sun setting. I could easily stay for a month or more.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely property with some superb bungalows and friendly staff.The first suite that they put us in was spacious with a nice fish pond in the bathroom with a fountain but didn't have a tub and had dirty toilet seat cover. Everything else was nice but we wanted the tub so they changed our suite. It was a little smaller but the bathroom was awesome and with clean toilet. It also had an outdoor fountain which seemed like it was the bungalows private one.Their welcome drink was so fresh and filling. The sea side pool next to the restaurant is nice but unfortunately we didn't have the time to enjoy it. On the other side they have sun beds and a bbq. We enjoyed a nightcap there.They arranged a nice new bike for us to get around. Breakfast was plenty and delicious.Only problem - You can hear insects/bird all through the night making it difficult for light sleepers like me. Next time will use ear plugs.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quiet and relaxing and very attentive and friendly staff. The bungalows are well equipped and there are lovely views. The bathrooms are particularly memorable - partly open roof, so a very back to nature feeling whilst still private!
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I checked out Bali Santi on the internet it looked great. It was actually better than I expected. The room was a great size with plenty of storage for all of our stuff, it was the beginning of a month long stay in Indonesia. The bathroom was massive and beautiful with gorgeous natural light. We had the bungalow behind the restaurant that had its own little plunge pool, which was awesome. The bungalow had a kitchen so we could have some of our duty free at our fingertips. The staff here are just lovely and happy to help. If you want a massage, you can't go past Ketut, she is amazing with such beautifully soft hands. I have a huge soft spot for Candidasa as it's on the seaside and it's pretty quiet. We have been coming here for 18 years and can't imagine going to Indo without a stop in Candidasa. Next time we will stay longer at Bali Santi.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved it here. Bungalows were spacious and comfortable. Setting was quiet and gardens nice.Infinity pool overlooks the bay and ocean.Restaurant serves cold beers and other beverages as well as breakfast lunch and dinner.Walking distance to bars and restaurants if you want to eat out.Will stay again when in Candidasa
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very peaceful. Fantastic private spa room with ocean views. Easy walk to town. Small hotel with varying styles of rooms including family room . We would definitely stay again. Great restaurants in Candidasa. Easy to explore the east coast of Bali from Candidasa.
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoy the pool that is built into the Seawall overlooking crystal clear water & a tranquil small boat mooring that is protected by an old break water.Rooms have good air conditioning & relaxing waterfront barHotel breakfast is goodCheck out the local Warungs for a great variety of local fresh seafoodThe hotel is surrounded within a short walk to many cheap good quality local Warungs (local restaurant with local food)Try La Putu on Jl. Madira 5 mini it's by carIt's a great base to use to venture out on excursions to the mountains/ temples & villages or as we did go on a boat ride to White Beach or Blue Lagoon to some fascinating colourful marine life including turtles, brilliantly coloured fish & coral regrowth As with most destinations the seaside location specialise in fresh seafood dishes & Chicken while I would avoid seafood in the mountain villages because it probably may not be fresh, unless it's a fresh water fish. Check it out before it's cooked
hotelName:
16    Bali Santi-Bungalows By The Beach
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We decided to have a pink tour through the different PinkCoco hotels after getting recomendations from friends and surely after reading the amazing on line comments.We directly contacted the hotels to get a better deal for our stay with a free upgrade and lower price.We started in Bali which we enjoyed so much in the Penthouse with an amazing sunset view from the top.The hotel is cozy and we loved the adults only pool where the staff provided free flavored water and free snacks everyday. Later we realized that's common in all Pinkcoco hotels , same as they do evening turn down with free nite-cookies and scented oil burners.Are these hotels really three star rated? From Bali we stayed in Gili Air and if Bali was great , this was wow !No words can describe the emotion of swimming at night under the moon , the superb staff service and the unique sunset experience sipping a Mojito while swinging in the famous pink swing.Lastly , we wanted to have some fun, we stayed at the property in Gili T where the party normally goes on until late at night with a chilled atmosphere with a funky crowd .The sunset was even better than in Gili Air and we considered ourselves so fortunate for having decided this pink tour that we will definitely do again.Thanks to all, Deli, Putu, Stefano, Lalu, Jojo and Made.We love you guys. Thank you so so much .
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an original booking at PinkCoco at Gili T however all boats were cancelled so we were lucky enough to get a night at PinkCoco Uluwatu. I’m so glad we did because it’s honestly so amazing. Staff were so helpful at both PinkCoco’s. The rooms and area in general were gorgeous. Turn down service was a treat they left the room smelling Devine even had little chocolates. We ate at the trattoria for dinner and breakfast it was delicious. Also the place with no name had great food too.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are currently staying here and it’s just wonderful. Great rooms, quiet and peaceful. Lots of places to sit down read and have some sun. Pools are great. Staff is so kind and attentive. Will definitely come back! Love pink coco
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really love this place it's clean, quiet and the people who are working there are really nice. I definately recommand this place to others. The beach is nearby, supermarkets in front and enough places for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Pinkcoco thank you for your hospitality and kindness
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Pinkcoco is a wonderful and very 'homey' hotel that is nicely appointed, very quiet and relaxing. We stayed as a family with our six year old and she loved it - especially the pool and free wifi! The Pinkcoco is in a great spot, just 200m walk from the gorgeous Padang-Padang beach which is a safe for swimming (lifeguard) has rock caves to explore and comes complete with a host of cheeky monkeys. Surfing and stand-up paddle boarding lessons are also available. There are plenty of great eating places on the nearby strip, but you can't go past the in-house Italian restaurant 'Trattoria' which has an enormous range of well-priced food and have super-awesome staff. I can't recommend the place highly enough. It's also close enough to get to cool tourist spots such as Ulawatu Temple - we hired a Grab (download the Grab app) for 4 hours for AU$27 and the driver dropped us, helped get tickets and brought us home (don't get a Grab one way and expect to get one to pick you up as there will be about 500-800 tourists also waiting!)
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is amazing the friendliest people you can come across. Hotel is super mellow beautiful property super clean. The rooms are prefect it’s all you need close to all the surf breaks and restaurants. Would highly recommend
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely loved Pink Coco!!!! We are travelling around the world on our honeymoon and this was our favorite room of the entire trip. Rooftop#2 was brand new for us, and everything was sparkling clean and decorated amazingly! So luxurious and with the most amazing view. Trini at the front desk, made our stay even better with her friendly and welcoming way, always remembering our names, checking on the details, and over all honestly caring about how we were enjoying our stay. The entire staff was wonderful, the hotel so clean, and epic pools. From the refreshing fruit water and cool mist and towels they greet you with when you arrive, to the genuine hugs when we left, we loved Pink Coco and can't wait to return!
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was just what we wanted...close to the beach, the rooms were excellent, very clean & comfy. Staff excellent and nothing was to much trouble. The restaurant just next door was perfect for us but there was also may just down the road that we had some fantastic food at... amazing breakfasts. I would defenatly recommend this place.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely loved our stay at PinkCoco. The rooms are a great size, with a large bed. The gorgeous shower was by far the greatest part of the room, and the pool and shared areas were beautiful. The small touches really made our stay - fresh coconut water on arrival, the welcome bracelets and the turn down service at night. Each night, someone came to the room, to release the large net canopy over the bed and to light mosquito repellent candles. The restaurant attached( although not a part of the hotel) was delicious and very affordable. We will be back Maddie & Maddie ❤️
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: PinkCoco is absolutely above standard, lovely staff from garden man Zulu to recpetion Tini. Breakfast is delicious with 5 options. Like that you had 2 pools and a place to make yoga, reading spots every where. Will be back.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful boutique hotel in Uluwatu. The price is very reasonable for what you get. The room was lovely, the pools were amazing and the staff were friendly and helpful. There is even an onsite day spa which was great. We cannot wait to go back!
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for two nights. Big room, could have been cleaner for the price per night. Also after the room was cleaned there was this really persistent smell of sewage, my girlfriend just thought it was incense but I found the smell absolutely nauseating (maybe it is just me). The pools were nice and big. Breakfast is included if you have a booking.com genius status. Breakfast was very good, especially the eggs benedict. Be aware there are monkeys near the hotel, we had one on our balcony so remember to keep your balcony door closed when you are not in your room.Do not get your clothes washed at the hotel itself. I explicitly asked that they wash my clothes only with cold water, but they did not and some of my clothes were ruined. I did not have to pay for the wash service, but I would have expected more compensation. Scooters were on the expensive side if you rent them for one day (100.000IDR) and do not include fuel. Also this is the only place on our trip where they checked the scooters for damage, so make pictures before you sign the rental agreement.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pink Coco is an awesome little hotel very close to Padang Padang Beach. The location is perfect for anyone who wants to be at the beach but not pay for the beach. The rooms are large and immaculate. The staff are super friendly and very helpful. There are 3 pools so always somewhere to hang out. There are plenty of restaurants near by and lots of shopping. Uluwatu temple is about 2.5 kms away. I highly recommend the Pink coco.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first stay here at Pinkcoco and we just loved it. From our first friendly welcome hello, to our fresh coconut drink and rose water face wash we knew we were in for a treat. Room 11 was our palace for 4 nights. Perfect to a tee. Big comfortable bed, divine pillows and pretty mosquito net canopy. The indoor/outdoor bathroom provided all we needed. Fabulous shower with delightful body wash and shampoo. Our room was cleaned every morning to perfection. And at night the bed was turned down, electronic mossie protection turned on, a candle lit and little treats left on the bed. We used the round pool outside our room. Pure bliss. Plenty of shade if you preferred and lemon drinking water on tap. We felt so relaxed and at peace for our entire stay. All of the staff were delightful, pleasant and helpful. You could tell they all had pride in Pinkcoco. Thank you to Pinkcoco for making our stay so wonderful.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service was outstanding, the staffs are super friendly and warm and always sincerely helpful. They gave us a bracelet and a luggage tag to remember them. Cute, comfortable room. Mosquito net, mosquito repellent are always ready in the room. To make sure that the we didn't get disturbed by the mosquitoes, they lit the mosquito repellent in the afternoon, along with aromatherapy candle that made our room smells really great. They also paid attention to every tiny details like providing hairbands in the bathroom. Everything was in pink. The pool was amazing also. We swam in the evening, the water was warm and clean. Padang Padang beach is just 2 minutes walk from the hotel. The only downside was the loud live music from the cafe nearby. But the music was pretty good though, for us it wasn't really disturbing. For those of you who wants a quiet, peaceful night, make sure to choose a room in the back or near the pool so that the music didn't disturb you that much. Definitely recommended for anybody visiting Uluwatu. Looking forward to coming back!
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This just wasn't our scene, I reckon it might be great if you're young and want hostel vibes but with private rooms. Kids hooking up in the pool at night, aircon didn't work, loud music outside the room until midnight and a smelly bathroom. Staff seemed nice enough but they forgot to order our taxi to the airport even after we asked them twice and they said they had. This was on the day a massive World Bank conference was happening and only certain cars were allowed to go to the airport. Luckily we managed to catch a lift with someone going to a different terminal and we made our flight.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time I’ve stayed in this area. Loved this hotel. Old style Bali with some fun quirkiness. We had an upstairs room near the Adult Only pool. It was spacious with a large bathroom and lovely veranda overlooking the clean, quiet pool. Tea making and a good fridge. Excellent helpful staff and some nice welcoming touches. 5 minutes walk to beautiful (sometimes crowded) Padang Padang beach and 30 minutes walk to Bingin Beach. Close to Mango Cafe and Bukit Cafe. We’ll be back.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property was amazing, there were so many little details and effort put in by the staff that made it incredible - from the pink bracelets they give you on arrival, the rose water face mist, room cleanliness, to turning turn down the room each night.The Manager also made a point of greeting us and ensuring we had a great stay.I would highly recommend staying here.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The atmosphere of the hotel is top notch. It has nice pools, the staff is very friendly,the manager made,tini and the rest of the team are superb,the hotel is very lucky to have them. We had a room at the "adult" pool for the first 2 nights, then 2 nights on the first floor with a sea view. Rooms are very atmospheric. Every night the room is prepared by the staff sleep with an atmosphere candle, nice scent, "mosquito" free and a surprise in bed, very nice.Enough eateries nearby. Padang padang beach around the corner, dreambeach in the vicinity but the most beautiful beach is more to the south. White beach, blue sea and besides, you are almost alone hereDefinitely will come back again!
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super clean room, cleaned once a day then turned down at night time lovley touch. Staff there are sweet. Staff in resturant are really lovely Just a few points i would like to highlightComfortable bed, however does get a bit cold at night maybe good to have a slightly thinker one on top.The shower is a lovely feature to look at however it is really hard to get a warm shower with it either being scalding hot or cold The night time noise from mango tree and bar and chill was so bad in one of the nights DJ playing house music until 2am. It seems to be on different nights as a couple of nights there was no music. We really felt sorry for the families that night with young children. Would be great if reception or greeting including a show around of were everything was, spa resturants etc.Amelia and trevor
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed with my boyfriend in Pinkcoco Bali after reading so many good comments in TA, and so lucky we chose it .This is a quaint hotel very well designed with ample rooms if you take a Horizon room type and very nice semi open bathrooms too.I love the shower which is a lava stone and the water runs like a waterfall. Very original touch and great feeling to be under a waterfall.This little hotel has 3 pools , one only for adults which we appreciate a lot. But what is out of this world is the level of service and touches . From the check in with nice cold towels , iced tea and a pink bracelet of course.During the day they pass around fruits skewers around the pool and they provide free fruit water .All th staff are amazing with always a sincere smile on their face . Thanks Tini and Desy for all your help.The room is cleaned twice a day and at night they put an aroma scented oil in the room, a mosquitoe set though we did not feel any mosquitoe during this time of the year, actually at night may be chilly .The pity is that the hotel does not manage their restaurant though seems to be next year they will take over . Nothing wrong with the restaurant but too Italian for everyday meal . Would have wanted a more international food but the dishes that I ate were tasty.The hotel is just walking distance from the beach and there are many other places around to eat and drink.I personally like Horizon 13 which is the biggest room they have. The price was fair for the high season but I would not save a few dollars looking for something cheaper as this hotel is managed very profesionally. We booked direct and they gave us a special price. We wanted to visit their hotel in Gili T but they told us is closed for some renovation after the earthquake they had on August 5 but we will go for sure next time .  There is an independent spa at the back of the hotel and I was very happy with the service . Price was quite reasonable for the month of August when everywhere is full . Remember to book in advance .So very recommendable and pretty hotel. I luv it !
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is ok, but way too expensive for what you get.There is a lot of noice until late in the night from the beergarden next to it. The room smelled very bad, like I was sleeping in a sewer. We paid 100€ and we didnt even get breakfast.The girls from the reception are very nice, the manager is not at all. I would not recommend to stay here for more than 30€ a Night.We feel very fooled and deceived. There are much better hotels around for less than half the price.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for the second time at Pinkcoco for 5 nights and it was just as perfect as the first time! Lovely staff, amazing room, and the facilities are stunning. So close to Padang Padang beach and great eating spots, it's an oasis and just makes relaxing so easy. Thank you to the super special team there, we can't wait to come back as soon as we can!!!!!
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was originally booked for Pinkcoco Gili T, however due to high seas was unable to make it across to Gili T. Was booked through one of Expedias brands and was ready to accept defeat and find alternative accommodation in Bali for the time we were meant to be on Gili. However a friend recommended I call the hotel to see if they could rebook me to a later date. Ended up speaking to Meiki who was fantastic, super helpful and accommodating. Originally was able to move my dates at Pinkcoco Gili T to a few nights later however upon further investigation into the ferries it was apparent we weren't guaranteed to get across. Decided to ask Meiki if we could stay at Pinkcoco Bali instead, and upon a bit of checking we were told we could!Spoke with Made who was 10/10 in his service and hospitality. Due to availability issues we had to move rooms during our stay but we were very appreciative they were able to accommodate us at all so it wasnt a big deal at all.Rooms were massive, with very comfortable beds. I'd say the decor was very romantic however would suit families and groups too. Pools were awesome, and the setting was very laid back. Just what we needed after escaping the main tourist areas of Kuta and Seminyak. Wasn't a major fan of Padang Padang beach but the hotel is well situated for exploring the southern tip of the island, and is handy to must do's such as Single Fin and El Kabron.Overall thoroughly enjoyed my stay there. Definitely try Mango Tree for lunch and Beetroot Bali for brekkie, both 2 mins walk from the hotel.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We come back here every year again. The rooms are big, clean and have a great style. You have two pools to hang out after an awesome day surfing. Padang-Padang and some other great surf spots are just a walk distance away. Also Perfect for families with kids. The Hotel Manger I Made and the whole crew make your holidays easy. Thanks to Tini, Daysi, Zulu, Putu and staff. You guys rock. See you next year again :-)
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Pink Coco with another couple and really enjoyed staying here! The room was wonderful and serviced daily. Most nights we took advantage of watching the sunset from our balcony! Near great restaurants, spa and Pedang Pedang beach. Enjoyed relaxing by the adult pool. We would stay here again and recommend it to our friends and family.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good: All the staff I encountered were just super friendly and went out of their way to remember the names of all guests and to ensure your stay was comfortable. Also the design of the entire property and the facilities is amazing.Bad: On my first night I encountered 3 large cockroaches in the bathroom. When I mentioned it the next morning the staff was extremely apologetic and ensured my room was deep cleaned on the day. Location wise it was ok as I was attending a wedding very close by, however for the rest there is not much to do around.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights, its a decent hotel with a nice restaurant at the front. The rooms are comfortable, clean and spacious. They have 2 pools, the adult pool is very relaxing and the staff are very attentive, they come around with cold towels and fruit periodicallyGreat value for money, recommended
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here from six nights and had a great time. The hotel is a short walk to Padang Padang beach (which is a better swimming spot than Uluwatu) and there are lots of restaurants and cafes nearby to. The staff were also very attentive and friendly, and looked after me when I was a little under the weather. Will definitely be staying here again!
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location 5 mins from Padang Padang beachStaff is very nicePools are really nice- one small one bigThe room is well decorated. The shower is like a waterfall. There are so many interesting items in the room. Loved everything about it.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel which located just a few minutes from the famous Padang Padang Beach, is incredible. Its the perfect place to enjoy relaxing holidays in the paradise. Pink Coco provides more than the expected and will always be my favourite place on the Island.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights when I was in Bali for work. I didn't spend much time in the room as was working but what I did experience was great. The staff are super friendly and willing to assist with anything. I arrived after a 3 hour drive really hungover and they were kind to offer drinks and water haha There is an Italian restaurant attached and although it's not part of the hotel so need to pay at the end of each meal. Reasonably priced and good food. We were probably given the worst room they had as it was tucked in the corner of a courtyard so quite dingy but it was still totally fine. There are 2 pool areas, 1 which is adults only and always really peaceful, my husband spent a whole day here on his own whilst I was out. Few little bars and restaurants within walking distance and it was reasonably priced, so for me it ticked all the boxes.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Centrally located on the Bukit Peninsula this place was very clean, the staff was amazing and they take pride in their facility. I found out from the lady who owns Can Chill Warung next door that PinkCoco was the only spot in town for many years. The community has grown up around PinkCoco and that suits the place really well as the staff goes out of their way to make you feel at home. We really appreciated their genuine kindness and willingness to help us with everything we needed. Just a short walk to Padang Padang and a healthy 1.5 mile trek to Uluwatu. I did it every morning with board in hand at age 47, needless to say I was warmed up for my surf when I arrived. They also didn’t know we were brining our 9 month old since we booked through Expedia, and as soon as we arrived the upgraded us because we had a baby. It was super thoughtful.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing place ! We spent 6 days In pinkcoco In Bali In roof top apartament. The view was amazing, the room was clean, the staff prepared it every morning and night. They have 3 swimming pools! For kids and for adults. Whole area is very beautiful and całym (except the roosters each morning ). The staff and whole customer service are very helpful and friendly. Those 6 days In pinkcoco were Really Great !❤️Thank you !!! Magdalena and Dominik
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything about Pinkcoco is amazing!!! I stayed for 3 nights... such a lovely place to stay, great staff, 3 pools,... they even make your room ‘ready to sleep’ every night!!!The food in the restaurant in front of Pinkcoco is nice... there is plenty of choice. The location of pinkcoco is great. You can walk to the beach, there are a few restaurants in walking distance, two mini markets,...I would definitely recommend Pinkcoco!!!
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Place is incredibly peacefully. Had a scam booking and needed to find a place to stay pretty late in the afternoon.Found these guys cruising around searching for a place. Staff and reception lady was so welcoming and helpfull.Got us sorted pretty quick. Same awesome service as their pace in Gili T Island. Will definitely recommend them to anyone. All the facilities that you'd need. Cheers till next time.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Pinkcoco for 1 night for a little bit of quiet away from Kuta. As soon as we got there we felt it was more like a little bit of paradise away from Kuta. Beautiful hotel and fabulous staff. We enjoyed it so much that we booked to go to their sister hotel in Gili T. Thank you for making us so welcome and making our holiday a fabulous one.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No hesitation in recommending this place; great pools and clean spacious rooms. We booked the 360 view room which was great. The location isn't too central so it would be best if you can ride a scooter. Taxis are overpriced so you need to get the bluebird taxi app but for that you need an indonesian sim card. We couldn't get a taxi from single fin around 7:30pm so had to get a "local taxi" that charged 50k (down from 100k) for a 3 minute ride. Mango tree is a good restaurant nearby, very friendly staff and reasonably priced. Finally, Pinkcoco wouldn't be what it is without two very special ladies; Toni and Ventry. Hopefully the management read these reviews and recognise what a vital role they play. They were extremely helpful and so polite. They recommended places to eat, were honest that the taxis were expensive (this level of honesty was refreshing in bali) and got us an indonesian sim when we needed. Every time we went past they would smile and wave. We needed an iron and ironing board, all we needed to do was whatsapp them and it was brought up within minutes. The water didn't work one morning and it was fixed promptly. These two ladies were fabulous. We really wanted to recognise what a great job they did in making our stay so pleasant. Thanks ladies!The positive reviews about Pinkcoco was what prompted us to book it and we were glad we did. My wife and I would highly recommend this place.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved this place. I was only there for 3 nights, but I wish it was longer. PinkCoco really captures the essence of Uluwatu, with a touch of luxury.There are several 5 star resorts nearby, if that's what you fancy. But I much prefer a place that lets you experience the unique vibe of a location, without having to sacrifice creature comforts :)
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely one of the best hotel experiences. Gives you the cozy feeling of a guest house but with adorable, chic and rustic rooms and 5 star service. Great location if you plan on walking to the beach and local restaurants. 8 minute walk to Padang-Padang beach, 10 minutes to Bukit Cafe, which is amazing! Great bar next door with live music and a cool vibe. Fantastic restaurant on the premises. Pool is refreshing and there if even an adults only section of you want something more peaceful, although I never found it necessary as the hotel guests, kids included, seemed very relaxed and chilled out. Felt super safe at night walking around. The staff are so friendly and accommodating. Traveled with my boyfriend to Bali and the Gili Islands for three weeks. Came for 3 nights in the beginning of our trip. Tried to extend the stay another night but they were booked. So we traveled around a bit more and came back for our last week. I even decided to stay alone for a few days while waiting to take off on my next adventure. Will definitely be back again!!
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we arrived till we left we were pampered by the complete staff (Dessy, Tini, Ventry, Zul and all the others)! They showed us the well decorated stylish (pink) room with poolview as we booked. But we were attracted by the 360 degrees view room and after the ladies showed us the room we changed to this room (upgrade). Perfect room with a big own terrace on top of the building with perfect view. As said the whole staff is taking care for you as a guest. Free cooled cucumberwater at the pool, slices of watermelon are offered, every evening the room is prepared for the night etc. Breakfast you can have at nextdoor restaurant Trattoria, with a wide variety. Also drinks at the pool you can order Trattoria. For dinner there are many choices in Padang Padang Beach, but we can recommend Trattoria also.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the third time in seven years I've stayed at Pink Coco and will keep coming back! I've stayed there solo and also w/my wife and kids. The hotel and staff are superb; the onsite restaurant always delicious pasta and pizzas; and the rooms/grounds are unique, immaculate, and ultra peaceful. Lots of other great restaurant options within walking distance too. And excellent beach just down the road, and many of the world's best surfing spots just minutes away. A few days there and I feel balance restored in my life. Can't wait to go back again soon!
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great hotel in terms of location in Ulu Watu - the rooms where great and the staff extremely friendly - not a huge hotel, so feels very private especially with a GF or wife which was nice - they have a good hotel price for the scooter which you need in this area as everything is far away and the price of a scooter for the day equals a taxi ride.no breakfast which was a shame, but they are wonderful restaurants nearby!
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had an amazing couple of days here. The staff were very helpful, the rooms had a great energy and the pool right outside was a nice touch. Great value for money. Scooters were available for a good price and the day spa attached to the hotel is wonderful.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed for two nights. We were in the upstairs rooms, loved the rooms and air con. After traveling it was a lovely relaxing break for us. The restaurant was maybe more expensive than expected, but table service costs. All in all I would definitely bring my family or friends back for a visit. Great value for money.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a long day at the beach my girlfriends and I finished the day at Pink Coco Bali. We spent the evening chilling at the pool with nice refreshing cocktails following by a relaxing massage at the spa and wrapping the night with an amazing food at the beautiful restaurant (I loved the blue pendant lights by the way!)I definitely want to highlight the great service we had, the staff is fantastic so friendly and kind. I highly recommended it!!!
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed at PinkCoco (yes, everything is pink) for 4 nights at the beginning of August. We were greeted with a welcome tray of iced tea, a cool washcloth, a pink sarong, and a pink bracelet! Every staff member was so gracious and helpful, from letting us use their phone to call a credit company to hailing us a driver late in the evening when we had a medical emergency to printing out our plane tickets. The accommodations are artistic and comfortable, with a veranda and daybed that looked out onto a beautiful infinity pool. The adjoining spa and restaurant are not part of the hotel but we appreciated having such easy access. There were also fabulous restaurants including Mango Tree and an Italian and sushi restaurants, which were a thirty-second walk from our hotel room. We hope to be back. 5 stars.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were unsure what to expect , but this hotel did not disappoint. on arrival we were greeted warmly and after a lovely chat taken to our poolside room. All was as the photos on line. Comfy bed with mossie nets and outside bathroom which was quite an experience during a storm ! lovely outdoor sofa under cover for relaxing out of the sun. Three very clean and pleasant pools one of which was Adults only, not really an issue as there was only one little girl staying!The staff could not have been more helpful including the maintenance man who got the tv to show the formula 1 for my husband who wanted to see Louis Hamilon win! The hotel has some nice eateries close by . We would not hesitate to recommend the pink coco as we could not fault it.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights in this amazing hotel. Really nice room (NATA) and staff was very friendly and nice. Nearby padang padang beach and nice places to eat. Restaurant in hotel is also very nice. I would definitely recommend everybody to stay in PinkCoco Uluwatu!!Gr, Ann
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've never written a review before but this place really made an impression on us. We booked a room for 3 nights but didn't realize how far our room was away from the pool. We thought we had booked a room at poolside our mistake.The explained the situation to the staff who were amazing especially the two reception girls ( absolute gems), really they did everything they could to get us the room we wanted as the hotel was really full and sure enough they managed to work there magic. Nothing was to much trouble the ambience and the tranquility of this place is just pure heaven. The 3 pools and just the little things like providing cold water by the pool really makes this place shine from the rest.Thanks for a wonderful stay we cant wait to come back.P.S Hold onto those wonderful staff you have.Guy & Dewi
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The PinkCoco was a magical little haven. We stayed for 3 nights here and could easily have extended. Positioned perfectly off the main road and next to all the popular beaches and restaurants/bars. We had room 19, right next to one of the pools, beautiful outdoor bathroom attached, they photos they have up don't really do it justice. We hired a scooter which the hotel arranged, smooth process. Overall the place was super. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed at PinkCoco for 3 nights at the end of our trip around Bali, and it was the perfect haven in which to relax and unwind in Uluwatu. The staff are incredibly helpful - so much so that they gave us a free room upgrade when we arrived, as well as offering us fruit throughout the day by the pool, and just being friendly when you see them around in general. The rooms are beautifully designed, as well as the bathrooms, and the whole place has a wonderful, boutique feel.The hotel is well-situated for Padang Padang beach (a short walk) and there are plenty of great cafes and restaurants nearby (Om Burger and Bukit Cafe to name a few - and the Italian restaurant at the hotel is delicious too) but it would be useful to get a motorbike if you wanted to explore the other beaches. Also useful to get the Bluebird taxi app - we used the hotel's cars a couple of times to get to destinations, but found ourselves being ripped off by local (unlicensed) taxis back, so Bluebird is definitely the way forward - and 10x cheaper (literally, in some cases).We loved our stay at PinkCoco and would definitely return if we found ourselves in Uluwatu again!
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at pink coco 2 years ago and we decided to stay there again this summer because we had very good memories of the place.It's the first time that i witness myself so many improvement in a service that was already great.The staff is super kind and do whatever they can to make your stay fantastic, the rooms are very clean and in mint conditions.We've been here with our baby girl who loved the swimming pool and the italian restaurant which is a partner of pink coco.We will definitely come back next time we'll be in Balip.s. padang padang is at walking distance, i went surfing there early morning with very few people in the water
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was better than we had expected, and we really liked the look of it online.The room was huge, clean and beautifully designed with simple furnishings. We didn't realise beforehand that the whole resort was architect designed, which showed in the small touches that made it feel very welcoming. The WIFI was great, even in our room. The full surround mozzie net meant that we could sleep with the windows open and avoid the aircon.The staff were fabulous and couldn't be more helpful, even arranging scooter hire for our stay.The location was nice and central and surrounded by some really quality restaurants, although they have one of the best in the area themselves.The beach is just down the road and the area felt really safe during the eveningsMost of all its right near some world famous surf breaks but somehow manages to avoid the hype that goes with that proximityWe loved it and will definitely be back.Thanks guys
hotelName:
17    PinkCoco Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a week inFeb 2019. Amazing location, pool looks right over the water where you can swim and watch seaweed farmers. Bungalows are new and clean. Shower is the best we've ever found in Indonesia. Lovely accommodating staff and good breakfast. Close to good restaurants and dive shops. Will stay here again.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stayPros...- lucky enough to be able to check in early- large room and cold fridge (deluxe room)- huge bathroom/nice hot water- ease of getting pool towels- location- good poolCons...- breakfast, if you don't eat eggs your options are limited. On day three I asked for fresh orange juice but didn't get 'fresh' yet couple two tables down did. Perhaps to improve the breakfast experience, rather than limiting the choices it might be better to give guests a $$$ cap and allow to chose anything from the menu to that value.- staff knowledge, we wanted to hire bicycles as our insurance didn't cover me as a pillion passenger on a scooter/motor bike. Staff had little knowledge of where we could hire bicycles. Turns out there are what appear to be some good bicycles only a couple of hundred meters away. Instead based on the advice provided we walked into the main part of town when we could have got them much closer and appeared to be much better than what we hired.- bed, while comfortable was noisy getting in and out.Despite these small things, we would recommend and if we come back to Lembongan would stay again. Dogs were very friendly and not too annoying.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was ok, room, staff, view, breakfast and food.....Location is right on the beach, you could touch the sands, swimming in the sea is a good choose activity enjoy the sunbed and waiting for sunset everyday. Recomended
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Pemedal for 4 nights and loved it. The hotel is directly on the beach and the scenery is beautiful. The room was fairly big and comfortable and the staff were very helpful and friendly and the service was great, couldn't really fault it. Only negatives were that one side of the room is made up of windows and open shutters, consequently it does very little to block out noise. You can hear everything, from the waves on the beach (lovely) to your next door neighbour using the toilet (not so lovely). The curtains are also very thin and don't block out much light. The room stays lovely and cool but if you're a light sleeper like me, you'll be woken by the sun by 6.30 every day. Overall though, great price and beautiful location.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our 4-days-stay in Pemadal beach Resort. Directly at the Lungut Batu beach is had everything you wish for — we had to say, that it is one of the nicest places, including the beach, you could be on Lembongan. Of course Dream beach is fancy, has a nice restaurant, but also crowds of selfie-crazy tourists and massive waves. Wann swim? Wait for the tides and enjoy cristal clear turquoise water or a nice beach walk, looking out for good places to dine. Pemadal was very relaxed, clean, well equipped; the waiters very friendly, the service excellent. Breakfast that is included, was wonderful. Normal size pool, nice dogs. We will come back!
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed for 4 nights in a deluxe room less than 50m from the beach. The hotel arranged fast boat transfer from our previous location in Ubud using D'camel boat. The transfers were faultless and a very smooth crossing, upon arrival on Lembongan they use a floating jetty rather than having to wade through the water. The hotel location in our opinion was perfect, beachfront yet within walking distance to many bars and a local supermarket. Hotel grounds were very well presented with gardeners constantly maintain the grounds. Our deluxe bungalow was very spacious with a comfortable bed and all required amenities, bathroom consisted of a large wet room with both a shower and separate bath tub. There was always sunbeds available and the pool was both clean and rarely in use. Staff were always smiling and very polite. We found the breakfast very tasty and fresh and enjoyed our evening meals watching the sunset. Overall it was a very relaxing and enjoyable stay and would definitely return to this hotel in the future
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a sea view bungalow, overlooking both the pool and the beach. Decent size rooms, Comfortablr beds, great aircon, good wifi, huge bathroom with lots of hot water and lots of English TV channels, including some with movies.Nice size pool, good restaurant, reasonably priced and nice food.9nly downside was that the bungalows have one large panel that has no window, just slats with no mosquito net so whilst it remains private (nobody can see in), there is a chance for bugs and mosquitos to get in, although we had none in our room. It also means you can hear all noise from outside and there was a particularly noisy, selfish Indian family in 2 bungalows a couple of doors up from us and if they were awake, everybody was awake. Could be a problem for light sleepers.Hotel has a nice beach (grit not sand) and is conveniently close to a few shops and bars.Good choice for a stay on Lembongan.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for four nights and it was the most pleasant stay. Compared to other resorts in urban Bali, the staff here are super friendly and always wearing a smile on their face. The rooms are neat and clean, and the staff were always there to help when needed. excellent view from the room. The restaurant is lovely and the food there is delicious. Enjoyed every bit of our stay. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with 4 other couples. Was surprised what we got for $50 a night. Could sit in the pool all day and enjoy the view. Hire a bike from reception and explore the island. Lemongrass restaurant is a great pick and about 5min walk as you turn right out the front gate. Will be back again
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Awesome location, very clean room and unique, lovely staff best spot for sunset, there are many restaurants in Lembongan island, rent scooter and around the island is one of the best activities to explore this island. Going to snorkeling in manta bay with a greatest challenge, also in gamat and crystal bay.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are staying in Sanur for two weeks and thought it would be a treat to have two nights away on Lembongan, we only stayed for one. We chose this hotel having read some great reviews online and were really excited about the stay. I have to say that check in was friendly and we were given cold drinks/towels on arrival. Our room wasn't quite ready but this was because we were early, having arrived with Glory boats ( great service by the way) at around 10.30. This wasn't a problem as there are plenty of restaurants along the beach to sit and wait.When we were shown to our room, we were initially very pleased, as it seemed comfortable and clean. However, we soon discovered that there were many little things that let the room down:1. No loo roll - we had to ask at reception. 2. No kettle - just an old fashioned filter coffee machine that was a bit grubby. This was odd as there was no filter coffee in the room and if you wanted an instant, you had to walk over to the hotel bar to request hot water.3. No hair dryer, not the biggest deal in the world but a bit inconvenient- again had to ask at reception. 4. For a deluxe room, the bathroom felt a bit dirty and the shower was pretty ineffectual. 5. The safe was very temperamental, there was a trick to getting the numbers to register!6. The bedside light was broken.Maybe the worst thing though was the swimming pool. This is described as an infinity pool I guess if you looked at it from the correct angle, it could well be.2 However, it was very small with only half a dozen beds round it. Also, the pool water itself was quite murky so put us off getting in.On a positive note:1. The location is great with fantastic views of Mount Agung.2. The beach is stunning and water crystal clear.3. Amazing sunset from a bean bag on the beach.Could be a great place if a little more car was taken with the rooms, sorry Pemedal!
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this location!!! Great hidden spot. Drinks really cold and food is great. Fantastic service and friendly staff. Access to the pool and beach if you are exerting food and drinks. Definitely work a stop for the day. Pull up a bean bag and settle in. Great vibe ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay - wonderful staff. The front desk helped us rent scooters and arranged travel back to the boat off the island. The restaurant runs on Bali time but everyone was friendly and the room was perfectly clean. The neighbors have a rooster, so there’s that - but after the first day it just kinda made us laugh.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights and loved it! Good value for money.Easy check-in and spotless, roomy accomodation (we had a deluxe room) which had a fridge and a king size bed (firm).Pool is awesome! Warm overlooking the beach. If you want to beach swim you may need to invest in some ‘booties’/‘aqua-shoes’ as the rocks/shells/coral is quite harsh underfoot.View is amazing and the sunset is beautiful from the beach.Restaurant ok (basic breakfast but suffice - ask for no onion in your omelette). So many places around for a bite to eat but main meals here are good. Good music.We hired a scooter to get around the island and happy we did. Location is good but limited if you are on foot. There are some amazing places to see over at Ceningan and Mushroom Beach is a must.Staff are friendly and helpful.All up a very relaxing stay... we will be back.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this place , traditional Balinese style bungalows , clean and comfortable and right on the beach . Pool area and restaurant also good value . Great cocktails. Fantastic price for a beachfront property although not all rooms have fridges . Friendly staff . Would definitely stay there again
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This little hotel is fantastic. It is located right in front of the ocean - which you can view from their infinity pool or sunbed area. The rooms are gorgeous: each is an individual bungalow and has its own porch, and the inside is entirely made of wood. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Even though the resort does not have its own spa, the staff made it easy to arrange a visit to a nearby Kemilau Spa which exceeded our expectations. It’s oceanfront location was perfect: not only did it allow for direct enjoyment of the beach but also made it convenient to walk along the beach and enjoy other oceanfront restaurants and bars. The hotel was very clean during our stay.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is everything you would hope from a beach front hotel. Infinity pool, bountiful plumerias, calm beach, quiet grounds, cheerful staff, and a/c cooled wood paneled rooms. My wife and I stayed here during our honeymoon and were treated with the respect and kindness that you hope for on that joyous trip. The island is fun to explore but we loved to come back after a long day to relax by the pool, eat tasty snacks and drink delicious drinks. If you want to live in the lap of luxury stay here.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sadly , we arrived in Bali after a long journey from the UK.On our first night, there was an earthquake which obviously scared us immensely. We were travelling with our 2 children and was very concerned about the situation. We had booked 3 nights at The Pemedal Beach. The morning after the earthquake we rang the Pemedal to advise that we would not be travelling to Nusa Lembongan and staying at Pemedal as we were all too scared to travel to a small island in these circumstances. There had been several earthquakes in the vicinity previously, in addition the sea was very rough. Pemedal advised in the telphone conversation that they would make a 10% charge for our booking and refund the rest of our money.Sadly this has not been the case and a refund and not been given to us.Why would they agree to this and then not honour it?We were looking forward to our stay in Nusa Lembongan but circumstances beyond our control made it unsafe to travel.It is very disappointing that you did not keep your promise, we paid you a lot of money!Lets hope you reconsider and refund us as you promised.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in a bungalow near the beach. Great location and good outlook over the beach. Very relaxing on the lounges or by the pool. Easy walk along the beach to other resorts and restaurants. A bit noisy in the morning from neighbouring roosters. Try and get middle villas close to beach
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Unfortunately I’ve been in this hotel only one night! The room was nicely decorated and very clean, the restaurant serves food all day and it’s pretty good too. They gave us a towel for the sun bed looking the beach. The position is good, you can walk to all the bars and restaurants on the beach or inside on the street. The staff is nice and helpful.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Pemedal Beach for 5 days. The location is awesome, and the sorroundings are beautiful! Our room was of the deluxe type, which is slightly bigger than the other ones, and has a tub, but there’s no way to there’s enough hot water to fill it. When we arrived our room looked clean, but there was a lot of dust and spider webs on the headboard of the bed. We mentioned thos to the staff, but it was never cleaned. We also used the coffee cups provided as well as the two glasses for water, the were not replaced even though we put the out for the cleaner to see. Same thing with our take away feom the restaurant. It was in our room for 3 days, before we removed it ourselves.If you go, go for the view and the pool. The on site restaurant is not worth visiting except for the breakfast.I always ask myself if I would recommend the place to a friend, and sadly this is not the case this time.With more attentive staff, and a good cleaning of the grounds, this place could be fantastic!
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The resort is located on the beach at the quiet end with not many boats around so the beach is fairly clean. The Superior room is clean with a nice deck overlooking the beach. The bathroom could do a better clean; tiles were a little mouldy and peeling wall paint. Room doesn't have a fridge and found out the Deluxe room does have it and also a nice bathroom so I would pay extra and stay in Deluxe next time. Breakfast was limited but adequate. Staff are great. Really enjoyed my stay, will definitely return
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: These villas were amazing. Literally right on the beach. Rooms were a great size. Staff was very friendly especially my new friend Putu Budayasa the barman. Only small downside was no fridge in the room which didnt really matter anyway. Beautiful pool right on the beach.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel as it is located right next to the beach. So you can enjoy the sea view while swimming in the pool or having food in the restaurant. However the beach is not suitable for swimming. The huts are clean but not very big, the bathrooms though are big. Superior rooms doesn't have minibar. Staffs were polite and very helpful. The restaurant remain open quite late and the food is also good, but limited choices. Breakfast could have been better. However there were quite a few good eating place nearby (especially Lemongrass)
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great accommodation. Quiet spot. Beautiful beach. Excellent breakfasts. Lovely and accommodating staff. Beautiful pool. Our family loved staying at the Pemedal Beach Villa and we will definitely be back.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Traveling with my syster and this hotel is totally okay but not more. The room is really cute but the bathroom is not, the pressure in the shower barely exist and the bathroom and water doesn't smell very good Im afraid.But I like the room,good fluffy pillows but the but itself really need a matress because you can feel the the feathers(?) in the bed. I think the breakfast is good, you get a meny with many different dishes to choose from. And also coffee and fresh juice. The guy in the restaurant (I don't know his name!!) is so so so nice! I love his smile in the morning :)And the other staff is also really nice and helpful!!They have a beautiful garden which they take good care of! Its really beautiful!There are plenty of sunbeds and a cute infinity pool. But I do think they should set up a few rules by the pool, there is a asia familj here that eat next to the pool and even in it. After they were done there was a half lime flooting around in the pool and rice all over a sunbed.. They were also playing and screening really loud in the pool late at night. So when your bungalow next to the pool (as we are) it gets reaaaally loud. Im not a very pick person Im just trying to be honest! And I don't like food in the pool:)The hotel is on the beach which is Nice but the beach is unfortunately not very clean.. Indonesia and lembongan is really beautiful so its a shame that no one (gouvernment) doesn't do anything about the problem. I think it would be Nice if all the hotels try to do their best and clean the beach next to their hotel. Im not sure Im coming back to lembongan after seeing all the trash here by the beach.. A restaurant close by the hotel are cleaning the beach next to the restaurant and that is really good, all the hotels should do the same. Anyway, the wifi works good most of the times. This is a good hotel, you get what you pay for :)
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this resort due to its proximity to the surf breaks and it is ideally located for that. The pool is lovely, but the restaurant area lacks any vibe and is functional not inviting. Food is okay.I missed out on a deluxe room and as a result there was no fridge. Our aircon was so noisy we got moved to another room.I wouldn't say it's the cleanest of areas either. Bathrooms need a serious disinfect. Our toilet leaked from the underneath too so god knows what bacteria lurks - suffice to say I was unwell for the bulk of my stay here. Aside from the surf I wouldn't recommend.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a week after reading pretty good reviews of this place.Pros - The room was clean, was a good size and the air con kept it very cool. We were literally just steps to the pool and beach. Plenty of lounge chairs by the pool and beach.Looks out over Shipwrecks surf break. Staff was friendly enough.Cons - When i asked if they served cocktails (i didnt see any on the menu) I was told no.I'm kind of surprised that no one has mentioned this in their comments. Maybe I misunderstood but I never saw anybody with one in their hand for the entire week we were there. They do have Bintang though and I had my duty free!Rooms were only cleaned maybe every 3rd day. That didnt bother me too much because when i asked for something such as toilet paper, it was quickly provided.There is no shower curtain in the bathroom so the floor can get wet by the toilet etc.The bathroom is a good size though.Breakfast was a bit poor .... The couple of cooked items, (rice & vegetables) were cold and they didnt refill anything so there wasnt much too choose from. Same thing happened every day.I didnt find out until the day before we left that they had another breakfast menu you could order from. It seemed they were reluctant to hand it out because they werent too keen to have to cook.All in all the price was good and we would probably stay there again if we couldn't manage to book our favorite place.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
