review_body: Beach front hotel, simple breakfast. Close to all shops and restaurant. Very friendly staff always willing to help.Of you surf there is a surf spot right in front of the hotel, you can see the waves from the swimming pool
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pemedal Beach Villas have a very friendly staff. The restaurant has pretty decent food, a Indonesian style breakfast in the morning, with fruit, juices and coffee. The beach is beautiful right out in front with lounging areas, chairs etc. Shade. The pool was not that clean at the time, lots of kids and families were staying there, so was a bit cloudy and funky. Pemedal is located within walking distance to many restaurants, spas and yoga! We went diving next door at Blue Corner Dive Center, which is literally next door and very convenient! The resort is also quiet since you have to walk a little ways down a little path into town. Our villa had a great porch, clean, comfortable, hot water, safe, no refrigerator which I missed. Nusa Lembongan goes through tons of plastic water bottles, burns trash, which you can smell in the am and pm. I would recommend having large water containers located at the resort so you can refill your water bottles instead of having to buy more and more....I would recommend booking the ferry directly through Pemedal since it's cheaper and better service than booking on your own. Pemedal is really special place, and I would go back and stay, especially for the staff!
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great property with bungalows few steps from the beach. Lots of sunbeds and fresh beach towels are supplied. Enjoy great views from the pool. Breakfast was ok but the restaurant doesn't have much for lunch or dinner.Friendly staff though not many speak English. Housekeeping needs to tighten their belt....the salt water/calcium deposits on the jet spray and dirty blocked shower heads were a sore point in an otherwise perfect stay.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was on the beach and nice ocean view !Food was not too bad...breakfast was not many option only noodle or fried rice and bit of fruits ...the service was bit slow ... the power cut off quite often maybe 3 times or 4 times a day no light and Aircon so it was so hot !
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The entrance sets the mood, being quite rustic. The deluxe rooms are a good size and very nice inside. the air con works well and the bathroom is big. a shower curtain would have been nice to keep the water off the toilet. One thing is to take earplugs, the roosters are loud. The breakfast was very plain with only 4 dishes to choose from, and no eggs. I opted for the sliced sausage and chilies which was tasty enough but after a week of that I was looking for something different. We had lunch there a few times and the food was good and the beer cold. What was quite odd was that on the beach chairs they had a cocktail list but at the bar they said they didn't make cocktails. Maybe it was something to do with the renovations that were going on. The new reception was being worked on and one staff member said they were going to extend the swimming pool. The location is good being near some nice places to eat an a handy mini mart. The view of Shipwrecks from the pool and dining area was a treat. I would stay there again but just hope the renovations are finished by then
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great start to Nusa Lembongan. I loved this accommodation with its little bungalows. It was quiet with its private beach and pool and then things to do close by. the rooms were comfortable, but I do think they need to brighten them up a little as they are a tiny bit dark. Maybe some more lighting? Huge bathrooms. The neighbouring hotels provide some good dinner options and then the Spa that is close by (on main road walk towards Mahgari hotel) is AMAZING. Worth the visit. The smaller rooms have not got a fridge so if you want one you will need the higher room type. The bar will provide ice on request though.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful little cottages right next to the ocean. The rooms were very tidy and had good air conditioning. Unfortunately our room didn't have a refrigerator but we knew that when we booked as the deluxe rooms were sold out. Location is great and close to town. Would suggest renting a scooter though. Pool is right on the water and has a great view of the sunset. Breakfast is very basic but is fine. Don't expect a western style buffet. Staff are friendly and were happy to help.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dropped in while on Lembogan because of a mates recommendation. We were staying up the beach a little further away. Great layout of timber bungalows and the pool looks great. Its a small property and nothing fancy but that's what I'm after. Its on the beach, its quiet, its close to food, there's legendary surf breaks out the front and you can book dive/ snorkel trips from the resort.I'm going back in a few months to stay for a week. Cant wait.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was very clean and had all the furniture and equipment needed for a good stay, perhaps except fridge. However, the hotell provided newly fresh water everyday and cleaned the room. The bungalows was located almost right at the beach with a nice pool, the hotel also provided a lot of sun beds at the pool as well as at the beach. The breakfast buffé offered was all right, but nothing spectacular. Well worth the money.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff, okay cleanliness, nice beach, alright food. Your bathroom mat and towels wouldn't be changed unless you told them to. Nusa Lembongan is a fairly small island and is not super clean. We saw people burning garbage not too far away from the hotel. People who book from Agoda are most likely getting the rooms that are the closest to the loud villege/kampung (accidentally saw their check-in check-out board behind the reception). The hotel is very close to the nicely paved main road that has many restaurants and little shops. It was quite convenient for us, although there was always a dog or two, following us when walking from the hotel street to the big road.We were glad we didn't stay around the other beaches as the way to get to some of them, such as the Dream beach, can be a bit confusing if you go by a scooter and some parts of the road are a bit bumpy. We rented a scooter from Pemedal for Rp80k and explored the island. Caution: no insurance, no helmets. We don't think we saw a police station either, but the island seemed very safe.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got a bungalow with seaview from the porch. I spent so many hours in the pool just watching the ocean and the mountains over at Bali. Had front-row scene of Mount Agung's cold eruption. It's located far from the main tourist-areas, near the locals. We love that. Yes, the rooms are dark, but then again, you don't spend much time there anyway. The wifi is slow and sometimes not working at all. But this is a place to disconnect. Great diving and snorkling companys just around the corner. Not far from Adimart. Takes about 30 minutes to walk to Jungut batu. Friendly staff. Wish I could give it 5 stars, but the cleaning of the rooms weren't that good, even though we tipped some days. The breakfast was good depending on who was the chef. We stayed 10 days, and loved it.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Checked out today, I will just go with pros and consPros - great location right on beach and view from bungalows. Bungalows are beautiful, clean spacious and well maintained, staff are friendly. Food ok. Con - DO NOT stay in rooms 100 to 106 on northern side of property, the noise from the locals and their roosters is terrible, motorbikes at 5am loud thumping music and roosters crow from 4am to 4pm. Can not put air con on at night it rattles, did ask to move but said fully booked, they looked at air con but no different,
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice place, on a beautiful stretch of beach. Beautiful wooden bungalows, everything looks new, is nicely decorated and it's very clean. Great staff and amazing pool, next to the beach. Would definitely come back here and would recommend to anyone!
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely place with beautiful staff. Basic but special. Had a lovely time here while diving nusa Lembongan. Roosters were a complimentary alarm clock.. We had deluxe room which was very spacious. Staff could not have been more helpful.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: stayed here with family for 2 nights with 4 rooms... it was a very beautiful bungalow, the room was spacious, cold aircon, the hotel offered boat transport which is very helpful for us, you can also rent motorbike from the hotel.easy access to the beach with a sunset point. i love staying at Pemedal.the only thing, the reception lady was not so friendly and breakfast was only 3 different choices of menu, which is too bad. there is no drinking water supply in the room.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was in Bali between sept 17th and sept 30th, and I went 2,5 days in Nusa Lembongan, I stayed in Pemedal, a very very nice place, all bungalows are in wood.. wood from the ground to the walls and also the roof lol, it looks so nice! The food was very good, and the staff was friendly, I'd like to thank Putu, a guy from the staff, he is so kind!!!! even the way he put things on your table is done with extreme elegancy..to be honnest I never seen that.. even in the best restaurant I went to.. so, Putu, you are awesome!the beach is very nice...and only 15 meters from my bungalow, the swimming pool is 10 meters from the beach.. woooow ;)) Outisde Pemedal area, there's everything: shops, ATMs,Motorbikes renting etc etc.. Pemedal Bungalows is definitely a place I recommend and I'll choose for my next visit in Lembongan! a very nice place to stay! :)
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my family recently and had the best stay , The rooms are beautiful and right on the beach , meals are fantastic and Bingtangs cold . Beautiful pool . And you are over looking Shipwrecks surf break . Meals and beverages very reasonable and the staff so friendly my family were sad to say goodbye to everyone. It's a very special place and we will definitely stay here next trip . The locals are very cool and relaxed . Sunsets are stunning. Would recommend Pemedal Beach .
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a superior room with the sea view, but there wasn't a sea view. We said about that to the hotel staff but they didn't do anything about that, just said its close to the beach. That was a big disapoitment for us. Room was ok, bathroom basic. Cleaness ok, but cleaners didn't do their job very well. Well overall room was ok. Beach was fantastic, propably the best on lembongan! Restaurant staff was exellent and food was tasty with good prices. You can rent a motorbike from the hotel with ok price. Overall hotel was good.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked Pemedal Beach Villas through Agoda after considering many other villas- not really knowing much about the location. How wonderfully surprised we were when we arrived to see the most beautiful view out across to the reef and ultimately to Bali. There are only about 20 villas so it is very quite and safe. The room we chose was a superior. It had ample room and a beautiful Balcony we had unit 111 and it is the first on the left looking to the ocean so great uninterrupted views. The rooms are fairly basic with great air con, TV, small wardrobe and some shelves. A good King size bed. The bathroom is huge with good quality toilet a shower and and basin. They supply soap and shampoo but no hairdryers. The linen and towels are changed daily and pool towels are provided.There is no safe in the room nor at reception- but the units are well secure and we had no problems leaving our valuables. There was no fridge or phone....but in all honesty we survived 2 weeks with out these easily. our rooms was about 10 steps to the pool and 15 steps to the restaurant. I believe the delux rooms have a fridge The restaurant has a lovely tropical feel and looks out across the beach. They provided breakfast as part of our package. It was basic but lovely. a choice of omelette/eggs/pancakes/fresh fruit and juice or coffee. the menu changed daily and we sampled everything and were never disappointed. They have a good lunch menu and a different dinner menu. Everything we sampled was lovely. Especially the mash and sauteed vegetables on our last night.You can book boat or fishing tours, island tours, ferry returns all from reception easily and when we wanted to go some where they would organise transport for us and we paid the driver a small fee. They have the best beach front with lovely white sand and sun lounges under thatched wooden umbrella shades. An adequate small infinity pool sits beside the restaurant looking out to sea.Overall we totally enjoyed our stay at this resort, The staff are fabulous and very helpful and special thanks to Santa who really can do anything and always has a great smile and happy greeting. My husband and I are in the close to retirement bracket and we had more than enough to occupy our time here. I give it 4/5. But don't expect a Nusa Dua type of holiday this is a small island and things a very laid back. No pretentiousness here
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we arrived at the hotel with our 3 kids the room was not ready- the welcome was very bad - we had to wait more than 3 hours - once in the room the beds for the kids were not prepared and we were requested to pay 3 times the price despite the clear content of the contract- no smile at all during the 3 days we stayed until the manager called us and threat us to call the police and kick us out if we do not pay to get the 3 beds for our kids - ( as per mangers own words) - they also refused to serve the breakfast ... the most awful experience ever since we are traveling - and certainly not a place to stay with your family if you are in Bali. We had so many others good experiences on the island.The pemedal hotel is the hotel to avoid !!!!!
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with a group of friends. The cottages here are all timber, fairly simple with furnishings (air-con, tv) but perfect if you are after a relaxing getaway and not too fussed about not having 5 star furnishings. The gardens around the cottages are beautifully maintained and the staff are incredibly helpful. However if you are a light sleeper the roosters going off in the morning (from 4am) can be a bit annoying - if this is you - pack some earplugs :)The breakfast here is basic but ok. The views at sunset from the pool or one of the lounges on the beach is magnificent.Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved these bungalows. Simple, clean, good air con, comfy beds & great location. The breakfast is basic but sufficient. The pool was lovely & being right on the beach meant you could go for an ocean dip too. I hired a motor bike here & it was so much better than the ones my friends got on the street, had more guts going up the hills. Can't wait to come back here.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this place direct for 3 nights and was not dissapointed. Absolutely gorgeous. Staff very helpful. Rooms very clean. Breakfast was more than enough to start the day and food from the restuarant was not only delicious but reasonably priced. Location is fantastic. Overall this place is an absolute hidden gem in paradise. We will definitely be back!
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything is perfect .. from the spacious and clean hotel rooms, the ac is cool enough, the atmosphere is so quiet, the staff is very good, the people around are very friendly, the local food is also a lot to sell, the pool is clean, the beach is still very original and the water Very clear, make sure to go snokling .. a great holiday and not forgotten. Love this place so much.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great huts that are very roomy, great beds with a big bathroom, no safe in room and you have to buy water but very clean breakfast was ok , the pool was great best spot overlooking the beach which had a lot of coral so a bit hard on the feet but had great sunsets and view, I would love to return to the Pemedal Beach Villa
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have spent a night in this villa cause it seems that it looks nice. However, the room is not as good as what we expected. The room has a very weird smell and the toilet door create a high pitch sound when closing. The staffs seem friendly and willing to help us. By the way, the welcome drinks is so tasty.
hotelName:
18    Pemedal Beach Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in private villa with pool for 2nights. Rooms where cleane and nice. AC was leaking some water to the bed and on the night there was few ceckos in the sealing at night (see photo) Rented scooter for few days 80k/dayHotel is a bit remote located, but if you rent scooter or just want to relax at hotel this is just please for that.Breakfast was served to the room every morning, there was few options for sets.Staff was helpful and friendly. Can recommend
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in Bali for our honeymoon and stayed in Nusa Lembongan for a night. It was a lovely, spacious room and bathroom and view was just lovely, including the forest around us. The pool is such a great feature! We opted to get back from our tour a little earlier just to laze in the pool a bit. It has such a great view and lush garden around it, just like the pictures!We also did our tour of West Penida and dinner at Hai Bar and Grill through recommendations from the resort. They were spot on! Great breakfast too.Just a point- We had the Deluxe room with the sea view.We knew that the bathroom was separate which is fine .There is a common walkway between the bathroom and the room and hence can be tricky for some. But still would recommend.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To get out for a morning dive (pre-booked with Twin Island Dive) I arrived late on Tuesday night to dive on Wednesday morning. The staff were friendly, the room was spotless and the setting was scenic. I was on a very tight schedule but with the help of the villa staff and both Kip and Bryce I had a good nights sleep and two amazing dives.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m french who’s living in London, I came here with British friends. We are extremely happy about this resort where the staff is just incredibly amazing, where the food is great , prices are very affordable, we had the best cocktails ever made by a great bar tender . Balinese people are just so kind and mindful of everything. Just come in and you will feel home in a paradise.. and you will meet nice people from the borough..highly recommended.. also the place is not like most of resort as not a lot of tourists then your experience will be unique. Can t wait to come back :)) .. my instagram available for all pictures on Bali highlights :)Sylvain_thefrench
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my partner booked the Sea View Bungalow for 3 nights. The overall experience was positive and I would highly recommend this place.The place is perched on the hillside over looking Nusa Ceningan that was an amazing view to wake up to. Breakfast is also sent to your room, which made the overall experience a lot more positive. The only downside is the resort is located at a more remote area of the island with less than ideal roads leading up to it. Hence, be prepared to rent a scooter to get around. I read the other reviews that this is a major gripe of the other guests. I guess if this villa was located any where nearer to the "city" area (Jungutbatu), the prices would be a lot higher and the villa would lost its charm as a peaceful retreat away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Nonetheless, in this part of the island, there were plenty of really good cafes 10 minutes away such as Mama Mia that did not require reservations to get in (unlike those in the city), but provided good food without the crowd. The staff also provided in every room a booklet detailing all the recommended cafes at different price points.In my opinion, this villa offered very good value at its price.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The resort is hidden at the less busy side of the island with stunning views. The rooms are clean, they provide a good breakfast and the staff is very friendly. I recommend renting a scooter while staying here due to its location. Thanks for our stay!
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a cute little hut style room. We played extra for a pool but not realizing it was not like it was in the photos, we didnt even use it! We really enjoyed the villa and the cute decor. Would have been the cleanest bathroom we had while in Bali. Friendly staff.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My girlfriend and I stayed there for four nights. We stayed in the treetop and private pool villa. What killed the vibe was lack of training in hospitality management. I’ve stayed at far less quality places that did were more catering to guests. The improvements are easy to fix so I’m sure this place could be next level.Pros: (1) The rooms are nice and clean. (2) The people working there are warm and friendly Cons: (1) No privacy, while in the “private pool villa” staff would walk into our area unannounced to fix things or clean on at least two occasions. The villa walls are all glass and we could have been undressed. It felt invasive. (3) they didn’t have an iron on site for us to press our clothes, 1* motels have irons...(2) breakfast and dinner is mediocre - juice is watered down and food is bland. (4) not a a big critique but robes in the room would have been a inexpensive nice touch
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am truly surprised to read the past few reviews, as we had an amazing experience at this hotel. We arrived here tired and sleep deprived and were blown away by this place and never felt more relaxed.We had a quick and smooth check in, and got to stay in the room with view over the straight between Lembongan and Cenengan with the yellow bridge, phenomenal! (we booked garden view, not sure if this meant we got an upgrade). The room was nice and clean, and has a nice semi-open bathroom with warm water. There are different options for breakfast and always delivered hot and on time (even earlier once upon request). Our first day we spent relaxing at the hotel, which has phenomenal views over the cliffs with a few different terraces and an infinity pool. Lunch is really good. Personnel is exceptionally friendly and on point to help/serve when needed. Yes the hotel is quite remote, but this is what you get if you want cliff views and tranquility. If you want to get around, you definitely need to know how to ride a scooter, as walking is not an option (the road is very steep with potholes and no lighting). There is a good restaurant direct opposite the place and there are restaurants that offer a pickup + drop-off otherwise. A scooter ride to the Jungutbatu area will take around 20 min.We recommend this place to others and would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Twin Island for 4 nights we stayed in 2 different rooms. The first 3 nights were spent in the Bungalow with Garden view this was a lovely room and we really liked the feel to it. We then had to move for our last night (mistakenly booked 2 different rooms) to the more expensive room of the Double Room with Balcony and Sea View, we was expecting this room to be nicer and although larger the room had 2 lights out of 4 that worked, the fan in room did not work, the door was hanging off the hinge and worst of all the toilet completely stunk of sewage. So already unimpressed with the hotel this on the last night was the icing on the cake. The breakfast was horrendous and by horrendous I mean the food was completely cold when delivered to us twice. We asked the first day for a new one to get a slightly warmer breakfast but by the second day we didn’t even bother and after that breakfast was off the cards for us. You also get wasps attacking you for you breakfast if you have it on your balcony. Which resulted us sitting on edge of our bed trying to eat our cold breakfast. Unpleasant to say the least. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL IF YOU DO NOT KNOW HOW TO RIDE A MOTORBIKE. This is the biggest factor to the hotel of all. If you do not know how to ride a motorbike you will not be able to get anywhere as this hotel is in the middle of nowhere. Luckily for us we knew how to ride a motorbike so it wasn’t a problem for us. But for someone booking this place unknowingly it could lead to devastating results if you can’t explore anywhere. There is no option provided by the hotel to help you get around or any kind of taxi services on the island.The hotel staff in general were not very helpful. Upon asking advice around the island they were useless. We also requested that we could get a scoopy bike before we arrived at the hotel, which they said would not be a problem and that they could get it from another company/hotel. When we arrived and asked about it they said this is not something they can do and we can only use there bike which was a dirty small bike which was rather uncomfortable for the 2 of us. We also asked twice if we could change this to be given the same answer of no. We also asked if we could stay in our first room the whole 4 nights as we didn’t want to move about and we thought the hotel would have recognised that we had 2 bookings and helped sort this as many other hotels do. They originally said that we wouldn’t have to move room but then said we would have to when showing us to our room. Overall a bad stay at Twin Island Villas, the only positive being the first room we stayed in, but other than that I cannot think of any more positives. It’s a shame really as this could be a nice hotel if they sorted out some of these issues.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Twin island dive center is a best place to organise you a great day out diving at the most beautiful dive sites. This is defently one of the best dives i have done so many beautiful corals seen turtles and massive GTs and so many other fish that i could be writing the names over a arms length cant wait to diving with Kip and his crew again on my next trip
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: People say oh you’ve gone to such and such a place you should write a review-I always think....what’s the point of a review and THEN I happened upon a place like this and I realize I need to share my experience especially since it’s a small island and if I wish to return and find this holiday oasis- others need to know it exists!! I'll say this experience was a Surf and Turf holiday, since I spent time on land and at sea. Each morning I enjoyed my delicious breakfast brought to me by the lovely staff, everything plated and ready for consumption with a view that you will never experience any place else but sitting on the balconies of Twin Island Villas.Looking out over the yellow bridge with a view of Nusa Ceningan and Nusa Penida in your peripheral is a moment to treasure. So yes, now you know...Twin Island Villas is all about location- location- location!! Complete with the attention to details and the commitment to service is what makes this place stellar. Cleanliness is godliness and in my room I felt like a goddess. The bathroom is semi outdoor letting in just the right amount of breezey sea air. The modern fixtures and cool sinks caught my eye and I've made mental notes for whenever I build my house to include the stone sink. The luxurious and infinite pool called to me on a daily basis however because I went diving and on a day excursion to Nusa Penida I was only able to indulge for one night.And now comes the surf how convenient to have accommodation and diving all in one place!! All I had to do to get ready for my dive was wake up go down to the front office and sit with Bryce to talk about step by step how the experience would unfold. When I got in the water I actually knew what was coming next. They provided complete transportation to and from the accommodation to the dive site where we launched. The whole time on the boat your are starring into the most crystal clear water with blue hues for days. It was all a visually stunning experience; taking in the sea on the Ceningan channel on the way to Nusa Penida. Capt Pinky and I were all smiles and heading to the dive sites made me feel like being on this beautiful island was where everyone needs to be. Onwards! as the crystal blue water on either side of the boat cut into the waves effortlessly; we arrived to our first dive site. Bryce our instructor explained everything he had talked about on land I gearded up with his help and did my first entry into the water- Perfect! I gave myself a 10. My friend came next I give him a 10 too. We came to the front of the boat at Bryce's direction...now remember this is my very first time diving in the sea and he explained everything and as we descended and the air was released from my vest, I had a moment of extreme peace and calm. Swimming with the fish is magnificent! Down and down we went from my exclamation you would think it was meters long but in reality it’s probably only 6 feet deep there I got to see amazing sites and I was guided with an occasional OK sign in my peripheral, in my front vision, or directly in front of me. With each signal I felt completely comfortable and I responded with glee a word hardly ever used but so appropriate for this instance. I emphatically recommend Twin Island Villas for accommodation an diving. Book your next holiday here and I am sure you will have a wonderful experience.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 4 nights at Twin Island Villas while we were in Lembongan. We wanted a nice quiet place to relax on our holiday and Twin Island Villas was 100% perfect!The staff were very friendly and on our check in, we were given lots of information about the resort and the island. The location had amazing views and it was very peaceful in among the tress!
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Twin Island Villas is nestled away between trees and hidden on top of a hill which looks out over the ‘yellow bridge’ and Nusa Ceningan. It’s quiet here. Peaceful. When we first arrived, the staff were kind enough to pick us up from our prior accommodation on the busier side of the island and transport us up the winding hills to the villas. With superb views out across the two islands, the balcony was the highlight of our room, and featured comfortable seating and even a game of Jenga to pass the rainy days of the musim hujan (rainy season).The location of the property is inconvenient, yet brilliant at the same time. The accommodation doesn’t have its own restaurant (breakfast is served in the rooms though) and it’s too far to walk to access the island’s restaurants and bars. Renting a motorcycle is the best option and the staff are happily able to arrange this. The remoteness, despite its inconvenience (especially during the wet season), is also perhaps why you will love this place.There is a swimming pool here and although it is rather small, it boasts excellent views over the strait and was mostly unused by other guests during our stay. Twin Island Villas also offers scuba diving and the staff were approachable, knowledgeable and helpful in this field.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An awesome secluded island style getaway, overlooking a channel with a touch of personal attention and attention to comfort and needs.Skilled diving, dive sited, staff and equipment were amazing. Definitely do this again.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: People that complain about the tranquillity of this part of the island just don't get it; that is why you should go here! A badly maintained road to the resort makes sure there is no traffic noise...! The rooms are all very different and probably the only minor point could be noise from other guests, but as we chose a bungalow, we had no complaints. We enjoyed the freshly cooked breakfast and found it to be sufficient, if anything maybe some more fruit would top it of. The reason for choosing this resort would be the surroundings, the dive facility and the staff. Kip and Sarah run a good place and staff here do speak good english, something you shouldn't take for granted here, and are therefore very helpful with booking boat tickets etc.The dive facility is very well run, equipment modern and well maintained and safety comes first. As a well travelled dive instructor, I can highly recommend them.For dinner, restaurants will pick you up and drop you off (again, the wonderful staff will help you here), but D.Mas is 10 steps away and worth the 10 steps.Do rent a scooter (cheap and quickly organized) and drive around to see why Twin island is great to stay and relax.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My second trip to Lembongan and while the island has developed a lot since my last visit, Twin Island is still in an undisturbed little haven away from the occasionally pumping music of Jungut Batu!It's a grown a little since my last trip, some additional rooms and a much needed sun patio in front of the bar for afternoon tanning sessions, but still maintains its island charm. The new staff are smiley and helpful and make a good poolside sandwich and cocktail!Don't read too much into the picky reviews, this isn't The Ritz and should be critiqued accordingly! The rooms are perfectly well cleaned and towels and bedding changed as needed without trying to kill the environment. The rooms have a rustic Balinese feel and their little quirks but this is the kind of island living I crave when escaping the city lights of Europe.If you want a polished, over-sanitised, clinical room in a large hotel with hundreds of staff, then this place isn't for you, but if you want to feel like you've truly escaped and see the real side of Lembongan/Bali, I'd book it in a heartbeat.Either way, enjoy your holidays people!
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Initial planned to stay here for 2 nights, eventually stayed 6. Very nice villa's on a perfect location. The staff was super friendly and helpful arranging everything you can think of. We will definitely be back! Thanks Kipp, Sarah, Bryce and the complete staff! We had a wonderful time at Nusa Lembongan. Benjamin & Desirée
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went there for honeymoon, since we want to enjoy Nusa Lembongan view and have a quite night for rest. This place is a bit far from the Mushroom nor Jungutbatu Port, however they have a stunning view (you can see the colorful Yellow Bridge at night, and enjoy the greenish scenery from the top). We stayed in Treetop room - this room is incredible. Mostly designed with bamboo, it is in the second floor hence you'll see the top of Lembongan as your morning view. The service is awesome, they offer me a very nice deal for transportation from Sanur to Lembongan (return trip). They also has scooter rent and snorkeling package. When you stay here, its a hassle free. Thank you Twin Island.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had decided to elope and chose Twin Island Villas as our location, and what a great decision that was...We had a small wedding ceremony performed in our villaSarah and Kipp, where do I even start..... firstly, Thank you. your service was exceptional. from organising transport to our post wedding photo shoot to dropping off a special bottle of bubbily for us to enjoy as our first drink together as husband and wife. there was so many little things I had forgotten to do but before I even turned around to ask for help Sarah was there with the answer. There isn't enough good things I can say about this place. We cant wait to return and will never forget your guys making our special day so stress free.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed at Twin Island Villas for two weeks and found it an amazing place to stay. Initially the villas being a little out of the way can seem like a con, but once we explored the island and came to realise how crazy with hustle and bustle the main parts of town could be we came to greatly appreciate the tranquility and serenity of Twin Island Villas, with its private and child free environment. Highly recommend getting a scooter to get around. The room we had was beautiful and spacious, with a basic breakfast provided directly to your room to start your day. Bed was comfy and large, made for a great nights sleep. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. My friend was sick and had to visit the doctors and the staff went above and beyond by taking her to the clinic and helping us explain to the doctor what the issue was. They would book dinners for us each night with free pick up and drop offs which are provided by the restaurants. Kipp and Sarah who are the managers, were nothing but perfect. They were professional but chilled and friendly which made them feel like just a couple of friends we made along the way. One major convenience is you can dive with the hotel via Twin Island Dive. They take you directly from the hotel, to the boat and back to the hotel when you’re done.We completed our Open Water certification when we were there. This wasn’t a planned part of our trip but was the best experience by far. Kipp (manager & diving instructor), was an amazing instructor. Us being idiots, didn’t quite take to diving like a fish to water, Kipp was patient….more than I can comprehend but with his encouragement and experience we were able to get our certificates and be comfortable diving. Kipp has a passion and love of diving which makes you feel safe at all times and inspired us to start planning our next diving holiday!
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful views & beautiful villas. Originally we weren't confident enough to do our diving & time was an issue for us but Kipp took us on the dive boat for us to do some snorkelling.Since travelling South East Asia for over 3 months, I've got to say this has been the best and most amazing island to snorkel on. It's paradise. It also made me want to come back and do my diving. Especially after watching the way Kipp & Brice were with the divers made me feel at ease to be in their hands if I was to do it in the future. Sarah and kipp & all the local staff at twin island villas went above and beyond for their guests. I would 100% recommend for anyone wanting to relax, dive or even just spend half a day on the boat snorkelling! Ps. The villas had amazing plunge pools!!
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited the island with my cousin for 5 days and had the best experience of our trip. We arrived at Twin Islands to be greeted by Kip and Sarah who offered us drinks and talked us through the services at the resort. They were so kind and really made our experience amazing!We loved our room and had the most beautiful view from our own personal terrace and sunbathing area. We had our breakfast of preference served to us in the morning on our terrace and all members of staff were super friendly and helpful! We also did a snorkel and dive trip with Twin Islands and had an amazing couple of days! The snorkelling locations were amazing and was so much marine life to see. Would 100% recommend as we had such an amazing trip and wish we could have stayed longer.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was too short, only the time of 1 night, but next time I know that I should stay longer! The room was really nice with the calmness needed. The staff is really good and helpful and plus, I had the chance to be invited to their BBQ. Really appreciated their service and warm welcomed feeling. Will see you again for sure!
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel partly as it was child free, but also for the amazing scenery that we'd seen photo's of. We were not dissapointed as there is an awesome view wherever you find yourself standing.Upon check in, with a welcome drink to boot, we were shown to our room which overlooked the Ceningan channel and the swimming pool, it really feels like you are alone in your own paradise spot as you are not overlooked anywhere.I cannot fault any of the staff in any respect, the local staff are SO friendly and the managers (Kipp & Sarah) really put themselves out to make everyone's stay perfect, from arranging to call local restaurants to place a reservation for dinner to offering suggestions for activities or sightseeing from the local experts.Should you happen to be a Diver, you will be in paradise here as the on site PADI 5 star dive resort makes daily trips to the many dive sites around the islands, and all conducted with the utmost safety underwater.Breakfast is good, having it served on your own private balcony / patio is a brilliant start to the day.All in all, a beautiful hotel which you will not be dissapointed with.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This resort was not what I expected! It is advertised as something that it is not. I stayed here with my husband and the service was awful. Safety was a concern for us therefore I would not reccomend staying here especially if you have children. It's no surprise the breakfast is included because it was just terrible.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Twin Islands In July 2016 and I am writing this review a year after as we just looked though our photos from our Bali holiday. We went to a number of places in Bali but Lembongan was our favourite and that is partly due to Twin Islands.We wanted accommodation that gave us a luxury retreat feel but with access to sights and activities. We were not disappointed. The accommodation was lovely, small number of little huts, a small bar, breakfast served to our hut to eat on the balcony and friendly hosts. We loved the secluded location, very relaxing! You will need a scooter to get around, but in all honesty this is the only way to get around the island anyway, so if you wanted to check out the island you will need one no matter where you stay.There is a little restaurant across the road and the food there is lovely (I'm vegetarian and it is limited, but then it was everywhere in Bali), but some of the larger restaurants will pick you up in a truck and you can book via the accommodation staff.There is a pool at Twin Islands but there is also one across the road that you can use, but there are so many stunning beaches around the island, a pool really isn't necessary! The only downside was that due to the huts being made from wood, we could hear people going up and down the stairs to the hut above, but earplugs solved that problem!We couldn't recommend it enough!!
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am currently travelling South East Asia with my other half on slightly more than a shoe string budget, so this place qualified as a bit of a splurge, but it is more than worth it. Prior to arriving Kipp and Sarah (the owners) were flawless with telephone and email correspondence being as helpful as they could, which makes everything worlds easier, and creates a much more personal feel. The bungalow itself is everything that you will want and more, with a fully stocked mini-bar with air-conditioning that is almost too good. Minor mishaps happened during our stay on the island (nothing to do with Twin Island though) and Sarah helped us out an unbelievable amount. The kitchen is great, nice and clean, the bar has an astonishing view, as does the pool and staff were superb! I do not have a bad word to say about this place. Would highly recommend this place to friends and family alike.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at Twin Island Villas where we had nothing short of a wonderful time. The hotel sits on Lembongan island, yet looks over the yellow bridge and Nusa Ceningan, meaning you have easy access to explore both islands as you please.It needs to be said that both islands are suitable to explore by scooter, so if you're not a scooter driver or don't want to pay for someone to drive you around on one, then neither Lembongan nor Ceningan are the destinations for you. The most beautiful spots are those usually accessed by an unkempt, bumpy road - such is the natural beauty of these largely untouched islands. Twin Island Villas is no different. You'll travel down a bit of a bumpy, dusty road to get there, but when you do the seclusion and view are worth the journey.What makes the experience at Twin Island particularly stand-out is the familial hospitality of Kipp and Sarah. Just ask for recommendations on what to see, where to go, where to eat and they'll happily share their local tips. And when it comes to great snorkel and dive spots, these guys are the best. Owning a dive shop connected to the hotel, they make sure you have a safe and enjoyable experience every single time you head out on the water(which you absolutely should - the underwater world is half of the beauty of the islands). My boyfriend is a diver, while I prefer to snorkel, and even that was no issue. They were able to organise for a boat to take us to spots which were suitable for both, so everyone had a wonderful time.After a day out exploring, Twin Island is the perfect place to return to and relax, with comfortable spacious rooms, clean airy bathrooms and views that are still fuelling my daydreams weeks later. We'll definitely be back to Nusa Lembongan, and when we go, we know exactly where we'll be staying.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Before booking this villa, actually I know the villa is far away from main area. But when I read recommendations in tripadvisor, I just wanna have a try of this villa.Luckily, the staff member, Ayu, enthusiastically welcomed us. She helped us to arrange the room and breakfast. She also helped us to find a driver, taking us around of Lembongan. She is a cheerful and nice girl, which make our trip be more funny.We booked tree top villa. The Balinese room is not really big but that is enough for three people. The room can perfectly see the view of Ceningan. It would be very nice if you sit in front of view to enjoy your breakfast. And don't miss the adorable swimming pool! I ordered the villa and an additional bed through agoda. Unfortunately, The villa informed us they didn't receive the additional bad order. They are not available to take the bed immediately because they didn't have male staff members at that time. I think agoda should more communicate with the hotels because this is not the first time I saw these kind of things happen. Although the things were not perfect, if you love enjoying the peaceful and natural villa, this place is still a choice.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This resort did not live up to its expectations, my friends and I were constantly having problems with no solutions provided. When we first arrived the owners were very pleasant, they showed us a map of the island along with offering us beverages which we believed were complimentary, but when checking out we were unexpectedly charged for the drinks. For the most part our rooms were clean but there was a huge open window in the bathroom, this made us uncomfortable because it could be dangerous at night. The window is big enough for a grown person to comfortably come in with ease. When this issue was bought up with the owners they played it off like it was no big deal. If there was security near by or staff who spent the night we would have understood but by 9:00 p.m. there was no staff to help incase of an emergency, this resulted in many sleepless nights. Also the safety deposit boxes in the rooms were not attached to anything and could easily be lifted out of the room. We also bought this up with the owners and they didn't consider it to be a problem. Although the cooking staff was friendly the breakfast was inedible, the toast was rock hard, the eggs were very salty and runny. We paid extra to have breakfast included and most days didn't end up eating it. The pool light was broken so after sunset we were not able to use the pool and the water was very frigid, we also talked to the owners about this and nothing was done and we weren't able to enjoy the pool. No where does it state how far this resort is from the main hub of the island. It is approximately a bumpy 20 minute ride uphill into what look like a forest. We were charged $25(USD) each time by the resort to get transportation to reach the bottom of the hill. (Sometimes the owners would change the amount and even increase it to $25) We had a very hard time finding a cab that would drive us back to the resort at night, and if they did, the charge was $50… That’s how secluded this place is. This also become very dangerous at night because there was very little lights driving back to the resort and the roads were very bumpy and we were unsure if we were heading the right way or if were safe. The resort set up snorkelling for our group and we thought we would be in good hands as this resort is also a dive school. We requested to have life jackets for everybody participating just incase. When we arrived on the boat there were only a few life jackets and they were mostly broken… They also took us on a day the waves were incredibly high and strong so much so our snorkels were filling with water making what was suppose to be a beautiful experience very scary. It was near impossible to try to swim or even look at the fish without being pushed by the current. I would not recommend staying here.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want to get away from the crowds, and enjoy a tranquil/quiet setting this is the right place! We stayed in 2 different rooms (overlooking the pool directly and bungalow Cinta) as our itenarary changed, but both Kipp and Sara did their best to accommodate us. The location can't be beat and overlooks the Ceningan (yellow) bridge. The entire staff is amazing and go above expectations to please you. My only knock would be that the AC in bungalow Cinta is not strong, and can leak drops on you. Additionally, the en suite toilet in the bungalow is step down and has a large gap behind the step..........my wife was a bit freaked out as critters may crawl through. But this is minor compared to the overall experience. Side note: Kipp is an amazing dive instructor, highly recommend diving with him.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Kim and I returned from 5 nights staying in the tree top villa.. very comfortable beds, pillows and the open bifold windows offered an amazing breeze where air con wasn't even necessary.. looked forward to breakfasts in the villas.. super friendly Sarah in reception.I would not stay anywhere else on the island .. nice and peaceful and away from the maddening crowds.. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Hired a moped from the villa and cruised both islands .. thanks again for a relaxing time .
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spend 6 nights at the Twin Island Villas and had the most amazing time. Staff & management is very friendly & helpful, the rooms are clean, the bed is very comfy and the view from my villa was breathtaking. I just love the fact that it is so secluded in a very peaceful setting and tucked away as that was what I was after. A lot of places on the island offer a free pick up & drop off and to hire a scooter is more than affordable and the staff organised that for me and gave me very helpful tips where to go and what to do. Will definitely going back!
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We originally booked 4nights, then after arriving extended our stay 3 more nights to get certified at open water diving. The lovely villas are set on a quiet hillside overlooking the channel with nice breezes, lots of happy birds and pretty foliage. There is a beautiful pool and an onsite kitchen which offers complimentary breakfast and delicious snacks- we loved the spring rolls! Our villa had a large balcony where we would enjoy our morning coffee and breakfast and then relax at night. The staff are all wonderful- so warm and welcoming, making us feel at home. P and Darren arranged our transport from our hotel in Bali to the ferry to Lembongan then to Twin Villas, making it so easy!! Once we arrived, they arranged a scooter for us and we explored the whole island. We snorkeled one day, then went out diving with P, then decided to stay and get certified. An amazing experience, we really can't say enough good things about this place! We loved it!!
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is fantastic with serene views and peaceful surroundings that make the five min scooter journey from town MASSIVELY worth it. The location and hotel are simply idyllic and stunning and the staff are warm, welcoming and friendly, giving genuine advice and help with everything they can, even organising transport or scooter hire should you need it. Lovely breakfast brought to your room, gorgeous views, professional diving and snorkelling trips planned for you if desired and a great price for the luxury and really clean too. I would stay here a million times over and I was genuinely sad to leave and will definitely visit again! Gorgeous!!
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So last year my sister and I decided to arrange a last minute vacation. We didn't know where we were going, we just knew we were going somewhere and it had to consist of sun, beach, snorkel! After coming across Twin Villa online and dealing with P directly over email, I knew this is the place where we were heading to. We stayed on Bali mainland which was an experience but that was not our definition of "vacation" for us. I am so glad that we extended our stay at Twin Villa's because it was exactly what we had visioned! We stayed in the Villa with the private pool, even though the main pool area was quite and not many people around to bother you. Where Twin Villa is located, is very quite but easily accessible to get on a scooter and head to the busy parts of the island! You can also walk across the road to D'Mas Huts for a quick bite to eat. The staff were amazing! Such friendly people - Darren and Prashanti always giving you ideas on where to go and what to do which helps especially when you have limited time (because there are so many things to do and you want to do them all). I would highly recommend a trip to Nusa Ceningan and Nusa Penida (snorkeling is out of this world). Snorkeling can be done with the Twin Dive team - remember to take extra memory for your GoPro because the marine life is stunning! Just beware of massive lizzards that make duck sounds, they like to enjoy the luxury of Twin Villas too :) Other than that, enjoy the chickens waking you up in the morning from a distance and enjoy the pure beauty of this amazing island.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a young couple. Enjoyed the beautiful atmosphere and breathtaking views. We stayed in the love shack and it is just perfect. Bathrooms are outstanding and all linen smells like absolute heaven. I kept smelling the towels when we got there. It has such a private feel with the right balance of cruisy, friendly staff. The pool is gorgeous and clean. We drove our own scooter and it was perfect. We enjoyed going on our own exploring and the hotel said they could organise any activity we liked but no pressure. Very sad to leave tomorrow. Thank you.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed a few times on Nusa Lembongan and returned as we love the island and its people.This time we feel was our best visit yet. Twin Island Villas had so much to offer. Everything we needed.Friendly staff that made us feel welcome. Even some great jokes shared by Darren. Clean rooms with wonderful views over to the sister islands of Cennigan and Nusa Penida. Beautiful sunsets.Enjoyable breakfast to help start the day of adventure whether it be diving, snorkelling or exploring the island.You can book to either go diving/ snorkelling around the majestic islands to spot Mantas and a multitude of sea life. If you do go your dive instructors have many years of experience and local knowledge. They share this with you in the most enjoyable way. Or book a scooter to venture off on the newly tarred road to sight see around the island.Prashanti also helped us book a 2 day sightseeing trip to Nusa Penida where we stepped back in time. I would go back in a heart beat. Thanks to them all.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: love everything in this place and love the pretty girl that called Ayux :)And nothing of what I say will be enough to describe my appreciation to this place.Staff was very friendly, my room was has amazing view.Hope next time find shower toilet seat :)
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My second trip out this beautiful island paradise and the wonderful Twin Island. I was very happy to see that since my last visit the road has been redone! This makes getting to and from the resort much easier.Once again the room was perfect, the staff were warm and friendly and the beer icy cold. Darren and P went out of their way to make me feel welcome. I look forward to coming back again soon!
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed at Twin Island Villas for 4 days at the end of September and dived with them for 2. When we first arrived on Nusa Lembongan, all the taxis were saying 'Ah Twins, the one with the view' so it sounded promising and when we arrived I was honestly blown away with the view. The infinity pool is spectacular, and we stayed in room 1 which had stunning views over neighbouring Nusa Cenigan from the room, bathroom and balcony. We couldn't have been treated any better, the staff were super friendly and went all out to make sure we had a good time. We hired scooters from them for 2 days which was a great way to get around the island and they made top recommendations for places to eat. This is a unique and quiet place and we were so glad to have stumbled across it. There's a restaurant just behind the hotel for food at lunch/dinner (I can highly recommend the sweet potato fries). Breakfast is served at a time of your choice on your balcony and the musli and pancakes were both delicious. We also spent a couple of days diving with Twins and the facility and instructors were top. We're both instructors ourselves who have dived around the world but this is a truly unique dive centre. Both Darren and Kip went out of their way to make sure we got to see what we wanted, which for us was manta rays. After all the boats had left the dive site after the first dive, Kip let us stay around to do the second dive here and it resulted in the most phenomenal manta ray encounter. We were the only people on the site and got to spend an hour less than a metre from these amazing creatures. Thanks to Kip for the best experience we could have hoped for. It's certainly an experience you wouldn't get with big dive centres. Unfortunately we lost the GoPro on the next island we went to but it means we'll be back next year to retake the footage!Thank you to Twins for making Nusa Lembongan the best part of our Indonesian trip, we'll be back to find the mola molas as well as manta rays.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we first arrived at twin islands we thought we were in the sticks of it, a mile away from everything. But it was an adventure. Scooters are a must, they're so much fun and give you so much freedom. Amazing views and an awesome breakfast. The staff were super friendly and helpful. We loved twin islands we decided to stay a couple of extra nights. Definetly recommend! Thanks guys for an awesome time away and a relaxing trip.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overlooking the Chanel between Lembongan and Cenningan island. Surrounded by trees and surprisingly very cool (cold) place to relax - super amazing chicken burgers and ice ice cold beers this place will be your #1 spot to locate yourself new road patched its way comfortable ride to the hill top side. With all sorts of activities from Diving (all new gear) fancy boat and not to mention the most warm welcoming friendliest staff (Kipp and Darren) go out of their way to satisfy your needs and make sure all settled in. Loads of space and rooms are AMAZING! I would recommend this place to families coupes and even singles looking to to escape. Nusa Penida where you get mola mola and manta rays is just a 15min boat ride away with some spectacular diving. These guys know their dive sites. Great snorkel sets for sale will set you back a meet 40$ and your all sorted to experience a world and family vibe in your weekend away in what I like to say PARADISE!!! Thanks guys for an amazing everything
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely Place at the top of a hill but a nightmare to get up and down if you re not used to riding on really lousy roadsI kind if expected bad roads but this was a little bit ridiculous. The high point of the day was getting back to the room and enjoying the view.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Now, let me say first that my opinions are based on expectations that come with a price of 88 Euros per night for our room - which is European standards...At a first glance this place is heavenly - the view onto the yellow bridge to Nusa Cinigan, the lush greenery etc - it is the things that you can't see at a first glance that make this place not so great and then some.Not so great:- theres a huge building site all around the hotel with hammering, electric sawing, levelling and so on. Hardly a minute of quiet all day. The staff offered to go an talk to the builders if it's too loud, but basically that would have meant for them to stop altogether- there are many little things missing in the room - the TV doesn't have any channels, the coffee box isn't refilled, our soap wasn't refilled in the three days we were here, there is no shelf to put clothes, there is no hook to hang towels, the shower is either super hot or cold- the moment we wanted to enter our private villa with plunge pool one of the managers broke our door (!) It then took several hours for them to sort of fix it until the lock broke and we were locked out with several handyman fidgeting with our door for quite some time. The staff were trying to be nice and friendly about it, but it didnt exactly make me feel secure and other than a spoken apology they did not do anything- the hotel is in the middle of the jungle so u definitely need a ride (and off the beaten track romanticses it a litte - it's 15 minutes up and down the worst road) - they provide u with a bike (which is great) but they don't have a free shuttle service U have to pay if you want them to drive you. However, many restaurants offer a free shuttle.- the complementary breakfast was a joke on two out of three days. The cooperate with a Warung next door (which has really good food). Breakfast was: 9 little pieces of fruit, 2 pieces of toast with little marmelade and 2 eggs. Also: coffee and juice. However, we paid 88 Euros per night (which seems incredible now) and for that kind of money u get a continental breakfast in Europe. If this place had been much cheaper we would have been ok with the many shortcomings - but that kind of money in this region should really go a long way.- last but not least the most horrible part: the loudest chanting noise ever! The manager had told us that 'nice changing wafts over' from the other island, but it is more like somebody scrapes out your eardrums with a spoon. On our second day it started around 4 pm - a man saying something and then a woman 'singing' through cracked loud speakers blasting across the island (people, it sounds exaggerated, it isn't) - and it didn't stop. It went on until about 22 pm and drove us close to insanity. When it finally stopped we were so so happy. However, it resumed at 7.30 and basically continued in one form or another all day until in the evening the man returned even louder. We put earplugs in and pillows over our heads and it went on and on until about midnight. No chance at quiet and peaceful.Things we liked:- even though I was really concerned about bugs (am allergic to bites) there were hardly any around- there's a water dispenser in the room so you have plenty of water- the public pool is so so nice- the staff is really friendly and try to help you with anything- the view is fantastic- very comfy bed- if you want a bike they organize one for youAll in all it can be said that this place has a lot of potential to be really nice, but it isn't yet.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really lovely hotel in picturesque location! It's on the quieter side of the island, so you need to get a lift when you arrive on the ferry. We had a very nice room with a great view & next to the infinity pool. Very nice breakfast served to your room each day. Staff very friendly & helpful. Only downside is that it's a bit further away the busier side of the island, but great if you want a relaxing getaway. It's easy enough to travel about if you rent a scooter. Would recommend.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: "Come as a guest, Leave as a friend" the perfect motto for this piece of paradise. We stayed for 4 nights and if we hadn't prebooked all of our accomodation, we certainly would have stayed longer. This place is wonderful! The villas are beautiful, stunning views, great food, snorkelling and exploring the islands! All of the staff bent over backwards to fulfill our wishes and couldn't have made us feel more welcome! We're now planning our next trip there with all of our family. Thank you so much, Sarah, Pea, Darren, G'day and Scuba for helping us create the best memories! We loved it!! Glen & Majan Nicholls, Normanville S.A.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a hard and bumby ride to get there. A bit away from everything. Room was nice. No deposit safe and there was a big window hole for easy access.Nearly knocked myself unconcious when going to the sunken bathroom at night. Problem due to a loose piece of wood on the first step. Management seemed to be missing all the time when we needed them and most of them struggled to speak English. No restaurant and bar area was average to poor. Breakfast was good and delivered to the room. A bit expensive for what we got.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here on recommendations from friends.The managers, P and Darren along with their staff made our stay an outstanding experience and were more than happy to assist in arranging transport and dinner at different locations on the island and any other requests we had.It is a away from the hustle and bustle of the village and beaches, so be prepared to hire a bike to get around if you want to do the sight seeing thing.If you are looking to dive or go snorkelling around the island, Twin Island also run a dive company and provide a great personalised service and experience.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Twin Island Villas is a wonderful place if you like to reside a bit off the hustle and bustle of the tourist hotspots on Nusa Lembongan. However, because the island is so small, you get wherever you want to go quickly with the motorbikes you can rent there (yes, the road is bumpy, but it's fun to drive the bikes). The staff is very kind and helps you with wathever your needs are. The breakfast they serve - in your room, if you wish! - is super delicious. If you have the chance, try to book one of the two huts where you can enjoy your own pool ("Cinta" or "Kecil"), it's definitely worth it.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there during 2 nights. Lovely place, very peacefull. The staff is so nice. Amazing view, very quiet. Don't hesitate to rent a scooter and go visit. If you want, you can eat at the restaurant just in front of the hotel. It's only 30' from Bali.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Twin Island Villas for our last 2 nights in Indonesia, it was a sharp contrast from the buzz of Seminyak but in a good way! Very peaceful with lots of surrounding greenery, an excellent spot to see the sunrise and take an early morning dip in the pool. The staff were fantastic, all very friendly and helpful. This would be a perfect location for travellers looking for a quiet romantic hide away. The only downside is the roads on the island tend to be a bit bumpy and getting there on the buggy can be a bit bouncy! We hired a scooter from the hotel and zipped around the island which was initially quite daunting but once you get used to the roads it's a lot of fun! Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Twin villa is the best place I stayed on lembongan island. The crew is so friendly and helpfull, the managers are awesome and the resort is so beautiful. It's big and peacefull. You have so much private space and it will give you a real holiday feeling. The breakfast is delicious and the view over the island is great. Highly recomended!!
hotelName:
19    Twin Island Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A big thank you to Novi and her wonderful team for once again providing us a superb stay in this very special place.As usual the 5 star accommodation was matched with 5 star service.Chris and MargeAustralia
hotelName:
20    Kano Sari Ubud Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a fabulous find. A real oasis about one mile from very centre on the quieter east side. Luxurious rooms and larger pool than most, with much thought given to detail such as providing torch and mosquito spray for evenings. First rate staff, so willing and helpful. Free local transport too and introduction to Tano for guided tours. Thank you for a wonderful 3 day break after a very long flight.
hotelName:
20    Kano Sari Ubud Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a AWESOME villa. Staff are so wonderful and go out of their way to make your visit memorable. Food is also very good. The rooms and grounds are stunning. Walking distance into town. They give you a phone to use. Can drop you off at restaurants or shopping and then you ring them and they pick you up.
hotelName:
20    Kano Sari Ubud Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We and another couple just spent three night at Kano Sari. We occupied the second floor rooms with a lovely great room between the two rooms. Kano Sari is truly amazing! We had arranged prior to our arrival in Bali with Yunita to be picked up in Sanur. Their driver came to pick us up for a small fee and took us to the hidden compound. The grounds are beautiful with lush plants, pool, outside dining area and a spa and sets above a canyon and river. The entire place is tastefully decorated and open air, immaculate. Our rooms had everything we needed and was air conditioned. There was a frig, safe, water container, lovely view, mosquito netting for the night, spacious bathroom with walkin shower and lots of amenities and evening turndown service. A very delicious breakfast was included each morning. Each evening we were able to select from the menu our breakfast choices. Everything was very fresh and divine. We also enjoyed two tasty dinners. One night we sat in the outside patio and one night inside. The menu is delicious and we each selected different dishes. Yunita and Novi always gave us their full attention and are lovely, kind and conscientious hosts. We really appreciated these ladies and their assistants! The Kano Sari also offers transportation included in the cost around Ubud. We had their driver take us to the market, a restaurant one evening and Novi drove us to a shop we were interested in seeing. They also arranged to have a driver take us to the airport when departing and they arranged for a day driver to take us to temples and sights. But central Ubud is within walking distance if you do not use their car service. My husband and I each had two massages during our stay. We simply told them what time we wanted and they made the arrangements. We really enjoyed the wonderful massages.We would return to the Kano Sari if we ever went half way around the world to Bali again. It is incredible! We made our reservation months in advance. So my best suggestion would be is to do the same because there are only six rooms.
hotelName:
20    Kano Sari Ubud Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Again I have returned to the Kano Sari villas in Ubud. We were welcomed by the wonderful staff as we arrived. The whole environment is beautiful and has particular attention to detail. It is only a quick five minute walk to the end of the street and you are in the Main Street of Ubud . Sometimes we did not feel like walking and the staff drove us. We we able to organise tours very easily and we also hired a motorbike all at the villa from asking the staff. It was never a problem at any time to get something to eat or drink. Every room is a picture in itself and the bathroom was spotless. The worst thing is that you have to leave at some stage to go home but it is a favourite spot in Ubud to go back to and adventure out from. Well done all the staff, excellent kid.
hotelName:
20    Kano Sari Ubud Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights. Lovely place, the staff are awesome and always smiling. They thought of everything you will need from a cell phone to call them, flash light, tissues and Suron for the temple visits. The breakfast is delicious with home made yogurts. It's comfortable and clean. You will hear crock Crow and dog barks they provide eat plugs if it bothers you. I used it just 1 night as it quickly fades away. They will make sure you enjoy your stay. We arrived around 1 am and everything has been put in place for us. Overall just great place!
hotelName:
20    Kano Sari Ubud Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Kano Sari meets all your expectations and more. The level of detail and friendly service from the staff just continues to make you smile. The rooms are very comfortable, not to mention spotless, and the grounds are absolutely beautiful. A nice small boutique place to stay, just far enough away from central Ubud so that you can relax in peace, but close enough to stroll into town when you feel like it. However, transport can be a arranged by the staff if need be. We are already planning our next visit to Kano Sari and can't wait to return.
hotelName:
20    Kano Sari Ubud Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can’t say enough about how much we enjoyed our stay here. It’s a small boutique hotel. The grounds and the pool are wonderful. The staff speak excellent English and helped us arrange tours and activities. It’s close enough to walk to town but on a quiet street. The room was large and the bed was comfy. I would not hesitate to stay here again.
hotelName:
20    Kano Sari Ubud Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our second trip to Beautiful Kano Sari. It’s the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of down town Ubud. But walking distance to it all. Every care is taken to ensure every guest has a unique and wonderful experience. All the staff are very friendly and very knowledgeable. Beautiful decor and very comfortable mattresses blissful sleeps. After many visits to Bali. Kano Sari is the one place we will consistently return to in Ubud they have spoiled us.
hotelName:
20    Kano Sari Ubud Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friends and I were very surprised by the beautiful accommodation when we stayed at Kano Sari. The staff couldn’t be more helpful and made our stay just fantastic. The furnishings and appointments are made locally and of excellent quality and the villas are set in a very tranquil part of town that is within an easy walk to the town centre. Just perfect!
hotelName:
20    Kano Sari Ubud Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff: This is what made the stay as great as it was. The staff, especially Novi the manager, were extremely sweet and helpful about everything.
