Two pools are nice to swim and the best time for an ocean swimm is in the morning.It is a place for a longer stay.
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed a fabulous stay at this resort for 4 days . We absolutely recommend this resort being our first trip to Bali.We experienced tranquility and beautiful tropical spacious gardens and pools.Our room bungalow was well presented. Special thanks to Resort staff particularly Ning for relaxing spa experience and morning yoga . She is an asset to this resort and hope she is still there when we return next October. A beautiful gentle lady who paid special consideration to our daughter .Restaurant staff were highly trained and welcomed us every day which made us remain in this resort for all meals . They became familiar with our names and where we enjoyed sitting . Particular thanks to beautiful Era, Febri,Uni , Yudi and Anga trainee . Hopefully name spelt correct....All of these staff mentioned are to be highly commended please and are the reason we will return. Our breakfast and dinner were the most enjoyable we have ever experienced anywhere !!Thank you
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to relax and feel special. The hotel was great and we had a fab pool all to ourselves.Hotel hosted a cocktail party which was a great way to socialise with other guests. Great choice at breakfast.
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this fantastic hotel with super service and wonderful on the beach location. Hotel offers rooms in different standard and price. We had the privilege to have a up-grade and stayed in luxury pool-villa this was really a five star experiece. Great breakfast for all and very nice, relaxing beach/pool area. Hotel has it all and we will surely return again. It makes our 25th Marriage so great!
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room size is big and spacious, has Jacuzzi and big bath tub. View of the sea is great as well. Transport service from the Airport was unpleasant as the driver is hard-selling on taking his package tours. The vehicle is not clean and air ventilation was bad. The transport vehicle from the hotel back to the airport was much better. Massage provided in the package was good.Food for both restaurants at the resort is limited and not up to expectations.Reception staff gave the wrong orders for our romantic dinner menu and forgot my request for additional tissue box. Expected more quality services and food standards for price paid. Would have been a better experience if not for those mishaps.
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had 5 nights here and it was fantastic. The Hotel is well maintained and the staff are friendly and helpful. We had an ocean view room upstairs with a balcony and daybed. The breakfast is huge with decent choices. The housekeeping did a good job, and also had a turn down service at nighttime which was a nice touch. There are 2 pools, and the ocean which is safe to swim in. We will definitely be back.
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed as a family of 5 at Candi Beach Resort and Spa for 4 nights. We had booked 2 garden view rooms and although they were interconnected they were very small and not suitable for our family of 2 teenagers and younger child. Candi Beach upgraded us to a Villa at a very reasonable negotiated extra price. The villa was beautifully appointed, complete with our own pool. It was set idealically amongst the back drop of the mountains in a stunning landscaped garden setting. No ocean view but this is not needed as the landscaped setting is picturesque. Although the Villas are not designed to sleep 5 as they are essentially one large room with sleeping and living space combined and a separate luxuriously appointed bathroom, the hotel provided us with an additional bed and we were all comfortable. I would recommend the Villas for a couple or family with a young child as long as they are aware pools are not fenced. The resort has 2 pools and access to a private beach. We enjoyed breakfast each morning and the buffet dinner at the restaurant. The resort has some surrounding restaurants/ cafes and a spa where we had a very good massage. We found these restaurants far better than going into Candidasa which was disappointing with no beach views or access. Also it is interesting to go for a walk down the little laneways to see the village houses etc outside the resort , if you like to explore.
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Candidasa is a lovely small village and Candi resort and spa is surely a gem around 2kms from Candidasa. The place is on east side of Bali and not very touristy. We were looking for a place away from the hustle-bustle and party scenes of Bali and this totally lived upto the expectations. The beach is perfect - white sand and turquoise blue waters on one side and a hill and lots of palm trees on the other side. We had booked Ocean Bungalow which had beach view but not uninterrupted - it was pool view and then beach view (could have been better if they would have clearly mentioned that all ocean rooms do not have uninterrupted views; the description on website is bit confusing). The staff is amazing - very courteous and helpful which is usually the case in Bali (never had a bad experience with people anywhere!). The food at the restaurant is good too. Overall a peaceful luxurious stay and beautiful views all around.
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Candi beach for 9 nights in early September, following a 4 night stay in Ubud. Rather then reviewing the local area, weather, all-up experience i'll focus specifically on the hotel in this forumn. I'll try to introduce a little bit of witt but i'm fairly jet-lagged atmo.Positives:Food: The restaurant food quality was really good, the breakfasts had a good choice selection, the ocean restaurant western menu was really well prepared, and the prices (and i know this is a cheeky subject) we actually thought were not awful. They were double the nearby warungs (for some choices, within some warungs) but in general were comparable with other hotels, and less then our previous in Ubud. The quality and service was excellent and the room service variety was also good. They didn't mind bringing a cheeky pancake and some potatoe wedges to the room after several Bintangs at 11:00pm (despite pancake not being on the menu), this saved our hangover the following day and it was very tasty. Drink: Alcohol is expensive in Bali, enough said, but i enjoy it greatly. I didn't like that the hotel mentioned a corkage charge for brining alcohol into the hotel (10% of what they charge) not crazy, but annoying. Especially when a large 66CL Bintang in Candi is 85k +21% Tax/SCharge, and in the local shop we bought a 66CL Bintang for 30k out-right. It's expensive at Candi for drink, as with any hotel but the cocktail range was good and they were really well made so we didn't mind. Happily blew through a few M on some strong long island ice teas knowing we could have a naughty pancake in the room later to sober up. Overall this is positive, drinks weren't massively expensive and good quality cocktails.Room: The Villa's were spectacular, really beautifully kept and thought out environments, really special, even for Bali which is naturally beautiful. However see my negative below on this (Re Room). Location: Good, quiet, lovely beach, peaceful and beautiful surroundings, good spread of local warungs and alternative options nearby too. Really good location, one of the best we saw in all of Bali.Onto the Negatives: (worth noting we've given 4 stars still so i don't want to make this sound too much like a downer, but i'll go into some smaller/minor things, that knocks candi, in our opinion, off being a 5 star):Room: Initial delux garden room was very small and photo's (obviously because they're professionally done) on the website make it look bigger then it is, it's small, sorry, it just is. Not saying it's advertised as grand, but it was under-whelming to walk into. The hotel was unable to upgrade us straight away as the other rooms were full (people with sense had booked them). We managed to upgrade to the best luxury private pool villa 1 day into our stay as it was the room they had most availability in, for the last 8 nights. Note there was no discount offered, despite me asking (as we were VIP+ members of Experian that offered free room upgrades (i know this is cheeky, but our other hotel gave us an upgrade for free, Candi was tough), and the "freebies" they gave us were actually less then originally offered to us via email, if we were to have upgraded before we came. The negative here isn't the above however, it's the delux garden room is cheap in price, but also cheap in experience (in our opinion). You definatley don't feel special as such (not like we did in the hotel we stayed in beforehand), we had to pay alot for our villa upgrade, and it was this that made the holiday... but it cost. Food: Great food, we got the 3 course indonesian night banquet, was a buffet with everything pulled together, dancing was good though. We also got ill after booking the romantic dinner on the mountain special experience, both of us were sick that night... we only had 2 glasses of wine so it was down to the food.... view was unbelievable though, and the service was 5*****. The actual quality of food as said above was very good so i don't want to push this down too much. The waiters were lovely! LOVELY!Inconsistency: some days they'd bring us pancakes to breakfast, sometimes they said they wouldn't, the coffee machine broke a couple of days so coffees took ages (25 minutes) to come. Sometimes the yokes on eggs were rock solid, sometimes hash-browns massively over-done.. Sometimes they served an egg with the indonesian egg dish, sometimes not. it was inconsistent (note we're not fussy eaters, if i'm honest we knocked out a few local warung mains and eat near anything) but we do like yokes you can dip something into! Shuttle: We got the shuttle into Candidasa, when they picked us up, only sent one shuttle for 9 people, we allowed the family to go in front instead of leaving them there, so we waited 15 minutes to get re-picked back up, we were treated by cattle by the locals, everyone wanted to sell us snorkeling, fishing, glasses, bags... list goes on, wasn't pleasent. Overall the positives out-weight the more minor improvement points, but it was definatley not 5 star for us. The service, VILLA quality and location/food was really good, but if you don't pick the right room you won't get the same experience. Plus the a la cart menu breakfast is only for villa guests (if you want it included) same with afternoon tea. Our fault for not reading that, but it's true. Tours are more expensive from hotel, including shuttle back to airport (we're talking 40%) to local providers.
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was clean and the stuff friendly- we unfortunately had a garden view room which was quite noisy- the villas with private pool looked beautiful. Recommend renting a motor bike and travel in the area.
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I like it here. Its a little bit far even by car but you are away from any crowd. Its not recommended for party lover, but more for stress relief people who had enough of city lifestyle. And they have private beach eventho its not that big but enough for those who like to swim in the sea. Good time it was..
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a villa with pool, this was a swimming pool not a plunge pool, as we had this we also had the a la carte breakfast in biru restaurant, fantastic breakfast choice served by lovely ladies, thanks to the lovely lady that asked if of us - overlooking the beach, it was magical and just the right amount of time - only would suggest might have been better if done later in the day so we could have ate more when fresh cooked. Tea daily bought to villa in the afternoon was lovely. Enjoyed the tai chi boo in the mornings. Had massage and facial also very relaxing
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights with my partner and it was the highlight of our visit to Bali. We stayed in a bungalow with an ocean view which was a delight to wake up to every morning. Our room was clean and well presented with a large, comfortable bed. Bathroom was modern with two washbasins and mirrors and a large walk in shower. The hotel staff couldn't do enough to make your stay as enjoyable as possible and provided an excellent service. The swimming pool was clean and looked out onto the sea. Lots of comfy and clean sunloungers to recline on to enjoy the view as well as day beds. The breakfast was exceptional. Great selection on the buffet as well as the option to choose one dish from the menu, including dishes like crepe suzette and eggs benedict. Complimentary afternoon tea was a real highlight. The hotel offers some promotions which change daily such as buy one get one free cocktails. The dishes for lunch and dinner were a mix of Balinese and western cuisine and were well presented and delicious. The one slight downside for me was the 21% tax and service charge which was added on to the end of the bill. Would rather the tax was included in the price on the menu. We had a fabulous stay here and I would definitely come back again.
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had reserved 2 rooms for our family of 4, and they gave us two adjoining rooms - both with updated decor, etc. They were on the small side, but nicely appointed and had big bathrooms and we were happy to have adjoining. Would recommend for families.We all enjoyed the food on site, it was pricier than street dining but everything was very tasty and less expensive than other resorts we stayed at during our trip.The spa was on the pricy side, but lovely and if you don't have your sheets washed each night they leave you a 50% coupon for being 'green'.There was a complimentary walk in the morning (9am I believe) which we took - we were the only people doing it and it was a nice little 40min walk around the neighbouring community. The guide pointed out plants and little things of interest - it was a nice way to start the day.We also took the shuttle in to town - they drop you around all the shops and pick you up 2 hours later. There isn't a lot to do in town so 2hrs was plenty of time. The lobby has 2 big ponds and they give out cups of food to feed the fish which my kids loved doing. The beach was a disappointment and it was insanely windy when we were there so we didn't go in the beach at all and even the pool was too cold! But we hit unusual weather. I wouldn't choose this resort for a lengthy visit if you wanted beach time, pools were fine but the beach isn't nice for swimming/playing.
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 5 wonderful nights with my teen daughter as the start of our first trip to Bali, and we were delighted by what we experienced. The manager here does an incredible job of making sure that everything on the property is in order. Their breakfast each morning is a wonderful variety and everything is delicious. Both pools are absolutely sparkling clean all the time, and all the grounds are maintained beautifully. We stayed in both an original room and one of the new ocean view suites, and we were comfortable and happy in both. The ocean suite is stunning. If one of the ocean view suites is available for your stay, do book it because they are amazing. But don't pass up this property at all, because the standard rooms are also very charming and comfortable and still offer you the wonderful grounds and the amazing treatment by everyone at the hotel. After exploring Candidasa, I suspect this is the absolute best property to choose for a stay in this area. This hotel will certainly be my choice when I return, and I highly recommend it if you prefer a quality experience in every way.
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Always the best holiday ever, white sandy beach, blue ocean, wonderful staff and beautiful surroundings. what more could you want in Bali.. we have stayed here five times now. Staff are fabulours, surrondings perfect, rooms to die for and impeccable service.
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are now here since a week and have been enjoying every single minute. The pool villa we are staying in is absolutely fantastic - plenty of space, comfortable beds, and a huge bathroom with jacuzzi. Starting the day with a swim in your „own“ pool is just great, having the very good breakfast in one of the two restaurants after that is even better. The a-la-carte breakfast is especially to recommend. The service is extremely good across the complete hotel, everyone is very friendly and you are always greated with a smile. The dinner is also fine, there are though quite a few other good options just outside the hotel or in Candidasa, which is a 5 minute taxi ride away.The overall atmosphere is very relaxed, the guest structure is international.If you are looking for a relaxed & at the same time luxurious resort, this is the place to go. Candidasa is a good distance away from the bigger tourist spots, so do not expect a lot of nightlife spots.We can definitely recommend the hotel and will surely be back!
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very Nice hotel with nice gardens, 2 swimmingpools and good restaurants at the sea. The staff was very friendly. We stayed in a luxe garden bungalow. A really nice house with your own terrace surrounded by tropical trees and flowers. The breakfast is very extended and you can enjoy your breakfast with a beautiful sea view. Candidasa itself is not so exciting, but there are many nice places to visit from this part of the island. There is a diving school at the resory with very helpful personel offering a lot of variety in diving excursions. We really love or here
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful garden,beach...we could stay very confortable and reluxing on the beach side bed feeling the wind. At the restaurant and the pool side, most staff was very frendly and helpful. I loved this quiet place and smile of staff. If I can visit Bali again,definitly return here!
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The beachside is absolutely amazing! Breathtaking view! Garden is so calm and beautiful. Room was completely comfortable and big! Staff is amazing too. Everything was perfect. I am sure we will visit soon. Keep going! ❤️
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel exceeded all my expectations: awesome villa with private pool, very complete breakfast, great food at night, nice location. The gardens are very well kept. Will return for sure for more nights.
hotelName:
23    Candi Beach Resort & Spa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I usually don't like to 'repeat holidays', but my partner and I had such a great time at De Moksha last time we were in Bali that we had to come back again! The reasons we returned are: great rooms, beautiful surroundings, everything you could want or need in the resort, and most importantly: the staff!The staff at De Moksha are so welcoming and friendly. You are welcomed by name, and any requests you have will be immediately seen to. We particularly loved the company of Agus - he is so knowledgable and is constantly looking out for the comfort and wellbeing of the guests. We greatly enjoyed his company, he had great suggestions for things to do (we did the yoga class, massages, meditation class and bike ride offered by De Moksha) and he organised them all for us. Thank you for making our trip so great Agus!The eco resort is surrounded by rice fields, and is an ideal place to stay to get away from the noise of the main town centres. It takes about 20mins/25mins to drive to central Canggu from the resort, which makes it ideally located if you value a solid sleep, as Canggu is LOUD at night!Things to know if you are considering De Moksha:- the on site restaurant is incredible, with a variety of food options available. The kitchen staff speak fluent english and are able to cater to any dietary requests you have. When I travel, I like to experience new things, but the onsite restaurant is so good that we kept going back!- there are plenty of activities that can be organised for you, both within and outside of the property. Just discuss with the staff what sort of things you might be interested in, and they can make great suggestions. - the resort has motorbikes for hire. However, unless you are already licensed/ experienced in driving a scooter, I wouldn't recommend hiring a bike in Bali, as the roads can be crazy. De Moksha has a driver onsite (Wayan) who is wonderful and VERY reasonably priced!- the road leading up to De Moksha is a little rough, however, there are currently works happening to fix the street. You cannot see the inside of De Moksha from the road, but once you walk in - paradise!- there are new rooms, a new dining area, and a new pool being built at the moment, due to open later this year (2019). We couldn't hear any construction noise coming from De Moksha though. There is some building happening next door (not de Moksha) that can occasionally be heard, but it's not enough to disturb you or interfere with the tranquility.- very comfortable beds, effective AC, soft bedlinen, and the water in the pools (private room and resort pools) are so well maintained that the water is crystal clear. - the complimentary body products offered in the room (body wash, shampoo, conditioner, hand wash, moisturiser) are to die for. I am a big fan of Aesop products, and they are definitely on par. The only thing I would change: have the products in the room nicely packaged and available for sale, I would have loved to have bought some for gifts.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful and quiet resort, arrounded by typical rice fields. The staff is very caring and nice.A very beautiful pool, and a clean and welcoming villa made our stay relaxing. Exactly what we expected.Recommended!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We started our honeymoon with 2 nights at De Moksha and it was a great place to adjust to the time difference and relax. There's not much to do around the resort so we spent most of our time on-site, swimming, getting massages, doing yoga, etc. It's quite private and we felt like we had the resort to ourselves most of the time.The outdoor bathrooms were a cool feature, but we appreciated indoor facilities after 2 days. The yoga class we booked was fantastic as were the massages. The food was average.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a spanish couple and we had our best “resort experience” at De Moksha. The place is magical and the staff it’s really helpful, specialy talking about Agus, he is super happy and we enjoyed more thanks to him. Thanks Agus and De Moksha!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly and kind staff! Breakfast and diner are good. Staffmember Agus was verry helpfull with anything you like! We had a fantastic bicycletour with Agus trough the local streets and visit the local ceramic fabric. We would absolute go back when we visit Bali again!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This review is long overdue but I had to write it as De Moksha was amazing! My husband and I stayed here for a week for a relaxing time before heading to busy Jakarta. It was my husband birthday while we were there and the staff helped me organise a birthday cake.We stayed in the self contained villa and loved all aspects of it. Clean, comfy and private.Breakfast was incredible. We ordered food from the restaurant everyday and spoilt ourselves. All delicious!The staff are amazing. They remember you name and have the ability to make you feel like family. We will be back as it was such an incredible experience staying here. Thank you De Moksha!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Over all an excellent experience . The place is quite far from restaurants cafes etc, but its only 15-20 mins car ride to Canggu area. Some parts that can be improved are , probably more lights in the walking path towards the villa , we were struggling to walk at night to our villa .
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Magnificent place, the resort is located in a quiet place surrounded by greenery. Unfortunately we stayed only one night, the rooms were super clean inside they were everything, shower accessories, soaps, TV, music boxes, fragrant towels, wonderful sheets, never slept in sheets so beautiful and soft , the clean room with private pool was a marvel. They also brought us dinner in the room, VERY GOOD, and the beautiful young ladies, smiling and kind. The abundant breakfast all the very polite staff smiling and friendly, we met Agus who prepared us a fresh fruit smoothie, very nice indeed a very good waiter. The residence offers a common swimming pool, beautiful clean, and calling the restaurant from the internal number you can drink a nice cocktail by the pool. The guys at the reception are also BEAVISSIMI E super kind. in short, everything is excellent
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Pool: Amazing Views, clean, relaxed, tranquil. Restaurant: Good options however from a hotel like this we would have expected more items to be made fresh. Customer Service, Staff: Staff members were accommodating, polite and professional Room, (Double Room): Great views from the room overseeing the greenery and shared pool. Bathroom: Beautiful views however not practical. The shower and the bathtub are outside with limited lighting and it is difficult to use the bathtub due to the amount of bugs. Too many ants, flys and bugs in the room during our stay. When we checked in the bed sheets looked dirty (approx 50 small dead flys on the bed (which look like specs of dust), we asked the front desk to change the sheets asap. If you don't mind 50 dead flys on the bed in the evening and 100 when you wake up on your pillow case and bed sheets then this room is great for you however we did not feel comfortable at all. The room needs alot of TLC. Their is alot of damp in the room, the walls are dirty, the plaster is falling from the walls due to the dampness in the room. Not what we expected at all from a boutique hotel.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for staycation with rural life style and location and escape from city routine, this is a good choice. Best way to enjoy is rice fields private pool and make one day tour. Not much activities around. To enjoy property you can bring your food and cook food and enjoy.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was really looking forward to staying at De Moksha because the photos, description on the booking sites and website make it sound amazing. They would benefit from investing more in maintaining the basic hotel facilities and training its junior customer-facing staff than its current expansion to the land next door. I encountered a number of issues: - I was initially delighted by the pre-stay questionnaire one week before arriving which asked me about my profile and what activities I wanted to do ‘so they could meet customer expectations’ but clearly the front desk don’t know what info i had already shared at check-in. He was unaware that I’d already informed them through the survey that I wanted to do yoga (main reason for staying there) and was quite inexperienced in managing the situation.- 24 hours after arriving management sent another survey asking me to rate the stay so far where I mentioned the wifi and tv in my room wasn’t working and suggestions on how they could reword the description about their yoga classes to manage guest expectations but don’t think anyone read it. No one acknowledged the issues I highlighted.- The description on the website and in the booklet in the room say there’s twice daily yoga on site which is misleading as there’s no classes being run in the beautiful yoga shala.- There hasn’t been an executive centre on site for 3 years and the wifi was patchy most of the time including in my room. Fortunately I discovered the wifi the main office was excellent quite by accident but only at the end of my stay.- the beautifully designed pool area was in great need of maintenance. We couldn’t swim in the dirty pool because of a broken filter. The jet spa and outdoor shower next to the pool weren’t working either. I really had hoped to have a better stay but it was these little things that spoilt what could have been a truly amazing holiday at De Moksha. Whilst I was unlucky with a few things meeting expectations thank you to the more experienced staff Agus, Wayan and Wiwit for trying your best to make my stay great!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Impossible to sleep!!! Dog bark behind villas!ALL THE NGHT !!! And bark again and again!it’s the fkg hell! And bark bark and bark again and bark and again again and bark again and again again and bark again and again again and bark bark and bark !!!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros: Most of the staff are genuinely wanting to see you have a nice and relaxing holiday. The bathroom amenities are nice, breakfast is delicious and plentiful and the menu is otherwise really good and well priced. The sheets on the bed are really soft and the pillows and mattress were great.Cons: The main swimming pool was out of order upon our arrival. After speaking to other guests I established that it had been that way for a couple of days. The filters and pumps weren't working which meant that the pool turned green. When I spoke to the hotel front desk staff about this, firstly she wasn't actually aware of the problem and secondly apologised politely, said it should be fixed the next afternoon, but did not offer any compensation. When she said we could instead swim in our private pool, I said we couldn't do this either as our private pool pump and filters also weren't working (we had no power at all in our room - which was then fixed). Once the pumps and filters were fixed on the main pool, you could see that it was still not safe to swim in so we didn't get to go in it at all (main selling point for this place is the pool!)NYE dinner was overpriced for what was provided. There was heaps of mosquitoes and the resort did not provide any insect repellants or incense / citronella coils to deter them (there is currently a Japanese Encephalitis outbreak in Bali and other resorts provide coils to burn & repellant spray!) Someone had clearly tried to light up the oil diffuser sticks in our room & the room isn't sealed! There are large gaps in the ceiling.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights,Had a pool room in tropical garden.Beautiful spacious room with outdoor bathroom and mini kitchen.Bed was super nice and cosy.Food was good and breakfast was ample.Staff were all lovely and friendly too. This resort is slightly isolated in the jungle but not far from tanlot temple.Only negative was the TV was too complex to operate and some books would have been nice in the room to read. Infinity pool was pleasant to use and relax inn.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect place to unwind and relax as a family. Beautiful resort with a large swimming pool and also private pools attached to villas.Night time is peaceful and quiet with the soundtrack of the jungle playing in the background. Woke up every morning feeling super recharged
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From entrance to the smallest details, this place was heaven on earth, if you're looking for peace of mind, relaxation and beautiful scenery, this place has it all. Whether you're on your honeymoon, with family or friends, trust me you will find happiness in every cornerWe took a villa with a private pool, allow me to say, we were mesmerized especially by the bathroom: it's outdoor!! Don't be shocked, it's very private!The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever seen. The food was delicious. The restaurant is surrounded by a rice field.. YES! It cannot get any better! And the staff.. well i don't know what to say, they were the best! Super friendly, very professional, always at your disposal and most importantly, they make sure you feel at home!I will miss this place profoundly!!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Incredibly nice and friendly staff, beautiful and spacious villa, amazing public pool and all surrounded by beautiful nature... just a perfect place to relax. 6km from Tanah Lot beautiful temple. The breakfast was really really good! You must go if you're looking for a peaceful stay to disconnect completely. I wish we could have stayed longer and will definetely go back on our future travels to Bali.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms, pool, area, surrounding is perfect. Very quiet and comfortable.Not perfect for gluten-free-eating. Superb fish! Other meat-meals only standard-quality.Perfect as homebase when exploring Tanah-Lot, Kedungu and even Canggu (6km).
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ever so often in your travels you stumble upon something extraordinary. This is one of those things. The hotel is remote, but intimate because of it. With drivers to take you wherever you might want to go, that is not a problem, but you then get to return "home" to something special and calm. If you like personalized service, fresh chocolate delivered to you every night, staff that is all accommodating and an owner that helps each and every guest get the most out of Bali, then this is a hotel for you. In fact, my best recommendation is that I chose this as the spot to propose to my future wife, with the help of the owner, as I could not plan the event in secret on my own. We will definitely return to Bali and most definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My four night stay at De Moksha was at the end of my two week trip to Bali. After the hustle and bustle of the first 10 days, stepping into De Moksha was like pressing the pause button. It’s environment is calming and relaxing. The staff were wonderful, so helpful and so friendly and so typical of Balinese culture. If you want to stay put in the hotel you can do so or they can arrange activities. I slept in late, chilled by my private pool, talked to Arma the owners dog, ordered food to my room in the evenings, played music and mostly just chilled. Coming back at night to my turned down room and my leaf boat of turndown chocolates made my day. It’s the little things you see I cannot complement De Moksha enough and look forward to my next stay!!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at De Moksha, the staff is very friendly and helpful.The room is very nice and has everything you need. Also loved the bath tub and outside shower. The staff brought chocolates to our room everyday and if we were not there they would make sure a light is on for us when we come back and our room was made comfortable.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was not clean: sheets with stains, dust, toilet could have been much better...Resort looks nice, but needs work.Pool was ok.Drinks were expensive.Staff was friebly, but insisted on immediate payment before entering the room.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best place where you can enjoy your honeymoon ❤️ Everything was amazing: good service, friendly staff, paradises views, superb private pool,delicious food,perfect massage and Spa.Definitely we will come again inshallah ❤️❤️.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my husbands first visit to Bali and I really wanted to make sure he saw the magical "secret" Bali I have been lucky enough to experience a number of times previously. De Moksha and Tanah Lot was more than perfect! Room was clean and fresh, pool (out of this world) and lounge area very peaceful and the staff at De Moksha are amazing!! We honestly were treated like royalty from arrival to departure and the website photos do not do the resort justice. I will be forever grateful to all staff at De Moksha, Agus, Winda and spa staff get special mentions, for giving my husband and I the truest Bali experience and exceeding our expectations with the De Moksha Boutique Resort (&Tanah Lot). We are already planning our next stay at De Moksha for 2019, he can't wait until he can stay here again (neither can I) and we can't wait to share more of Bali and Tabanan region with family/friends. We wouldn't recommend anywhere else but De Moksha Boutique Resort - just magical. Simone and Murray
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Street to arrive at the hotel is not properly runnable. Difficult with car and most of all scooter.In the room you have an amazing rooftop but a lot of jeco on it that they escrement on your bed.You have one dog of the property of the hotel (I don’t care about dogs but my husband is allergic) that seat on your chairs and use the common place. But you also have stray dogs that it means no control of the entrance.We asked for dinner at 21.34 but they told us that the kitchen was closed so the closest center was at 10 mins from the hotel BUY SCOOTER under the rain.The WiFi connection is almost not existing, you should fill the password every time your telephone turn off and it catches the line just at the restaurant (not in the room).We didn’t use the hotel services because a bit expensive compared to the rest of the island.No European breakfast existing: you have to choose between three kind of breakfast (rice, yogurt or eggs). Any changes are acceptable and any effort made to satisfy the customers needs.Beautiful resort and beautiful rooms, but as I said on the title, just esthetics and no substance.Won’t come anymore.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of 3 people just stayed at this lush, verdant paradise for 3 days. Upon arrival, we were amazed by the accommodations and grounds. Like a little sanctuary from all the hustle and bustle of Bali. If you want to relax and have a base in a peaceful outlying area but not to far from the airport (~1 1/2 hours depending on traffic) and major sights, this is it. You can easily find transport to and from this gem which is quaintly set adjacent to a rice field. I am not sure about the rates of this hotel because it was part of tour by Shanti/KimKim travel but it is a great value at almost any price.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is beautiful, we had a great stay. It rained most of the time while we were there, however this did not affect us because the villa is amazing, it has everything you need. Loved that there is only 10 villas/ rooms, very relaxing and peaceful, also no noisy kids running around the pool. Restaurant staff are lovely, very welcoming, breakfast selection was good. We can’t wait to come back!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing, very friendly staff and always ready to help. great and very tasty food. The pool is very nice, the view from the rooms are really amazing (rice fields on the left & pool view in the front)Highly recommend for people who want to escape to a very relaxing spot.The resort is eco friendly so u might have some visitors (harmless lizards which is very commun in bali)
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not to understate the chic modern Javanese eco-design combined with traditional Balinese features of the resort it is the experience of truly living among the locals and being accepted into their lives that made our stay at De Moksha so special. Owner Gunn Wibisono recognizes the unique position of his resort away from the commercialization and is going to great lengths to develop walking and cycling tours to highlight the culture of the traditional villages. By employing all his staff from these nearby villages he has established such trusting relationships with these families that they welcome him and his guests into their homes to proudly explain their traditions. Our guide Agus took us on a cycle tour through villages, across the rice fields, past a duck farm, temples to a secluded surf beach to stop for a refreshment at his auntie's Warung. Later in the day he took us to see the Tannah Lot temple at sunset and to watch him dance in a traditional Kecak Dance before an Ocean View dinner. We were made to feel like part of an extended Balinese family while staying at De Moksha Boutique Resort.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want to stay somewhere where nature is important to you then this is the ideal location for you. If you don’t like peace nature good service and amazing surroundings then don’t stay here. It is very remote but worth every cent . We loved the 1 bedroom villa with your own pool. The main pool is also amazing and the bathroom is breath taking. The toiletries are very nature friendly and make you feel as though you have just walked out of a 5star spa. You will love this place!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was amazing. The staff (super kind and helpfull), the location (middle of the rice fields), the villa with private pool, the massages and the food. We loved it all and we will come back soon!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my boyfriend had only been in Bali for two days and had already decided we are gonna come back next year to de moksha- it was just perfect and the best way to chill and relax. WiFi wasn’t the greatest but we didn’t care as it was so tranquil. Staff were very friendly. Cocktails and food was great. The outdoor bathroom was amazing.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful romantic villa with a great outdoor bathroom. The sheets on the really big bed felt like silk. The breaksfast is very luxurious and you get a lot of it. The staff members are very friendly and personal. The call you by your name and are interested in what you do.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This resort was, at first glance, a beautiful escape from the chaos of Kuta. The eco-lodge concept is great in a region devastated by rubbish in parts. However, the experience at De Moksha was not as perfect as we had hoped.Firstly, the villas themselves were less private than we had expected. In other parts of Bali, the villas were completely private with high walls surrounding the villas. Here, the villas with their 'private pools' were completely open to anyone else staying there as there was no wall around the villa to retain privacy. This ultimately lead to us keeping our blinds closed as anyone walking past our villa could peer through the windows and see us. The second fault of the villas was the partially open air roof. This minimised the effectiveness of the air conditioning and also resulted in numerous bugs getting in the villa at night.The completely open bathroom was nice during the day, but was a little uncomfortable at night, especially as there were a number of spiders around outside at night.We thought the breakfast was very well prepared, but we were disappointed to see the street dog (which hangs around the resort, but which has mange and worms) was walking in and out of the kitchen/food storage area. We commented on this to staff who laughed and said, 'yes. She likes to sleep in there'. After that, we were really uninterested in continuing to eat at the restaurant.The yoga pavillion is located by the dining area and is a beautiful set up. However, classes are $25 for a single person to attend, which is incredibly expensive and unreasonable. I notably never noticed any classes taking place and I assume the price is probably the offputting factor here.The private pool was very small and was really only a dip pool beside our villa, but it wasn't clean (we could see green algae in it) and so we never decided to use it. We also noticed the main pool wasn't particularly clean and this was quite disappointing.Lastly, the villa is really far away from anything, so you have no option but to organise drivers, which is very costly. If the resort had a more appealing pool, restaurant and affordable activities, this might be less of an issue, but as these were all sorely lacking, we left the resort for other activities at a significant cost.Despite all my comments above, I do believe the resort has great potential if the above issues are addressed. The location is really peaceful and could be a very idyllic escape for couples.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After seven months of travel we wanted to spend our last week unwinding in luxury. Luckily we found the best place to do so!! De Mokscha is absolutely beautiful and attention has been paid to every single detail. From the incredible infinity pool to the stylish rooms and the great restaurant. Even more important is that every member of the staff makes a huge effort to make your stay as comfortable and memorable as possible. Would definitely recommend this place to everyone!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We first booked 2 nights at De Moksha Resort but we loved it so much that we extended our stay twice! We just couldn’t leave the place! Everything there is simply perfect. The resort and the villa are gorgeous, the food is delicious and the staff is amazing. We first planned to move to other cities during our trip but decided to finally stay our whole trip at De Moksha. Instead we used the bicycle available for free at the resort or hired a driver. This place is so peaceful!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ayu and Dewa were very helpful in coming up with ideas for the special birthday celebration and catered for all our asks without any fuss or bother. Throughout our stay they added some surprises which made us feel very welcomed.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: De Moska Boutique Resort turned out to be a little gem. Its six villas nestled in beautiful gardens at the bottom of a drive, and all with private pool and refreshing architecture were a delightful surprise. The Restaurant provided excellent meals and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We had some interesting discussions, especially with Aya whose philosophical views gave added spice to our stay. Lying alongside a river and surrounded by rice fields and interesting villages, and not far from Tanah Lot it proved a nice location, and if you don't have your own transport the Resort will provide it, including from the airport at a price we found (too late) that was much less than charged through the airport authority. It proved a quiet, relaxing and refreshing experience and we would definitely recommend it to anyone.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Got what I needed during my stay here, refreshing green surroundings (rice paddy view from balcony) and very nicely decorated place. Welcome drink was one whole coconut, my favorite! The room was neat and comfortable - one of the best bed I've ever slept on - they have Egyptian bedding and adjustable colored lighting that suits your mood/energy. The pool is really nice and you get access to the communal kitchen and movie room. Would definitely go back one day!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The road to the hotel is beoken and in bad need of maintenance. Hotel facilities and room amenities are higher than expectations. The check-in experience was quite good. But the experience requesting for a power adapter on the phone was miserable due to the staff's weak English speaking. The included breakfast was awesome.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cleanleness could be improved a lot, the hotel is also pretty worn down and needs urgent refurbishment.Breakfast only limited a la carte choice.No Service at the pool.Location not so great either. Nothing around to do. Reception directly at the main pool next to the sin chairs. Very strange.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: [TRIGGER WARNING: READ THIS ONLY IF YOU WANT TO KNOW HOW GOOD DOES IT FEEL TO STAY IN DE MOKSHA]Before we begin this lengthy praises of how beautiful De Moksha and how ethereal it can be as your accommodation while you stay in Bali, I would like to thank particular party who complete my vacation in Bali. Special regard goes to Ayu, the most amazing Hostess (P.S: She knows almost every part of Bali, you can ask her to guide you whenever you want to go. Out of her shift of course. Plus she can drive a motorcycle! Such an amazing person!). And then to the owner of the resort! They were there and they tried their hardest to listen to your input regarding the resort. So do not hesitate to talk to them! Mas Gunawan and Mas Hans are a couple of wonderful souls!Let’s begin this!Me and my friends stayed in two different type of the resorts; the two bedroom villa and the main villa. The two bedroom villa was spacious with a high ceiling and every bedroom equipped with a luxurious bathroom; a perfect place to indulge with yourself (or your partner). The bathroom has a bath tub which can be place to contemplate, tranquilize your mind, or as simple as enjoying wine throughout the night.Here comes my favorite about the bathroom: They provide shampoo, soap, and hair conditioner with natural fragrance! Unlike other toiletries in several places I have stayed, their toiletries do not ruin your hair or skin, they rejuvenate it! I came home with smoother skin and hair (This is not exaggerating)Once you finish your business in the bathroom, you can slide yourself into the bath robe. The bath robe is a five star itself, it has a really smooth fabrics and feel so comfortable on your skin. I literally felt like in a vacation while roaming through my villa or just sitting in front the television watching some tv show or program when I was not going out.The two bedroom villa provided a private pool where you can enjoy the sun and have a little pool party with your friends. The water was amazing, it does not hurt your eyes because the chlorine is not really strong (ergo, it wont ruin your skin as much as regular swimming pool water do)The bedroom itself has an exquisite bed sheeted with comfortable fabric. They told me that they use some special fabric which will adapt to the room temperature, by adapt I mean that the fabric will turn warm when the room temperature is cold, and it will turn cool when the room temperature is hot. On top of that, I enjoy the fluffiness of the pillow, really send you to the dream world.On the last days of our stay in Bali, we moved to the main villa which was located on the highest ground of the villa. The main villa is a studio room equipped with an open air bathroom (this seems like their signature⎻presenting the experience of interacting with the nature of Bali).There are not much difference between the studio room villa and the two bedroom villa, they provide the same comfort and the touch of Balinese culture in the room. There is only one difference I spot while I stayed there: There was a chakra light on the ceiling to complete your leisure. The owner told me that we can utilize the chakra light depend on the color of the light and one of them is to boost the sensual energy in the (red). This room is worth to try if you are taking a vacation only with your partner here.The rate for each rooms are breakfast included. You can walk down to “hill” of the villa and enjoy an open air breakfast (accompanied with the sound and the fresh air of nature). They serve variety of breakfasts, from the traditional Indonesian breakfast to a western style breakfast. I only tried the traditional Indonesian breakfast and hearty breakfast (typical breakfast with sausages, bacon, ham, eggs). They will serve the breakfast with the complement of fruits, variety of breads, tea, and a juice. Most of the time, Ayu the Hostess service us through our breakfast time and she is so entertaining. What I love about this villa is they are really inclusive and open about the real notion of diversity, you will complete your vacation with tons of new experience.People probably worried about the location of this villa which is quite far from the frenzy of Bali night life experience. I assure you, do not worry, they provide motorcycles and also a car for you to rent so you can travel from the villa to other places.For me, if you are looking for a place in Bali where you can experience the “real” Bali, you have to try this villa. They offer varieties of experience which will make your stay memorable. Along this review i attach the snippets for my stay in De Moksha.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hi, peeps. Have you ever imagined a serene and beautiful place to rest on your weekend? A beautiful paradise on earth that is far far away from the noisy crowd?Then, here is the right place for you - De Moksha Boutique Resort. Located at one of the most scenic places in Tanah Lot, Bali, you can enjoy the beautiful view and a breath of fresh air.de Moksha is an awesome place to rebuild your connection with Mother Nature. You can feel its captivating beauty by the time you take your first step there. The eco friendly villa is surrounded by glistening rice field. Walk your way on the pathway surrounded by decorative plants and flowers. Your sights will be pampered by flying butterflies. Enjoy the humming of the harmonizing songbirds. You can feel how Mother Nature touches and rejuvenates your soul here.de Moksha offers more than just its amazing natural atmosphere. The hosts give you their excellent service and hospitality. In the morning, you can get your breakfast served either in your room or in the restaurant. Every single menu they serve is prepared with a very careful touch so that you can take a pic and post them directly to your social media! When they clean up your room, they will also spray it with aromatherapy. When you want to have a shower, you will find your hand made amenities.You do not need to worry on how to spend your day here. You can ask for a personalized trip in de Moksha. Feel free to go outside to have a beautiful journey to Bali's natural or cultural tourism sites. If you choose to stay, you can also spend the day by playing PS4 in the home theater room, have a massage, sunbathe on the side of the pool, or take a yoga class for your spiritual well being.They'll serve handmade chocolates for the guests in the afternoon. They also provide a hot water bathtub in case you want to relax yourself after a long day. Afterwards, you can also have a romantic candlelight dinner in their restaurant.de Moksha is not just an ordinary eco-friendly villa where you can spend your day and night in Bali, it also offers a whole body, mind and soul experience. Let them rejoice only in de Moksha!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is De Moksha, an utterly beautiful place away from the crowd to feel, to see, to hear, and to touch the warm kindness of Bali.So let me tell you what they do to pamper you every single day.You'll wake up in the morning when the sun kisses your body, sneaking through the curtain. You can walk to the restaurant or have your breakfast served to your room : your designated butler will have it delivered. How fancy is that?Eco friendly private villas is not just a gimmick for them. You can see green and yellow rice fields, where birds are chirping and butterflies are dancing while enjoying your breakfast at the restaurant.They will serve you a LOT, a plate of breads, pancakes, pumpkin cakes with butter and strawberry jam. A choice of main menu, fruit juice, TWG tea selection or Bali Kintamani coffee. And all is instagtammable You can even try to eat the kedonfong leaves - thanks to our amazing host Bagaoesoekawatie for the knowledge When you go back to your room, you'll find the housekeeping have your room tidied up and you can smell the aromatherapy fused nicely to the air. Grab your bath robe and start dipping your body at your own private pool.After soaked wet, go straight to the bathroom for a quick shower where your amenities are hand made with essential oil.Rent the bicycle for free, have a short trip to Tanah Lot, took a yoga class, or ask for a personalized trip around. Too lazy to go outside? Find yourself sitting on the home theater room, they even provide PS4 console for you!Tired after a long trip? I don't think you will say no about a full body massage that they provide.In the afternoon, the housekeeping will tune down your room once more and serving you their delicious home made chocolate. Go soak yourself in a hot water bathtub, pour a bag of bath salt, grab your book or just rest your eyes gazing cause the sky and stars are your ceiling.After that you can enjoy your TWG chamomile tea and sleep. Don't forget to turn on your Chakra light on.In the end, you will never want to leave this place
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Truely memorable and special resort, would definately recommend great value for money, the only thing is Tannah Lot can be abit far from shops restuarants etc so do your homework and if you dont mind taking taxi rides for 30min to busy markets ect then this is a winner, amazing landmarks and scenery
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first trip to Bali and we decided to stay in Nusa Dua and then in Tanah Lot. So happy we decided on Tanah Lot. This hotel was amazing - from the staff to the rooms to the food - this hotel is a must for anyone interested in going to Bali!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brilliant hotel! Lovely peaceful setting and extra luxurious - probably the best hotel we stayed at in Bali. The breakfast was very generous and delicious. The spa is very reasonably priced and next to a small running river which makes for a lovely atmosphere. Pool is great and the staff are fantastic. Costs around £3 to get to Tanah Lot Temple. I would definitely recommend to everyone. Special mention to Ayu for making our stay so wonderful!The road to get up to the hotel is very bumpy and a bit tricky if you want to go for a walk after dark. Otherwise perfect.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I truly loved my time in the sanctuary that is De Moksha. As someone that has been to Bali and stayed in many Villas over 20 years this is an exceptional place. The villas are very luxuriously appointed with wonderful taste and execution. Privacy of the villas and private pools is achieved through lush gardens and a secret tropical garden design. With panoramic views over verdant rice Padi terraces you can only feel rejuvenated and refreshed. The staff are truely lovely and helpful. I had some travel requests for when I arrived and they were handled very smoothly and without issue. The staff from reception, to security, restaurant and housekeeping were al lovely. Very nice setting for meals beside the rice Padi terraces. Wonderful staff there and the food was very good quality and healthy. Breakfast is an abundance of healthy dishes and dinner is a range of local to international choices. This will be a new standard for me in luxurious Bali villa experiences.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are after a quiet and luxurious place to stay, De Moksha Boutique Resort should be your place of choice. The staff is very caring and friendly and also give you a chance to experience 'authentic Bali' if wish to do so, e.g. we used the opportunity to help prepare temple offerings and were invited to Ngaben Ceremony in a neighboring village.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dear De Moksha family, we thank you very much for your help! We were unable to access Indonesia for our holidays because we were robbed in KL and the hotel didn't charge us any cancellation fees because we found ourselves in an extremely difficult situation trying to find emergency flights only for repatriation. This decision to help us in this hard time is proving a lot for the perfect quality and the high ethical level of those people who run this magnificent hotel we had chosen to stay at. Your hotel is a lovely place we were waiting to visit for months! We will never forget what you made for us and we will plan to visit you in our next holidays!!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: De Moksha Boutique Hotel is a great place to stay and rest, far away from the crowded cities... The villa (Pranayama) had a private pool and the bed was excellent. Perfect staff ! Highly recommended !!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first trip with my husband without the children. So i demanded for a perfect place where i can spend quality time with my husband. Thank god we selected de'moksha! It is located in the village by the rice field.. far away from the husle and busle of the city. The place is amazing.our room was in the second floor where we can experience amazing view from the balcony. First we would like to get the room with private pool... but who need private pool when the swimming pool seems like our "private pool" already as the hotel is not big and you can feel the ambiance of staying in semi private hotel. The room is equiped with homemade toiletries which are sooo amazing... they leave my skin smoother and my energy hair. The room is spacious and will give you a quality sleep and relax.The restaurant lays next to the rice field which give you amazing view during breakfast. The food is actually so so... but thank god to the view and lovely pregnant waitress (i forgot her name) which i'm sure has made the food tasted better This place is really suitable for you who wants to escape from the city... wants to spend quality time with the couple and family ... but probably no really suitable for the ones who love the husle and busle of the city.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at the de Moksha Boutique Resort was a very good start for our holidays in Bali. The staff was very friendly and they tried to help us whereever they could. The accommodation was clean and luxurious.The breakfast was incredible and we really enjoyed eating dinner in the restaurant.We explored the area near the Resort with a rented motorbike and you can reach Tanah Lot or Canggu beach within 30 minutes. We really enjoyed our stay there and recommend it to everyone!
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not the easy to get to but that's bali. The area is beautiful, if you like nature and rice paddies they are everywhere! The associates in DeMoksha are amazing, have to highlight Mr. Anton one of the receptionist whom helped us throughout from Check-in to following up with my lost luggage and went an extra mile to purchase additional electronic mosquitoes repellent so I can sleep :o) what a kind soul! The in house amenities are made by the hotel and they are amazing all natural products.
hotelName:
24    De Moksha Boutique Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went to the Tamarind for four nights and were lucky enough to get the highest villa with the most spectacular views. The team at the Tamarind really are exceptional. Armand should be really proud of the team he has. There was no hesitation from the staff when my twelve year old was surfing and the roads were closed to buggy’s for a cremation ceremony for one of the reception staff to go and collect her in their motorbike so she wasn’t waiting. Then on our last morning when our eldest came down with Bali belly at 5.30am we were escorted straight to a doctor and the staff waited with us to ensure he was okay before taking us back. Be patient with the language barriers on Nusa Lembongan, there is stuff occasionally lost in translation but the friendliness of everyone here really makes your stay. Thank you to all of the staff.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An amazing resort. Stunning infinity pool. Lovely rooms. Great location with a shortcut through to the beach and lots of restaurants to watch the sunset. A traditional ceremony when you leave to bless and protect you for a safe trip home was a nice touch.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the most wonderful stay here with our 1 year old boy Thomas. Apart from the hotel itself, the highlight was the staff who treated us and our boy so beautifully. As for the hotel, it has terrific pool facilities with spectacular views, high quality massage facilities, and wonderful healthy food from the on-site restaurant Indica. Thank you Tamarind, we can’t wait to come back soon!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Tamarind after hearing fantastic reviews and recommendations. We definitely weren’t disappointed ! Very clean facilities and room, the staff were extremely friendly, food was delicious and the view from our room and infinity pool were spectacular !! Easy to get around he island with a scooter. Beautiful island to visit. We will definitely be back ! Thanks for providing such a pleasant stay ! 100% recommend this resort to everyone
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So we arrived super early (10am) and we were immediately welcome , of course our room wasn’t ready since our check in was at 3 pm , we had an amazing breakfast by the pool and by 12 pm they check us in , super well kept room , after that the front desk helped us to booked all our activities and tours , the manager even gave us a ride to a restaurant that he recommended, super nice people ! Ohh and we check out early and they give us a breakfast read to go ! Thank you for your hospitality!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I recently spent 3 nights at The Tamarind. The resort is conveniently located 5 min walk from the ferry drop.The service was exceptional and some of the best we’ve had in Bali. Once we got off the ferry, we were picked up at the wharf by the staff and taken straight to our room for check-in. It felt like we were VIP.Throughout our staff the staff were amazing. The girl on concierge was so helpful with organising our day trip to Nusa Penida, scooter and dinner.The view from the top pool and our balcony was great. The gym was surprisingly really good compared to other hotels and the spa also looked really nice.The only suggestion I could give is that I feel the restaurant menu needs some improvement. Although we enjoyed the breakfast, I feel like it was not up to the same level you expect for this grade of resort.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel with two swimming pools, beautiful spacious rooms with balcony and a view of Bali and it’s volcanos and great ambiance. All the staff was super friendly and attentive and Highly recommended
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Halfway through a trip around Bali last week, another couple and ourselves wanted to appreciate the laid back nature and outdoor activities of Nusa Lembongan. The islands (including Nusa Ceningan and Nusa Penida) have a lot of fun outdoor things to do, but the development is much more basic and sparse. So it was amazing to find this 5 star experience to call home!The hotel is small but beautiful! Stepping up a hillside with just 12 rooms of various sizes every room has a view. We had the Pavana Premium Room which offered gorgeous morning views of the volcano on Bali. The room was extremely spacious and well appointed with luxury finishes that would stand up to comparison to high end hotels around the world. The stepping nature of the building allows for 2 different vanishing edge pools to relax in after a long hot day adventuring (a drink in hand in the pool looking out at the view under the large Tamarind tree is perfection!). The food and drinks at the poolside open air restaurant are creative and offer something for everyone from both west and east. We tried a lot of things on the menu and loved every one! And the all day breakfast was great! They offer essentially 2 breakfast entrees per person and since you can eat when ever, you can have one when you get up and the other later after a dip in the pool or a treatment at their spa (great too!).What really clinched how much we loved the hotel though was the caring staff and all that they did for us. The Balinese people as a whole seem kind and friendly but this was to another level! The front desk staff (including Indah) bent over backwards helping us set up all of our activities and directing us to the best restaurants (try Lemongrass and Warung Bambu). And the restaurant staff always had a story and a constant smile (tons of giggles too!). Mae and Intan went above and beyond though after my husband bruised his arm pretty good on a moped. For the entire time we were there they were checking on himand on their own bringing ice up to the room for his arm!All 4 of us wish that we could have stayed there longer! It was the highlight of our trip! Thank you Tamarind!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a short boat ride from Bali, we arrived in the crystal clear waters of Nusa Lembongan. We were so excited for our upcoming adventures on the island and a little break from the hustle and bustle of Bali. Neither of us had been to Nusa Lembongan, Cenigan or Penida before, so we had a lot of exploring to do. When we arrived at the hotel only a short walk from the harbour, we were greeted by the lovely staff who were beyond helpful. They provided multiple recommendations of where to explore, where to eat and what are the must sees on the island. The hotel itself has two beautiful swimming pools, overlooking the beautiful ocean and it's very well maintained. The staff and food are wonderful, the rooms are beautifully set up with eco friendly products all over and very comfy beds. We highly recommend The Tamarind resort and can't wait to visit again !
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of four, which includes two toddlers, had a wonderful holiday at The Tamarind.From the moment you’re collected from the ferry, to breakfast every morning and drinks by the pool, the team at The Tamarind go above and beyond to make sure your stay is as relaxing as it can be.We stayed in a three bedroom villa and the views from the master and especially the rooftop were breathtaking.Travelling with small children can be tricky, but nothing was too much trouble, which we really appreciated. Particularly Pinkan and Mita, thank you ladies! Our boys felt so special and cared for.I couldn’t recommend The Tamarind more strongly - make sure you visit!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in one of the rooms closest to the restaurant for a couple of days at the end of our Bali trip! It's an amazing looking boutique hotel, with 2 infinity pools and a very nice vibe! Rooms were very spacious and had a large balcony, which still gave us ocean view, despite being sold as garden view. Major downturn for us were the ceremonies held nearby, which start at 6am and continue throughout the day. They're quite noisy, so if you're here for some peace, it might be something to take into account. Service in the restaurant was very good, however take into account Lembongan is a small island and kitchen runs out of stuff very easily. Pinkan really greeted us with a smile every day and did her best to make our stay even better!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a four day stay at this beautiful hotel. Travelling with two teenagers, I wanted to give them the ‘wow’ factor which I achieved by booking one of the villas on the hilltop. The master had the most incredible view I’ve ever seen and even better was from the top sundeck which takes in the village and the surf breaks. Not only is the location perfect, with only a quick walk to Playgrounds surfbreak and into the village for a meal, but the staff are also magnificent. Particular thanks to Chusnul who was very kind as well as Pinkan and Mita (Hope that’s correct) who served us everyday at breakfast and shared their stories with us about where they came from and life in Nusa Lembongan. Nothing was too much trouble and everything was done graciously with a smile and with care. Bed and linen was possibly best I have ever slept in. Pools were beautiful and breakfasts freshly prepared and generous in size. Very relaxing stay indeed and highly recommended!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a great resort! The staff are friendly, you can ask them any recommendation about the island!The food of the hotel restaurant (Indica) was really great!! I love that Tuna TarTar and pizza so much!!Location is really near the pier!!That was my best resort experience in my life ever. Thank you you guys so much!!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Tamarind is perfectly located, and very clean.The staff is lovely and helpful, with a very good level of English (contrary to other hotels we stayed at). They proactively came to me to refill my water and make sure I'm comfortable when I was working in the restaurant space, which is a detail I appreciated.Room had an awesome view, restaurant has good food with products that felt fresh, overall I had a great time.Will definitely come back if I'm in Lembongan!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are so many incredible things I can say about the Tamarind Resort. I actually made a TripAdvisor account so that I can leave a review for the hotel. The first thing i have to say is that this is quite possibly one of the best all around resorts I have ever had the pleasure of staying at, anywhere in the world. When you consider the price of rooms a night it also becomes the best valued stay I’ve ever had. It’s definitely more expensive than other hotels in the area but it’s not obscene and when you consider all of intangibles involved with the resort it instantly becomes worth it. The staff is a highlight of the resort. They were so accommodating, understanding and brilliant. They were extremely adaptable, knowledgeable and kind. I spoke to a couple of people on staff and I enjoyed their company immensely. The breakfasts which are part of the room fee were amazing. The multiple infinity pools after a day of adventure were cooling and rejuvenating and the gym was the best I’ve seen during my weeks in Indonesia. The staff hooked up multiple tours, a scooter rental, and multiple reservations. They truly go above and beyond with their service. It’s a feeling that reverberates throughout the island and it’s intoxicating. I’d suggest taking the tour to Nusa Pineda, it’s the bigger adjacent island which is more untouched and majestic filled with beautiful beaches and beautiful people. I know this sounds too good to be true already but the rooms are amazing. I got a deluxe room which was spacious clean and beautifully designed. The view from the balcony lit up gold and tangerine skies every evening and provided a good relaxing place to just chill out. The beds — maybe the most comfortable ones I have slept on in quite some time. I am going to need someone from the resort to tell me what brand they are. At the end of the day I’m toint to recommend the Tamarind to anyone looking to spend a little bit more for a trulyIncredible and comfortable experience on Nusa Lembongan. There is something that everyone from the management to the staff of the hotel is doing right and it’s a really cool feeling to witness something like that.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff and common areas of this resort are lovely. However this is at best a 3 Star hotel. The room smelt Mouldy/musty and it seemed to be coming from the air conditioning. There were stains on all of the furniture (couch, table, chair and pillow) as well as a big gross glob of hair in the shower before I used it!
