The rooms are big but there is the wrong type of furniture in them to make them feel luxurious as mentioned it is also dirty.There are some lovely touches here a cake in our room for our honeymoon, swim up bar, breakfast and a card delivered each night with suggestions for the next day. But the owner needs to spend some money modernizing and maintaining this property. I feel as though there is much better value for money to be found elsewhere on this island.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Tamarind was the perfect place to stay on Nusa Lembongan. The location is great as it's nearby the port where the boats arrive and depart from the island, and the views of Mt. Agung are magnificent. We stayed in the Candrika Suite which is one of the closest rooms to the main pool and restaurant Indica. The breakfast served by Indica is superb and we even got to enjoy a floating breakfast on the pool one morning. Our room was really spacious and modern with great amenities supplied in the bathroom. We had a garden view with glimpses of the ocean - very serene! We recommend heading up to the top infinity pool for sunset cocktails as this offers the best views.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My parter and I stayed here for 2 nights. We booked through a third party website but once we had booked they contacted us directly to organise the boat from Sanur to Lembongan, they make it a easy and smooth trip over and they greet you as you hop off. The resort itself is stunning with great views and very nice and spacey rooms. The restaurant is good and the included breakfast is even better. They have a gym which is the best I have seen in a hotel in Bali which is great. If you want to book a scooter or buggy for they day they will deliver to reception and organise it all. (145k for scooter 800k for buggy)They make up your room twice a day and prep it for bed at night which is a nice touch. Overall the best stay I’ve had anywhere in Bali.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Of the several beautiful places we stayed in Bali, the Tamarind was by far our favorite. It was beautiful, clean, and comfortable with the most accomadating staff. They provided transportion around the island, picking us up from our ferry, bringing us to our activities, and even to and from dinner. They arranged all our activities for us which made fitting in everything we wanted to do a breeze. The service from everyone was impeccable, from the front desk, to the restaurant and bar, to housekeeping. Our favorite was Yoga at the restaurant. He made many suggestions and was always smiling. Breakfast was delicious, especially the homemade almond milk for our coffee. Drinks were tasty and room service was speedy. The room had anything you could need and the views were incredible. The private dinner up at the top pool was so romantic overlooking an incredible sunset. It was the perfect setting for our engagement :) I can’t say enough good things about this place. We hope to return some day soon.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Tamarind was a nice spot on Lembongan. The room and pool area were really nice and well kept. The staff was very friendly and helpful booking us snorkeling and picking us up from the ferry. We were disappointed in the food and drinks. Very western menu which is probably great when you are traveling with children, we weren't. The cocktails at the restaurant and pool bar need some work, It really is as simple as training your staff in cocktail basics to make this 'excellent.'
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel's location, design and architecture are wonderful! It offered the most wonderful views we had in Nusa Lembongan.The room was really good and the bed was super comfortable. We had a great view of Mont Agung outside our window. It was unbelievable!The pools are amazing as well!Once again, their staff was super welcoming and caring!Breakfast could have more vegetarian options but they are at least opened to change a few things.We had an amazing time while staying there and would be looking forward to coming back!Totally recommend!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The pools where nice (especially the view). But overall it was very disappointing. The rooms had no view, it also smells funny. And we had the most problems with the staff.. with every order it went wrong, or it was not available or we were getting the wrong orders. We also we’re waiting a long time before the staff was coming to take our order (and we were the only table in the restaurant).. the spa was also very disappointing and not that good. Overall it was very disappointing for what you pay.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I stayed in Tamarind's 3-bedroom villa in December 2018, and we have nothing but praises for the hotel. The one thing that amazed me the most was that even though the hotel was operating almost at full capacity, it didn't felt the place was overcrowded. The whole place just provides the sense of serenity, which is a much needed escape from the busy city life. Even though our villa didn't come with a private pool, the pool was literally 10 steps away from our door. There was even a swim-up bar to complete the whole experience. My husband and I had one of our best afternoon drinks there (as there was only 2 of us in the pool, and 1 bartender who provided us with her full attention). Checking in and out of the hotel was hassle free. The whole villa was very clean, and it provides one of the best views of the sea/beach in level 3 (while lazing on their day bed). Perhaps one of the downside was that there were no en-suite bathrooms to the 2 bedrooms in level 2. There was also a smell that came out from the bathroom in level 1 at night (perhaps the sewage?) but it was nothing too unbearable. The beds and pillows in Tamarind was also very comfortable and none of us had trouble falling asleep at night. We also requested to have breakfast delivered to our villa in the mornings. Breakfast was delivered on time, and every dish was amazing. Even though they missed out on 1 coffee on one of the mornings, it was delivered promptly. All in all, my family and I enjoyed the stay and I'll definitely stay in Tamarind again if I'm in Nusa Lembongan again.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Tamarind for 4 days as part of our holiday in Bali, and I wish we could have stayed there for the entirety of our trip, it was simply " heaven on earth". The services they offer are above the 5 star rating! From the moment we landed we were treated to the Tamarinds outstanding service. We organised through the hotel to experience their " VIP Service". As soon as we stepped off the plane we were greeted by airport staff who promptly fast tracked us through immigration. There was no waiting in hour long queues. We were escorted to the lounge where refreshments awaited us while airport staff collected our baggage. Once collected we were seamlessly taken to our transport vehicle which was also organised by the Tamarind. For the small added fee, I can't recommend this service enough! Once we arrived at the hotel I was blown away. The intricate design which blends into its natural landscape combined with the high quality finishes really brings you into luxury. We were welcomed by friendly and very helpful staff who went above and beyond for all our needs. Nothing was to much trouble for them. We arrived to our rooms followed by our luggage, and the sense of luxury continued. The rooms are well thought out, minimalistic, extremely clean and very functional. Not to mention the best hotel beds and pillows I have ever had the pleasure of sleeping on!I thought it couldn't get any better, and then I was bought up to the main pool on the upper level. The views were absolutely breathtaking. The amazing infinity pool overlooks the island and sea and in clear skies allows you to see Mt Agung in all her glory. The service gets even better with the addition of the swim up bar which allows you to eat and drink without leaving the pool.The Spa at the Tamarind leaves nothing to be desired. It ranges from 2 hour bliss packages, to massages and facials. There really isn't anything the Tamarind doesn't have to meet your needs.The restaurant was beautiful and the included breakfast menu offered a great variety of meals. The kitchen is more than happy to tailor your meal to suit any deity requirements. I simply cannot praise The Tamarind high enough. From the minute you book your room to the minute you have to unfortunately part ways, you will experience the highest quality of service. You will not be disappointed. I'm eagerly awaiting my return to this heaven on earth.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Tamarind resort quite simply exceeded all of my expectations. Having stayed in many resort/hotels over many years the Tamarind outshines them all.The resort gently and serenely blends in and compliments the most spectacular natural space giving you a wonderful sense of peace and harmony as soon as you walk in.The staff are wonderful. They are always friendly, courteous and smiling, you genuinely feel like your at home here. We checked out all the facilities during our stay. The gym is state of the art and very well laid out.the three pools are just magic with the upper pool having the most awe inspiring view of the surrounds below. The spa is just heavenly i think i think i floated out.I was also lucky enough to participate in the cooking class with the chef. He was very generous in sharing the secrets of the Balinese cuisine. In short the Tamarind will be seeing us again and again and again. There is no where better to experience the beautiful island of Nusa Lembongan.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Tamarind for 2 weeks in December over Christmas and New Years. What a very special place. The accommodation was wonderful with views over the ocean. The staff was exceptional from the housekeeping service at night leaving us wonderful towel surprises in shapes of turtles and manta rays, to the very friendly restaurant staff who made our mornings with their cheerful welcome. We were so spoiled by the amazing stay that we did not want to leave and come back to the UK!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Tamarind for 4 nights as one of our 3 stops in Bali for our honeymoon. All 3 of our hotels were very nice but the Tamarind was our favorite. The hotel construction looks brand new and very modern, the views from the rooftop pool are breathtaking and the staff are incredibly helpful and accommodating. I had a stomach issue when I arrived at the hotel (it started before I arrived at the Tamarind, nothing to do with the hotel) and the staff went way above and beyond to help me get better, offering us a variety of stomach-friendly teas, drinks & off-menu food that helped me get better in no time. They arranged all our activities, rentals & reservations on the island and truly made for a memorable stay. Thank you to everyone here for making our honeymoon so special.P.S. my wife says the Tamarind has the best hair-dryer she’s ever used at a hotel.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m a seasoned world traveler that has stayed in a variety of 1 to 5 Star accommodations around the world. This was without a doubt one of the top 5 hotels I’ve ever stayed at. From the amazing welcome, the super friendly staff, the amazing food (amazing— I mean it!), to the lovely clean faculties— everything about The Tamarind was remarkable. It is very walkable to get around downtown FYI ;) We were so sad to leave and wish we could have stayed longer. What an amazing place!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommended for a simply luxurious, peaceful experience while exploring the area, we were always looking forward to being back in the comforts of The Tamarine after a day of activities! As frequent Bali visitors, but first timers to the Nusa Lembongan island, we were pleasantly surprised with the amazing hospitality and beautifully intimate setting of The Tamarine Resort. The area is still developing in comparison to Bali, but holds its own untouched charm.The location is great, super convenient to explore, but also away from the busier areas. A few minutes from the nearby ferry port, 8 mins buggy ride to Mushroom Bay bars and 12 mins to the popular Sandy Bay Beach Club. The island is basically only accessible by scooter or buggy, the Tamarine provides buggy rides at your request.The staff is top notch, starting with management to the friendly staff, super attentive and helpful. From addressing feedback of our room to providing personalized day trip tips to even finding first aid for injuries, they addressed every ask with a smile to make sure our stay was awesome. Thank you to Nigel, Pupusa, Pinkan for making our stay extra special!The only expectation to set is on the food which is mainly western, there’s a limited menu and was not what was expected for the price. We found the coffees, smashed avocado toast and the off-menu Nasi Goreng to be our go-tos.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Special thanks to Intan for keeping us served at the pool bar. Restaurant service was great throughout the day, and breakfast was extremely good (flexible breakfast times also fantastic). Rooms are very comfortable, and the service of the reception staff taking us to and from restaurants around the island was extremely helpful. Would highly recommend The Tamarind.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel is the best in Lembongan! the food is good (especially the Pizza), the room is clean and wonderful, and my favorite one is the pool, which has amazing beautiful view.The service is awesome, we have left the hotel and forget to take my hat, the employee (I can remember her name) from hotel has bring the hat to boat landing for us, which is really surprise!!! we will definitely visit the Tamarind again in next trip in Bali.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in a Villa for 4 nights with some girlfriends and absolutely loved the entire experience. From the greeting when we first arrived, to being shown around our villa and the the overall treatment by the staff. The pool is superb, the view is amazing and there is definitely a relaxing vibe around the pool. The swim up bar was ideal. The villa was way better that expected. It was massive, and offered very comfortable accomodation. The kitchen size was impressive, and the bedding was very comfortable. The bathrooms were excellent as well with plenty of room. The outdoor bath tub off the master bedroom on the lower level was a surprise, and an awesome touch. The turndown service at night with dessert was a little something extra. All the staff were extremely kind and helpful. I was too scared to scooter, so I was taken by buggy to certain locations on the island for free - this was really convenient for me because my friends were all on scooters. The food at the restaurant was excellent. The menu selection made you want to try everything - and nothing disappointed. We tried the gym and the facilities were better than expected - especially for an island resort. Sadly I only swam in the infinity pool on the top level, however loved the idea that there were 2 other pools to choose from - which would be convenient when I return with my family. I had a treatment at the day spa and really enjoyed the service - if I had more time I would have gone back. Overall, absolutely enjoyed my stay and wouldn't hesitate to recommend or rebook the Tamarind Resort.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were so freindly, the location was very central to all the major attractions, close to good eating places, pickup and drop off service was extreamly helpful, rooms were extreamly clean. Beautifully designed hotel.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful stay at The Tamarind Resort in October.The resort is quite new and close to Jungutbatu and only about 500 metres from the Rocky Fast Cruises office.We received a lovely greeting from the reception staff, given a refreshing welcome drink then showed to our room on the third level of the resort.Our Pavana room had lovely views to Jungutbatu beach from the window and balcony.The room was spacious and very tastefully decorated. It beautifully cool and had every conceivable amenity and a nice bathroom with a rain shower. We did however expect a separate bathtub that wasn’t in our room.The standard of cleanliness was excellent and I liked the fact that they supplied drinking water in glass bottles with extra available complimentary on request. One of Bali’s biggest problems at the moment is plastic pollution and it is good to see the Tamarind is not contributing to this!We were close to the top infinity pool and we ended up spending a lot of time there!The views are to die for, we never had a problem getting a sun lounge and Freddy and the other staff were so obliging at the swim up pool bar. They even went down to the main restaurant to get me (good) coffee!The meals in the restaurant, Indica were excellent, fresh, tasty, nicely presented and reasonably priced.We especially enjoyed our breakfasts at the Tamarind. My wife loves breakfast in bed and it was a highlight of her Bali holiday to have a delicious a la carte breakfast delivered to the room.Usually I like to explore a new destination but we loved the Tamarind so much that we basically didn’t leave it for the first two days! I hired a scooter for the last to days to go have a look around Nusa Lembongan, this was arranged by the reception staff and it was delivered and picked up at the end.All the staff were wonderful so friendly and genuinely wanting to help.It was nice to meet the new resort manager, Armand.On departure we were given a special treat in the form of a traditional Balinese blessing at the shrine under the 300 year old Tamarind tree. I think it was Putu who did this for us and I found it very touching and one of the nicest things to happen to me in 11 trips to Bali.I thoroughly recommend the Tamarind Resort to anyone and would return in a heartbeat!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Tamarind was modern clean and had an amazing view over the bay and Nusa Lembongan. However the biggest highlight was the staff, some of the friendliest people I have ever met and always looking out for us, especially our friend Freddy. The only downside to the hotel was the hot water was low pressure and changed temperature a lot. I would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4/13 nights in Bali and I regret not staying here longer. The staff are absolutely wonderful and healthful, the pool is beautiful, the food was delicious and at night it was quiet and peaceful.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The tamarind is a delight in itself! We came as three friends wanting to relax and unwind and weren’t disappointed. We stayed in the top level villa with three bedrooms and it was stunning. The villa itself is beautiful but nothing prepares you for the beautiful views. The staff are wonderfully friendly and kind, the food was delicious and on many occasions we chose to stay in and dine instead of heading out due to how lovely and well priced the menu is. Lots of healthy options and beautiful fresh juices. I had a two hour spa treatment at the resort spa Amlika and found the service, price and facilities fantastic. The gym also did not disappoint, all the equipment is new and is stocked with the integral basics for a good workout. Over all had an amazing stay and are sad to have to go. Looking forward to returning.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed couple weeks ago in the hotel and I have to say is really nice place relax and very clean too. All the staff they try the best for make you feel accommodate will be in top for sure. Hopefully when I’m back to Bali will be staying in there 100%
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently visited Nusa Lembongan and The Tamarind for the first time and absolutely loved it, fabulous location and views to die for. We stayed with a group of friends in villa 109 and were pleasantly surprised by the quality and luxury feel. Service was top notch with all staff very friendly and helpful. Special mention and thank you to Freddy and Pinkas who were brilliant and made our stay even better. Highly recommend ❤️
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at eight hotels over two weeks of travelling in Indonesia and the Tamarind was my favourite for sure. Incredibly luxurious, with great rooms, excellent facilities and next level service.The staff at the resort were so friendly, always happy to help when needed. There's two infinity pools, one that's perfect for sunset and one perfect for sunrise. The dream. The room was huge, as was the bathroom, and I had a little balcony that was nice to relax on. The view from the balcony was impacted by large plants in front but it was still a nice atmosphere.The restaurant service did take a while and the food wasn't the best I've had, but it was still decent and they did apologise for the wait. The next morning I had the floating breakfast though which was one of the coolest experiences of my travels, and all that was DELICIOUS. The strawberries and cream in the breakfast was one of the best things I've ever eaten.Overall I was incredibly impressed by the Tamarind, I've already told all my friends and family about it and I can't wait to go back some time in the future.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sadly the stay didn’t match up to the reviews I’d read. Pros:Decent locationFood is goodStaff are friendlyGreat views from the poolsCons:Water STINKSRoom was dirtyService takes foreverIn short, there have to be better options on the island- the worst of our 4 hotels throughout the 2 week stay.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful stay at The Tamarind.The staff is very kindly, it is a peaceful place to stay, the pool was very quiet and the breakfast was just perfect. The view from our room was also a great part of our stay.We loved everything !
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights. Everything about this place was fantastic. Spacious, modern & luxurious rooms. All the staff we encountered we're so friendly and helpful. We we're made to feel very welcome. Breakfast & dinner was delicious. Only a short walk to the beach & everywhere we needed to go. Would definitely reconnend!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying in the Tamarind was an absolute pleasure. The rooms and facilities are beautiful. The hotel is laid out in such a way that we felt like we had the hotel to ourselves most of the time. It is so peaceful and relaxing. Even though we had a hitch in the water supply in our room, the service was just incredible and more than compensated the issue. The staff make you feel so welcome and they are full of excellent recommendations and useful suggestions for the local area. The staff are really what make this hotel so special!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for three nights in a nice room with a balcony with a view of the sea and mount Agung. They have three (small) pools with one of them open for non-residents. The food is very good and the staff is friendly and caring like you only see on Bali. A special thanks to Pinkan for all the recommendations and the fantastic service she provided. If we ever go back to Nusa Lembongan, this would probably the place we’d stay.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for our honey moon and had an amazing time! The views of the island are spectacular especially from the infinity pool at the top (which has a swim up bar). We also enjoyed the gym and the complementary breakfast. The service staff were awesome as well. They drove us to various places on the island in a buggie free of charge. I also forgot my hat and they bought it to me at the port before I left the island. Highly recommended and probably the nicest hotel in the island.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at The Tamarind in September 2018 for our honeymoon and really enjoyed our stay. For someone who has travelled to Nusa Lembongan twice already, I was interested to see what the newest hotel on the island was like. I was amazed to see such a 5-star hotel on the island! Situated an easy stroll to Nusa Lembongan village, The Tamarind is a relaxing escape for those wanting more pool action, than beach action. The rooftop pool (for in-house guests only) is serene and has an amazing view across the beach, village out the Mount Agung. I particularly loved the Hotel Spa – a beautiful oasis, offering amazing spa treatments. Not that we used the gym, but speaking to a local friend, the hotel gym is the best and most well stocked gym on the island. The rooms are well appointed – however, one small matter we couldn’t avoid was the slight smell from the bathroom drains. On arrival the room was stuffy and the smell from the drains was fairly strong. We needed to air out the bathroom for about a day before the smell dissipated. Understanding we were on an island and the sewerage system probably isn’t as good as a major city, we didn’t really mind and this didn’t affect our stay at all. The staff are so lovely and accommodating. They would ask us questions each day of what activities we were doing that day and offer suggestions. We did find the service of the tables/food a bit slow – but perhaps that is the island way?Overall, we had a comfortable and enjoyable stay at The Tamarind. We loved the rooftop pool, the pool bar, the hotel spa and the yummy daily breakfasts. Thank you Tamarind!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Tamarind Resort. The Villa is just amazing and spacious. We really enjoyed the lounge area on the rooftop and loved that you could have your breakfast served up there. Unfortunately the warm water in the shower didn’t really work and the water smelled pretty bad. Also the bedroom kind of smelled when we turned of the air conditioning. I also didn’t like that they charged much more for all of the offered trips and to rent a scooter while using the same providers that you could book at the beach for much less. Nevertheless the view and the pool area were incredible! The included breakfast is also really good and you can order as much juice and coffee as you want. One thing I didn’t like is that the staff often just put the dirty dishes in front of the rooms and it was there for a few hours until somebody picked it up. The gym is very well equipped and clean! Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would book it again!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is elegant and sophisticated. The staff are extremely helpful and kindFood was beautiful.Rooms were spacious and clean, everything you could want.Pay more for a view! The garden view isn't much more than a small patio.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I used the gym and it was amazing. New clean equipment - 2 treadmills, 1 rower. Squat rack, pull-up bar, cable machine, benches and an abundance of dumbbells (1kg- up to uber heavy) plus many other items. Room was nice n cool (2 aircon units, only one was on), had chilled water towels everything you would need. Cost is 10k per single session which can be seen as expensive in Bali terms but if you are looking for a clean safe gym to work off all the eating and drinking then this is the place! We will definitely go back before we leave this beautiful island. And we even got a free buggy ride back to our accommodation on top of the hill.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I recently stayed here for 6 nights for a small honeymoon following our wedding in Bali and it was the perfect place to stay. The resort itself is beautiful, such a lovely tranquil setting and amazing views. The staff at the hotel were all so friendly and the service was excellent. We did see the manager a few times as well and had some good conversations with him which was a really nice touch.Our room was beautiful, very modern and the balcony views were just perfect. The room was cleaned to a high standard every day and we got a sweet treat every night when we came back in to the room which was lovely. The bed was one of the comfiest I have ever slept in... I really just did not want our stay to end! I would definitely recommend staying at The Tamarind if you are visiting Nusa Lembongan, the best resort on the island!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all, the beds and cussions here are heavenly! The hotel and rooms are well designed and styled. No buffets at breakfast but a l a carte. All the staff are really friendly, pleassant and helpfull as is the new manager, Armand. Hopefully he can keep the hotel in shape as is is. There are two infinitypools, the upper one only for hotel guests with a stunnig view over the bay. The restaurant has a nice variety of dishes to serve. We would really like to return here in a couple of years.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 2 night in Tamarind Resort at a villa, which is one of the best experience during my stay at Lembongan. Customer service is wonderful, meals are delicious(I would recommend the burger for sure), and rooms are clean and tidy. The most amazing part is the scene from the villa - breathtaking sunset, romantic star nights, and astonishing sea view.
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Tamarind is clearly the nicest place to stay on Nusa. The pool areas are beautiful, spa is lovely and the rooms are well appointed. The hotel organised our snorkelling trip for us with Nemo, who was knowledgeable, friendly and most importantly safe. We managed to see many mantas and felt comfortable on the boat especially after we heard of one of the tourist boats capsizing at Manta Point. Worth paying extra for piece of mind. We didn’t want to leave in the end!
hotelName:
25    The Tamarind Resort Nusa Lembongan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My girlfriend and I had a local AirBnB that turned out to just not be all we had hoped, so we looked locally in Ulu for some resorts that we could feel a little better about. We checked out some online and in person and then stumbled upon De Sapphire. The front desk was so friendly and had no problem showing us the rooms and accommodations to make us comfortable before booking. This was not only our favorite option in the area, but one of the more affordable as well! So many amazing restaurants and beaches within a 10 min scooter ride, which the reception was able to help us with. They were so accommodating, the rooms were unique and extremely clean. Little things from universal outlets, to letting us be picky with our food, made this place extra special. I would highly recommend to anyone staying in Uluwatu, couples, families, solo, whatever it is, I’m sure you’ll love it here.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: By the time we got to Sapphire we had had a pretty stressful trip. Sapphire was just what we needed to relax. The property was beautiful, the room was clean and had a beautiful view of the ocean. The staff was friendly. We loved our time there and would go back again.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were married at this resort last week with almost the entire villas booked out with friends and family. All staff were amazing, accommodating our every request with a smile on their face. The resort is in a great location with a fabulous pool set in an intimate setting. Highly recommended
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I & my husband have stayed in this gorgeous peaceful villa for 3 nights on last May and we had absolutely great experiences.We were greeted and welcomed by friendly staff at the reception, fresh juices as welcome drink like an oasis in the humid summer in Bali. Our villa with amazed ocean view and flower petals with swan from towel arts were on the bed. Breakfast on the following day was nice, they have plenty choices of foods served in buffet while we enjoy the sea panorama. We had grill BBQ for our diner which was completing our night. We will be back for sure!!
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Didn’t arrive until a bit later on our first night.Staff were friendly and helpful.Room was okay, bathroom was quite dirty.Breakfast was included in the stay, this was okay few options to choose from nothing special.The hotel is in a very quiet location down great if you want some peace and quiet.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My fiancée and I stayed here for 2 nights. The grounds and rooms were very nice however, it wasn’t our type of hotel for a couple looking for a relaxing time. Our room was next to the pool which at least 75% of the rooms are. We were woken both mornings to groups of people drinking and being loud in the pool at 8am and throughout the day. Not the relaxing time we were looking for. The reason I gave this hotel such a high rating was because of the staff, in particular Putri at the front desk. She was fantastic. She went above and beyond to make our stay the best she could. She is an asset to this Hotel!!
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff here are very friendly and accommodating. Rooms are clean. Chillout on bean bags in the sun, three different depths of pools. Location handy. We enjoyed our first trip with the babyAnd would love to return here.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What you’re paying for here is the beautiful clifftop location and sprawling view over the sea. The rest is not up to standard.Our villa’s downstairs toilet had not been properly cleaned and the stairs leading up to the bedroom smelled distinctly of urine. It was so overpowering and when we informed staff, all they did was spray chemicals on the stairs - the urine smell returned in minutes. We were also woken up by a very loud frog in our villa in the middle of the night, and then construction work/drilling right at our window in the morning!The shower pressure was also abysmal. The guest directory/book in the villa contained no information about the resort or services, only the restaurant’s menu. The restaurant drinks were really overpriced, with a small bottle of water being 20,000 IDR. The food was average, the breakfast bland.The wifi is basically non existent. I understand it’s Bali, but in various areas of the property, the speeds were between 0.5mb/s and 1 mb/s, according to our testing app.To rent scooters from the property it’s more expensive than normal, which makes no sense to charge already paying guests a premium. Transport to the airport is also 200,000 IRD more than regular price. Overall, it’s really overpriced (2,500,000 IRD+ for one night) for what you get. The location is gorgeous, but it’s just a rip off.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are staying here for 2 nights and I can already say it’s super amazing. Great view from our room to the ocean. Friendly stuff and good food. Really can recommend you the villas here. My highlights are the oceanview, pool and room!:)
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was amazing spending some nights at the hotel, all the nature, the peacefull atmosphere.The pool is incredible and it has a wonderfull view.Our room was super Nice, i had flowers on my bathtub... all the crew was Very Nice, Helping a lot with everything and always smiling! From my room i had This wonderfull view and the birds singing, i just loved it!
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very beautiful hotel, positioned in a great location right opposite my very favorite place to eat Muz Kitchen, very clean and uses filtered water to wash all the salads whoops back to de Sapphire. It is cheaper to hire a motorbike here then out on the street. The rooms are clean the beds are amazingly comfortable and you feel like a princess in the four poster beds. I highly recommend this place to stay the view is incredible the people are amazing and very helpful you will not be disappointed.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The resort was a great getaway from the city, if you are a city person. It is nestled among the jungle with many greenery and fresh air for the family or couples. Checking in was a breeze and our rooms was located right next to the pool, as though it was our private pool area. Kids enjoyed the dip in the pool after a long hot day. The view facing the cliff and ocean was magnificent at sunset. There is not many shops located near the resort but then again that is the beauty being away from the city. Breakfast was good, with choices of local and western food. The staff was attentive and responsive. Thank you for a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all I want to mention that our experience overall was good. Of course we had pros and cons.Pros:1) The view from villa is amazing. 2) The resort itself is placed in a good place not far from main road where you can find all the things that we find handy: cafes, pharmacies, motorbike rental places.3) The resort itself does provide motorbike rent service. However the price is higher than in local places.4) The staff is very kind.5) The Raj (gm) is doing his best in circumstances he’s now (we went trough several issues during our stay and all of them Raj has managed to solve).6) tasty food. The chef surprised us by unexpectedly tasty beef steak. Improvement points:1) reconstruction noise. I would make a limited schedule for noisy reconstruction work and make this schedule public so everyone can know when to expect noise. Maybe someone can adjust his day accordingly. I know that from management perspective this will prolong the redecoration process but maybe will make it more customers oriented. 2) reception stuff needs to be more trained in troubleshooting. They need to clearly understand where their responsibilities are ended and they have to call a manager in order to resolve customers’ issue.3) based on our experience I’d notify customers that they need to close the doors & windows during their absence since monkeys can come inside. 4) I’d place beach towels nearby the pool so i don’t need to run each time to the reception and ask for them.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely welcome and great local info from Arik and the front desk team. We had a garden room on two floors. Very clean. The downstairs is quite a dark room. It has a sofa, tv, coffee table and a bathroom. Upstairs we had a big double bed with mosquito nets although the time we were there we didn’t need them. Also a safe. Bathroom with shower over the bath. Balcony with two rocking chairs. Two Pools with loungers usually spaces. Nice view of the sea and a temple. Restaurant service slow. Food ok. We liked Muzz Kitchen at the top of the road great home cooked food. Single Fin bar and restaurant is only a short walk away . It’s great fun especially on Sundays and Wednesdays lots of floors with bars and a DJ. Superb place to watch the sunset. Also close by Uluwatu Temple worth visiting for the comical dance show get there for 5pm. There is building work going on but it didn’t disturb us. I liked seeing monkeys on the surrounding trees they had no interest in humans. So no need to worry about hats and sunglasses.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our second visit to De Sapphire and i must say that this place never disappoints us. We have stayed here before on our previous holidays and loved not only the accommodation but the location and people working here. Absolutely loved it again this time. Raj is an awesome villa manager and he know how to keep his guests entertained. His team did everything they can to accommodate our needs as we were travelling with our one year old daughter. Thanks again to the team at De Sapphire, we will be back again next time.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent a week at the end of October in this hotel in a room overlooking pool.The rooms are impeccable with a very comfortable bed, a large TV, fridge ... everything to feel good.The bathroom and tastefully decorated with samples for a shower or bathing.A view of the pool with the sea and a beautiful Balinese temple, a beautiful postcard.Breakfast is simply excellent, lots of fruit, eggs according to your desires, choice in pastries, hot, cold, I feasted !!The staff is really very friendly.Indeed the lobby was undergoing renovation, some noise but around the pool, no worries.I think the work is now complete.I would return to this hotel with great pleasure but with my family next time.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the second time we visited De Sapphire... the staffs were very happy to see as again and manager Raj came to welcome us. There was some renovation going on but the management make sure that it doesn’t disturb us. We stayed 3 nights here and spend much of our time in the pool. The new restaurant menu was so good and like the cocktails. On the second night we heard some loud music from the near by club and we informed the lobby about it, in 5 minutes manager Raj directly came to our villa and upgrade us to a ocean view villa. Appreciate greatly for his awesome service and great management. We definitely will come back here.. it’s like our home in Bali now. Well done de Sapphire team..: BRAVO
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Checked into Da Sapphire hotel a few days ago . To start when we showed up the front of hotel was all boarded up . Looked as if it was closed . Reception was actually in a car park kiosk. Front desk staff we’re all very friendly and helpful . We hung out by the pool for a few hours while our room was getting cleaned . Pool towels looked stained and dirty like they had not been washed . Four vodka sodas came to 600k as well which was shocking . We we’re listening to hammering , sanding , and then to top it off they started jack hammering mid day . When we asked the GM Manager about it he said they were redoing the foundations for safety after the earthquake which we later found out was not the total truth . Several of the villas were under construction and getting built . After hours of construction noice we decided to leave for a bit . Upon arrival back jack hammering continued . At this point we decided that this was not what what we wanted to deal with and asked for our money to be returned so we could go to a more quiet peaceful place . Raj the GM spoke with us briefly then sent his front desk people to “deal with us “ They tried to move us to another room yet it was CLOSER to the construction. We just wanted to leave and be refunded . Raj finally Came to our room after an hour and proceeded to make excuses for everything still not accepting to return the money . He was EXTREMELY rude and unprofessional and I’ve never felt with anyone like him before . We decided to leave anyway without the refund and dispute it with booking.com . The easy part would have been to make us happy and not to argue a mute point . The room was actually really nice but worst management I’ve ever dealt with . Shame on you Raj .
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the most relaxing time at these villas.Great locations and views to die for overlooking the ocean. Spent every evening on a sunbed with a beer watching the sun go down. Gorgeous.Pool area was lovely, bar and restaurant were very good. We had pizza by the pool one day and a three course meal on another and both were very good. Staff were always very happy to come and bring drinks and food to you by the pool when you ordered but rarely came round to ask if you wanted anything which might be something for the hotel to consider when the restaurant is quite. On the outside a couple of the villas looked a little tired as well as reception and the sunbed cushions were discoloured but there was lots of work being done painting and fixing (did not disturb in any way) whilst we were there. I only mention it as when we first arrived I noticed, but in no way did it impact on how amazing everything was. We had an ocean view villa and it was gorgeous inside. Very clean, looked brand new and loads of technology inclusing two massive tvs. View from the balcony was lovely. Massages were available in your villa or overlooking the ocean and reasonably priced. Staff helped us with a restaurant reservation and hiring a scooter.A couple of minute walk to Ulu Cliffhouse which is worth a visit to lounge by the pool and have a drink and 15mins walk to Single Fin. Would 100% recommend and would definitely return.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been to Bali many times, and this trip has definitely been one of the best. The Sapphire Hotel in Uluwatu is gorgeous. Artha, at the reception desk, is more than accommodating and the rest of the staff is so friendly.. they have a really nice restaurant and the pool is to die for. The hotel is within 5 minutes walking to uluwatu cave. All the staff at the hotel is so friendly. We originally booked a hotel elsewhere and realized it was not as close as they said. The grounds here are super clean & are meticulously groomed. We will be back in Bali for the month of September, we will be spending at least 1 week here and we are super excited! Can’t wait!! Good job Sapphire staff you are all great!!
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such an amazing start to our two weeks in BaliOur unit was a perfect balance between private, luxurious, and homey.We didn't bother with the tv's but the bed was just right, while the second floor wicker chairs were perfect for a book and coffee with the sunrise... Or a book and Bintang with sunset. The staff was so happy and friendly. All of our meals and beverages were better than expected... The Sapphire set the bar quite high!! I would easily return and recommend this to anyone
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The gardens are beautiful. It has amazing views of the ocean.Walking distance to Single Fin.The room was lovely.The only downsides were that the swimming pool was a bit merky and the tiles on the edges going a bit green with algae.My booking deal said a welcome drink was included but we were not offered a drink and it would have been so appreciated because we were stuck in traffic for 2 hours to get there and were hot and thirsty on arrival.Breakfast was adequate but nothing to rave about.The staff were nice.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely villa with an ocean view to die for, I loved my 3 night stay at de Sapphire! It's a short walk to ulu cave for a surf or single fin for a drink.The staff were one of my highlights, they were excellent and really helpful. I Can def recommend staying here :)
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 2 weeks for a babymoon escape with our 2 year old daughter. We had a poolside villa that had a view out to the ocean - it was just beautiful to wake up to, and the room was perfect with everything we needed, and very comfortable. The hotel staff were absolutely incredible - they arranged a cot for us, our 2:30am arrival time was no problem, they were all so warm and friendly and accommodated our every need throughout our stay. We had breakfast buffet included and whilst the a la carte food and drinks menu at the dining room were a bit on the pricey side compared to other options close by, it was very convenient especially with kiddo to feed, and had a great selection - definitely try the tacquitos - divine! This was a perfect family destination - highly recommended.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the sapphire cliff villa, Oceanside room for 2 nights and I cannot day enough nice things about the place and people here. The room overlooked the ocean and pool. It’s a quaint hotel which was nice, didn’t feel like a big resort feel. I don’t normally write reviews but what prompted me to is the service we received from everyone at the front desk, but specifically Kutut. Kutut taught us how to ride a scooter since it was our first time, and was so patient and helpful. Then, later that night when we were going out for dinner, our taxi driver was late and he knew we had a reservation time to make, so Kutut drove up in his car and drove us himself. Very very nice people and beautiful views, close by to walk to Single Fin area and restaurants. Thanks for the nice stay.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here with an ocean view villa and it was amazing! To wake up every morning and look look outside to the ocean is so relaxing. The rooms are clean, and comfortable. The pool area looking out over the cliff with the bar and restaurant right next to it with pool side service is perfect. It is only a short walk to the cliff face bars and restaurants, also where you can walk down to the beach.Would highly recommend staying here as I would stay again myself.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at De Sapphire exceeded every expectation, the view and location is truly amazing. De Sapphire is relaxed with an authentic Balinese feel. The pool is spectacular and the rooms were spacious with fabulous pillows. Thank you to Raj and his team of friendly staff, we loved the upgrade to the ocean view room and the concern for when I was sick. We will definitely come to stay again on our next visit to Bali
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had our private villa, and it's been amazing!Quiet and clean, comfortable bed, spacious room and relaxing place. It's everything we could ask for in Bali in terms of enjoyable stay, especially after we had a less positive experience due to earthquakes happening in July-August in other parts of Bali. And the pool is very convenient if you'd like to take it easy at the complex during the day. One thing that could be improved though is the food menu and the quantities served.Would definitely recommend it!
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The villa was fantastic, with a beautiful view. The villa had a superb bed, as well as good air conditioning and a nice bathroom. The staff were all very friendly and service minded. All in all a very good experience.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a week with my husband and two kids (a todler and a baby 9 months old). Great views and friendly staff, but a lot of small things became irritating during our stay. 1. MUSIC. We had to ask at almost every meal to have the music turned down in the restaurant because it was so loud we could barely speak to each other. And a suggestion: maybe wait until afternoon to turn the music on all together. It’s not necessary (or very relaxing) to have to listen to music from you wake up till you go to bed. 2. MUSIC pt 2. Please change the music more often. We stayed for 7 nights and it was the same 6-8 songs on repeat. 3. WATER. Do as the eco resorts: put a gallon of water in every room so we can refill our plastic bottles - and reduse plastic in Bali. On their website it says the hotel is eco-friendly but I’m not quite sure where that lies. 4. HOUSEKEEPING. Pay more attention to the ‘tidy my villa’-sign. When staying with to small children, it’s very inconvenient that the housekeeping hasn’t been done until just before bedtime even though the sign in question had been on the door several times during the day. But we did enjoy the pool which is great for kids. And the staff was very friendly as well. Over all it seems that a few but key things could male this place great!
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Go for room #29, we loved having our own yard and outdoor space to relax or read a book. Not much in the form of nightlife here as it is quiet but the food is pretty good the property is beautiful and peaceful and the pool is wonderful!
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at De Sapphire in Uluwatu for two nights. When we arrived we were shown to our garden lumbung and greeted with a welcome drink. The villa was huge with two floors and two bathrooms and a large balcony. There was plenty of wardrobe space and a safe. The location of the resort is brilliant, with views out over the ocean and a few minutes walk from many restaurants and bars (ulu cliffhouse and single fin both in walking distance). They had the World Cup playing on a projector whilst we were staying which bought a few people in and had a good atmosphere.Would definitely recommend this place!
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing, though it was just one night stay. Situated away from the main road, serenity surrounds this compound, overlooking the calm sea and a beautiful temple. Room was very comfortable, bathroom tastefully renovated. Most importantly, staff were very friendly from the front desk to restaurant servers to the GM (Raj). This beautiful villa definitely made you feel at home. It'll be my next stay when I return to Uluwatu.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The accommodation here is villa style, there are single and double story villas all with great garden views and some with garden and ocean views, and all with pool views. The place is very quiet even when there is 100 percent occupancy. There is a very nice open restaurant with great ocean views and the food and beverage is a reasonable price. We as an older couple love the place,that's why we keep coming back
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sunrise smacks on your right and sunset on your left with a wide ocean view in front of you. Restaurant serves great food and good view. The swimming pool is just great for a lazy day. Nice peaceful and lovely place to stay.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: De Sapphire Cliff Villa is ideally located in Suluban, not on the main road but in a really quiet place, clifftop, facing the sea. It offers standard rooms as well as fantastic 2-storey wooden bungalows. I strongly advise you to opt for a bungalow, with seaview. They are spacious, comfy, and beautifully set.The rates are really friendly and include a buffet breakfast... yummy !The service staff is extremely friendly & helpful.Will stay there again for sure !
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a beautiful boutique style resort situated on a cliff top overlooking the ocean . We loved the pool and the tropical landscaping. Our room was small but adequate and comfortable. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. You can walk to restaurants and Single Fin from here. We hired a bike and enjoyed riding the short distances to beautiful beaches, the temple, sunset at Single Fin etc. The restaurant on site has a beautiful setting. We had to provide coupons for breakfast and the breakfast menu was a bit limited. I found it odd that on just one occasion at breakfast I asked for milk with my tea and was refused. The waitress told me it wasn't included with the breakfast. There wasn't an issue on either of the other two mornings. Despite this one inconsistency, I would recommend staying at this little oasis.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A gem intimate stay in Uluwatu area, just few steps away from the well known single fin and ulu cliff house clubs and Omnia.Perfect setting for couples, never over crowded and accommodating service.The balinese style small villas look beautiful over the cliff and the pool is cozy and yet suitable for diving and fun swims.Nice spread of breakfast where you might meet the GM, greeting the guests and thanking them for their stay.Been twice and looking forward to come again!
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for a leisure, quiet romantic holiday, please ensure you will select those cliff-front ocean view guestrooms. Or you will be suffered by loud music or terrible karaoke singing from neighbor's club. As per my personal experience, There will be loud music on every Monday, Tuesday and Friday. Plus Karaoke night on Thursday from neighbor's club (or restaurant). It's not hotel's fault as they could not control neighbors' behavior.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I recently stayed at De Sapphire Cliff villas and we thoroughly enjoyed it. All the staff were friendly and helpful and the villa was comfortable, clean and lovely. The restaurant meals were amazing, the chef even came and spoke with me about my allergy to gluten and pointed out the meals I could eat. He even made a special dish just for me. The manager came and sat with us each evening for a chat. Overall, we would rate this accommodation very highly and would certainly come back.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After staying at a disappointing brand name resort we chanced upon De Sapphire at Uluwatu and it was perfect, so much so that we came back later in our trip and stayed another 7 nights. It's nice and quiet with a beautiful pool yet only a short walk to the Uluwatu cliff and surf. The room, superb. Super comfy bed & pillows, all the comforts plus a great Bluetooth sound system. The only down side is sometimes it was hard to leave. We were traveling with a little one under 2 and the staff were great with her. The girls were super happy hanging around the pool while I went surfing. Would recommend particularly to any surfer bringing their partner or family.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved our stay here! We had the double storey villa with ocean and pool views, own private front yard and Bali hut, free breakfast and great aircon. Staff were extremely attentive and very welcoming. Very relaxing and we didn’t want to leave. Will definitely be coming back :)
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is hotel is so great! Me and my parents spent 3 nights here and we absolutely loved it We booked a suite with oceanview (+ extra bed) which actually turned to be a 2-floor villa, and the view was even more beautiful than we could have imagined. The villa was spacious and clean, and the pool was cool and refreshing (and offers the same amazing oceanview!). The staff was always helpful and friendly, and even the manager took the time to sit down for a chat and get to know us. Uluwatu has so many beautiful places to offer and this hotel is one of them. We will definitely come back here❤️
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly, welcoming and sweet staff. Clean room, fresh towels/linnen. We liked the comfortable bed too. Roomservice, restaurant and scooter rental reasonably priced. Booked extra night and received free upgrade to the grand suite, great view. Def recommend.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What more can we say? Everyone's been rooting for this hotel. We really had a pleasant stay here. Amenities were good, pool was excellent, clean and inviting. The area is just so great, nearby restos and padang padang + blue point beach is just a walk away. The staff are just exemplary, so accomodating. We had a wonderful talk with their Managers Mr. Raj and Sandy! Everyone is just so awesome treats you like family. Had tried their breakfast provided as ala cart which is tote fine, the next day breakfast was given buffet already. Great but not much choices tho nevertheless everything was just delectable. We had taken dinner served with wine at their restaurant for our last night and its a best decision we made to relax as we were quite exhausted for the day. Overall, thumbs up! We will definitely consider staying here again in case we decide to revisit uluwatu. To the owner and management, your people are just exemplary! Good Job! Keep up the good work and all the best! We will be posting a vlog soon in our Youtube channel (DNDY Diaries) covering our Bali escapade with our stay here, hopefully to wrap it up soon. Haha. God Bless! - Maria and Dave
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this villas is right next to the beach with beautiful view from the room. I enjoyed a romantic stay with my wife at this property. The food was excellent and the staff was there to help us throughout our stay.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful, well appointed Villas. Very clean with heaps of space to spread out your surf boards/bags. Well above 3 stars, our villa’s bathroom was huge and the king bed was unbelievably comfortable! Pool and grounds are lovely and well kept. Heaps of space in and around the pool so you don’t feel squished in with other guests. Great service. Our stay was relaxing and above our expectations. Would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed end Jan 2018 in an Ocean View Villa. Our room was nice and clean, but did need some maintenance.The roof to downstairs was leaking and dripped water throughout the lounge floor. Also, floor boards up stairs on balcony were slightly wobbly and weak. The room was an interesting set up, as downstairs and upstairs had doors separating the two so you could not easily access downstairs internally (could not hear door when it is being knocked).I would also suggest some room diffusers to help minimise the old musty wood smell.The breakfast was good, perhaps more variety as it is set as a la carte but only about 5 options (not good if you are a fussy eater like me)Overall, it was a nice stay with a great view and friendly staff.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel for my 2 last nights in Bali.The villas are lovely and how the name says, right next to the cliff! The pool is relaxing and calm and you have a good view on the ocean. You can reach all the popular surfspots and bars with the hotelscooters (80k RP/day) in arround 10-15min.The incl breakfast gives u a lot from the menu and u have a small buffet with fresh friuts, juce, coffee/tea and bread.A friendly manager is walking arround on breakfas and asks you how everything is.Only minus point: almost no coctails aviable at the bar or "sold out"...Come back here next time
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the 2nd stop of our 1 month visit to Bali. This hotel looked so amazing from the pics on the web that we just had to book it. It's in a very quiet spot just a few mins walk off the main road, near to a yoga studio & has amazing sea views. The staff were so friendly & very helpful. However, our room (nr 27) was grubby & could really do with a really good clean. I know I'm being picky, but here's a run down ... a lot of rust & calcium deposit (from the water) around the shower area it just looked neglected, layers of dust on various areas, cobwebs by the tv, dirty marks on the mirror, dirty curtains around the bed (where housekeeping mop the floor & the dirty water seeps onto the bottom of the net curtains), sloppy/patchy paintwork on walls, splashes of wood varnish on the windows .. these should have been wiped off, paint spots on the floor which made the floor (poor workmanship if you can't be bothered to cover the floor when painting!) & water damage stains on the ceiling. As I said, I know I'm being picky but when you notice one thing you start to see more & more which is why I'm saying the overall room impression is 'grubby'. Sorry!
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really enjoyed it here. Staff great, especially front of staff who spoke excellent English. Sea view room very nice and large. Staff helpful with scooter hire and transfers. Near to single Fin beach bar. Liked the beaches nearby reachable by scooter. Would stay again. Pool table at bar also nice addition. View great.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and i stayed here for 5 nights.it is one of the best places i jave stayed.staff is super friendly and helpful.dicky is an awesome guy and i am very impressed with him.also riska and Aru in the restaurant are great and was very professional and helpful.great room.aircon.great pool area and bar area.cant complain at all.higly recommended.will come back one day 100%.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a fantastic stay at Garden View Villa of De Sapphire. Staffs were friendly and prompt to assist. Beautiful view from the restaurant of the villa. Bike rental's available at the villa itself, making it so convenient to move around. Awesome location, near to places like Ulu cliff house, Single Fin, Uluwatu temple, and many gorgeous beaches around. Comfortable bed, TV with many channels, bluetooth speaker if you want to blast some music, clean bathroom with bathtub(where I had music on and relax). Overall, it had been a pleasant stay for me.
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 5 days for a bit of luxury after backpacking. We where Extremely disappointed in the food, service and cleanliness. We didn’t want the room cleaned everyday but when we asked it was pointless. The breakfast options are poor at best and having to pay for a fruit platter or omelette seems insane in Bali. We where asked to “pre pay” for any thing we wanted to consume out of the mini bar or room service which also seemed out of the ordinary considering they had our credit cards on file. The hotel reception staff told us that there where no taxis available to the hotel and refused to call us one when we wanted to go to seminyak shopping and we had to use their extremely over priced service. I found the reception staff rude and unhelpful. Rooms small and dirty and would not recommend this place to anyone going to Uluwatu for the price. We also had ants in our room and got all through our clothes. Photos are of our room after being “cleaned”
hotelName:
26    De Sapphire Cliff Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a really nice stay in the Villa , Perfect cleaned and the staff is really nice and try to do everything you wish.If you Want a really good breakfast and want to Know where the best places are you Need to ask for Surya. He can give you everything you Need.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A disappointing 3 night stay at hideaway villas mainly down to cleanliness. The swim up pool doesn’t have any form of filtration on it therefore for 3 days there was a dirt layer sat on top of the pool. This wasn’t cleaned once by housekeeping, unfortunately we never stepped foot in the pool. The bathroom also had an awful sewerage smell which was worse in the morning. The villas look better online it’s probably about time for a spot of TLC. We only ate breakfast there which also wasn’t brilliant. Everything at the hotel is an extra, we were never offered our complimentary massages and the staff spent plenty of time chatting around the front desk.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed in a one bedroom villa and couldn’t be happier with our stay and the service that was offered to us. We celebrated her birthday in which we were served a lovely floating breakfast and plenty of high fives from all the staff. The security out front was a huge peace of mind and they were so nice every time we came and went throughout our stay. Reception desk were always so welcoming each morning for breakfast and the chefs did a fine job with the food that was available. One particular staff member, Surya, went above and beyond every time he served us. Polite, punctual and fantastic at what he does. We would recommend Hideaway Villas to anyone and everyone wanting to have the paradise we got to expericece.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The villas here are simply put beautiful. I didnt give a 5 star rating only because the view is only of the skies and the ocean at a distance. But the villa itself will make you wish you stayed longer. The staff were helpful and hospitable, I remember Surya. He was friendly and spoke very good English. He gave some great suggestions on where to go for some sight seeing. You wont regret your stay here.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at a two-bedroom villa for 2 nights at Hideaway Villas. Wow, their Villas are absolutely gorgeous and their service is even better. Their staff is trustworthy, we asked to leave our luggage after checking out because we were going to the islands and they gladly kept it for us and everything was intact. I am absolutely impressed with everything, their pool was perfect and the place was big enough for 3 adults!
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had my stay at hideaway villas, beautiful place and excellent service. Surya is one of the best service crew I’ve met! Highly recommended. Agus, one of the staff here even rmb my stay here previously. Will definitely be back here again if I were to explore Uluwatu again!
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a fairly hectic couple of weeks in busy Canggu and Bingin ... the Hideaway Villas was the most welcome and perfect little piece of Bali heaven before heading back home. With impeccable service from our welcome and right through our stay, we SO enjoyed the beautiful peace and tranquility of this gorgeous hotel - and private plunge pool was the icing on the cake ✨ highly recommended for a real break away from it all ... but also relatively close to famed surf spots and beaches - special mention for Ulan, the most gorgeous front of house manager, and a Thankyou to the whole team for their genuine care and ‘nothing is a problem’ attitude ... a real Bali experience (but without the dust and noise) ❤️❤️❤️
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here recently for five nights. We had a great time. The villa was lovely and it was so nice to watch the sunsets by the private pool. We found the staff very friendly and accommodating. Upon our arrival I thought our room was clean and it was cleaned daily. The bed was very comfortable and the design of the villas made you feel like you were in your own tropical paradise. I do need to mention a couple of things though..I didn’t like that the lounge was open to the elements. I’m a bit paranoid about getting bitten by mosquitos and other bugs so we often didn’t laze around at night in the lounge area. Now in terms of food...but bare in mind my husband and I are a bit fussy....we didn’t like the food and the cocktails weren’t great either. Further, the villas are a bit remote so it’s a shame there isn’t a complimentary car service to get you around. It was a bit annoying having to get cabs all the time when we have stayed at other places previously with this service included. However you can rent motor bikes (I think for free) but we didn’t feel comfortable doing that. There are some nice places to eat at outside of the hideaways so my suggestion would be to venture out. My husband and I got a day pass for one day and went to the Radisson Blu which is about 3kms down the road. The food and cocktails there are really good and it was nice for us to change up the scenery a bit. All in all we enjoyed our stay but we couldn’t rate it higher due to the food.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located several hundred meters up a bumpy winding road it is aptly named Hideaway. The location is listed in Google Maps, so you can find your way here even if your driver has never been here. It’s near the New Kuta Golf Club and the Garuda Wisnu Kencana monument.From here, it can take about 1.5 hours in a car to get to Seminyak, due to traffic, but again this place is called The Hideaway and one wouldn’t stay here to be close to all the hustle and bustle.Fortunately all the food and services are reasonably priced (at least to my American tourist standards) and I didn’t really need to leave the place to eat or exercise or relax.There is no large communal pool, but every unit has its own private pool.The massages from the spa are very good and cost less than they do back home.Staff is professional and attentive, especially Surya and Ulan. Very friendly people. The gym is small and there is only an exercise bike, a treadmill, and a weight bench in there. They should replace the weight bench with a multi-station resistance machine, that’s my only suggestion for improvement of the place.I would stay here again.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived here first to unwind and relax. The place was amazing. We had a one bedroom pool villa and it was perfect. Very quiet surroundings made it feel definitely hideaway. All staff were friendly and welcoming. Cant wait to come back!!!
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room clean with nice view, however the cats make it so hard to sleep at night as they were noisy and they wreck the whole place especially if u leave food and even if u throw your rubbish in the dustbin they will ransacked the entire dustbin. The staff are friendly I should say Brian and his team. Surya with his service in F&B and Eka in the spa. The stay was wonderful and I would definitely return.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 5 days in the 2 bedroom villa and the experience was nothing short of exceptional. The environment is tranquil, with nothing busy in sight – there was just the view of the forest and the ocean beyond. Given its location, you could say that it is truly a hideaway. The staff were very accommodating, understanding, and prompt.If you are looking for a quick getaway to a tranquil place with a great view and access to modern amenities, you're looking at the right place.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a great experience with hideaway villa bali. Staffs were so polite and nice! The front desk staffs were pretty much helpful when we need their assistance! To the staffs that have help us so much on our first day of stay, thanks again! We truly appreciate your help! The restaurant staffs were so friendly especially surya. On top his job responsibilities, he shared with me and my partner great places that we could venture in Bali! Thanks for making our 5 day stay a memorable one!
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the hideaway villa for 2 days and had a beautiful villa with an own pool and a really nice view over the southern jungle of bali.The villas are modern and clean. The service was really good and the staff was kind and friendly. Specially our new friend Surya who did everything for us to feel comfortable. Thanks for the bracelets.We highly recommend this place to stay and relax or discover the beaches and the pura luhur temple.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
