review_body: This place was stunning! Staff was so nice and helpful. I stayed in the one bedroom suite with my husband and had amazing service. They treated us like Kings and queens! The room was beautiful and had a gorgeous view! Also the floating breakfast is a must! 10/10!
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best view. Recommended!! Service verry excellent for all item in villa. This place is clean, not dirty. Verry comfortable. Very friendly, kind service, giving good suggestions for guests. Next time, we will comeback again in here.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali

review_body: We had a very pleasant stay here in Hideaway. Everything was really good and much better than we expected. The rooms were spectacular and needless to mention the private pool, it was really Amazing!!!

review_body: We had an enjoyable stay in Hideaway villas. The room is spectacular, spacious bathroom, staffs are really helpful. Though location is remote so signal is unreachable however, they provide wifi in vill

27    Hideaway Villas Bali

review_body: I spent the week in Hideaway Villas, the time I had here was incredibly relaxing. The staff, food, spa and room were all fantastic. The next time I come to Bali I would love to stay here again! Could recommend to anyone
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali

review_body: Guest will be greeted by the beautiful greenery of the villa, staffs are really friendly, acknowledgeable and always at your assistance. The villa itself makes you feel at home, clean, and well equipped. Villa is design in such a away that we can enjoy Bali natural view of the sea.Lots of variety of food and drinks.. In conclusion, perfect stay at Hideaway Villa.. for couple and even for family..Special thanks to Mr Fay Wahid, Mr Satria, Mr Surya, Mr Ari, Ms Dia and all the lovely and superbly professional staff at Hideaway Villa. Definitely will be back!!With love, ErmaSheikh
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best place in Uluwatu .It’s such an amazing villa .Staff so friendly and helpful..I would 100% guarantee this place ..They helped us with veg floating breakfast... Just loved this place
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are extremely disappointed by the lack of management of this place. We checked out over a month ago and have yet to receive a refund for our bond. My girlfriend and I have emailed and called hideaway from Australia in an attempt to get this resolved but have had little to no response and no attempt to resolve the issue. It is very unprofessional to not have our money refunded to us and will definitely never be staying here again. And caution others to be careful if staying here and also failing to have their bond returned.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent some real great time here.... The staff, from management down to the gardeners were so amazingly polite, helpful and courteous that it was an experience like no other. Food and Bec service was sublime... cocktail menu has increased by 1 to include our favourite drink, that’s the level of service to expect here. The rooms, albeit a little small for “pool villas” are exactly as advertised and well worth the money spent. As a base the locality for us was perfect, the spa treatments amazing and the wait staff our family.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali

review_body: Hideaway Villas is a beautiful spot, we really enjoyed our stay here. We only stayed 2 nights but we wish we could have stayed longer. The staff are wonderful! Especially Ari he went out of his way above and beyond to make us comfortable. We also enjoyed the bamboo spa which the hotel has to offer. Very relaxing & one of the best massages we’ve had. Amazing sunsets & througherly enjoyed the floating breakfast! Definitely recommend this spot!
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staffs are very accommodating, helpful and friendly! Love the food. We stayed in the 1 bedroom villa. Able to arrange floating breakfast in your own villa Only thing is the insects. Especially in the toilet. Mini centipede crawling around. Could be better with insect control! Overall, stay was good!
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali

review_body: We were stay in hideaway villa for 3 day 2 nights. We are family from Bali Indonesia. Sometimes we need a private and new atmosphere in our routine. So hideaway villas the abswer. The gym room is so clean, we do exercise with a tree view, restaurant have a koi fish, so my kids can feeding the fish. I like the design of room and garden. They just do 1 mistakes when i ordered food by phone. But they give a free capucino for us. And the door in our bath room (204) can't locked. May be the technian can repair the door. It's not impoertant for couple guess, but it's really really important for guess with children . We want to back again some day. Thanks for service.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For those who are looking for a villa that is full of calm, privacy, and comfortable environment hideaway villa is the answerThe location is hidden from the crowds and has beautiful sceneryi book for one bedroom villa for 2 days, the room was very clean , the bathroom was great and the bathtube was awesome, especially the pool , it was very clean and besides that, we can also have breakfast in the pool :)Ooh, and the staff were very friendly, and the pasta OMG you all should try , it was very good... :)So, what you all waiting for, call the villas right away and book NOW!! :)
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best two bedroom villa with a private pool, when you bring 3 kids for a holiday mood in Uluwatu, Bali. The rooms are very clean, loved the bathroom!! Don't forget to try the yummy pasta, our favorite dish when we spent our vacation there. So, Hideaway is a must visit villa.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hideaway Villas in Uluwatu is a hidden sanctuary away from the Bali tourist hustle and bustle. We stayed in a one bedroom pool villa. It was spacious, clean and to have a pool at our front door was beautiful. It had everything we needed for a relaxing getaway. The staff could not have been more hospitable, friendly and attentive. Nothing was too much trouble. Food choice in the restaurant was a beautiful mix of local specialities and European dishes at very reasonable prices. Breakfast, which was included, was a broad selection from a menu and cooked freshly when ordered. The spa treatments available were extensive and very reasonably priced as were tour packages on offer. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Thank you to the whole team at Hideaway for making us feel so welcome and special. Dianne & Paul
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super friendly staff, maximum privacy, amazing view, delicious food, you name it, they have it !I can say the service was AMAZING as I stayed here for my bf's bday (gave him a surprise), i requested a floating breakfast with a side note "happy birthday" turn out they gave us a cake decorated with 'happy birthday' they even sang for him !Everytime we asked for room service it doesn't took long until they deliver our requests.We really feel like we were well looked after during our stay, thank you !!Definitely coming back xx
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful View, friendly staff, you will definitely have a great new experince, comfortable and cozy.... highly recommended for family and friends.You also can enjoy your private pool, don't forget to visit their spa!!!Awesome❤️
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent service, friendly staffs,Comfortable and clean. I would love to recommend this place family and friends. For sure we will comeback again soon.Thank you for great hospitality one of the best new resorts in Bali.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed at Hideaway Villas for 3 nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We initially booked a 'Pool Suite' but only stayed for 1 night as it was not what we anticipated. There was no area to sit outside and access to the pool was through the bedroom or bathroom window. The air conditioner leaked and dripped and there were loud, crowing roosters from 5am which meant a sleep in was not possible.We requested a room change and moved to a '1 Bedroom Pool Villa' which was much more our style. Nice pool, day beds to sit outside and read etc. The room was quite open but the door to the bathroom provided some privacy and protection from bugs etc. Bathroom was nice, clean and well kept. Although there was no view of the ocean from any of the rooms it was very green and lush which is always nice. Breakfast was a bit boring, we anticipated a larger range and the ability to go up for additional servings but it was all just off of the menu. My husband is gluten free and they were very accommodating of dietary requirements. Also, the dining area overlooked the car park which wasn't very appealing. We did order a floating breakfast for 1 morning, it was a nice idea in theory but not practical at all. Getting out and about by foot is half the experience in Bali but this was not an option whilst at Hideaway. This is our second time in Bali but we weren't confident enough in hiring scooter so figured taxis would suffice - this was not the case.It was an expensive experience, particularity of an evening. Most restaurants had a flat rate to travel to Hideaway after a certain time (200,000 or $20 AUD) which is ridiculous for Bali considering it was a 5-10 minute journey! We had to walk quite a distance in order to find a taxi, it did not feel safe.The car service offered via Hideaway was no better in price but we did get a transfer from the airport which was very helpful. This shouldn't really be advertised as being in Uluwatu as it's so remote and right on the edge of the town. It has no easy road access and you're required to go down a windy road which makes you feel like you're in the middle of nowhere. To be honest our time at Hideaway was quite boring, there was no vibe. We spent most of our days out at various beach clubs like Sundays and Single Fin - getting there was fine but getting home was the issue.Staff were helpful but do need further training, there was definitely a communication breakdown. We also had to pay an additional fee upon arrival which we are still confused about but to be honest didn't bother pushing the point because of the language barrier. It was okay if you want to be super secluded but we wouldn't stay there again.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I dont find many places serving Lamb Fried Rice with authentic taste, just like what I imagined. Now I know where to find it in Bali. Authentic, delicious and yup...exotic! Service is good, ambiance of restaurant is awesome and the resort itself is gorgeous. will recommend to friends and def will be back!Cheers.

review_body: Love this peaceful place, away from crowded.Beautiful landscape and amazing view.Staff are very friendly.Recommended for travellers who loves nature. Worth for a visit and will come back again soon :)

review_body: Excellent place to stay. All the employees very friendly. Especially our driver,tour guide who's name is Satria is the best.The room very clean, the food on the restaurant can have many choices. I am very enjoy live here.

review_body: Excellent resort, closer to everywhere and everyone is so friendly and knowledgeable. Especially Satria who spent 3 days with us and took us everywhere. If there are 10 stars I will give him 10. Thank you so much for the excellent services. We enjoyed it very much.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali

review_body: Excellent Villa,Great Breakfast,Awesome Service and Friendly Staffs...You cant beat the price either...The view is breathtaking,so if you need a me time to hide away this is the place.Very Recommended!

review_body: Spent 2 nights in this fabulous place. Great view from every room. Total privacy. Excellent choice of food. Excellent service by warm, friendly and experienced staff. Thanks to the management for the detailed attention given to all visitors. Good place for family too. You can get exhilarating views of the sunrise and sun set.Highly recommended place.Stephen Samuel Singapore
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali

review_body: Amazing place, well built and place it well taken care. The amount of dedication on the staff which makes the place very much a home away from home. Totally happy with the service. Would definitely recommend this place as my family enjoyed the stay but most importantly the people and their service makes the extra difference.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali

review_body: i meet my friend and have coffee in hideaway villa...... a place to enjoy and relax in Bali ... eapecially with our spouse.....When you are in Bali ... you need a place that so quite to refresh all thing and Hideaway villa .... a place that can answer that need.....
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good for stress detox with it private pool, clean and airy rooms. Service are excellent with friendly staffs always available on call.Been staying in quiet a few Villas in Bali and Hidaway has been my favorite place, stayed most of the time in the 2 bedded Villas and has never been disappointed.My Daughter love the pool and warm afternoon sun.Best for Honeymoon and family bonding time.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For those who want the best relaxation, the most coziest of space and a time to remember for the rest of your life’s, these is the place you should be. Good ambience, well mannered staff!! Don’t regret not coming cause me and my family had the vacation of our life!!!
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hideaway Resort is a cosy gem of a holiday destination for those who value privacy far from the noisy crowd. The resort is located not too far from Bali's attractions in Uluwatu and to the commercial center of Kuta. The resort has a view of the sea and beautiful sunsets. The food is well prepared and delicious. Staff is attentive and very helpful.Left the place with good memories at an affordable price.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My Partner and I recently Eloped in Bali and chose to have our wedding at Hideaway Villas. Glory and her team were amazing and made our day faultless and one to remember. I would highly recommend Hideaway Villas to anyone planning to get married, you wont be disappointed.The Hotel has great facilities and the Staff are very helpful and friendly, it truly is a great destination in Bali.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at the Hideaway villas quite late having booked it last minute online, due to the hotel we should have been staying in not being up to scratch. We were immediately impressed by the security at the villas and when we pulled up at reception our first impressions were great. Everyone was warm and friendly and after checking in were taken to our 1 bedroom villa. The Villas themselves are a fantastic design, a large imposing door giving way to a flight of concrete stairs which lead up to an infinity style pool with the water running down the wall beside the stairs. The lounge/diner is open plan and opens out on to the deck around the pool with an internal door leading into a well air conditioned bedroom with plenty of storage space and a contemporary well decorated bathroom with large bath and shower. The part ocean view from the deck and pool is glorious but could have been improved if the view from the pool was uninterrupted, infintity pool style, rather than being the top of the next villa. The Food available on site was great although having been used to buffet style breakfasts, having to order what we wanted wasn't as enjoyable. The resort itself is fairly remote with about a mile walk to get back to the main road, this increases the feeling of isolation so if you're looking to get away from it all and relax, this is the place. Though if you're not, then you can always hire a scooter to get out and about or failing that a driver for the day.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sadly we were very disappointed with our stay at hideaway. We were shown to our room (1 bed pool villa) which had rust in the bathroom and stunk of damp. We immediately asked to be moved which we were to a better room in a different corridor. Still a damp smell but not so bad. Everything feels very tired - furniture needs updating, paintwork peeling etc. We even found a used plaster under one of the sunbeds which made us feel the rooms were not very clean.Food was not good - beef was so tough it was inedible and everything felt rather greasy so we went out for every meal inc breakfast each day.Very disappointing as the photos are not an accurate description of reality.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I recently spent two lovely evenings at the Hideaway Villas! True to its name, the hotel is tucked away at the bottom of a winding road away from the hustle and bustle of the town. The grounds were maintained beautifully, with stunning flowers and greenery. The staff were very attentive to our needs, and even helped us organize a day trip into Ubud along with dinner and a spa experience at the hotel all for $100USD. There were a few times the staff made mistakes or miscalculations (with fees, and dinner orders) but overall the service was great. We loved our villa (we tried the floating breakfast in our pool which was incredible) and the room and bathroom were not only chic, but also very well maintained. Our spa experience was also 10/10 - both my partner and I loved our 60 minute massage service. The only thing that could use some improvement would be their food (our room service was quite average) and since there are not a ton of options for dinning out in that area the food at the hotel should really be a little higher quality.Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend the experience to any couple looking for a romantic retreat hideaway!
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I got marry at Uluwatu in Oct and all our guests stayed at Hideaway Villas Bali. We decided to have our reception dinner at this villa as all we need is a Nice, Hidden villa which close to our ceremony location.We all had a great family time in the villa! The food is nice, services are spectacular. Their staff ( especially the sales manager Glory ) are very helpful and friendly. I kept contacting her to discuss our wedding dinner and she’s quick response and willing to help. Definitely would love to stay at Hideaway Villas Bali again if I visit Bali again in future.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As the name indicates, it's an enjoyable secluded place.Staffs is very nice and proactive.The quality of the breakfast can be improved but this is minor compared to the pleasure of staying here.High value/money to my point of view.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 5 days. The villa & it’s pool were nice and clean although our only view was of the boundary wall, nice if you just want privacy. The friendly and extremely helpful staff are what make this hotel what it is. Nothing is too much trouble. Our special thanks for excellent service goes to Rosa, Satria, Ari & Papua. We hired drivers and enjoyed visits to Tegalalang rice terraces, tempaksiring water spring and Taman ayun temple. By Taxi we visited the lovely nearby Thomas beach and then enjoyed great pizza at Single fin, watching surfers and the sunset. We had good food at El kabron, although too late for the sunset view we did catch their live music. If using taxis request bluebirds, they charge by the meter so avoid any who quote a fixed charge.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon. The first room they gave us was one concrete wall away from a farm that had at least one dozen roosters roaming freely. All day we heard roosters and even dogs barking. Our room also had no hot water and after maintenance spent 45 minutes in our room the first night they still couldn’t get it to work. The manager moved us to a better villa the next day but that villa still didn’t have hot water until our last night (we spent 3 nights). The gym at this resort was terrible. It was the poorest excuse of a gym I’ve seen. There was two adjustable dumbbells that weren’t even matching. They need to invest in some proper equipment and weights. The only saving grace of this resort was the staff. Everyone was very friendly and the manager gave my wife and I a free massage as an apology for the hassle we had to deal with. I think that Hideaway Villas owner should invest some more money into this resort as it’s portrayed as a 4-5 star resort but is actually only a 3 star. The rooms could also be cleaned more thoroughly. There was grime and green mildew on shower heads and roof of bathrooms. Also green mildew growing around edges of infinity pool. There is great potential for Hideaway Villas if some changes are made.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Service was excellent, reception/restaurant/room service staff were all very friendly and efficient.Room was in a good location/clean and roomy the best thing about the room was the access to our own pool, room was lovely and very relaxing. Loved the outdoor area. Only negative thing we found was no shopping and eatery close to property and 7 nights a bit too long. Next time we will stay probably 4 nights and 4 nights in Kuta. We loved our holiday at Hideway Villas if you are looking at a relaxing trip then this is the place. Also loved visiting the spa, so relaxing and great girls taking care of you.Thank you to all the staff at Hideway for making our holiday a remorable one.
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came to Hideaway Villas to recharge.The GM Gede Hubertus went to a lot of effort to ensure we were comfortable & nothing was too much trouble for him.The prolific flowering vines cascading down the walls along the walkway to the villas, frangipanis & other tropical plantings were very beautiful.We were content to mostly relax in the quietness of our villa & pool.Brian was very helpful suggesting some places of interest when we did decide to sightsee.We were very glad of his suggestion to use transportation from Hideaway Villa.Satria, our driver, was a true gentleman & we felt very safe & comfortable in his care.ALL the staff were very helpful & friendly, THANKYOU Rosa, Ari, Ede, Surya,Agus,Pande & all others,for waiting on us,also reception & cleaning staff.The security here is great.We made the most of the bamboo spa...delightful! the ladies were very professional.Loved our stay at Hideaway Villas!
hotelName:
27    Hideaway Villas Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely hotel with beautiful light wood decor in the seafront restaurant and bar area - a wonderful place to have breakfast in the morning, with lots of recliners and beach beds to enjoy the sunshine during the day and the sunsets in the evening. Staff very unobtrusive, you need to wave them across when you wish to be served, etc.We stayed in a bungalow (No.12), room was lovely with beautiful dark wood decor and high ceilings. But only downside is the presence of the farm next door, roosters/chickens and geese making a lot of noise from 3am, you will benefit from ear plugs to get a good night’s sleep! Recommend requesting rooms to the north / closer to the beach. We mentioned this to reception and hotel management were very sympathetic to us, and we were happy with their proposed solution.All in all a brilliant couple of days staying here - the food was excellent too albeit slightly more expensive than surroundings, but is of improved quality.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The food and drinks at the restaurant were very expensive then adding on 21% to the bill. We ate and drank elsewhere. The bed was very hard. No bottled water supplied in the room. Needed to purchase own water to brush teeth. Roosters were calling out every morning from 3am onwards.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What can we say? We decided to stay one night more....and we could have stayed there more days, weeks.....The hotel was extremely beautiful. Fancy with a frenchy touch that helped to make it even better. Good quality and friendly staff. The location is quite good (15 minutes walking from the harbor).But if the hotel was good......the food was amazing!! We met Manu - the Chef - and we ordered different dishes every day, for dinner lunch or breakfast....and all of them were out of this world!! Please, order Profiteroles as a dessert....amazing!!We give them 5 stars because we can’t give 6.....;))
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gorgeous design, great service, unique bungalows - each with their own shower facing a private courtyard. Strikingly beautiful, two pools for guests to enjoy + amazing spa. Definitely the best hotel in the area - so glad we stayed here. A once in a lifetime experience. Boutique feeling without being too small.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing place. Friendly people. Beautiful restaurant. The room was perfect!! Super romantic. Location was great. Only issue, restaurant is expensive compared to top trip advisor restaurants in the Island. We avoided eating there.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: - great rooms with great shower - great pools - great staff - great location - great breakfast We would book again!!!- prices are much higher than other places - portions were small - because of the prices, people avoid sitting here during the day; because of this it looses a bit of atmosphere, which is a shame because it's such a beautiful place
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We decided to go to this place despite it being more expensive than other spa options near by. So happy with that decision. I went with the Swedish massage and was in absolute heaven. The room had aircon and was clean. Hands down best massage I’ve had. Going back tomorrow!
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I found all aspects of my stay exemptplimentary. Straight from your 1st entrance thru the resort to the beach side -simply stunning layout and 1st glimpse of the beach and aqua sea jaw dropping. Very comfortable deck chairs.  Food devine (french cuisine) and very comfy dining set up - lower level situated on the beach sand. The villa's interior design is really pretty, spacious, very clean, beds really comfortable and each villa very private, the Spa was staffed by professionially trained staff, I drifted off each time I had my massages!
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel during our 4 day trip to nusa Lembongan.The room or rather villa/bungalow is very spacious, clean and the interiour gives it a real luxurious feeling. Bed, shower, toilet, anemities were all good. What we were missing roomwise though was a klamboe/mosquito net? Lembongan compared to Bali has more mosquitos and insects. Throughout our stay we were good food for the mosquitos and it would be nice if the beds had mosquito nets. Noisewise, we could hear scooters and animals, but Lembongang is pretty crowded, buildings and streets are built very close to each other, so I think you will have this issue on lots of places. Also, the hotel can't do anything about the dozen roosters in the neighboorhoud that like to compete on who can be the loudest! haha. While we were staying here we had a couple of friends and family also on Lembongan spread throughout the island and when we showed pictures they all said that it was very luxurious compared to their stay. Of course, I also believe this is one of the more expensive stays on the island.Staff friendliness was good, although the reception is not always staffed. Sometimes when we called, nobody was there to pick up the phone and we would have to walk to the reception. Also, the hotel could be more clear about the included breakfast. They said it was included, but during breaktfast we just got an a la carte menu and it wasn't really clear to us what was included or not. Could we order the whole menu? Did we have to choose a specific package like English or American? We had breakfast at the restaurant of another resort one of the mornings and we saw that they had a menu for their hotel guests which stated specifically what was included in their breakfast. Maybe that's something Indiana Kenanga could also do. The location was very nice. It was right on the beach and there were some nice places to eat within walking distance. All in all, it's definitely a great place to stay on the island.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights, after staying for 3 nights in other place that was far better (and 3 times cheaper) than this hotel. We were so disappointed that having paid so much this was actually the worst stay during our 3 week trip.Actually just when we arrived in the reception there was another guest complaining about their family stay and saying so many things were broken, so seems to be pretty common.But let me start with few good things about Indiana>+ Location is very nice, next to the beautiful beach and many restaurants around+ You can rent a motorbike in hotel, no need to search far for it. + We liked the pool area , enough sunbeds as hotel is never crowded+ We struggled with shower in some of the hotels, but here it ran very good with enough hot water , not so easy on the islandAnd thats;about it- Rooms are tired and gloomy, you actually don;t want to stay inside the room at all- Lack of management, staff doesnt seem to care and know how to deal with issues- But the worse is that you can forget about a good night rest! And I am not talking about roosters and dogs barking, this is kind of part of the island life that you get used to, I am talking about the Diving center right next on the street. There are a group of Spanish working there, and they kept on screaming entire evening, with loud music, many people / we understood they are celebrating something, it actually felt like they are inside of our room! eventually my husband had to go ask them to keep quiet (which they did for approximately 5 minutes and then all over again). Reception is closed at 7 PM so there is no one to attend and help out here, it's kind of up to you to argue with these people. Seriously if you are running 2 businesses so close to each other you have to learn to cooperate, and from what we understood in the reception, the only one who spoke to them once or twice is the security guy. And yes, we complained in the morning and were not offered anything in return, not even a complimentary breakfast (which by the way was not included for this high price we paid), it seems to be a common complaint so they just say sorry and thats it.I cannot say anything about the food because there was no breakfast included for this price, but there are many options around.Overall the relation with quality you get for this price is awful. I wish we stayed longer in the other villa.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for three nights as part of a 5 week stay in Bali. Whilst the hotel is on a gorgeous beach with two great swimming pools, it does not meet expectations for the price paid in Bali. The staff are lovely but lack in any kind of initiative and service is poor. Getting an order taken for drinks or breakfast takes far longer than it should - the staff just stand talking to each other. We were woken up by construction work at 1am which was frustrating for us as we were up at 6am every day for diving. After complaining to the manager we were offered a complimentary dinner and for a lunch bill to be removed from our tab. We gladly accepted, however upon check out the manager changed her mind and said just a free dinner and refused to cancel the lunch bill. We felt uncomfortable arguing in front of the Indonesian staff as the discount for the food bill is a lot by Indonesian standards. Both the lunch and the dinner at the restaurant did not live up to expectations in terms of quality and the price paid. We got better food outside of the hotel for £20 whereas dinner for two comes in at £100 at the hotel. Overpriced hotel. Not 5 star service. Stay elsewhere on the island.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in villa 6, closest to the bar and the beach. Nice and quite. Lovely beach with 16 sun beds that seemed to be always available. However no one stops passing by tourist from using the sun beds for nothing which I found strange. Beautiful beach and great sunset view from the beach bar. Villa with small private garden. Spacious room and even more specious bathroom. Aircon could be more powerful but it was ok. Massive comfy bed. Being really picky I’d say that it could be cleaned better as amount of dust in some corners or sockets was too obvious for me. And don’t be scared by ants they are here everywhere, you need to accept it. Staff friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First things first: make sure to get villa 1 to 6. These are closest to the beach, pool and restaurant. We first stayed in villa 19 which is much further from the beach and had a lot of noise at night. Mainly barking dogs and scooters. When reported, the staff immediatly arranged our move to villa nr. 3 where we had a perfect (silent) stay.Nice and quiet beach, perfect for searching for coral, as the beach is filled with it!. Breakfast is ok (fresh fruit, toast, coffee, tea, fried eggs, pain au chocolat, fresh fruit juice, homemade strawberry jam, butter).
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This small resort s very well appointed. casual, tasteful luxury. Caters for every need with 2 cafes, spa, 2 pool and right in the beach. Staff and owners very friendly. Cant fault this place. Will be back
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our garden villa was large and beautifully appointed. All staff was extremely attentive to our needs. During our first dinner a slight storm blew in and Veronika, the owner loaned me a shawl! Manu, their French chef was amazing..food was excellent...presentation perfect! Servers like Lia graciously greeted us and made sure our meals were a pleasure. Manager Kadek and Veronika arranged details for us like snorkeling, a tour of the island and even what we should do on Bali after we left them as we had a very late flight home. We felt so well taken care of! Not to mention the exquisite beach and two beautiful swimming pools! Our first visit to Lembongan...we were delighted!
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you decide for a more expensive hotel at the beach you want beach . - 200 m to go from the bungalow to the beach - just a lot of walls around you , walking between a labyrinth of grey walls to get to anywhere - if you ask for water you have to go back to your room and bring empty bottles, even if your leg is obviously hurt , provide just 250ml bottels- it is not possible to cancel the breakfast because of severe sickness , no flexibility at all because booking over Agoda , breakfast 10€!!!!!! - the pool at the reception closes at 6 pm. That means walking 200m to the other pool... - extremly loud around , bad singers with guitar , dogs , rooster, etc - expensive food and drinks , taxes of 20% not! Included- helpful stuff and manager who enforces customers to write positive on TripAdvisor, ... poor for a resort like this. - any time you use the internet you have to subscribe again and again with user and password. - the ac stays on 16degree Celsius. It is not possible to put temp up+ the villa is beautiful the shower a little bit rotten, a small paradise prison with a door into the labyrinth of walls
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There were 5 of us staying in Villa 1 which had its own pool, small but relaxing. Only 50 yards from the restaurant and beach. All the staff were very helpful and accommodating. The bedrooms had air conditioning which worked and there was always plentiful hot water for showers and washing. The laundry service was good and everything came back and smelt fresh. Wi Fi connections were mainly good. There was also a DVD player and a good choice of DVDs in the restaurant to borrow. Looked forward to the breakfast each morning. Plenty of coffee/tea/fruit juices. Both English and Continental breakfasts enjoyed by our party. scrambled eggs were great. The restaurant was always well attended with guests and visitors. French cooking and the Chef cooks a great steak. All the food was of a good standard. One could eat by the beach or inside. Quite romantic and there were honeymooners there. We had an issue over the booking of the ferry from Bali but all got resolved in the end. Thoroughly recommend.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4D3N in very nice villa. Authentic Indonesian design with quite and nice pool even though small (house siZe pool).The owner and manager was very friendly and helpful. They served very yummy french food in their restaurant with stunning views facing the beach. On the other side, we had no internet connection in our room during the stays and it’s very difficult for us We have to go to the restaurant to get the wifi connection. Aircond and water heater in the room doesn’t work as what we aspect. This 3 things not worth for the price that we’re paying.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We did have a great time at the resort. For the price we were very comfortable and loved the location. I am writing this review to thank Sonya for getting us our iPad back! We did not realize we had left our iPad there until she emailed us asking if it was ours. She went above and beyond to make sure it was safely returned to us. I was very impressed with the customer service and honesty I encountered at Indiana. Especially with Sonya!!! Thank you very much Sonya!!!
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights at the Indiana Kenanga resort, arriving late (7pm) by Nusa lembongan standards and the reception was closing as we arrived meaning we got a rushed check in and walk through to our accommodation. The Vila itself was very spacious and the bed was excellent, in our opinion some of the fixtures were dated (broken window panel in the door, door did not close/lock properly, missing/black grout on tiles) but overall we were happy. The first night we dined at the hotel restaurant which was excellent, however very expensive when considering other local options. Breakfast was not so great and we ended up eating elsewhere. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful and the location right on the beach is stunning if you walk through at the right moment when the tide is high. We rented scooters, slightly strange experience as we were rented the security mans scooter which meant he wanted it back early despite paying for 2 days...overall really enjoyed our stay, expensive and food options however from what we could see it was worth the extra expense if you want some luxury on Nusa Lembongan.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really lovely hotel with great facilities and two nice pools. The rooms were huge and the bathrooms were really well laid out (and also very spacious). We were in a bungalow close to the beach, which was a great location within the hotel. There were lots of day beds by both pools as well as the beach. We had breakfast and dinner at the restaurant on the beach, which was excellent. There are also quite a few restaurants close by to chose from. The location is at the northern end of the beach so around a 15 minute walk along the beach into town. The Island has really developed since were last there with lots of new restaurants and cafes and transport around the island. Love the relaxing vibe of the Island and will definitely be back.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only stayed here for one night. I don't know what the other rooms are like, but our room was so loud we could hear everything from neighbours and what was happening on the street, it continued all through the night! The location is good, but the place itself is pretty rundown, all the upholstery needs replacing, could do with a paint job and landscaping looks pretty unmaintained. The staff were polite and friendly, but still unfortunately I feel this place is overpriced for what it is.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel - not cheap but it's worth the money if you look for something special. For me the best hotel on that beach. Especially the breakfast is very good and the cosy seats on the beach. The restaurant is quite expensive but the quality is high. Best food we have eaten here so far. Remind: you have to pay service and tax extra - so it will be more expensive than on the menue-card.You can hire motorbikes and do Spa and book massages if you want.The Beach is sandy but also stony. If you look for sandy beaches you should not go to Nusa Lembongan.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The pace on Lembongan is significantly slower than on Bali with the only transport on the roads being open air people transports, golf buggies and the obligatory scooters. As a consequence, it's also quieter and more relaxed. It's an island where you relax rather than party and Indiana is a great base to work from with beautiful villas and suites augmented by a terrific spa and creperie.Highly recommended.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have to say that this is the first time I have ever written a negative review about a place. We still look back on our trip and remember this sour memory which I don't want anyone else to risk tainting their vacation. It started with us feeling mislead about the room we had booked when checking in, but talked it out with the European manager who agreed the booking site was wrong with the number of beds promised. He said we could contact the booking site directly, but in the meantime we had to pay more for the extra bed that we thought was included in our original price. (*The site has since been updated, but nothing was reversed for us) To make up for it, he said we would all receive complimentary breakfast. The first morning at breakfast we were told which portion of the menu was complimentary and enjoyed our meal. Second morning, after our meal, a check was brought to us to sign and since we didn't have to do this the first day we asked at the front desk where the person confirmed our meal with complimentary and signing was a formality. Our last morning, the waiter tells us that our meal is not complimentary and the manager comes out saying we need to pay for breakfast and back pay for the other mornings. It came out of nowhere for us and we were completely taken aback with the rude nature and aggressiveness of the European manager. We ended up packing up our things and checking out in near tears as we had never been treated this way before. They did not own up to their miscommunication issues and blamed it on us. It was not the level of hospitality or service you would expect in any situation. It really was a shame because we thought the food was great, local staff wonderful, and loved the property, but it was not worth being treated the way we were or the price we ended up paying.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a good time, thanks to the staff as they were very welcoming and friendly.BUTFor more than 100$ a night you get:Rooms which are not clean and lack a lot of maintenance. Clogged drainage, the shower not working properly, you put your stuff somewhere and it's dirty afterwards, paint is coming off the walls, chairs in the garden broken, the door to the room not opening and closing properly. The pool doesn't really invite to stay longer and the French chef appears like an arrogant ***.Thanks again to the staff which made us enjoying our time.But if we would come again? NO - not for this price...Even the drinking water is charged for, where in modern times it's complimentary in most hotels esp in Asia. At least they should have a water dispenser for free use to avoid plastic but...It seems the owner just tries to make as much money as possible, is relying on his restaurant which is really good but has forgotten that people want to feel comfortable staying in his place.Conclusion: You can find better places for less money on the island.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this Hotel because our original booking at Tigerlillys was cancelled due to renovations. We were booking into Indiana by Tigerlillys so it was not our choice of hotel. It was very nice and the staff were friendly but it would not have been my choice of hotel. I did not like the privacy of the villa style accommodation as I was on my own most days while my husband was away diving. The pool was very quiet and was occupied most days by a couple of free divers practicing. The food was good, it was very clean and I would have no complaints at all other than it was not the hotel of my choosing. I also booked Tigerlillys as it had a no children policy and we had a crying baby near our room most of our stay. Hopefully we will get to stay at our chosen hotel next year. Thanks for having us.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We felt there was a lack of soul in this hotel. It is not well managed and the people working there seem bored. The clientele is discreet and mostly made of couples. There was a mic mac with our reservation and we were upgraded to the double room villa which was great though too big for two. We enjoyed its private pool a lot and would come back. The French chef is very nice but cares more about surfing than cooking : it was an ok experience but not so great and expensive as he has a great experience with stared chefs in France and as it is the only French restaurant on the island. Better to eat balinese food in a small restaurant. Don't forget to rent a scooter if you want to discover some of the damaged beauties of the island.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are not price sensitive and want to stay on the island... I suppose Lembongan Beach Club and Resort is probably the best...reviews showed Indiana K above average but the stay was bearly tolerable... salty water in showers.. dark rooms to hide the dirt.. air con that dont cool...
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the a/c villa with a king-sized bed, lovely shower with amenities and outside veranda. The staff was helpful and friendly both at reception and the restaurant. The front desk helped us plan two great day excursions around Lembongan/Ceningan and also a full day to Nusa Penida. The restaurant offers unique and flavorful dishes that are served with great panache. The freshness of the salads and fruit was wonderful and the evening ambience was delightful. The hotel is located on Panorama Beach, and secluded from the hustle and bustle of Mushroom Beach and the ferry beach area. Highly recommend this hotel and will enjoy another visit soon.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friends in Bali recommended this property...and the were "right on."Beautiful villas, with breakfast included, excellent restaurant, attentive staff. We booked several tours through the hotel and were not disappointed!We found this an excellent place to stay with the true Balinese feeling.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent an amazing time at Indiana. The staff was great from the front office to the restaurant. Special mention to Made. We really felt special. Thanks to the front office team, always available and Jordi at the restaurant. The food is great, the chief is amazing. The villa was also amazing, the place is perfect. We will come back.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The one downside is no keycards but breakfast lovely even though on the second day we got a trainee so communication got lost. I love crepes and they do the best in Nusa Lembogan .There is a salty pool and and normal pool.The room is great.Also with A/C and closing doors.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not a bad place for the island, but there are better ... Did no live up to the price. Room was not well cleaned, the staff was not attentive, they began re-painting the place our second day there which closed most of the beachfront area. Breakfast is set and you can't make any changes (really? at this price?) With that said, their restaurant is AMAZING! some of the best dinner we had in Indonesia, which was not expected at all. And their other pool area is beautiful and a perfect retreat.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We as a family of 5 have just recently stayed in Villa 1 in the Indiana Kenanga Villas for 3 nights and absolutely loved it and certainly would come back. The Villa's presentation was first class, private and with your own pool and only 50m from the beach. The only negative was that due to the Villas being open and the both bedrooms being separate we didn't feel comfortable for our 3 kids to sleep by themselves in bedroom (This is only a very small negative) and the breakfast supplied was basic but all you need. We loved Nusa Lembongan and loved the Indiana Kenanga Villas so we'll be back for sure!!!
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights in a villa at Indiana Kenanga with our 3 children and we enjoyed the 2 large beautiful bedrooms and the private pool. The restaurant with the French Chef was awful, and even though prices might seem to be high compared to any other restaurant in Bali, you will appreciate the quality of food and the location. As you will come to Nusa Lembongan with boat, you will also appreciate the performance to have such good products in your plate.As a conclusion, it is probably a little bit more expensive than other hotels, but it worth it. We will come back, inch'allah!
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrival:Upon arrival we found the villa and decor to be simply stunning and very Asian posh with Buddha statues stylishly placed and whitewashed wooden furniture accenting the modern fusion feel of the place. Villa: Our villa is large with two bedrooms and a large swimming pool. A small kitchen area with a stovetop is excellent if you want to make a few things in the room. Cleanliness: it's surface clean but not deep clean. The tabletops are glass and very streaky. The pool/ beach towels smell of mildew. The room is lovely though and it's not like it's disgustingly dirty; It's just that it's also not exquisitely clean. This one is reflective of our standards. For us it's just a bit dingy overall, The bathrooms especially and the kitchen unit in the villa. Beach view from restaurant :  The restaurant area at the beach is simply stunning and the turquoise water captivates you. You can eat breakfast, dinner and lunch there and watch the surfers in the distance. Definitely a highlight.  Food: Lunch so far is fantastic, both at the French creperie restaurant and the beach restaurant. The clubhouse sandwich is superb. The crepes are interesting and delicious.  Breakfast however is a massive disappointment-- the selections " included with the room" are for either eggs or pancakes ... Coffee.... And juice. The bread is dry and they didn't get the eggs right on any day and didn't remember the complaints we had had to change things up and get it right the next. Also lattes and Cappuccino will cost you. The breakfast seriously is the worst part of our stay. This is not reflective of any French cuisine. Dinner:Apparently the French chef they have was away our week. Too bad for us. The dinner is quite delicious really but it is expensive. 15-+$30 entrees. We were able to order off the lunch menu to change it up but they ran out of ketchup. Perhaps a French restaurant doesn't have ketchup anyways but always nice to have on lunch French fries. Perhaps a staple item for one is not a staple for another. But it's ketchup!!Room issues : Hot water: ran out of propane so had no hot water for a day until we complained and the checked it. Toilets don't flush well-- had to call a plumber to plunge and fix. Service:It's ok. The people are pleasant and smile. Unfortunately they don't remember things well. We have a toddler who needs a paper cup so she's doesn't break the glass ones. Each day they brought us the same tall glass of juice and each day we had to ask again for a paper one. Very little English -- probably part of the miscommunication m, but it is Indonesia after all- can't fault them for that. Spa: It's gorgeous esthetically.Only had a pedicure. It was about 45 usd ( expensive) and wasn't very good. Didn't shave heels or anything. Very little cuticle work and it just was the most basic pedicure possible. Overall:It's still a gorgeous place on an island so it's never that bad is it? It's just overpriced and tries to sell you a level of accommodation and service that they simply don't provide. Again...: the people are very nice and that's always a positive point.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, great 2 bedroom Villa not far from the beach. Clean and good air conditioning, great Restaurant on the beach. Friendly & helpful staff. Just loved it. (Limited breakfast choice when you have breakfast included). Next time we will just order off the yummy menu and not have it included in our deal.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 6 days with our friends at Indiana Kenanga. We totally fell in love with this place ! The staff is very nice and welcoming, the villas are luxurious (We had a big villa with our own private swimming pool), the restaurant is to die for 1. Because it's on the beach with the view on the turquoise water of lembogan island 2. Because it's a gastronomic Restaurant with a French chef ! The spa is beautiful and offers the best traditional Balinese massages. I totally recommend this place it was one of the most magical place I've ever been to!
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my friends were there in November 2015. The staff and host couldn't have been more friendly. The villas are clean, nicely decorated, with a good internet connection and the environment is quiet. The food at the restaurant was great.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came to the island on a whim and stayed here based on previous reviews since we had no previous experience on the island or recommendations. The hotel was beautiful, it offers a individual villa type setting which gave us the privacy we were seeking. Beyond that the staff were very kind and extremely helpful when asked hotel and general touring inquiries. The hotel is located walking distance to any sight seeing or roaming your are in the mood for. We lucked out by choosing this hotel, we looked at others on the island while there so know these recommendations are true - stay at Indiana Kenanga.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nusa Lembongan is much quieter than Bali, and Indiana Kenanga is the perfect place for a romantic get-away.The resort is situated towards the northern end of the long beach on the island and has immediate access to the beach itself, where the warm water is so inviting.The villas are more than adequate, with the two-bedroom variety being quite luxurious and having their own plunge pool. Even the one-bedroom villas are spacious and have all mod-cons.The staff are ultra-friendly and go out of their way to make you feel like royalty. Although it is not cheap, the French restaurant (with a Michelin-starred chef) is above the ordinary.From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel special and we would be more than keen to come back to Indiana Kenanga for a future taste of a welcoming island off Bali.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed an afternoon at there pool bar. Beautiful little shady hut, really quiet, there was literally nobody else so we had a private pool. Nice palm trees created some shade in the pool. Great for our little one. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was amazing everything were good and Pak Surya was so kind to us! Beautiful villas by the beach, nice ala carte breakfast, private pool bar, friendly staff. We're stayed in 2 bedroom villas spacious room with private pool, our own kitchenette and lazy bed by the pool. Great escape from Bali!
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quite luxurious and well maintained. Staff were helpful and friendly, maybe because they still are village folk at heart. It seems no one has a monopoly over access to the beach so strangers can walk through the place from the one main road to the beach. Dogs are allowed by owners to roam the beach and even walk into the restaurant, which if you like dogs, is a good thing.As Siren N noted, if you get a villa next to the farm, you will be awoke by a chorus of roosters at 4am. Try to get one nearer the restaurant/reception.We had some issues getting hot water in the shower. The lights are ridiculous dim at night, but then some people may like it that way.All in all we like it.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Indiana Kenanga has bags of potential to be a seriously great hotel but it fell short of the mark in several areas. This one of the pricier hotels on Lembongan but for a boutique, reasonable enough. However, compared to other boutiques in Bali and Asia, we were not overly impressed.The lay out it fantastic, the bungalows of good size but the interior decor is super dated, badly lit & a bit tacky. None of our lamps had bulbs in. The pool area is lovely & the front of the restaurant has a great spot to watch the sun go down with a cold bintang.The food however was disappointing & overpriced. Breakfast in particular was not good. Choice of poached eggs or the plainest omelette known to man. The coffee was undrinkable, eggs were either totally overdone or raw, underdone toast, fruit literally thrown on a plate & a serious lack of customer service. Not one member of staff greeted us warmly in the morning which is unheard of in this part of the world.We also had a minor issue with our safe. We were unable to get in to it & needed a master key. This happened in the evening, around 9pm. When we went to the front desk, the staff had locked up for the night & we just had the security guard to help. For a boutique hotel & at the price we paid, we expected at least one member of staff to be available. This was not a serious incident but it is a concern should something happen that requires a more senior member of staff!
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 4 nights, the first night we stayed in the room closest to the restaurant and beach. While it was handy being so close to the beach we found it noisy in the evening due to being directly next door to the restaurant. We asked to change rooms the next morning and they were very happy to move us to another room away from the restaurant.Great location at the best end of the beach.Lots of good restaurants close by - our favourite being Planet Nomadas.By the main swimming pool they have beautiful homemade waffle cones and gelato - excellent on hot day.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in Villa 2, and this is truly like a mini-home. The 2 bedrooms are huge, comfortable, firm beds, large bathroom with shower and tub. The living area has lots of different sitting areas for reading, playing games, a kitchen area, and on top of that, our very own pool with deck chairs, set among the greenery. We loved our villa.The staff are friendly and helpful. We took advantage of our free cocktail and free massage for each of us.The restaurants have very good food, but are about double the price of any other hotel restaurant along the beach. It's definitely worth going to the Creperie - fabulous savoury and sweet crepes, but the main restaurant has nothing vegetarian at dinner, so we got pasta, pizza, indonesian or mexican food at other places.Our only real complaint of this place is the NOISE of the chickens and roosters. They don't just crow a few minutes at sunrise, but about once an hour throughout the night, and longer during the day. The locals houses are intermingled with the hotels, and so the sounds of roosters are everywhere. Bring earplugs!
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow this place was amazing it one of those hidden place in the middle busy street you get into a side street and then bang in your face this place I must say was a surprise the reception is away from everything you taken to your room now mine was 4 and 5 fully recommend them you enter this little garden and there is your room this private sanctuary fantastic room spacious traditional ,the shower room mmmm The staff was fantastic helping you out I fully recommend to get a scooter and visit the island Over all I love this place and fully advise you to stay there if you near by other you can call yourself a fool .....
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location on the beach front for surfing and water activities. The experience for us was great. The staff in all areas were exceptional. The Villa was beautiful.Nusa lembognan is NOT a high end resort town, it is however a true bali experience in which you can see the seaweed famers and fishermen make a living, enjoy the sun surf snorkelling and island pace of life. The only let down which was understandably out of their control was the neighbours rooster!
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You think for paying almost 300 dollars a night you will get at least a decent kind of service. They refused to drop us off to the bay which is like only 5-10 mins drive and asked us to pay 20 dollars extra for that. Restaurant was wayyyyy overpriced for such a mediocre food.So many other nicer hotels around. Never again.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have been there to stop for drinks. 2 Water, 2 iced teas and 1 Banana Dream Ice cream. Payed 230000 rp. Choclate sauce was burned and only 1 poor spoon of ice cream, which was not good. See it on the Foto. And as this was not enough a couple in a table next to us had burgers. The meat was Rare and wenn i Say rare, it means that if you put enough meat together you would have a living cow. But best Part was, that the couple told the waitress that it is not correct. Waitress took the halfed burger back into the kitchen. And a few minutes later, she came back with the Same burger well done. For this High priced Restaurant an absolute " no go ". The only Way to handle this, is to cook a full new burger. I absolutly cannot recommend to go there.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was spacious, clean and nice. The food was also very good, we enjoyed having our meal here. The staff were friendly and helpful. Pool setting was nice but maybe a little small. Direct access to the beach and it was convenient for us to go around
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited the restaurant with a group of about 20 people. Almost everyone had 3 courses and cocktails. The food was sooo good no one had any issues. I would highly recommend eating there at least once on your stay. We visited twice because the food was so good.
hotelName:
28    Indiana Kenanga Luxury Boutique Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Komune is incredible. They seriously have it all! World-class surfing, yoga, a skatepark, childcare, an indoor fitness center, amazing restaurants, and even their own version of California’s infamous Muscle Beach! Simply put, you’ll be asking to extend your stay on day 1.Make sure to order their floating breakfast! The food and variety on the floating breakfast is incredible. My only complaint is that we couldn’t stay longer We’ll be back
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful east facing location with excellent gym/yoga/massage facilities. Great happy hour and good food. Missed the sunset but excellent resort. Black sand was usual for me but no problem. Pool lounges great with really good music but just a bit too loud. Recommend.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a Beachfront Suite on a trip to Bali with 8 of our friends to plan our wedding and we all fell completely in love with Komune! We have now got our wedding booked there for next year and cant wait to share with the rest of our family and friends!!
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our daughter and her husband planned a holiday to Bali and encouraged us to join them. Had not been to Bali since 1982. Initially had a few nights in a villa in Canggu then moved to Hotel Komune Resort. Wonderful reception after an hour's taxi drive from Canggu through Denpasar.We had two of the top deck rooms overlooking the sea and our own plunge pool which ran the length of the 20 odd rooms but had rope barriers between each unit to avoid lap swimmers disturbing other guests. The resort had two other pools, one a 25 metre lap pool in a "quiet" area where children were not permitted. This back area of the resort featured all the "healthy" activities such as yoga, meditation and gyms including an outdoor "muscle" training area. It also had an outdoor restaurant/bar for a delightful breakfast/lunch or dinner after your workout. Down on the beach was another pool more specifically for the families with kids. Beach swimming was not really an option as it is a surf beach only for pros plus there are many rocky inshore reefs and rips along shoreline. It is also a volcanic area so the sand is black. Not a big issue given the pool. The resort also has a large open air restaurant on the foreshore and the food is fabulous. Huge range of menu items catering for all types from vegans, veggies and carnivores. Presentation and quality is first rate and leaves a lot of Aussie restaurants to shame. All the resort staff are super friendly and efficient. In the evening they also put on a small open air theatre for the kids showing movies that keep them amused and out of their parents' hair for a while!Clientele is mostly Australian and I understand the resort is owned and operated by Australians. Plus the clientele is not your traditional "Kuta Aussie". Everybody was very friendly and no bad behavior anywhere.The rooms are delightful with your bed overlooking the sea and you fall asleep hearing the crashing of the waves. The rooms have all mod cons including full range of TV stations, fridge, mini bar, kettle, international power outlets, safe and cupboard space, ironing board etc. Take a few moments to study the operation of the shower as it is a little complicated and usually starts with a burst of cold water in your face from the handheld device! Pricing of food is very economical and you can feed four people for a quality dinner for about $80-$100 including drinks. If you have a late night flight home you can check out at 11.00am but put your luggage in a secure lock-up and stay around the resort using the facilities and then get changed late afternoon in the resort change rooms close to the gym area and then grab your taxi to the airport. (Allow about 90 mins to be safe) Food and drinks after check out can simply be paid on your credit car or cash as required. The resort also has a pavilion overlooking the beach for functions and weddings. In summary a marvellous resort with a focus on health activities.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We live in Bali. Sometimes we feel the need to go week away from the Blayu village where we live. This Komune beach resort is our choice this time. Traveling with 2 children aged 9 and 10 years I was very surprised and happy when we were told that inside of the Resort there is a Kids club which is equipped with a skate board and cycling. We are not a surfer family where the Komune beach resort is famous for surfers even though all families with children are welcome here. The staff greeting us warmly. All Friendly. The view from our room 232 was very charming. Our first lunch today is also satisfying. Looking forward to trying out the Spa tomorrow. There are also several Gym Classes in the morning that I want to follow. Thank you to the GM for your hospitality welcoming us warmly. X
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such an awesome place. Amazing staff: friendly, polite and prompt! Beautiful grounds and luxurious rooms. Great attention to detail. The food is plentiful, delicious and caters for so many types of tastes. Great Rendang tacos! Beautiful cocktails and great plant based dishes when you are feeling healthy. So relaxing. If you can afford the option staying in a beachfront suite is pure heaven. Thank you so much for such a well needed, totally indulgent and chilled holiday! Oh did I mention the great waves, beachside bar and pool and awesome massages! ?? Seriously! Sooooo goood!Kim xxx
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sons wedding - absolutely more than expected. A real excellent experience. We will remember this vere positive in our family for many years. The rooms are very fine, excellent food and always a smiling and helpfull service.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Komune in a group of 55 as part of a fitness retreat with Tribe Social Fitness. I can honestly say that Komune exceeded my expectations. If you needed anything for your room you just needed to ask and they would be there promptly. The rooms and resort was immaculate. Facilities were 5 star and the food was absolutely amazing. What surprised me was that food and drinks for a 5 star resort were reasonable. Wayne and his staff made sure we had everything we needed and don’t get me started on the day spa “bliss”. I would highly recommend Komune either for large groups, families, couples or singles.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The beachfront rooms were amazing! With a private pool and the most comfy bed were to die for! We were able to see the surf break from the room with the most picturesque view ever! The rooms were spotless with the food absolutely fantastic! We couldn't fault the service - the staff were so obliging and always followed through with requests.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at the Komune was our first trip to Keramas. We were not disappointed! It is a magnificent spot and great resort.We stayed in a Beach Front Pool suite which was incredible - I could literally watch my children surfing from my king sized bed!!This resort is fabulous for surfing families as the surf break is directly in front of the resort.There is also a wonderful skate park (gear can be hired there) and a huge playground for younger children to explore.They food was impeccable - best beef rendang I have ever had!!The staff were super lovely and happy to accomodate.We had hoped to night surf but unfortunately the timing of the tides was not right during our stay.Would definitely love to stay again!
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were disappointed with our stay at Komune. If you’re after a good nights sleep, I don’t recommend the expensive beach front suites. Noisy weddings with thumping music in front of the suites will keep you wide awake. Management really need to inform guests of the noise before they book.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent weekend in beach front room overlooking the surf, a little noisy on the Saturday night due to a wedding being held at beach front deck and it would have been a courtesy by Management to have been advised prior . Would suggest you ask before booking a front room. If you ring for an ice bucket don't expect it to arrive ,even after a 2nd request. The location is isolated but did enjoy this , the restaurants onsite do have fresh, tasty food. Overall enjoyed but perhaps room service staff need a little refresher especially as it was quicker for us to collect the things we asked for .
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This resort is well run and I loved my Fitcation vacation here. The pricing is good for Aussies and they offer plenty of activities; starting with watching the pro surfing show, moving through massage & finishing at zen yoga - what's not to like?The rooms are fine for twin share, with the compact living, lack of privacy and storage being the biggest issue. We loved the gym, Muscle Beach, the two swimming pool areas. Well, I enjoyed the more lively party pool in small doses, but that is what is brilliant about the Komune, it is well thought through and there is something for everyone here.As food was an important component of our Fitcation, they nailed it completely. Loved the fresh food, juices and healthy eating options.WIfi seemed a bit of an issue but it was the Bali provider, not their internal resort connections. The local bar shack overlooking the paddy fields outside the gate, where the WIFI was perfect, which made a great office.I enjoyed using the Spa on several occasions, apart from one massage which I stopped after the pressure was too strong and I didn't like the sound of my back cracking. If that is you, say you 'no cracking!' I would love to return to this lovely resort at some point in the future. I left feeling fitter, stronger, healthier and happier. Thank you to all the wonderful staff at Komune.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our experience at Komune was seamless right from the reservation stage. I don’t even know where to start but after a long awaited holiday due to being so caught up in the grind, it was the perfect way to unwind. We arrived on a Monday night and arrived at the hotel at around 10pm. We wondered around and honestly komune has everything! You do not need to leave - there’s a brilliant gym with all the facilities you could possibly image, beach club, yoga, one of the best spa locations and the list could go on. Our room was divine and after staying at some beautiful resorts both nationally and internationally I can say that it was up there as one of the best! If you’re going to Bali and want to really enjoy your resort, whether it be for family, friends or business - don’t waste your time looking else where! We can’t wait to go back! Thanks to all the staff that took great care of us x
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at Komune Resort Bali were amazing. Genuinely providing great service with a smile each day. Our expectations were over met. The facilities are lush and green and the food delicious catering to a wide variety with healthy options and meeting dietary requirements. The rooms are extremely comfortable, modern and well serviced daily. The Spa treatments and services OMG, absolutely pampering. I highly recommend the Thai Massage. The gym, yoga and muscle beach facilities are also fully equipped and the professionalism of the instructors will definite keep you motivated and fit.
