Lastly the surf break, Keramas Surf Break, is so consistent and for all levels of surfing expertise.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Like a tropical paradise with all the trimmings. This is by far one of the nicest resorts I have ever stayed at in my life. Being slightly remote they really do offer every thing here. Gym, yoga, beauty centre, restaurants, many pools AND that surf!!! Well done Komune, a beautiful slice of heaven.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Komune for an 8 day yoga retreat and was blown away by this resort and it’s amenities. The grounds are beautifully kept, there are plenty of food options (also plenty gluten free, dairy free, vegan etc.). Both food and drinks were always presented beautifully and were always flavourful. The staff truly go above and beyond for their guests and will accommodate any of your needs. The spa is wonderful and offers very affordable packages (Try the goddess package or the hair cream treatment!). The health hub was great and offered beautiful yoga shalas and a pool to relax in as well as a fully decked out gym. The pool here is quieter and a great place to relax. The main pool area is fun and lively with music, drinks, and ice cream or fresh coconuts available. The pool itself overlooks the beach which is great for watching the surfers! The beach is a surfer lovers dream by far - waves were quite large during my time there. Unfortunately, this makes it difficult to swim at the beach. It’s also quite littered with garage which is unfortunate...The rooms were modern, clean, and simple (I stayed in a standard room). AC worked very well! The hot water in the shower will tend to run out later in the evening. It’s also easy to hear your neighbours as the rooms are not sound proofed. Overall, this is a wonderful resort and made my first stay in Bali a great one! Would definitely return :)
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location can find easily at google maps. Room was excelent except toilet since they use toilet dry type which is no water for closet. Book via tiket.com and apperently breakfast not included, not sure for direct reservation, so we choose pretty floating breakfast but kind of expensive. Most of the guest are foreign, we feel as local get different teratment service hehe the view from beachfront room is amazing but we feel bit annoyed with the little statue of goat i guest, the one and only hiks better remove it the view will be more better.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything at Hotel Komune ran so smoothly, the food was delicious, the staff was very friendly and went above and beyond, and the spa was amazing! The resort was also very secure. It’s about an hour ride to Ubud from the resort. I highly recommend the horseback riding that is only 5 minutes away.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we arrived my wife and I new this stay was going to be like no other we’ve had in Bali with yearly visits for the last 6 years . We stayed in the amazing beach front suite with an amazing infinity pool right outside our suite ,which overlooked the endless Keramas waves viewed from our king size bed . General manager Paul welcomed us with afternoon cocktails while we relaxed at the beach club restaurant. The food and service was 5 star .A beautiful and relaxing resort away from the Hussle and Bussle of most of bali’s Holiday destinations .Heading back in November for our Anniversary and counting the days .
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are super friendly, always happy and smiling and very helpful, the food is delicious and healthy, the whole scene is fun and vibrant but cruisey and laid back, the day beds are super comfy, the garden lap pool is stunning and relaxing, it’s our favourite go to resort for great food, surf, relaxation and meeting like minded people.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This beach has beautiful black sand; however, the shore was littered with both natural and man-made debris. The waves are endless for surfers but not recommended for swimming because of the stones that are carried in them. The resort is so inviting and relaxing. A wonderful place to forget about work and life demands. The offers a 5-foot deep pool that offers full view of the sea. The food is little mediocre and slightly overpriced. The bathroom facilities are clean but the cleaning schedule should be increased due to the sand and water accumulation caused by visitor usage. Overall, this is good family-oriented place to visit. The entrance to the hotel is mediocre as well, it does not look like a " beach resort". We thought we were in the wrong place initially.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for only 2 nights, the resort is BIG and the rooms and with an amazing view to see the big amazing waves, the room we took was with a pool also that is in-front of the ocean, if you ever go there try the restaurant and enjoy the view, take a walk at the amazing black shining sand beach that look amazing at night, and set back relax and enjoy the beautiful sunset.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for one night & couldn’t really fault the place. We stayed in a standard room which did the job for one night & the AC was great.We enjoyed lunch, dinner & breakfast at the beach club which came to £96 on checkout. For us this was a little pricey but I guess we were paying for the whole setting & convenience which I’d say was worth it!I’d definitely recommend & return :)Do note that if requiring a taxi, just make your way out of the resort a little & grab a local driver as the hotel only calls the exact one then takes half the cut that you pay the driver!
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love the charm of this beautiful resort the staff are absolutely lovely and the food was divine. I stayed as part of a Power Living training retreat and would love to go back again The location on the beach to watch the surf is pretty fab too
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went there for drinks in the late afternoon before our dinner opposite. Amazing place...from the moment you stepped in to the road to the beach club, to the view of the rooms and then the beach club area where friendly staff are everywhere. You can't see sunset here as it is in the east (I reckon sunrise is possible?) but nice waves, nice breeze, nice beach. Will want to stay there one day when I return.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a beachfront villa and whilst the room, location and staff were great - there was a wedding that kept us awake the whole night. There was bad music, speeches and screaming from 6pm - 2am (the music died down around 12:30 - 1, but the screaming continued), and it genuinely was as though we were guests at the wedding. We actually tried to leave, but transport is hard to get because of the location. The hotel should have informed us of this prior to our check-in. Apparently, there are weddings or events every weekend so I would be sure to check this before booking. We went for a relaxing weekend getaway and this was anything but. The two nights cost around $900 Aud and I honestly wouldn't go again if i was paid double that. There are five star, luxury resorts close by where you can essentially have your own isolated, beachfront villa for this price. This is the worst hotel experience I have had anywhere in the world.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay here so much it would be rude not to return..the staff are super friendly food options were fantastic and well priced .Great vibe to the resort with regards to health,fitness,surfing,family ect ect. We love this resort .And will be back .
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A group of 9 friends stayed in the pool suites. The rooms were beautiful, comfy beds, beautiful outlook across the lawn and river to the beach. We stayed over Nyepi and it was great to have the use of the day spa during this time. Food menu was delicious, extensive and really well priced, considering the resort is quite isolated, so they could charge what they like.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The resort is lovely. The basic rooms are a ways from the beach shrouded in jungle but acceptable. The service is amazing and the spa superb...the issue is the smoke. 7 nights of toxic levels of smoke. Every time we asked the staff about the smoke they denied knowing what we were talking about. It was a bit like stepping into the Stepford Wives world. Finally after escalating we received a lame excuse that it was due to burning rice patties nearby. Given that every nearby rice paddy was in mid-growing cycle it was definitely Not burning rice fields causing the caustic smoke. Walking along the beach we found huge burning trash piles that are lit every night. In the jungle rooms, with the thick humidity the smoke is trapped all night and the smoke is stifling. While the scenery is divine, if you have any respiratory sensitivity, beware that the air quality is absolutely awful. We were also surprised by a “fogging notice” for bugs. Again a toxic surprise.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My 4th stay, I love this place.Beach bar and views, food choices are all healthy, yoga, staff are all fantastic authentic Balinese.I recommend the beach view rooms, they have great views.The area is quiet.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Let me say first, I hated the location and I left after 1 night. But I have several issues:Location: This resort is off a highway. There are 2 lanes going 1 direction on each side. Once you turn down the road to the resort it is very dark. If you wanted to walk out of the resort to a town…. There isn’t one. It is like walking out of an industrial area. You are stuck in this “resort”. I did not come to Bali for that experience. Maybe you want to check into a Yoga retreat and stay there all week. This is your place. We had to go to the hospital in Denpasar and it took 1 hour with traffic at 8 pm and the cost was $21 USD.Ask what is important to you before you book . On-line the website did not seem so remote. I did not come to Bali to be stuck in a remote location. We did not have our own car.Dining: Breakfast is NOT included which is common in Bali. There is only 2 restaurants 1 serves only Healthy food which means no cocktails, the other is on the beach and expensive. Breakfast is costly and adds up. Our Lunch was $150 US for 6 and when I asked for water the waitress told me it was self-serve that I could get it myself. I had to let her know we were having lunch as a group and it would be best if she could bring us water. That was crazy! The waitress told us to get our own water during my meal with 5 friends? This is an expensive Bali restaurant!Room: The standard rooms are far from the beach and even the beach rooms are separated from the beach by the pool, bar, and a wide undeveloped area. These rooms are much more expensive so make sure you understand what you are getting. You are not walking out of your Hawaii condo onto the sand. No!The Bedding: I don’t know if something went wrong but…. Our bed comfort was OK, but we hand only a bottom sheet. That is it. No top sheet and no blanket. There was a down comforter with a duvet. So here is my issues: Do they wash the entire Duvet each time – don’t know? But no thin top sheet so hope so.  No top sheet so ZERO covers if you don’t want a heavy down filled duvet. Bali doesn’t need a down Duvet. It is warm so a sheet and light blanket should be appropriate. Maybe they think they are saving water by not having a top sheet. I disagree.The bottom sheet on the bed was just a regular flat sheet. So it came untucked when I moved during the night and bunch up. The room is modern and fine. I will never go back … but again if you are looking to fly all the way to Bali to stay in 1 resort and do Yoga, then maybe this works.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a weekend and thought it was very good. Our room was well equipped, clean and comfortable. The pools are both nice. They need a few more sun loungers though. The gym was well equipped. Food and drinks not too expensive. Some food dishes were excellent and some were a little bit disappointing and not very accurately described. Overall it was a good experience and we would go back again.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a pool suite and were not disappointed. The suite was spacious and overlooked the deck, plunge pool, and Keramas surf break. The staff were lovely and made us feel like part of the Komune family from day 1. Food was delicious and there were many different choices on the menus. Plenty for the Surfer and non-surfer to do. Great place for couples, families and friends trips away. The resort is located away from the major tourist towns but close enough if you want to do a day trip. There is a family style pool located beachside or the adults only pool (divine). Gardens immaculate and well kept. Would love to visit again one day!
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Where to begin? This was my first visit to Bali and it will not be my last! The hospitality is above and beyond anything you’ve experienced before. You are treated as a VIP from the moment you make your reservation. Just before arriving I received an email from the resort director Andrea. She sent a wonderful email with an array of information that I wouldn’t have thought to ask about and relieved what anxiety I did have about visiting a foreign country. Once I arrived and met Andrea she welcomed us as if she was a long lost friend. All of the staff went out of their way to ensure my stay was nothing short of amazing! The food was delicious, the yoga energizing, the pools and beaches refreshing, the atmosphere gorgeous and the excursions unforgettable! I also met with the resort trainer Mark to attempt to not turn to a slug during vacation. Not only is Mark easy on the eyes but he knows his stuff! His routines keep you interested and challenged. if you’re lucky enough to be at the resort when Graham is there be sure to schedule a Reiki session with him, it’s life changing! Do yourself a favor and be sure to make Komune Resort your next vacation!!!
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A treasured gem, a blissful stay, tailor made to meet a variety of personal desires and holidayers dreams come true!Review of Komune Resort, Keramas Beach BaliPending reviewWhether you're in need of a solo escape, a family get away with activities to suit the whole family, a romantic and indulgent couples escape - perhaps even a wedding? Or even a body, mind and soul health retreat complete with daily yoga, meditation, air conditioned gym facilities, and a huge selection of vegan friendly, gluten free, organic tummy happy foods and drinks to choose from at the health hub! Or if you're more inclined to a couple of scrumptious sliders and a couple of bintang or icey cold cocktails to wash them down at the beach club - what better way to wind down after a cracking day in the surf - break directly out the front of the resort ( actual proof of the massive air you just landed - as you partner can lazily watch you, fresh coconut in hand, from the beach side infinity pool) - Unless of course they have decided to spend a day of bliss in the Day Spa getting absolutely pampered! (My fav!)Honestly, there is something spectacular here for everyone!I have stayed at the Komune 3 times now, and it's safe to say - it's my absolute favorite place to stay in Bali! I've had a romantic get away there in the past, I've taken a mother and daughter trip, and the most recent - November 2018 - I came with my parents for a 2 week family get away (they too completely enthralled with our stay)There are a couple of room types you can stay in at the Komune with great deals and packages on offer as well - something to suit all types of stay. (Eat surf play package -great value for those wanting a bit of everything. and Yoga packages for those really into a health retreat).I have stayed in the *Resort rooms in the past - which are located a little down the back, are quiet and fairly private and are at a great rate for those on a budget.I've stayed in the *TS suites - which are a little more expensive than the resort rooms, relatively similar though slightly larger and a little closer.And my absolute FAAAVORITE!!!! the *beach front pool suites - ok a whole lot more expensive buuuut trust me - you'll kick yourself if you don't!! These rooms are situated facing the ocean and infinity pool so you feel quite connected to the livelyness of the beach club down the front yet private and quiet enough that you can watch the buzzing from a peaceful distance. You have a generous private pool and day bed out the front of your room (another tip - you can extend this if you're visiting with fam or friends and book the rooms next to each other - therefor elongating your private pools!) There is a large bath tub in your room with a privacy curtain you can draw across - with a variety of flower baths you can order to your room along with room service if you feel! And not to forget the incredibly indulgent floating breakfast you can order for your pool - just do it! Trust me!Other facilities of the resort that I haven't yet mentioned include:*Children free lap pool and day bed bungalows for some quiet time.*A giant fruit bowl skate park for the kiddies* A beach meditation and yoga shala and a jungle meditation and yoga shala.*An events roomAnd if the location and facilities didn't steal your heart (they certainly do mine!)The staff will! From the minute you walk in the door, you feel instantly at home, with warm welcoming and care. They are all so helpful, genuine and sincere, and are genuinely happy to be there - which is a point of difference I think really creates the special stay here. I'd like to give a special mention to everyone - though I'm not great with remembering so many names! Though there are a few staff members I can mention here :)Desak and Agung at reception - Thank you for going above and beyond to make our stay as special as you did and for giving us the best deals we have had EVER! We could have only wished for a holiday as special as we had with our budgets - but you guys achieved it for us! Thank you :)Agus manager of the beach club restaurant - Thank you my friend for always looking after us and going above and beyond - even outside of your usual duites to find us great deals, great travel and day trip tips and sharing your awesome music with us! it's great to have friends to chat to on our visits :)Dewa, Gex, Agus, Hendrix, Mega, Winda, Ryan, Ketut the awesome staff at the beach club restaurant,bar and health hub - You guys are just awesome! Thanks for making our stay so fun and having a laugh with us. You all made it so easy, relaxed and enjoyable. The food is impeccable - the best in Bali we've had! The drinks are fantastic and the service is always fabulous! You really don't need to go anywhere else to eat with so much selection - and trust me, you really won't want to! :)Windi, Sudi, Suci, Ayu, and I forgotten (apologies) the lovely man on front desk at the Day Spa - Thank you all so much for all of the love and care you put into your treatments - being a day spa owner and therapist myself, I know just how important and special this is - absolute bliss!and Rudi the wonderful and talented hair magician! Well people will just have to visit you to experience the pure magic and skill you posses! Thank you so much for looking after my family and I - you're a rare gem! :)We are thoroughly pleased with our visits and can't wait for our next visit to our home away from home
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing architecture and extensive grounds to explore backing onto a lovely black sand beach. Arriving at the resort, you will see the reception which is partly hidden under a terrace with a growing creeper. This is pretty much the theme of the place which is integrating nature into the resort as the gardens between the rooms is also somewhat wild and beautiful, making you feel like you are staying in a jungle. There are many corners to explore at this resort which include the vegetable gardens, a children's playground, the pool overlooking the beach, the gym, the 2 restaurants on site and the other outdoor relaxation pool. The second pool is so tucked away that I only managed to discover it a few hours before my departure, much to my disappointment. The pool overlooking the sea is an ideal spot to lounge around in or around on a sunny day asnd there are adequate options for doing so beside the pool. It is an ideal spot for people watching too as the beach is a popular spot for surfers too. The restaurant by the beach has a very beachy vibe and you can order refreshments from there when the waiters come around. The other restaurant on site, which is located closer to the gym is a dedicated organic restaurant with exquisite food and many options including local food. Portions were huge and we had a bit of trouble finishing what we ordered as we had ordered with such gusto. However, the flavour ensured we did eventually.The hotel even had a yoga or meditation hall or center which I didn't go to for any other reason that a quick visit to check it out. It was very secluded and hidden from view with lush planting around. The hotel made guests feel there was plenty to do by offering activities like free sessions with a trainer in the gym twice a day if you were up for it. It is also good to note that there were several different options of rooms to choose from and there was a block of ocean view rooms which looked really luxurious and very well designed. I did not get to see what the inside of these looked like but they were nice from the outside.Overall, it was a pleasant stay in a more out of the way location on Bali Island. If you came especially for the resort and set out to fully utilise the amenities on offer it is really worth it. However it is slightly further away from most other attractions and the motorbike rental is slightly more expensive as there are less options to choose from.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a family holiday at Komune in Sept 18, from the moment of arrival we were greeted with a welcome drink and wet towel & were continued to be spoilt our whole 5 day stay. We had the pool beach view rooms. The rooms are divine, from the lighting to the huge stacker doors opening onto the pool. We had 3 adjoining rooms so could swim the length of the 3 rooms. We also had our own sunken gazebo at one end where we sat and the breakfast watching the Balinese exercising on the beach. The front restaurant is awesome to sit and watch the waves you are so close the sea spray can use about wet your face. Staff were great always willing to give advice on day trips and general information about the area. We loved our stay.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our winter break was spent entirely at Keramas and we loved it!My husband chose Komune because he loves surfing and my daughter loved the pool! Thank you Dek, Eka and Adi Wijaya for the super service all the time there!!We spent Christmas and New Years Eve there and the entire team was great all the time. My daughter was really entertained at the Kids Club, thank you Desak for being so nice with her. At the restaurant, our special thanks to the always smiling Purwanti, Supradipta, Aditya, Winda, Dewa Ayu and Sri!!! Thanks to the Chefs that were always preparing delicacies for us, we really enjoyed.And Dewa and Agush, it was very nice to be spoiled and so well treated by you guys. Komune is awesome for surfers, families and anyone that enjoys beautiful places with very good service We will return for sure
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Komune Resort for 8 nights as part of a Love and Nourish yoga retreat with Anastasia Williams. The resort was a magical backdrop to the yoga and meditation. It is removed from the craziness of busy Bali up in Keramas on a black sand surf beach. Everything about the resort is geared to health and wellness, with a large gym, yoga offered in two shalas and two pools - one adults only, and one beach-side and great surfing. The menu offerings are healthy and superb, with a dedicated vegan menu. I've read some other reviews mention mosquitos, but personally I wasn't bothered by any and didn't get any bites. The staff were faultlessly friendly and warm. Being there over New Year I thought the resort would feel busy, but it never did and it was always easy to get a pool-side lounge. I'll most definitely be back!
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a place. We go to Bali twice a year and usually go to Seminyak, Nusa Dua, Bingin, Sanur or Jimaran. I have to admit that it has taken my surfing partner about 3 years to convince me to come up here as I was hesitant to go away from the buzz and clubs of Seminyak or the 5* hotels at Nusa Dua but our 5 day stay at this place was so beautiful and calming that I wanted to stay. Unfortunately they were booked out, so off we went to our 5* hotel at Nusa Dua, with 5* prices, 5* screaming kids with their nannies, greasy buffet food and I could go on but it will all be in another review.So what was so good here.The hotel website easy to navigate and offered extras like car from airport and massages to book in advanceWe usually get a cab but this was really easy and considering the distance to the airport it was ok value for money.It was very much a case of under promise and over deliver. We booked a suite with an ocean view which was modern, very clean, well serviced and very well laid out. There were always fresh towels and the communal lap pool in front is cordoned off so that people cannot swim past your room. You can see the ocean from your bed and there is another day bed and table and chairs outside on a patio.It was Christmas time so there were families and quite a few kids but it was almost like a Commune, many of the kids were playing together and everyone was really friendly. It was like one big family and many people had commented that they had been there numerous times. There was a family pool and beach club at the front which over looked one of the surf breaks. The staff were amazing. Balinese people are so lovely anyway but it looked like the staff were happy in their work, always smiling, they didn't look burn't out and they were always very careful to repeat your order.The food, just awesome. Very healthy and so many choices including vegetarian. And lots of fresh juices.And just when you think it is perfect enough, There is a whole adult area with adult lap pool and cabanas, a massive gym, a large Shala for Yoga and meditation, an area with another restaurant and a village green where you can just sit quietly after meditating and then there is the Spa with a lovely hair and nail salon, clothes store and massage rooms.We didn't leave the place until check out, although many people we met had drivers every day and visited other locations and other surf spots.Would we come back again - absolutely - can't wait.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having just stayed in Seminyak for four nights, coming to Komune was absolutely what the soul required. We stayed in a beachside pool suite - overlooking the ocean - and found every element of this resort wonderful. The amenities, the staff, the food, the yoga and health hubs, the ease of walking on the strangely beautiful volcanic sand - it was a dream. Can't recommend Komune Resort highly enough!
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is amazing. I don't think there is much they haven't thought of.Our travel style is typically boho chic boutique style or B&B / Homestay. We landed here to meet friends for a week of "retreat" with Daily Sweat's Strength & Culture Bali.We had already spent a little over a week exploring Amed and Gili Air. This resort is in the cut. Not much around but great central location for day trips. It is luxury eco-friendly with AMAZING food and drink, wellness centers (yes, with an 's') and spectacular beach views. The adult pool was quiet and perfect, though my husband and I are more beach than pool people, the beach here is really just for surfers and watchers. Get the room with the private pool if you can. Seriously. It changes the entire experience!The amenities are endless, the property is unbelievably well kept. CLEAN and Beautifully kept from landscape to technology. Brilliantly placed tall, big bright lights to illuminate the beach at night and draw the flying creatures. Frogs and gecko's on the grounds to help catch the flying pests. Fly spray is available at each venue. Multiple options for sit down to eat (although the menu's are pretty identical, which is not a bad thing since its all so good!The fruit juices... OMG.The staff is wonderful. If I were wanting some serious down time without much moving around in between stops, I'd be back in a heartbeat. Perfect for signles, couples and quiet families.It is however VERY quiet. If you and your group are not about that QUIET. Don't come here and disturb the peace. It would also be pretty embarrassing for you (as it was at some points for my group lol). We all loved it. They know how to take care of groups and there is nothing that cannot be accommodated. If you are looking for peace and chill and to worry for nothing - just BOOK IT!
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stopped here on the way to east Bali. Food was great, with the menu having a large variety to choose from, good prices and the service was very attentive. Very relaxed atmosphere, and plenty of deck chairs and lounges to hang out in.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the best time at Komune! Great view, great food, awesome facilities and activities! The great reputation is very well deserved! They have really thought of everything here! The rooms were spacious and beautiful! Try phoning them directly to book, you might get a better deal!
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the most amazing holiday. Thanks to all the beautiful people at Hotel Komune for looking after us. There is nothing I could fault about the hotel, staff, food and drinks. All 100%. I would highly recommend to everyone.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I co-led a fitness retreat at Komune and had an excellent experience. Really enjoyed the various places to practice with nice views and good equipment. All about the Health Hub restaurant food! Get the dragon bowl and incredible coconut milk raw cacao drink. Sweet helpful staff overall. Loved the rooms even though the single beds were fairly small, but comfortable none the less. Enjoyed that it was a great resort without the typical annoying feel of a resort — music at the main pool wasn’t too loud or obnoxious and the quiet pool was a little oasis (be mindful of the mosquitoes up there). Wish the beach had less trash but I think that is a typical island situation overall... still the black sand was lovely and it was a treat to watch the surfers. Gorgeous sunrise watching. Would return and definitely recommend.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Komune for 2 nights and we loved our experience. The beach front suite was beautiful and the food was delicious! Great beach for surfing. Staff were very helpful and so polite! Couldn’t recommend this place enough. Thank you for our stay, we will definitely be back!
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights. Loved everything about this place. The rooms are wonderful, we took the top rooms that are positioned on the roof with its own plunge pool. The gym is open 24/7 and has all the hear you need for Cross fit and normal workouts. The menu at the health club is a mix of vegan, wholefoods and modern, which is done so well and great for people that are looking for healthy food that also appeals to foodies. Try the local Balinese coffee for pre workout :) our 5 year old son loved the main pool that's kids friendly. There's also a great muscle muscle outdoor gym too for ninja warriors. Surfing is literally at your doorstep too and the waves are amazing. Highly recommend this place for those looking for an alternative from the typical brand name resorts and boring buffets. Wellness, mindfulness and be present is at the heart of this hotel's experience.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My favorite place in the world. Perfect place to stay for surfers looking to stay at a luxurious place with a world class wave. Eka and Abdi walked me trough the smoothest and easiest hotel check in I’ve ever had. My room was exquisite, with a huge comfy bed, luxury bath tub, private pool and beautiful ocean view! I was so happy to be able to see the waves when I woke up without even having to get out of my bed ! Komang Wijaya was awesome with helping me out with getting my laundry done and restocking my fridge. All the front desk workers were so awesome with accommodating me with whatever I needed. Ayu at the tour desk was great, she helped me rent a vehicle. Desak was a huge help too from helping me find a phone case to finding the best restaurants they were outstanding. Gus Ari, Juan, Lisna, Pawan, Nanda, Siwi, Budi , Surya and Gus De the bell boy were very very helpful as well! Over at the restaurant I was greeted with excellent service by Dewa , Eka and Agoes, Hendrik, De Juna and the girls working the hostess / cashier desk who I somehow for their names, maybe Ayu & Tiwi? (So sorry for the staff I forgot and couldn’t remember all your names). The spa was really good too. Out of all the massages I’ve had in Bali the ones I got here were the best. Big thanks to Ayu, Kadek , Komang and Windi for helping me relax and unwind. For when the waves get small I would head to the hotel’s private skatepark and skate the “fruit bowl” with the other skaters at the hotel. Love how they have really good skateboards that they let you use so you don’t have to bring one. Also the Boys at the beach club / lifeguards were definitely a highlight of my trip ! Gus De who runs the Warung was awesome along with Agunk , Adi , Lempog and Agus. The lifeguards would not only show me the best waves of the day and watch over everyone but they also would take time on their days off and take me around the island to show me their local markets, restaurants and my favorite , the monkeys. I also had the chance to meet the owner Mr. Tony Cannon who was a super nice guy whom all the staff here loved. He was surfing just about everyday and was a pleasure to surf with! Overall this place is by far the best hotel I’ve ever stayed at and will continue to stay here every time I’m in Bali. Thank you everyone at Komune Resort for the time of my life!
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a week and didn’t want to leave. The facilities are fantastic, there’s something for everyone (surf / yoga / gym / kids club / pools!!) Staff are very friendly too. A special thanks to Agus Tu for welcoming us back and making us feel special. See you soon!
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot fault anything about Komune Resort. We stayed there without really knowing anything about it as we were attending a wedding nearby, and the invite suggested it as a place to stay. How lucky we were! From the two completely different pool areas (one much more upbeat and on the beach, the other super zen and quiet), the option of trendy bar food at the Beach Club or delicious healthy eats in the other restaurant, to the yoga in the Beach Chala and the gorgeous little day spa- it was a perfect few days and we had no need to leave. The service was incredible and the ground impeccable maintained. If you can afford it, get a beach view room for a couple of nights- it was worth it
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quiet, calm, beautiful hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff. Especially Gex and Desak Tari always offered superb service!The food in all restaurants was delicious. Can recommend this hotel to single travelers as well as families.A relaxing and very enjoyable stay ☀️ Thank you.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My happy beach home in Bali for the last 3 years. If you're looking for a healthy and fun beachfront paradise on a non-touristy, not crowded surf beach, Komune will blow your mind. Every time I come to Bali, I book one or two trips to Komune and I end up staying longer than I'd planned. I just can't get away... It has everything that a health enthusiast could want: yummy, delicious healthy food (they even have an additional all-vegan menu now!), yoga, surf, spa on site, beautiful facilities (try the beachfront suites) and the most lively, beachfront restaurant, where I spend hours writing and staring at the waves. You can also come and just enjoy the beach club during the day, as it's only a 30-minute drive from Ubud. But for a fuller experience, I recommend staying for at least a few nights. The best part about Komune is without a doubt the kind, amazing staff, always ready to help. They truly go out of their way to make sure you're well taken care of - even for picky people like myself -- and they end up feeling like extended family. They make a difference. I'd especially like to reference Abdi - one of the managers for helping me with my bookings and tending to my requests with the kindest, most professional attitude, for the last two years. Thank you Abdi for making my stay at Komune so memorable, every time I go. You're a superhero and it truly helps to have someone like you as a reference. I'd also like to thank Wayne, the general manager for his hospitality, kindness and always cheerful disposition, willing to fix any issue, and always putting the client's satisfaction first. Thanks so much, Komune! You keep getting better and better.
hotelName:
29    Komune Resort, Keramas Beach Bali
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
